name: 4th of July Raspberry America
instructions: Rub a lemon wedge around the rim of a cocktail glass.
Dip the rim of the glass into sugar to coat it evenly.
In a shaker, add the raspberry vodka, sweet and sour mix, and grenadine.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake well until chilled.
Strain the mixture into the prepared cocktail glass.
Carefully pour the blue raspberry vodka over the back of a spoon into the glass. This will create a layered effect.
Add a lemon wedge to the rim of the glass.
Drop a few fresh raspberries into the drink for a festive touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy your patriotic 4th of July cocktail.

name: How to Make A La Louisiane
instructions: Fill a mixing glass with ice.
Add rye whiskey, sweet vermouth, Bénédictine, absinthe, and Peychaud’s bitters to the mixing glass.
Stir the mixture until well-chilled.
Strain the mixture into a chilled coupe glass.
Garnish the cocktail with a skewered maraschino cherry.

name: Absinthe Drip
instructions: Pour absinthe into your glass.
Place the absinthe spoon over the glass, and put a sugar cube on it.
Slowly drip cold water over the sugar cube until it dissolves into the absinthe.
Watch the drink turn cloudy and stir gently.
Enjoy your Absinthe Drip!

name: Absinthe Frappe
instructions: Prepare the Glass:
Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.
Mix the Drink:
Add absinthe, simple syrup, and 2 dashes of anisette or Pernod to the shaker.
Shake the ingredients until they are well-chilled.
Serve:
Strain the mixture into a large snifter or highball glass filled with crushed or pebble ice.
Top the glass with soda water, about 2 ounces, and stir gently.
Garnish with a mint sprig.
Enjoy:
Serve immediately and enjoy your Absinthe Frappe!

name: Absinthe Swizzle
instructions: Add absinthe, lime juice, orgeat syrup, and green crème de menthe to a highball glass.
Fill the glass halfway with crushed ice and use a swizzle stick or bar spoon to swizzle the mixture until well-chilled.
Top off the glass with more crushed ice and swizzle again to ensure everything is evenly mixed and chilled.
Garnish with a sprig of fresh mint.

name: Adios Motherfucker
ingredients: Lemon slice and cherry for garnish
instructions: Fill a highball glass with ice.
In a cocktail shaker, combine the vodka, rum, tequila, gin, blue curaçao, and sweet and sour mix.
Shake well to combine.
Strain the mixture into the highball glass over the ice.
Top with lemon-lime soda.
Garnish with a lemon slice and cherry.

name: Affogato for Adults
instructions: In a shaker, mix the hot double shot of espresso with vanilla vodka and coffee liqueur. Shake well to combine.
Place a generous scoop of vanilla ice cream in your preferred serving glass.
Pour the espresso mixture over the vanilla ice cream.
Add a hearty handful of chocolate chips into the glass.
Gently stir to blend the ingredients, savoring how the melting ice cream mingles with the espresso and liqueur. Enjoy!

name: Affogato Martini
ingredients: 1 shot espresso (or you can use 1 ounce of strong brewed coffee)
0.5 ounces coffee liqueur (optional for extra coffee flavor)
Chocolate shavings or coffee beans (for garnish)
instructions: Prepare the Glass:
Place a scoop of vanilla ice cream into a martini glass.
Mix the Drink:
In a shaker, combine the espresso (or coffee), vodka, and coffee liqueur (if using) with ice.
Shake well until the outside of the shaker feels cold.
Combine:
Strain the mixture over the scoop of ice cream in the martini glass.
Garnish:
Sprinkle chocolate shavings or a few coffee beans on top for an elegant finish.
Serve Immediately:
Enjoy the blend of creamy, coffee, and vodka flavors in your delicious Affogato Martini.

name: Alfie’s Apple
instructions: In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, add the mezcal, St-Germain, apple cider, lemon juice, honey syrup, and Peychaud’s Bitters.
Shake the mixture until it is well-chilled.
Double-strain the cocktail into the glass with ice.
Top off the drink with apple soda, stirring gently to combine.
Garnish with a slice of apple for a crisp, aromatic touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy the smoky, sweet, and spiced flavors of this sophisticated cocktail.

name: Almond Joy Martini
instructions: Rim a martini glass with chocolate syrup, then dip it in shredded coconut. Set aside.
Fill a shaker with ice and add the Amaretto, vodka, coconut rum, crème de cacao, and half and half.
Shake well to chill and combine the ingredients.
Strain the cocktail into the prepared glass.
For a fun touch, drizzle chocolate syrup inside the glass before pouring.
Serve and enjoy!

name: Almond Old Fashioned
ingredients: 2 oz Bourbon (Choose a good quality one for the best flavor)
1/2 oz Amaretto (For that deep almond taste)
1  dash Orange bitters (optional, but adds a nice citrusy depth)
instructions: Chill the Glass: Start by placing your serving glass in the freezer to chill it a little while you prepare the drink.
In a mixing glass, combine the bourbon, amaretto, Angostura bitters, and orange bitters if you're using them.
Add a handful of ice cubes to the mixing glass.
Stir Well: Use a long spoon to stir the mixture gently but thoroughly, about 30 seconds or so. The idea is to cool the drink while slightly diluting it to soften the alcohol sharpness.
Prepare the Glass: Remove your glass from the freezer. If you like, you can rub the rim with an orange peel to add a hint of citrus to the rim.
Strain: Strain the cocktail into the chilled glass over fresh ice cubes to keep it cool without diluting it too quickly.
Twist an orange peel over the glass to spritz its oils into the drink, then drop it in or rim the glass with it, depending on your preference.
Add a maraschino cherry for a touch of sweetness and a classic garnish look.
Enjoy: Your Almond Old Fashioned is ready to be enjoyed. Sip it slowly to relish the blend of bourbon and almond flavors.

name: Amaretto Sour
ingredients: 1 Ounce Lemon Juice or Sour Mix
instructions: Juice your lemon
Separate your egg white
Put all the ingredients in a cocktail shaker
Shake it without ice for a few seconds
Then add ice and shake well
Strain it into a glass

name: American Spirit
ingredients: - 2oz Jeptha Creed Bottled in Bond KY Straight Bourbon
- 2 dashes Jeptha Creed Ne Oublie Walnut Bitters
instructions: Combine all ingredients into mixing glass. Fill mixing glass with ice and stir. Strain into rocks glass over ice. Garnish with maple bacon and luxardo cherry.

name: How to Make an Americano
instructions: First fill your glass with ice, then add both the Campari and the sweet vermouth
Add club soda to taste and stir the mixture gently, making sure you don't destroy the soda's bubbles
Use your orange twist to garnish the drink and serve fresh

name: Angostura Colada
ingredients: 3 oz coconut pineapple sparkling water (to top)
Pineapple fronds and lime wheel (for garnish)
instructions: In a blender, combine the coconut cane rum, Angostura bitters, coconut cream, pineapple juice, and lime juice with crushed ice.
Blend until smooth and well-combined.
Pour the mixture into a highball glass and top with more crushed ice.
Add the coconut pineapple sparkling water, gently stirring to combine.
Garnish with pineapple fronds and a lime wheel, and serve immediately.

name: Aperol Blood Orange Gin Mule
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the gin, Aperol, blood orange juice, lime juice, and agave syrup.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously until well chilled.
Add a large ice cube to the serving glass.
Strain the mixture into the prepared glass.
Top with ginger beer.
Garnish with a blood orange slice.
Enjoy your refreshing Aperol Blood Orange Gin Mule!

name: Aperol Negroni
instructions: Fill your cocktail shaker or mixing glass with ice.
Add 1 oz gin, 1 oz sweet vermouth, and 1 oz Aperol to the shaker or glass.
Stir the ingredients together until well combined.
Strain the mixture into a rocks glass filled with ice.
Use a vegetable peeler or knife to remove a strip of orange peel.
Express the oils from the orange peel over the drink and use it as a garnish.

name: Aperol Spritz
instructions: Add the Aperol and the Prosecco to your wine glass
Gently put in some ice cubes with tongs. If you put the ice cubes in before the Prosecco, around half of your bubbles will be lost, so try to avoid this
Add the splash of soda and garnish your cocktail with an orange slice
Enjoy and drink your Aperol Spritz

name: Apple and Cinnamon Punch
ingredients: Cinnamon powder and brown sugar (for rimming glasses)
instructions: In a large punch bowl, combine the vodka, apple juice, ginger beer, and cinnamon sticks. Stir gently to blend the flavors.
Cover the jug or punch bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate until ready to serve.
Just before serving, mix cinnamon powder and brown sugar on a small plate. Wet the rim of each glass, then dip it into the cinnamon-sugar mixture to coat.
Pour the chilled punch into the prepared glasses. Garnish each glass with a thin apple slice and a cinnamon stick for an aromatic, festive presentation.
Serve immediately and enjoy this cozy, flavorful punch!

name: Apple Bee's Knees
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.
Add the gin, lemon juice, apple juice, and honey syrup to the shaker.
Shake well to combine and chill the mixture.
Strain the mixture into a glass.
Garnish with a sprig of rosemary and apple slices.
Enjoy your Apple Bee's Knees Cocktail!

name: Apple-Brandy Hot Toddies
ingredients: 8  cinnamon sticks or apple slices (for garnish)
instructions: In a small saucepan, bring the water to a boil.
Remove the pan from heat and stir in the honey until it is fully dissolved.
Add the lemon juice and apple brandy, stirring to combine.
Place a cinnamon stick in each of the 8 mugs or heatproof glasses.
Pour the hot mixture evenly into the mugs, using the cinnamon stick as a garnish and stirrer.
Serve immediately and enjoy the warm, soothing flavors of this comforting hot toddy.

name: Apple Brandy Negroni
instructions: Fill an Old Fashioned glass with ice.
Add the apple brandy, sweet vermouth, and Campari to the glass.
Stir the mixture until well chilled and fully combined.
Express the oils from a lemon twist over the drink by gently squeezing the peel, then drop the twist into the glass.
Serve immediately and enjoy the crisp, bittersweet flavors of this Apple Brandy Negroni.

name: Apple Brandy Rickey
instructions: In a highball glass, stir together the apple brandy and lime juice.
Add ice to the glass.
Top with soda water and stir gently to combine.
Garnish with a lemon wedge for a bright, citrusy touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy the crisp, refreshing flavors of this light cocktail.

name: Apple Brandy Sidecar
instructions: Begin by filling a coupe glass with ice to chill while you prepare the cocktail.
In a cocktail shaker, combine the apple brandy, orange liqueur, lemon juice, apple cider, and a dash of Holiday Pie Bitters.
Fill the shaker with ice, secure the lid, and shake vigorously until well-chilled.
Discard the ice from the chilled coupe glass.
Strain the shaken cocktail into the prepared coupe glass.
Garnish with a fresh apple slice for an elegant presentation.
Serve immediately and enjoy the warm, fruity, and citrusy flavors of this sophisticated cocktail.

name: Apple Brandy Sour
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the apple brandy, lemon juice, maple syrup, egg white, and cubed ice.
Shake the mixture vigorously to chill the ingredients.
Remove the ice from the shaker and perform a "dry shake" (shaking without ice) to emulsify the egg white, creating a frothy texture.
Strain the cocktail into a sour glass, allowing the frothy mixture to settle.
Garnish with a cherry for a touch of sweetness and visual appeal.
Serve immediately and enjoy the rich, smooth flavors of this classic sour cocktail.

name: Apple Business
instructions: Combine the dry gin, apple juice, lime juice, and honey in a cocktail shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously until the mixture is thoroughly chilled.
Strain the cocktail into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Finish with a garnish of three apple slices skewered together.

name: Apple Cider Amaretto Sour
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with a few ice cubes.
Add the Amaretto liqueur, lemon juice, and apple cider to the shaker.
Shake well for about a minute to ensure the ingredients are thoroughly mixed and chilled.
Strain the mixture into a glass filled with 2-3 large ice cubes.
Garnish with a slice of apple and a maraschino cherry on a cocktail pick for a festive touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy the sweet, tart, and nutty flavors of this autumn-inspired cocktail.

name: Apple Cider Aperol Spritz
ingredients: Garnish: sliced apples (cinnamon sticks, and thyme leaf)
instructions: Rub the rim of the glass with a slice of lemon and dip it into the cinnamon sugar mixture. Set the glass aside until ready to use.
Fill the stemless wine glass with ice until it is almost full.
Pour the spiced apple cider, Aperol, and Champagne into the glass.
Add a splash of soda water to fill the glass to the top.
Gently stir the mixture to combine all the ingredients.
Garnish with a slice of apple, a cinnamon stick, and a thyme leaf.
Enjoy your Apple Cider Aperol Spritz!

name: Apple Cider Bourbon Smash
ingredients: 1  dash of cinnamon sugar (plus more for rimming)
instructions: Prepare your cocktail glass by rimming it with cinnamon sugar moisten the rim, then dip it into a plate of cinnamon sugar for an even coating.
In a mixing glass, combine the bourbon, orange liqueur, maple syrup, caramel apple cider, and a dash of cinnamon sugar. Add ice and stir thoroughly to blend the flavors.
Strain the mixture into your prepared glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with fresh apple slices and a cinnamon stick.

For a warm, aromatic touch, lightly toast the cinnamon stick and rosemary sprig. Use a lighter or culinary torch to briefly toast the top of the cinnamon stick and rosemary, releasing their festive aromas.
Serve immediately and enjoy the cozy, seasonal flavors of your Apple Cider Bourbon Smash.

name: Apple Cider Cable Car Cocktail
ingredients: Garnish: Dried apple slice or cinnamon stick (optional)
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the apple cider, aged or spiced rum, Cointreau, and lemon juice.
Add ice to the shaker and shake vigorously until the mixture is well-chilled and fully combined.
Strain the cocktail into a coupe glass.
Garnish with a dried apple slice or a cinnamon stick for a festive touch, if desired.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Apple Cider Cable Car Cocktail.

name: Apple Cider Cinnamon Whiskey
ingredients: Cinnamon sticks (star anise, orange slices, or cubed apples (for garnish))
instructions: In a glass, combine the apple cider, cinnamon whiskey, seltzer, and lemon juice. Stir well to ensure all the ingredients are mixed.
Add your choice of garnish, such as cinnamon sticks, star anise, orange slices, or cubed apples, to enhance both the flavor and appearance of the drink.
Pour the cocktail over ice for a refreshing beverage.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Apple Cider Cinnamon Whiskey Cocktail!

name: Apple Cider Cocktail
instructions: In a cocktail shaker combine the gin, apple cider, lime juice, honey simple syrup, and a dash of cinnamon.
Add ice and shake or stir vigorously until the mixture is well-chilled.
Fill the serving glass with ice and add a slice apples.
Strain the chilled cocktail mixture into the prepared glass.
Garnish with a sprig of thyme and a cinnamon stick.
Enjoy your Apple Cider Cocktail!

name: Apple Cider Manhattan
instructions: Fill a mixing glass with ice.
Add the whiskey, sweet vermouth, apple cider, lemon juice, simple syrup, and Angostura bitters.
Stir the mixture well, to ensure it is thoroughly mixed and chilled.
Strain the cocktail into your coupe glass and garnish with cherry.
Serve immediately and enjoy the rich, balanced flavors of this autumn-inspired Manhattan.

name: Apple Cider Margarita
ingredients: Apple slices and cinnamon sticks for garnish
instructions: Rub a lime wedge around the rim of two glass. Dip the rim into a shallow dish filled with ground cinnamon to coat them.
Fill the glass with ice.
In a cocktail shaker, combine the tequila, lime juice, and apple cider. Add ice and shake vigorously.
Strain the mixture into the ice-filled glass.
Top each drink with ginger beer.
Garnish with apple slices and cinnamon sticks.

name: Apple Cider-Mezcal Margarita
ingredients: Garnish: cinnamon sticks and apple slices
instructions: On a small plate, mix together the granulated sugar, ground cinnamon, and salt.
Rub the lime wedge around the rims of 2 rocks glasses, then dip the rims into the cinnamon-sugar-salt mixture until well coated.
Fill the glasses with ice cubes.
Fill a cocktail shaker with ice cubes. Add apple cider, lime juice, mezcal, and triple sec.
Cover and shake well until the mixture is thoroughly chilled.
Divide the mixture evenly between the prepared glasses.
Garnish each glass with a cinnamon stick and apple slices, if desired.
Enjoy your Apple Cider-Mezcal Margarita!

name: Apple Cider Mojito
ingredients: 8  fresh mint leaves (plus more for garnish)
Garnishes: Mint sprig (apple slice, lime wedge, cinnamon stick (optional))
instructions: In a tall glass, add the fresh mint leaves and lime wedges.
Use a muddler to gently crush the mint and lime, releasing their flavors.
Pour in the lime juice, simple syrup, white rum, and apple cider.
Fill the glass almost to the top with crushed ice.
Use a bar spoon to stir the mixture, ensuring all the ingredients are well combined.
Top off the glass with club soda for a refreshing fizz.
Garnish with a sprig of mint, a slice of apple, a lime wedge, and a cinnamon stick, if desired.
Serve with a straw and enjoy your Apple Cider Mojito.

name: Apple Cider Punch
instructions: In a large pitcher or punch bowl, combine apple cider, orange juice, and lemon juice. Stir well to mix.
If making spiked apple cider punch, add the rum and stir to combine.
Add the sliced apples, oranges, and cinnamon sticks to the pitcher or punch bowl.
Refrigerate the mixture for at least one hour to chill and allow the flavors to meld.
When ready to serve, add the ginger ale to the mixture and stir gently.
Pour the punch over glasses filled with ice.
Enjoy your Apple Cider Punch!

name: Apple Cider Sangria
instructions: In a large pitcher, add the cinnamon sticks, sliced apples, sliced oranges, and frozen cranberries.
Pour in the white wine, apple cider, and caramel vodka. Stir everything together gently to combine the flavors.
Refrigerate the sangria for at least an hour to allow the flavors to meld.
Serve chilled and enjoy your seasonal Apple Cider Sangria!

name: Apple Cider Vodka Crush
instructions: Fill a highball or rocks glass entirely with crushed ice.
Pour in the apple cider, vodka, and ginger ale over the ice.
Use a stir stick to mix the ingredients well.
Garnish with a slice of Honeycrisp apple and a cinnamon stick.
Sprinkle a dash of cinnamon on top.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Apple Cider Vodka Crush!

name: Apple Cider Whiskey Punch
instructions: In a shaker, combine the apple cider and whiskey. Shake lightly to mix.
Strain the mixture into a glass filled with ice.
Add the sparkling wine and ginger beer, stirring gently to combine.
Garnish with a fresh apple slice and serve immediately.

name: Apple Cinnamon Whiskey Smash
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, add the apple slices and mint leaves. Use a muddler to gently smash them together, releasing their flavors.
Add the whiskey, cinnamon simple syrup, apple cider, and lemon juice to the shaker.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously until well-chilled.
Strain the mixture into a rocks glass filled with crushed ice.
Garnish with a cinnamon stick and a fresh mint leaf for a festive touch.

name: Apple Collins
instructions: Prepare the Glass: Fill a Collins glass with ice cubes.
Mix the Ingredients:
Add the Vodka, apple juice, and fresh lemon juice to a shaker with ice.
Shake well to combine and chill the ingredients.
Pour: Strain the mixture into the prepared Collins glass over the ice.
Top with Club Soda: Slowly top up the drink with club soda.
Garnish: Add a slice of apple to garnish.
Serve: Serve immediately and enjoy your refreshing Apple Collins.

name: Apple Daiquiri
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.
Pour in the light white rum, apple juice, lime juice, and simple syrup.
Shake well until the mixture is chilled.
Strain the mixture into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with an apple wedge on the rim of the glass.
Serve immediately and enjoy your refreshing Apple Daiquiri.

name: Apple Gin Fizz
instructions: Shake the Ingredients: In a cocktail shaker, combine the gin, apple juice, lemon juice, simple syrup, and egg white (if using). Shake vigorously without ice to emulsify the egg white.
Add Ice: Add ice to the shaker and shake again until well-chilled.
Strain and Pour: Strain the mixture into a highball glass filled with ice.
Top with Club Soda: Add the club soda and give it a gentle stir.
Garnish: Garnish with a thin apple slice or a lemon twist.

name: Apple Island Splash
instructions: In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, combine the pineapple rum, sour apple pucker, and pineapple juice.
Shake well to mix the ingredients.
Strain the mixture into a glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with Sprite for a fizzy finish.
Serve and enjoy!

name: Apple Juice Maple Cocktail
instructions: Begin by filling a cocktail shaker with ice.
Pour in the apple juice, vodka, lime juice, ground cinnamon, and maple syrup.
Shake vigorously until the mixture is well blended and thoroughly chilled.
Strain the mixture into a cocktail glass.
Garnish with a skewer of thinly sliced apple slices and a cinnamon stick to enhance both the flavor and presentation.

name: Apple Lemon Drop Cocktail
instructions: Take a lemon wedge and run it around the rim of a martini glass.
Dip the rim of the glass into sugar to coat it evenly.
Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.
Add 2 oz of Apple Vodka.
Pour in 1 oz of Lemon Juice.
Add 0.5 oz of Simple Syrup.
Shake well until the mixture is chilled.
Strain the mixture into the prepared martini glass.
Garnish with a thin slice of apple or a lemon twist if desired.

name: Apple Maple Dark and Stormy
instructions: In a rocks glass, combine the dark rum, maple syrup, apple juice, and ginger beer.
Stir the mixture well to ensure all ingredients are fully blended.
Fill the glass with crushed ice to chill the drink.
Garnish with a thin slice of apple for an extra touch of flavor and presentation.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Apple Maple Dark and Stormy!

name: Apple Mojito
ingredients: Mint sprig and apple slices for garnish
instructions: Muddle Ingredients: In a glass, add the diced green apple, mint leaves, sugar, and lime wedges. Use a muddler or the back of a spoon to gently muddle the ingredients, releasing the flavors.
Add Rum and Juice: Pour in the white rum and apple juice. Stir well to combine.
Add Ice: Fill the glass with ice cubes.
Top with Club Soda: Top off the drink with club soda. Give it a gentle stir.
Garnish: Garnish with a sprig of mint and a few slices of apple.
Serve: Serve immediately and enjoy your refreshing Apple Mojito.
For a sweeter drink, adjust the amount of sugar or use sweetened apple juice.
To make a non-alcoholic version, simply omit the rum and add more apple juice or a splash of lemon-lime soda.

name: Apple Mountain Dew Cocktail
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the pineapple juice, vodka, sour apple schnapps, and lime juice. Add a couple of ice cubes.
Shake the mixture until well chilled.
Strain the chilled mixture into a cocktail glass filled with crushed ice.
Top off the glass with 4 oz of Mountain Dew for a fizzy finish.
Garnish with a lime wedge for a citrusy touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Sour Apple Mountain Dew Cocktail!

name: Apple Pear Martini
instructions: On a small plate, mix equal parts cinnamon and sugar for the rim. Run a bit of cinnamon simple syrup around the rim of a martini glass, then dip it into the cinnamon-sugar mixture until evenly coated.
Fill a cocktail shaker with ice, then add the pear juice, apple cider, cinnamon simple syrup, lemon juice, and pear vodka.
Shake the mixture vigorously for 20-30 seconds to ensure it's well chilled and blended.
Strain the cocktail into the prepared martini glass and serve immediately.

name: Apple Pear Spritz
ingredients: Apple fan and edible flower for garnish
instructions: In a wine glass filled with ice, pour the pear liqueur.
Top off the glass with Champagne (sparkling wine).
Gently stir to mix the ingredients.
Garnish with an apple fan and an edible flower.
Enjoy!

name: Apple Pie Martini
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine vodka, Fireball, apple cider, half and half, and caramel sauce.
Add ice to the shaker and shake vigorously for 30 seconds until well combined.
Squeeze more caramel syrup into a martini glass as a garnish, or use the caramel sauce and cinnamon sugar for a sugar rim.
Pour the Apple Pie Martini into the prepared martini glass.
Garnish with your options like whipped cream, cinamon sugar, a cinnamon stick, or an apple slice.

name: Apple Pie on the Rocks
instructions: Start by wetting the rim of your rocks glass slightly with water or a bit of apple juice. Pour the brown sugar onto a small plate, then dip the rim of the glass into the sugar to coat it evenly.
In a martini shaker, combine the vanilla vodka, Fireball whiskey, organic apple juice, and a pinch of ground cinnamon.
Add a handful of ice cubes to the shaker, then shake vigorously until the mixture is well chilled and fully combined.
Carefully pour the cocktail into the prepared glass, ensuring you don't disturb the sugared rim.
Garnish with a cinnamon stick for an added touch of warmth and presentation.
Serve chilled and enjoy the rich, spiced flavors of this autumn-inspired cocktail.

name: Apple Spritz
instructions: Fill a wine glass with ice.
Add the Aperol, apple cider, and prosecco to the glass.
Stir gently to combine.
Top up with soda water if desired.
Garnish with a slice of red apple.
Serve immediately and enjoy your refreshing Apple Spritz.

name: Apple Vodka Lemonade
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.
Add vodka, apple schnapps, lemon juice, and simple syrup to the shaker.
Shake well until the mixture is chilled.
Strain the mixture into a tall glass filled with ice.
Top off with sparkling water.
Garnish with apple slices.
Stir gently and serve.

name: Apple Vodka Sour
ingredients: 1  egg white (optional, for a frothy texture)
Apple slice and lemon twist for garnish
instructions: If you haven't already, make your simple syrup by dissolving equal parts sugar and water over medium heat. Let it cool.
Juice your lemon if using fresh lemons.
In a cocktail shaker, combine the vodka, apple juice, lemon juice, simple syrup, and egg white (if using).
Add ice cubes to the shaker.
Shake vigorously for about 15-20 seconds. If using egg white, give it an initial dry shake (without ice) for about 10 seconds, then add ice and shake again.
Strain the mixture into a chilled rocks glass filled with ice.
Garnish with a slice of apple and a twist of lemon peel.

name: Apple Whiskey Smash
ingredients: A sprig of mint for garnish
instructions: Put the apple pieces, lemon wedges, and sugar into the cocktail shaker.
Muddle (smash) them together until the fruit is juiced and mixed with the sugar.
Add the whiskey and fill the shaker with ice.
Shake well until everything is cold.
Strain the mix into your rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a mint sprig. Enjoy!

name: Applebee’s Tipsy Zombie
ingredients: Splash of grenadine (plus extra for garnish)
instructions: Start by pouring a small amount of salt onto a plate. Run the lime wedge around the rim of the glass, then dip the rim into the salt, twisting to ensure an even coating.
Fill a cocktail shaker with ice cubes. Add the rum, lime juice, orange juice, pineapple juice, and a splash of grenadine.
Shake the mixture well for about 15 seconds to combine all the ingredients.
Strain the cocktail into your prepared, salt-rimmed glass filled with fresh ice cubes.
Finish by adding an extra splash of grenadine on top for a colorful and sweet garnish. Add a lime wheel for a citrusy touch.
Serve and enjoy your Applebee’s Tipsy Zombie for a perfect tropical treat!

name: Applejack Old Fashioned
ingredients: Orange peel or cinnamon stick (optional, for garnish)
instructions: In a chilled mixing glass, combine the apple brandy, maple syrup, Angostura bitters, and baking spice bitters.
Fill the mixing glass with ice and stir until well-chilled.
Strain the mixture into a chilled rocks glass over a large ice cube, if available.
Express the oils from an orange peel by gently squeezing it over the glass, then drop the peel into the drink.
Optionally, garnish with a cinnamon stick for an extra touch of warmth and spice.
Serve immediately and enjoy the rich, spiced flavors of this Applejack Old Fashioned.

name: Applejack Rabbit Cocktail
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.
Add the apple brandy, fresh lemon juice, fresh orange juice, and maple syrup to the shaker.
Shake vigorously until the mixture is well chilled.
Strain the cocktail into a glass.
Garnish with a slice of Envy apple for a crisp and elegant touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy the bright, balanced flavors of this refreshing cocktail.

name: Apricot Bourbon Fizz
ingredients: Sparkling wine or club soda (to top up)
instructions: Make the Cocktail:
In a blender or food processor, puree the pitted apricots until smooth.
In a cocktail shaker, combine the apricot puree, bourbon, lime juice, simple syrup, and elderflower liqueur.
Fill the shaker with ice, cover, and shake vigorously until well chilled.
Assemble the Drink:
Strain the cocktail mixture into the prepared glass, filling it about halfway or three-quarters full.
Top off the drink with sparkling wine or club soda for a refreshing fizz.
Gently stir to incorporate.
Garnish and Serve:
Optionally, garnish with a slice of lime or a few apricot slices.
Serve immediately and enjoy the fresh, fruity burst of spring in your delightful bourbon fizz.

name: Apricot Cosmopolitan
ingredients: Apricot slice or twist for garnish
instructions: Chill a martini glass by placing it in the freezer or by filling it with ice water while you prepare the cocktail.
In a cocktail shaker, add ice.
Pour in the vodka, apricot liqueur, fresh lime juice, cranberry juice, and simple syrup (if using).
Secure the lid on the cocktail shaker and shake vigorously for about 15-20 seconds. This helps to chill the ingredients and blend the flavors well.
Remove the ice from the chilled martini glass if you used ice water to chill it.
Strain the shaken mixture into the chilled martini glass.
Garnish with an apricot slice or a twist of apricot peel on the rim of the glass.
Serve immediately and enjoy your refreshing Apricot Cosmopolitan.

name: Apricot Daiquiri
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.
Pour in 2 oz of Rum.
Add 3/4 oz of Apricot puree.
Squeeze in 3/4 oz of fresh Lime Juice.
Add 1/2 oz of Simple Syrup.
Shake vigorously until the shaker feels cold to the touch.
Strain the mixture into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a twist of lime.
Enjoy your refreshing Apricot Daiquiri.

name: Apricot Gimlet
ingredients: Lime wheel or apricot slice for garnish
instructions: Prepare Your Shaker: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.
Add Ingredients: Pour in the gin, apricot liqueur, fresh lime juice, and simple syrup.
Shake It Up: Shake well until the mixture is well-chilled.
Strain: Strain the cocktail into a chilled coupe or martini glass.
Garnish: Garnish with a lime wheel or an apricot slice.
Serve and Enjoy: Serve immediately and enjoy your refreshing Apricot Gimlet.

name: Apricot Gin Fizz
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.
Add the gin, apricot liqueur, lemon juice, and simple syrup to the shaker.
Shake well until the mixture is chilled.
Strain the mixture into a highball glass filled with ice.
Top off with club soda.
Gently stir to combine.
Garnish with a lemon wheel or an apricot slice if desired.

name: Apricot Paloma
instructions: Fill a shaker with ice.
Add 1 oz of Apricot puree, 1 oz of Grapefruit Juice, 1.5 oz of Tequila, and ½ oz of Simple Syrup.
Shake well until the mixture is chilled.
Strain the mixture into a glass filled with ice.
Top off with a splash of Club Soda.
Garnish with a slice of grapefruit or lemon.

name: Apricot Spritz
ingredients: Fresh apricot slices and a sprig of mint for garnish
instructions: Fill a wine glass with ice.
Add the apricot brandy, fresh lemon juice, and simple syrup to the glass.
Stir gently to combine.
Top with Prosecco and club soda.
Garnish with fresh apricot slices and a sprig of mint.
Serve immediately and enjoy your refreshing Apricot Spritz.

name: Apricot Vodka Lemonade
ingredients: Lemon wheel and apricot slice for garnish
instructions: Fill a shaker with ice.
Add 2 oz vodka, 1 oz apricot puree, 1 oz fresh lemon juice, and 1 oz simple syrup to the shaker.
Shake well until the mixture is chilled.
Fill a glass with ice and strain the mixture into the glass.
Top off with sparkling water and stir gently to combine.
Garnish with a lemon wheel and an apricot slice.
Serve immediately and enjoy your refreshing Apricot Vodka Lemonade.

name: Aruba Ariba Cocktail
instructions: Add the orange juice, pineapple juice, grenadine, vodka, white rum, crème de banana, and lemon juice to a cocktail shaker filled with ice.
Secure the lid and shake well until the ingredients are thoroughly mixed and chilled.
Strain the cocktail into a glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a maraschino cherry and an orange slice to enhance both the flavor and presentation.

name: Aunt Roberta
instructions: Fill your cocktail shaker with ice.
Pour in 2 ounces of gin, 1 ounce of vermouth, and a teaspoon of absinthe.
Add a dash of bitters for that extra oomph.
Shake it like you mean it.
Strain into your chilled martini glass.
Sip slowly and savor the magic.

name: Autumn Apple
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the dry gin, apple cider, lemon juice, honey syrup, aromatic bitters, and a pinch of cinnamon.
Add ice to the shaker and shake until well-chilled.
Double-strain the mixture using a handheld strainer into a coupe glass.
Express the oil from a lemon twist over the drink and garnish with the twist.

name: Autumn Fizz
ingredients: Garnish: fresh lavender and sliced apple
instructions: Lightly rim your highball glass with agave syrup, then dip the rim into the lavender or ginger sugar to coat it.
Fill a cocktail shaker with ice and add the dry gin, lemon juice, and agave syrup.
Shake well to combine and chill the mixture.
Pour the mixture into the prepared highball glass filled with ice.
Top with sparkling cider.
Garnish with a sprig of fresh lavender and a slice of apple.
Enjoy your Autumn Fizz!

name: Autumn Harvest Rum Punch
instructions: In a large pitcher, combine the apple cider, frozen orange juice concentrate, cranberry juice, pear juice, and spiced rum. Stir well until the orange juice concentrate is fully dissolved and the mixture is well combined.
Refrigerate the punch for at least 1 hour to allow the flavors to meld together.
Just before serving, pour the sparkling white wine into the pitcher. Stir gently to mix.
Add sliced oranges, apples, pears, frozen cranberries, and cinnamon sticks to the pitcher for a festive garnish. Serve cold and enjoy!

name: Autumn Old Fashioned
instructions: Fill a glass with ice.
Add the rye whiskey, apple cider, Angostura bitters, and maple syrup  to the glass.
Stir the mixture well to combine all the ingredients and ensure the drink is chilled.
Serve immediately and enjoy the rich, spiced flavors of this classic cocktail.

name: Autumn Rum Old Fashioned
instructions: In a mixing glass, combine the aged rum, apple cider syrup, and Angostura bitters.
Add ice to the mixing glass and stir until the mixture is well-chilled.
Strain the mixture into an Old Fashioned glass filled with a large ice cube or a few smaller ones.
Express the oil from an orange twist over the drink by holding the twist over the glass and giving it a gentle squeeze. Drop the twist into the drink for added flavor and aroma.
Sip and enjoy the warm, spiced flavors of this autumnal take on a classic Old Fashioned.

name: Autumn Spiced Rum Cider
instructions: Fill a rocks glass with ice.
Pour the spiced rum and spiced apple cider over the ice in the glass.
Stir the mixture well to combine the flavors.
Pour in the hard cider to top off the drink.
Finish with 2-3 dashes of lemon bitters for a citrusy twist.
Serve immediately and enjoy the warm, spiced flavors of this autumn-inspired cocktail.

name: Autumn Spiced Rum Punch
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the spiced rum, apple cider, orange juice, and cranberry juice.
Add ice and shake vigorously for 10 seconds.
Strain the mixture into a prepared glass filled with ice.
Garnish with a cinnamon stick, orange wheel, sliced apple, and chopped pear.
Serve and enjoy your Autumn Spiced Rum Punch!

name: Autumn Vodka Smash
instructions: In a shaker, muddle the fresh fig and basil leaves together to release their flavors.
Add the lemon juice, maple syrup, apple juice, vodka, and a handful of ice to the shaker.
Shake well until the mixture is thoroughly chilled.
Strain the mixture into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with a splash of ginger beer for a refreshing finish.
Garnish with a sprig of basil and half a fig.
Serve and enjoy!

name: Azalea Cocktail
instructions: In a glass, combine vodka, pineapple juice, lemon juice, and grenadine. Stir well.
Serve over ice.
Garnish with a lemon slice, cherry, and fresh mint.
Serve and enjoy!

name: The B 52
instructions: Gather your ingredients and a shot glass
Pour the coffee liqueur into the bottom of the glass
Gently layer the Irish cream liqueur on top
Finally, top it off with another layer of Grand Marnier
Serve immediately and enjoy

name: Bad Santa
instructions: In a shaker, combine the bourbon and eggnog. If you prefer a chilled version, add ice and shake gently to mix.
Pour the mixture into a rocks glass or festive mug. Serve over ice for a cold cocktail or skip the ice for a warm, cozy option.
Sprinkle freshly grated nutmeg over the top. Optionally, add a cinnamon stick for an extra festive touch.

name: Bailey's Chocolate Martini
instructions: Fill your shaker with ice.
Pour in the Bailey's, vodka, and chocolate liqueur.
Shake it up well until it's cold.
Strain the mix into your martini glass.
Drizzle some chocolate syrup for a fancy touch.
Enjoy your delicious creation.

name: Baileys Espresso Martini
ingredients: 1/4 oz vodka (optional for an extra kick)
instructions: Prepare the Espresso:
Brew a strong espresso and allow it to cool. You'll want it cold to prevent melting the ice too quickly.
Combine Ingredients:
In a shaker, combine the cooled espresso, Baileys Irish Cream, and vodka if you're including it.
Add a handful of ice cubes.
Shake:
Secure the lid on the shaker and shake vigorously for about 15 seconds. This not only chills the drink but also introduces air, giving the martini a nice froth.
Strain and Serve:
Strain the mixture into a chilled martini glass. The aim is to have a nice foam on top.
Garnish:
For a classic finishing touch, float three coffee beans on the foam. This garnish is not just decorative; in Italian culture, it symbolizes health, wealth, and happiness.
Enjoy:
Serve immediately and enjoy the luxurious blend of coffee and creamy Baileys.

name: Bailey's Peppermint Martini
ingredients: 0.5 ounce chocolate syrup (for garnish and rimming)
instructions: Prepare your martini glass by drizzling chocolate syrup inside the glass to create a decorative swirl. For an extra touch, you can rim the glass with chocolate syrup as well.
Place the glass in the refrigerator to chill while you prepare the cocktail.
In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, add the peppermint vodka and Bailey's Irish Cream.
Shake vigorously until the mixture is well chilled and fully combined.
Strain the cocktail into the prepared martini glass.
Garnish with a candy cane and serve immediately.

name: Baileys White Russian Cocktail
instructions: Fill the Glass:
Fill a glass with ice cubes to chill the ingredients as they mix.
Add the Liquids:
Pour the vodka, Baileys Irish Cream, and Kahlua over the ice.
Mix:
Stir the mixture gently to combine the vodka, Baileys, and Kahlua, allowing the flavors to meld.
Top with Milk:
Slowly add the milk to the glass, creating a slight layer on top or blending it in for a creamy texture.
Stir Lightly:
Give the mixture a gentle stir if you added the milk as a mix rather than a layer.
Optional Garnish:
For a decorative touch, you could garnish with a sprinkle of cocoa powder or a few coffee beans.
Serve:
Enjoy your cocktail immediately while it's cold and refreshing.

name: Baltimore Zoo
instructions: Fill a large glass with ice
Pour all liquid ingredients except beer into the glass
Stir
Top with a splash of beer
Add a lemon wedge garnish

name: Banana Maple Smash
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.
Add the bourbon, banana crème liqueur, maple syrup, and lemon juice in the shaker.
Shake the mixture vigorously until well-chilled.
Strain the cocktail into a short glass filled with ice.
Garnish with a slice of banana and serve immediately.

name: Banana Old Fashioned
instructions: Combine the simple syrup and Angostura bitters in a mixing glass, stirring gently to blend.
Pour in the banana peel rum and fill the mixing glass with ice.
Stir the mixture for 20–30 seconds to chill and achieve the ideal dilution.
Strain the cocktail into a rocks glass over a large ice cube.
Twist an orange peel over the drink to release its aromatic oils, then drop it into the glass for an enhanced flavor profile.

name: Banana Pudding Cocktail
ingredients: Agave syrup ( for rimming the glass)
Crushed vanilla wafers for rimming the glass
instructions: Brush the rim of your serving glass with agave syrup, then dip it into crushed vanilla wafers to coat evenly. Place the glass in the freezer to chill.
In a cocktail shaker, muddle two vanilla wafers with RumChata and white chocolate liqueur until well combined.
Add vanilla-infused rum, banana liqueur, and simple syrup to the shaker. Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously to chill and blend the ingredients.
Remove the prepared glass from the freezer and fill it with fresh ice. Strain the mixture into the glass.
Top with whipped cream. Garnish with a banana slice, crushed wafers and enjoy your drink!

name: Bat Sh*t Crazy
instructions: Begin by rimming your glass with black sugar. To do this, pour a small amount of black sugar onto a plate, wet the rim of your glass with water or lime juice, and dip the rim into the sugar to coat evenly.
In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, add the apple vodka, pumpkin puree, apple juice, lime juice, and orgeat syrup.
Shake vigorously to blend and chill the ingredients.
Strain the mixture into the prepared glass.
Garnish with a sprig of fresh mint and a cinnamon stick for a spooky finishing touch.
Serve and enjoy Bat Sh*t Crazy—a festive, eerie cocktail perfect for celebrating the fall season!

name: Batanga Float
instructions: Place two scoops of vanilla ice cream into your glass.
In a separate glass, combine the fresh lime juice, tequila, and a pinch of salt.
Pour the lime juice and tequila mixture over the ice cream.
Top with Coca-Cola to fill the glass.
Stir gently with the knife you used to cut the limes.
Add a straw and enjoy!

name: Beachy Bourbon
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the bourbon, lime juice, campari and a scoop of ice. Shake well for 30 seconds.
Strain into an ice filled highball or rocks glass.
Top off with ginger beer and garnish with a lime wedge.

name: Beer Boulevardier
instructions: In a mixing glass, combine the Campari, bourbon, sweet vermouth, and blood orange bitters.
Stir the mixture gently to combine.
Pour the mixture into a serving glass.
Top off the glass with lager beer.
Garnish with a slice of blood orange.
Enjoy!

name: Beetlejuice Cocktail
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, muddle the blackberries until they release their juices and create a rich, dark base.
Add the 1800 Tequila Coconut, coconut water, lime juice, simple syrup, and torn basil leaves to the shaker.
Add a handful of small ice cubes to the shaker and shake vigorously to mix and chill the ingredients.
Without straining, pour the entire contents of the shaker into a Pilsner glass, allowing the muddled blackberries and basil to remain in the drink.
Top the cocktail with crushed ice to fill the glass and create a frosty finish.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Beetlejuice cocktail.

name: Bermuda Bliss
ingredients: Mint sprig and lime peel (for garnish)
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the light rum, blue curaçao, vanilla liqueur, lime juice, and cinnamon syrup.
Add crushed ice to the shaker and shake vigorously to chill and mix the ingredients.
Dump the entire contents of the shaker, including the ice, into your serving glass.
Top off the glass with additional crushed ice to fill.
Garnish as desired and serve immediately.

name: Berry Cherry Holiday
instructions: In a cocktail mixing glass, combine the blackberries, rum, orange juice, and cherry jam. Use a muddler to crush the blackberries and blend the flavors.
Add the spiced simple syrup, then transfer the mixture to a shaker filled with ice. Shake well to chill and mix thoroughly.
Prepare a tall glass with fresh ice. Strain the shaken cocktail into the glass.
Top off the drink with sparkling water and stir gently to combine.
Garnish with a few blackberries, a maraschino cherry, and a couple of fresh sage leaves. Serve immediately and enjoy!

name: Berry Lemon Drop Martini
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, muddle two strawberries and a few blueberries with simple syrup.
Add orange liqueur, vodka, and lemon juice to the shaker.
Shake with ice to mix and chill the ingredients.
Prepare your martini glass by brushing the rim with agave syrup and dipping it into sugar to coat.
Strain the mixture into the prepared glass over fresh ice.
Garnish with a slice of strawberry and a couple of blueberries.
Enjoy your vibrant cocktail!

name: Berry Spicy Basil Margarita
ingredients: 0.5 ounce agave syrup (for rimming the glass)
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, muddle three strawberries and a few jalapeño slices with the agave until well combined.
Add the orange liqueur, tequila, lime juice, and basil leaves to the shaker.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously to chill and blend the ingredients.
Prepare rocks glass by brushing the rim with agave and dipping it into Himalayan salt.
Strain the mixture into the prepped glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a strawberry, a few jalapeño slices, and a sprig of basil.
Enjoy!

name: Bicicletta
ingredients: 3 oz Dry white wine (Pinot Grigio or Sauvignon Blanc)
Sparkling water or club soda (to top)
instructions: Fill a highball glass generously with ice.
Pour Campari and dry white wine (like Pinot Grigio or Sauvignon Blanc) into the glass.
Top off the mixture with sparkling water or club soda.
Gently stir the ingredients to blend them together.
Garnish your creation with an orange slice or wheel.
Enjoy your drink.

name: Big Red
instructions: Fill a highball glass with ice cubes.
Pour 2 ounces of Red Label Scotch whisky into the glass.
Add 2 ounces of Budweiser.
Top off with 2 ounces of ginger beer.
Gently stir the ingredients to mix.
Garnish with a fresh lime wedge on the rim of the glass.
Enjoy your Big Red cocktail as you celebrate the 4th of July.

name: Bijou
instructions: Fill a mixing glass with ice.
Add gin, sweet vermouth, green Chartreuse, and 2 dashes of orange bitters to the mixing glass.
Stir the ingredients in the mixing glass for about 30 seconds to combine them thoroughly. This will also chill the mixture and dilute it slightly.
Strain the mixture into a chilled coupe or martini glass.
Garnish with a cherry or a lemon twist, if desired.

name: Bikini Martini
instructions: In a shaker filled with ice, combine the coconut rum, vodka, and pineapple juice.
Shake firmly until the mixture is frothy and well-chilled.
Strain the cocktail into a martini glass.
Add grenadine in the center for a pop of color.
Serve immediately and enjoy!

name: Bitter Apple Negroni
instructions: Add the apple whiskey, aperitif wine, Suze, and apple cinnamon syrup to a mixing glass.
Fill the mixing glass 3/4 full with ice. Stir until very cold, about 30 times.
Strain: Strain the mixture into a rocks glass filled with ice, or over one large ice cube.
Garnish with an expressed lemon twist. For an extra touch, add an apple fan.
Enjoy your Bitter Apple Negroni!

name: Bitter Strawberry Mai Tai
instructions: In a cocktail shaker or mixing glass, combine the strawberry-infused Campari, Jamaican rum, dry curaçao, lime juice, orgeat, and simple syrup.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously until the mixture is well-chilled.
Strain the cocktail into a rocks glass filled with crushed ice.
Garnish with a sprig of fresh mint and a strawberry.
Serve immediately and enjoy!

name: Black Lemon Drop Martini
instructions: Rim a coupe glass with simple syrup and black sugar, then set aside.
In a cocktail shaker, combine lemon juice, simple syrup, citron vodka, and a pinch of edible black glitter.
Add ice to the shaker and shake vigorously until well chilled.
Strain the mixture into the prepared coupe glass.
Garnish with a lemon wheel for a finishing touch of elegance.

name: How to Make a Black Manhattan
instructions: Fill a mixing glass with ice.
Add rye whiskey, Averna amaro, Angostura bitters, and orange bitters to the mixing glass.
Stir the mixture until it is well-chilled.
Strain the mixture into a chilled coupe glass.
Garnish the cocktail with 1-2 maraschino cherries.

name: Black Mojito
ingredients: Mint sprig and lime wheel  (for garnish)
instructions: Place mint leaves and simple syrup in a highball glass, then gently muddle the mint to release its natural oils.
Add the dark rum to a mixing glass, mix in the black food coloring, and stir until fully combined.
Pour the rum mixture and lime juice into the glass with the muddled mint, stirring well to incorporate.
Fill the glass with crushed ice, and top off with club soda.
Stir lightly, then garnish with a slice of lime and mint leaves for a fresh finish.

name: Black Paloma
instructions: Run a grapefruit wedge along the rim of your glass, then dip it into salt to coat the edge.
Pour the coffee liqueur, tequila, and grapefruit juice into the glass.
Add ice, then top with club soda.
Stir gently to blend the flavors.
Garnish with a grapefruit slice and serve immediately.

name: Black Russian
instructions: Place the ice cubes into your old-fashioned glass
Pour the vodka and coffee liqueur into a separate mixing glass
Stir the mixture together before pouring over the ice

name: Black Sangria
instructions: In a large pitcher, combine the dark red wine, brandy, and simple syrup. Add the sliced black plums, black grapes, and organic blackberries to the mixture.
Stir the ingredients together with a large spoon until well combined.
Place the pitcher in the refrigerator and let the sangria sit for 1 to 2 hours. The longer it sits, the darker the plums will become, allowing the flavors to meld beautifully.
When ready to serve, give the sangria a gentle stir, and pour it into glasses over ice if desired. Keep the sangria in the fridge until ready to enjoy.
For a fizzy twist, top each glass with a splash of sparkling water before serving.
Serve chilled and enjoy your Black Sangria!

name: Black Sunrise
instructions: Fill a highball glass with ice.
Pour the orange juice over the ice, leaving space at the top.
Add a splash of grenadine, allowing it to settle at the bottom for a layered effect.
Slowly pour the black vodka over the back of a spoon to create a dark layer on top.
Garnish with an orange wedge for a bright, citrusy finish.

name: Black Widow Shot
instructions: Mix the black edible glitter with the rum until fully combined.
Pour fruit punch into shot glass.
Carefully layer the rum mixture on top of the fruit punch using a bar spoon for a dramatic effect.
Serve and enjoy your shimmering, spooky creation!

name: Black Widow
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.
Add the black vodka, raspberry liqueur, lime juice, and simple syrup.
Shake well until the mixture is chilled and fully combined.
Strain into a chilled glass.
Garnish with fresh raspberries and lime wheel for a spooky finishing touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy your hauntingly delicious Black Widow!

name: Blackberries and Cream Margarita
ingredients: 1 oz Orange Liqueur (Cointreau or Triple Sec)
instructions: Add 5-6 blackberries and freshly squeezed lime juice to a cocktail shaker. Muddle the blackberries until they are fully mashed.
Add tequila, orange liqueur, coconut cream, and ice to the shaker.
Shake vigorously for at least 20 seconds to mix and chill the ingredients.
Rub the rim of your cocktail glass with a lime wedge, then dip the rim into granulated sugar to coat.
Fill the cocktail glass with ice.
Strain the mixture from the shaker into the prepared glass.
Garnish with the remaining blackberries.
Enjoy your Blackberries and Cream Margarita!

name: Blackberry Aperol Spritz
instructions: Pour the blackberry simple syrup and Aperol into a large wine glass.
Fill the glass to the top with ice.
Top off the glass with sparkling rosé.
Garnish with an orange slice.
Enjoy your Blackberry Aperol Spritz!

name: Blackberry Basil Whiskey Smash
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, muddle a few blackberries with the simple syrup until well combined.
Add the honey whiskey, lemon juice, and basil leaves to the shaker.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake it well to chill and blend the ingredients.
Strain the mixture over fresh ice in your rocks glass.
Garnish with a basil sprig, blackberries and get ready to enjoy!

name: Blackberry Cobbler Cocktail
ingredients: Fresh blackberries or lemon twist (for garnish, optional)
instructions: Dip the rim of your glass into honey syrup, then press it into graham cracker crumbs to coat evenly.
In the coated glass, muddle a handful of fresh blackberries to release their juices. Set the glass aside.
In a cocktail shaker, combine the blackberry whiskey, RumChata, lemon juice, honey, and a few ice cubes.
Shake vigorously until the ingredients are well-chilled and blended.
Strain the cocktail into the prepared glass over fresh ice.
Garnish with a few blackberries.
Serve immediately and enjoy!

name: Blackberry Fig Smash
instructions: Rim your serving glass with salt and fill it halfway with ice.
In a cocktail shaker, muddled blackberries, figs then combine the tequila, lime juice, agave nectar, and ice.
Shake vigorously until the mixture is well-chilled and combined.
Strain the mixture into the prepared glass over ice.
Garnish with the halved fig for a sophisticated touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy your delicious Blackberry Fig Smash!

name: Blackberry Pineapple Rum Cocktail
instructions: Fill a mixing glass with ice.
Add the dark rum, orange liqueur, blackberry syrup, lime juice, and pineapple juice to the glass.
Stir well until the mixture is thoroughly chilled.
Strain the cocktail into a serving glass with a large ice cube.
Garnish with pineapple slice and a few blackberries.
Enjoy your Blackberry Pineapple Rum Cocktail!

name: Blackberry Raven Cocktail
instructions: In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, combine the Chambord and lemon juice.
Shake vigorously for about 15 seconds to chill and blend the ingredients.
Remove the top of the shaker and gently pour in the chilled dark Lambrusco.
Stir the mixture gently to incorporate the wine without over-mixing.
Replace the shaker top and strain the cocktail into a frosted glass.
Garnish with a fresh blackberry and serve immediately.

name: Blackberry Sangria
ingredients: 4 oz fresh blackberries (sliced or slightly mushed)
750 ml bottle of dry red wine (a blended red wine works well)
½ cup brandy (Christian Brothers or similar)
2  medium oranges (or 1 extra-large, sliced into rounds)
instructions: Combine Ingredients: In a small saucepan, combine the sugar, water, and sliced blackberries.
Simmer: Bring the mixture to a simmer over medium heat, stirring until the sugar has completely dissolved.
Infuse: Reduce the heat to low and let the mixture simmer gently for about 10 minutes, allowing the blackberries to infuse the syrup.
Strain: Remove from heat and pour the mixture through a cheesecloth or mesh strainer to remove the blackberry solids. Let the syrup cool to room temperature.
Mix Wine and Brandy: In a large pitcher, combine the cooled blackberry simple syrup, red wine, and brandy.
Add Fruits: Add the sliced lime, oranges, and blackberries.
Chill: Refrigerate the sangria for at least 4 hours, preferably overnight, to allow the flavors to meld.
Add Ginger Ale: Just before serving, stir in the ginger ale for a refreshing fizz.
Serve: Serve the sangria over ice, making sure to include some of the fruit in each glass.

name: Blackberry Whiskey Smash
ingredients: A small handful of mint leaves
A splash of club soda (if ya like)
instructions: In your rocks glass, muddle the blackberries, lemon and mint leaves together to release their flavors.
Fill the glass with ice cubes to the top.
In a cocktail shaker, combine the whiskey and sugar with ice. Shake well.
Strain the mixture into your prepared glass.
Garnish with a few blackberries and a sprig of mint.
Enjoy your refreshing Blackberry Whiskey Smash!

name: Blackberry Whisky Sunset
ingredients: Orange Slice and Blackberries for garnish
instructions: Add 3 blackberries to the glass and muddle
Fill cocktail glass with ice.
Add OJ
Using a bar spoon, float the whisky on top
Slowly pour the grenadine over the back of a spoon so it sinks to the bottom, creating a layered effect.
Garnish with an orange slice and a blackberries.

name: Blackberry Widow's Kiss
instructions: In a microwave-safe bowl, heat the jumbo marshmallow for about 30 seconds, until it puffs up. Stir briefly and let it cool slightly.

Using your thumb and forefinger, stretch some of the melted marshmallow across the top of your martini glass to create a web-like pattern. Repeat until you cover the top of the glass with marshmallow webbing.

In a cocktail shaker, muddle the fresh blackberries to release their juice. Add the blue raspberry vodka, lemon juice, triple sec, purple food coloring, and ice. Shake vigorously until the ingredients are well-mixed and chilled.
Strain the cocktail into the prepared martini glass, carefully pouring it through the marshmallow web.
Serve and enjoy!

name: Blackberry Wine Slushie
instructions: In a blender, combine the red wine, vodka, blackberries, orange juice, and agave nectar.
Add a handful of ice and blend until smooth.
Pour the slushie mixture into a chilled glass.
Garnish with 2 blackberries on top for a festive touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy your refreshing Blackberry Wine Slushie.

name: Blarney Stone Fizz
instructions: Fill your shaker with ice.
Pour in the Irish whiskey, lime juice, and simple syrup.
Shake it well until it's chilled.
Strain the mixture into your highball glass filled with ice.
Top it off with club soda.
Garnish with a lime slice.

name: Blood and Sand
instructions: Fill your shaker with ice.
Add 1 oz each of Scotch whisky, cherry brandy, sweet vermouth, and fresh orange juice to the shaker.
Shake well until the mixture is chilled.
Strain the cocktail into a chilled coupe glass.
Enjoy your Blood and Sand cocktail!

name: Blood Moon Cocktail
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the rum, blood orange syrup, and lime juice.
Shake vigorously to thoroughly mix and chill the ingredients.
Pour the mixture into a Collins glass filled with ice.
Top the cocktail with 2 oz of ginger beer, stirring gently to combine.
Garnish with a slice of blood orange and a cherry for a striking presentation.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Blood Moon Cocktail!

name: Blood Moon Mojito
ingredients: Lime wheel and mint sprig (for garnish)
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the simple syrup, white rum, blood orange juice, lime juice, and mint leaves.
Gently muddle the mint leaves to release their oils, blending them with the other ingredients.
Add a few dashes of aromatic bitters and fill the shaker with crushed ice.
Stir gently to combine and chill the mixture.
Pour the mixture into a glass and grenadine for a dramatic effect.
Garnish with a sprig of fresh mint for an aromatic finish.
Serve and enjoy your Blood Moon Mojito—a bold and refreshing twist on the classic!

name: Blood Moon Potion
instructions: Start by preparing your glass. Pour a small amount of salt onto a plate. Run the lime wedge around the rim of the glass, then dip the rim into the salt, twisting to evenly coat. Fill the glass with ice and set aside.
In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, combine the dry gin, extra dry vermouth, and pomegranate juice.
Stir the mixture gently to combine the ingredients without over-diluting the drink.
Strain the cocktail into your prepared, salt-rimmed glass filled with ice.
Garnish with a cherry and a lime slice for a spooky finishing touch.
Serve and enjoy this bewitching Blood Moon Potion as you sip under the eerie glow of the moon!

name: Blood Orange Aperol Spritz
instructions: Take a large wine glass or a spritz glass and fill it with ice cubes.
Pour 2 oz of Aperol over the ice.
Add 1 oz of freshly squeezed blood orange juice to the glass.
Gently pour 3 oz of Prosecco into the glass.
Add 1 oz of club soda to the mix.
Stir the ingredients gently to combine.
Garnish with a slice of blood orange or an orange twist.
Serve immediately and enjoy your refreshing Blood Orange Aperol Spritz.

name: Blood Orange Bourbon Lemonade
ingredients: Blood orange slice and lemon slice for garnish
instructions: Prepare Your Ingredients: Squeeze the blood orange and lemon to get fresh juice. Measure out all your ingredients.
Mix the Drink: In a cocktail shaker, combine the bourbon, blood orange juice, lemon juice, and simple syrup. Add ice.
Shake It Up: Shake the mixture vigorously for about 15 seconds until well chilled.
Serve: Fill a glass with ice and strain the mixture into the glass.
Garnish: Garnish with a slice of blood orange and a slice of lemon.

name: Blood Orange Bourbon Smash
instructions: Prepare Ingredients: Squeeze fresh blood oranges to get 2 ounces of juice. Measure out the maple syrup, bourbon, and ginger beer.
Mix: In a cocktail shaker, combine the blood orange juice, maple syrup, and bourbon.
Shake: Fill the shaker with ice and shake well until the mixture is chilled.
Strain: Strain the mixture into a rocks glass filled with ice.
Top Off: Add the ginger beer to the glass and stir gently.
Garnish (Optional): Garnish with a slice of blood orange or a twist of blood orange peel.
Serve: Enjoy your refreshing Blood Orange Bourbon Smash.

name: Blood Orange Collins
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.
Add 1.5 oz of London Dry Gin, 0.5 oz of Blood Orange Syrup, and 0.5 oz of lemon juice.
Shake well until chilled.
Strain the mixture into a highball glass filled with ice.
Top with club soda.
Stir gently to combine.
Garnish with mint leaves.

name: Blood Orange Cosmopolitan
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.
Pour in the vodka, orange liqueur, blood orange juice, simple syrup, cranberry juice, and lime juice.
Shake well until chilled.
Strain the mixture into a chilled martini glass.
Garnish with a twist of blood orange peel or a slice of blood orange.

name: Blood Orange Daiquiri
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.
Add the rum, lime juice, blood orange juice, simple syrup, dry curacao, and bitters.
Shake well until the mixture is well chilled.
Strain the cocktail into a chilled coupe or martini glass.
Garnish with a slice of blood orange or a twist of lime, if desired.
Serve and enjoy your refreshing Blood Orange Daiquiri.

name: Blood Orange Gin and Tonic
instructions: Fill a highball glass with ice cubes.
Pour blood orange juice into the glass.
Add gin.
Add lime juice.
Add 2 dashes of orange bitters.
Fill the rest of the glass with tonic water, about 4-6 ounces depending on your preference.
Stir gently to mix the ingredients.
Garnish with a slice of blood orange or a twist of lime peel.
Enjoy your refreshing Blood Orange & Tonic cocktail.

name: Blood Orange Mezcalitas
instructions: Rim your glass with Tajin by running a lime wedge around the edge and dipping it into a plate of Tajin. Fill the glass with ice and set aside.
In a cocktail shaker, combine Mezcal, blood orange juice, orange liqueur, hibiscus simple syrup, and lime juice. Add ice and shake vigorously until well chilled.
Strain the mixture into the prepared glass.
Garnish with a wedge of blood orange. Serve immediately.

name: Blood Orange Mule
instructions: Fill a copper mug or glass with ice.
Pour in the vodka and blood orange juice.
Top with ginger beer.
Stir gently to mix.
Garnish with blood orange slices.

name: Blood Orange Paloma
instructions: Rim the glass with a slice of lime and dip it into candied zest to coat the rim.
In a shaker, combine the blanco tequila, blood orange juice, lime juice, simple syrup, orange bitters, and a pinch of salt.
Add ice and shake well until the mixture is chilled.
Strain the mixture into the prepared glass filled with ice.
Top with club soda and gently stir to combine.
Garnish with a slice of blood orange or a twist of blood orange peel.

name: Blood Orange Pineapple Margarita
instructions: Add the tequila, orange liqueur, agave, blood orange juice, lemon juice, pineapple juice, and coconut milk to a cocktail shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously for at least 30 seconds to thoroughly combine the ingredients and chill the mixture.
Fill a large martini coupe glass three-quarters full with crushed ice.
Strain the contents of the shaker over the ice in the glass.
Garnish with a fresh blood orange slice.
Enjoy your Blood Orange Pineapple Margarita!

name: Blood Orange Sidecar
ingredients: 1/2 ounce Grand Marnier (or preferred orange liqueur)
instructions: Optionally, rim a cocktail glass with sugar. To do this, moisten the rim with a blood orange wedge and dip it in sugar. Set aside.
In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, combine the blood orange juice, cognac or brandy, Grand Marnier, a dash of orange bitters, and simple syrup.
Shake vigorously until the mixture is well chilled.
Strain the mixture into the prepared cocktail glass.
Garnish with a wedge of blood orange.

name: Blood Orange Vodka Lemonade
ingredients: Blood orange slices and lemon slices for garnish
instructions: Fill a highball or tall glass with ice cubes.
In a cocktail shaker, combine the vodka, blood orange juice, lemon juice, and simple syrup. Add ice and shake well until the mixture is chilled.
Strain the mixture into the prepared glass over the ice.
Top off with club soda or sparkling water to your liking.
Garnish with blood orange slices, lemon slices, and a sprig of fresh mint, if desired.
Serve immediately and enjoy your refreshing Blood Orange Vodka Lemonade.

name: Blood Orange Vodka Sour
ingredients: A few dashes of orange bitters
1 slice of dehydrated blood orange (for garnish)
instructions: Prepare Your Shaker: Add the blood orange juice, vodka, simple syrup, and egg white to a cocktail shaker.
Dry Shake: Shake vigorously without ice for about 15 seconds to froth the egg white.
Add Ice: Open the shaker, add ice, and shake again for another 15-20 seconds until well-chilled.
Strain and Serve: Double strain the mixture into a chilled coupe or rocks glass.
Garnish: Add a few dashes of orange bitters on top and garnish with a slice of dehydrated blood orange.

name: Bloodberry Punch
instructions: Fill a highball glass with ice to get started.
Pour in the white rum, cherry brandy, lime juice, blackcurrant cordial, and strawberry syrup directly into the glass.
Add the cranberry juice and raspberry juice, then give the drink a gentle stir to combine all the flavors.
Finish by adding two dashes of Angostura bitters for a touch of aromatic depth and complexity.
Garnish with a cherry or lime slice for a vibrant presentation.
Serve and enjoy this bold and fruity Bloodberry Punch!

name: Bloody Champagne Bellini
instructions: Carefully pour  Amarena cherry syrup into the center of a flute glass. Take care not to drip the syrup on the sides of the glass, as it is thick and will cling to the surface.
Gently place an Amarena cherry into the syrup at the bottom of the glass.
Slowly pour chilled champagne or sparkling wine into the glass, allowing the bubbles to mix naturally with the syrup.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Bloody Champagne Bellini!

name: Bloody Dorito Maria
ingredients: Spicy nacho Doritos (crushed (for rimming the glass))
instructions: In a shaker, mix together tequila, habanero, tomato juice, celery salt, black pepper, Worcestershire sauce, and lemon juice.
Shake it up , then strain into your prepped glass over fresh ice.
In Preparing the glass, dip the rim in queso, then coat it in crushed Doritos and set it aside.
Garnish with your favorite treats, and enjoy your snack with your drink!

name: Bloody Margarita with Black Lava Salt Rim
instructions: Begin by preparing your glass. Run a lime slice around the rim of the glass to moisten it.
Dip the moistened rim into a small plate of black lava salt, ensuring the rim is evenly coated. Set the glass aside.
In a cocktail shaker, combine the tequila, Aperol, blackberry syrup, and lime juice.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously to mix and chill the ingredients.
Taste the mixture and adjust the sweetness by adding more blackberry syrup if desired.
Strain the mixture into the prepared glass, leaving the ice cubes behind in the shaker.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Bloody Margarita with Black Lava Salt Rim!

name: Bloody Vesper
instructions: Begin by rimming your serving glass with grenadine: dip the rim of the glass into grenadine, coating it evenly for a blood-like effect.
In a mixing glass, add the blood orange juice, gin, vodka, dry vermouth, and 0.5 oz of grenadine.
Add a large ice cube and stir the mixture for 30 seconds to chill and combine the flavors.
Strain the cocktail into the grenadine-rimmed glass for a striking presentation.
Serve and enjoy your Bloody Vesper, a cocktail as daring and delicious as it is dramatic!

name: Blow Job Shot
instructions: Begin by pouring 1/2 oz. Amaretto directly into the shot glass.
Layer a 1/2 oz. Kahlua on top.
Layer 1/2 oz. Bailey's by slowly pouring over spoon.
Finally, top with whipped cream.

name: Blue Blazer
ingredients: 2 teaspoons of demerara or raw sugar
instructions: Preheat two silver-plated tankards or blazer mugs with boiling water, and discard the water before adding the cocktail. Clear all flammable materials from the mixing area.
Mixing the Drink
Pour the Scotch whisky, boiling water, and sugar into a heat-resistant mug with a handle.
Light the mix on fire using a long match. Practice pouring the flaming liquid back and forth between the two mugs until you have a steady stream of flames.
While still ablaze, pour the mix into the other mug. Do this about 4 or 5 times.
Extinguish the flames by covering the mug with a silver-plated mug or using a fire extinguisher if necessary.
Add a lemon twist for garnish and serve immediately.

name: Blue Candy Fizz
instructions: Add ice cubes to a rocks glass.
In a separate shaker, combine vodka and cotton candy syrup.
Pour the vodka mixture into the glass with ice.
Slowly add the Sprite.
Gently pour the blue raspberry juice over the back of a spoon to create a layered effect.
Garnish with a cherry and serve.

name: Blue Caribbean
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the rum, blue curaçao, pineapple juice, lime juice, and coconut cream.
Add ice to the shaker and shake vigorously until well chilled.
Strain the mixture into a hurricane glass or highball glass filled with fresh ice.
Taste and add simple syrup if needed to adjust the sweetness.
Garnish with a pineapple slice, and maraschino cherry.
Enjoy your tropical and refreshing Blue Caribbean!

name: Blue Christmas Cocktail
instructions: Pour a small amount of honey onto a plate. Dip the rim of the glass in honey, then in coconut flakes to create a snowy rim effect. Set the glass aside.
In a cocktail shaker, combine the pineapple juice, Blue Curaçao, coconut cream, and white rum. Add ice to the shaker, then shake vigorously until well-chilled and blended.
Fill the prepared glass with ice and pour the cocktail mixture over the ice.
Serve immediately and enjoy this tropical twist on a holiday drink.

name: Blue Crush
instructions: In a glass, add the vodka and blue curaçao.
Fill the glass with ice.
Pour in the pineapple juice.
Top with Sprite and stir gently to combine.
Serve immediately and enjoy!

name: Blue Devil
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.
Add 1/4 oz lime juice, 1/2 oz confectioner sugar syrup, 1 oz light Rum, 1/2 oz blue curacao, and 1 oz orange juice to the shaker.
Shake well until the mixture is chilled.
Strain the mixture into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a lime wheel or an orange twist, if desired.

name: Blue Flame
ingredients: Fresh chili, lime wheel, and edible flower (for garnish)
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the gin, blue curaçao, honey chili syrup, and a few dashes of grapefruit bitters.
Add ice and shake well until the mixture is chilled.
Strain the cocktail into your glass.
Top with ginger beer for a refreshing, fizzy finish.
Garnish with a fresh chili, a lime wheel, and an edible flower for a striking presentation.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Blue Flame creation!

name: Blue Hawaiian Margarita
instructions: Optional: Rim the glass with salt or sugar by running a lime wedge around the rim and dipping it into salt or sugar.
Fill the glass with ice cubes.
In a cocktail shaker, combine the tequila, lime juice, triple sec, cream of coconut, blue curaçao, and pineapple juice.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake well for about 15-20 seconds, until the mixture is well-chilled.
Strain the mixture into the prepared glass over the ice.
Garnish with a lime wheel, pineapple slice, or cherry if desired.
Sip and enjoy your refreshing Blue Hawaiian Margarita.

name: Blue Hawaiian
instructions: Add all of the ingredients except the garnish items into a cocktail shaker with ice and shake well
Alternative method: blend all the ingredients with ice in an electric blender or with a stick blender for a frozen drink.
Strain from the shaker over crushed ice into a long glass or pour into a tall glass with no additional ice
Finish the drink with a pineapple slice and a maraschino cherry to garnish.

name: Blue Horizon
ingredients: Orange slices and wedge for garnish
instructions: Pour the blue curaçao into a glass filled with ice.
Slowly add the Lillet Blanc and a few orange slices.
Carefully pour the tonic water followed by the dry sparkling cava over the back of a spoon to maintain the layered effect.
Give the drink a very light stir to keep the gradient intact.
Garnish with an orange wedge and serve.

name: Blue Inferno
instructions: Mix the Ingredients: In a shaker, combine the Fireball Cinnamon Whisky, blue curaçao, coconut rum, and pineapple juice. Add ice to fill the shaker.
Shake: Shake the mixture vigorously for about 15 seconds to chill and mix the ingredients thoroughly.
Strain and Serve: Strain the cocktail into a chilled glass. Ice cubes can be added to the glass if desired.
Garnish: Add an orange slice for an extra touch and a hint of fresh fruitiness.

name: Blue Lady
instructions: Combine the blue curacao, lemon juice, gin, and egg white in a cocktail shaker.
Shake vigorously without ice for about 15 seconds to emulsify the egg white.
Add ice to the shaker.
Shake again for about 20 seconds until well-chilled.
Double strain the mixture into a chilled cocktail glass using a fine mesh strainer to remove any ice shards and ensure a smooth texture.
Serve immediately, and enjoy your Blue Lady cocktail.
You can garnish with a lemon twist or a cherry, depending on your preference.

name: Blue Mezcalita
instructions: Add the mezcal, blue curaçao, lime juice, and agave syrup to a cocktail shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously for 10-15 seconds until well-chilled.
Strain the mixture into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a lime wheel and serve immediately.

name: Blue Midnight Kiss
instructions: Rub the rim of a champagne flute with a lemon wedge. Dip the rim into sugar on a plate, rotating until it’s evenly coated.
Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Add the vodka, blue curaçao, and lemon juice. Shake vigorously until the mixture is well chilled.
Strain the mixture into the prepared champagne flute.
Fill the glass the rest of the way with champagne, allowing the bubbles to mix gently with the base.
Garnish a maraschino cherry into the glass for a pop of color. Serve immediately and enjoy!

name: Blue Mojito
ingredients: Lime slices and/or extra mint for garnish
instructions: Place the fresh mint leaves and simple syrup in a glass.
Gently muddle (press) the mint leaves with a muddler or the back of a spoon to release their flavor.
Fill the glass with ice cubes.
Pour in the white rum, blue curaçao, and lime juice.
Top off the drink with soda water, adjusting the amount to your taste.
Stir the mixture gently to combine all the ingredients.
Garnish with lime slices and/or extra mint leaves.
Serve immediately and enjoy your refreshing Blue Mojito.

name: Blue Moon Sour
instructions: Add the gin, crème de violette, lemon juice, and egg white to a cocktail shaker.
Shake vigorously without ice (dry shake) to emulsify the egg white.
Add ice to the shaker and shake again until well chilled.
Strain the mixture into a coupe glass or rocks glass.
Garnish with a twist of lemon.
Enjoy your elegant Blue Moon Sour!

name: Blue Motorcycle
instructions: Fill a highball glass with ice cubes.
In a cocktail shaker, combine the tequila, blue curaçao, vodka, rum, and gin.
Shake well for about 5 seconds to mix the spirits.
Strain the mixture into the glass over ice.
Top the drink with Sprite, giving it a light stir.
Garnish with mint sprig.
Serve immediately and enjoy the vibrant, refreshing flavor.

name: Blue Negroni
instructions: In a mixing glass, combine the Empress Gin, Italicus Liqueur, Cocchi Americano, and grapefruit bitters.
Add ice to the mixing glass and stir for 15 seconds to chill and dilute the ingredients.
Strain the mixture into a rocks glass over a large ice cube.
Garnish with a grapefruit twist for a refreshing citrus aroma.
Serve and enjoy your sophisticated Blue Negroni!

name: Blue Passion
instructions: Add the blanco tequila, blanc vermouth, blue curaçao, passionfruit syrup, and bitters to a mixing glass filled with ice.
Stir until well chilled and the ingredients are thoroughly combined.
Strain the mixture into a rocks glass over a large ice cube.
Garnish with a slice of fresh passionfruit and serve.

name: Blue Ramos
instructions: Chill a Collins glass with ice and set it aside.
In a shaker, combine the gin, lemon juice, lime juice, blue curaçao, orange flower water, vanilla essence, and egg white.
Shake vigorously without ice to emulsify the egg white.
In the shaker, add 2-3 ice cubes, and shake again until the ice melts.
Add the cream to the shaker and shake briefly.
Discard the ice from the chilled glass and strain the drink into the glass.
Let the drink sit for a minute, allowing it to settle.
Gently top with soda water to create the signature foamy head.
Serve and enjoy!
