name: Blue Raspberry Breeze
instructions: Add gin, blueberry lemon vodka, blue raspberry juice, and sweet & sour mix to a cocktail shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously until well-chilled.
Fill a rocks glass with ice, fresh blueberries, and quartered lemon slices.
Strain the mixed cocktail into the glass, leaving about an inch from the top.
Garnish with a lemon wedge on the rim and top with additional blueberries.
Serve and enjoy!

name: Blue Raspberry Lemon Drop Martini
instructions: Start by coating the rim of your glass with sugar.
In a shaker, mix the raspberry vodka, blue curaçao, simple syrup, and lemon juice with ice.
Shake it up until it's well chilled.
Strain the mixture into your prepared glass.
Garnish with a slice of lemon.

name: Blue Raspberry Vodka Lemonade
instructions: Rim the edge of a glass with blue sugar and set it aside.
In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, combine the light rum, peach schnapps, and pink lemonade.
Shake well to mix and chill the ingredients.
Strain the mixture into the sugar-rimmed glass filled with ice, leaving some room at the top.
Slowly pour the blue raspberry vodka over the drink, allowing it to float.
Garnish with a fresh strawberry and serve.

name: Blue Sky Coconut Mojito
ingredients: Mint sprig and lime wheel for garnish (optional)
instructions: In a glass, gently muddle the mint leaves and lime wedges to release the mint oils and lime juice. Be careful not to tear the mint leaves too much.
Pour in the cream of coconut and continue to muddle lightly to mix.
Add the blue curaçao and coconut rum to the glass.
Fill the glass with ice cubes to the top.
Pour the club soda over the ice, filling the glass.
Stir the drink gently to combine all the ingredients.
Garnish with a sprig of mint and a lime wheel if desired.
Enjoy your Blue Sky Coconut Mojito.

name: Blue Vodka Sour
instructions: Begin by gathering all your ingredients. This will make the cocktail-making process smooth and enjoyable.

In your cocktail shaker, combine 1.5 ounces of vodka, 0.5 ounce of blue curaçao, 1 ounce of fresh lemon juice, 0.5 ounce of simple syrup, and one egg white. The egg white is the secret to the silky texture and frothy top of the cocktail, but make sure it's fresh to avoid any health risks.
Start with a dry shake—shaking the mixture without ice. This technique helps to emulsify the egg white, creating a smooth and foamy consistency. Shake vigorously for about 15 seconds.

After the dry shake, add a handful of ice to the shaker. Seal it tightly and shake again. This second round of shaking chills the drink and further blends the ingredients, ensuring a perfectly integrated cocktail.
Strain the cocktail into a chilled coupe glass. The strainer will hold back the ice and any larger foam particles, leaving you with a beautifully clear and frothy drink.
For a final touch, garnish your Blue Vodka Sour. A simple lemon twist or a couple of edible flowers can add an elegant finish to this visually appealing drink.

name: Blue Winter Wonderland
instructions: Spread shredded coconut on a small plate. Run a lime wedge along the rim of your glass, then dip the rim into the coconut, pressing gently to coat evenly. Set the glass aside.
Add tequila, lime juice, Cointreau, and blue curaçao to a cocktail shaker.
Fill the shaker with ice, secure the lid, and shake vigorously for 15–20 seconds to chill and combine the ingredients.
Pour the entire contents of the shaker, including ice, into the prepared glass.
Add a fresh mint sprig for a hint of green and serve immediately.

name: Blueberry Bourbon Lemonade
ingredients: 2 oz cold water or club soda
Lemon slices and blueberries for garnish
instructions: In a small bowl, muddle the fresh blueberries until they release their juices and become a chunky puree. You can also use a blender if you prefer a smoother consistency.
Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.
Add the bourbon, lemon juice, simple syrup, and blueberry puree to the shaker.
Shake well until the mixture is chilled and well combined.
Fill a glass with ice.
Strain the cocktail mixture into the glass.
Top with cold water or club soda, stirring gently to combine.
Garnish with lemon slices and a few fresh blueberries.
Serve immediately and enjoy your refreshing Blueberry Bourbon Lemonade.

name: Blueberry Bourbon Reviver
ingredients: 1 oz Blueberry liqueur or blueberry syrup
1/4 oz Simple syrup (optional, depending on sweetness preference)
instructions: Muddle Fresh Blueberries:
In a cocktail shaker, muddle about 10 fresh blueberries until fully crushed. This releases their juice and flavor, setting the base for your drink.
Combine Ingredients:

Add the bourbon, blueberry liqueur (or syrup), fresh lemon juice, and simple syrup if using. The simple syrup can be adjusted based on how sweet the blueberry liqueur is and your personal taste preference.
Shake:

Fill the shaker with ice, covering the liquid. Secure the lid and shake vigorously for about 15 seconds. Shaking not only chills the drink but also dilutes it slightly, balancing the strength of the bourbon.
Strain:
Strain the mixture into a chilled cocktail glass. A fine mesh strainer can be used to ensure no blueberry skins enter the drink, giving it a smoother texture.
Garnish and Serve:
Garnish with a few whole fresh blueberries and a sprig of mint. The mint will add a fresh aroma that complements the blueberries and bourbon beautifully.
Enjoy:
Serve immediately and enjoy the refreshing, fruity twist on a classic bourbon cocktail.

name: Blueberry Bourbon Smash
ingredients: 1/2 cup fresh blueberries (plus a few for garnish)
1 ounce simple syrup (you can make this by boiling equal parts water and sugar until the sugar dissolves, then cooling it)
Mint leaves (for garnish and extra flavor)
Soda water (optional, for a lighter version)
instructions: Muddle the Blueberries:
In a cocktail shaker, add the fresh blueberries and simple syrup. Muddle them together until the blueberries are broken down and the mixture is juicy.
Add Bourbon and Lemon Juice:
Pour the bourbon and lemon juice into the shaker with the muddled blueberries.
Shake:
Fill the shaker with ice, secure the lid, and shake vigorously for about 15 seconds to combine all the ingredients well.
Strain:
Strain the mixture into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice. This will remove most of the blueberry skins and pulp, leaving a smooth drink.
Top Off:
If desired, top the drink with a splash of soda water for a bit of fizz.
Garnish:
Garnish with a few fresh blueberries and a sprig of mint.
Serve:
Serve immediately and enjoy the refreshing mix of flavors.

name: Blueberry Gin Sour
instructions: In a mixing glass, muddle the blueberries with the lemon juice and simple syrup until well combined.
Transfer the muddled blueberry mixture into a cocktail shaker.
Add the gin, Angostura bitters, and egg white to the shaker. Shake vigorously without ice to create a rich foam from the egg white (a dry shake).
Add ice to the shaker and shake again until the mixture is well-chilled.
Strain the cocktail into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a slice of lemon for a bright, fresh finish.
Serve and enjoy the delightful flavors of the Blueberry Gin Sour!

name: Blueberry Lavender Vodka Cooler
instructions: Place the blueberries in a microwave-safe bowl and microwave for 30 seconds to 1 minute, until they are soft and can be easily mashed.
Mash the blueberries with the muddler, then strain the juice into a rocks glass.
Add crushed ice on top of the strained blueberry juice.
In a shaker filled with ice, combine the vodka, half and half, and lavender simple syrup.
Shake well to combine and chill the ingredients.
Strain the mixture into the rocks glass over the crushed ice.
Garnish with a sprig of fresh lavender for an aromatic touch.
Serve and enjoy your Blueberry Lavender Vodka Cooler!

name: Blueberry Lemon Sangria
ingredients: Blueberries and lemon slices ( for garnish)
instructions: Start by placing lemon slices and a few blueberries in your rocks glass.
Add simple syrup, then muddle the ingredients to release their flavors.
Pour in the blueberry vodka, orange liqueur, fresh lemon juice, and white wine.
Fill the glass with ice.
Top it off with soda water.
Stir gently to blend everything together.
Garnish with a lemon wheel and a few extra blueberries.
Enjoy your refreshing cocktail!

name: Blueberry Old Fashioned
ingredients: 10 pieces Fresh blueberries: For muddling and garnish.
instructions: Muddle the Blueberries and Simple Syrup:
In a mixing glass, add about 8 fresh blueberries and the simple syrup.
Gently muddle the blueberries to release their juice and flavor, but be careful not to pulverize them into a complete mash.
Add Bourbon and Bitters:
Pour the bourbon and add two dashes of Angostura bitters to the mixing glass.
Stir the Mixture:
Add a few ice cubes to the glass.
Stir the mixture gently for about 30 seconds to combine the flavors while chilling the drink.
Strain into a Glass:
Strain the mixture into an Old Fashioned glass over a large ice cube to reduce dilution.
Garnish and Serve:
Garnish with an orange peel and a couple of fresh blueberries on a skewer or floating on top.
Optionally, give the orange peel a twist over the drink to release its oils before adding it to the glass.
Enjoy:
Enjoy your Blueberry Old Fashioned responsibly.

name: Blueberry Paloma
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the tequila, grapefruit juice, lime juice, and blueberry syrup.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously until well chilled.
Strain the mixture over fresh ice in a highball glass or rocks glass.
Top with soda water.
Garnish with fresh blueberries and an edible flower.
Enjoy your refreshing Blueberry Paloma!

name: Blueberry Pineapple Bramble
ingredients: Pineapple slice or lemon wheel (for garnish)
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the gin, lemon juice, and pineapple juice.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously until well chilled.
Strain the mixture into a rocks glass filled with crushed ice.
Slowly pour the blueberry syrup over the top, allowing it to cascade through the ice.
Garnish with fresh blueberries and a pineapple slice or lemon wheel.
Enjoy your refreshing Blueberry Pineapple Bramble!

name: Blueberry Whiskey Sour
ingredients: 1/2 ounce simple syrup (equal parts sugar and water, heated until sugar dissolves, then cooled)
1/2 cup fresh blueberries (plus a few for garnish)
Optional: A few dashes of bitters (aromatic or orange bitters are a good choice)
instructions: Prepare the Simple Syrup:
Combine equal parts sugar and water in a small saucepan. Heat until the sugar is completely dissolved. Let it cool before using.
Muddle the Blueberries:
In a shaker, muddle the fresh blueberries with the simple syrup until well smashed. This releases the juice and flavor of the berries.
Mix the Cocktail:
To the muddled blueberries, add whiskey, lemon juice, and ice. If you're using it, add the egg white as well.
If you like, add a few dashes of bitters for extra flavor.
Shake:
Secure the lid on the shaker and shake vigorously for about 15 seconds. If you're using egg white, you'll want to shake it a bit longer to ensure it's fully frothy.
Strain and Serve:
Strain the mixture into a chilled glass filled with ice. Some prefer to double strain to remove all blueberry pulp and seeds.
Garnish and Enjoy:
Garnish with a few fresh blueberries and a lemon twist.

name: Blueberry Winter Smash
instructions: Add a handful of fresh blueberries to a cocktail shaker and muddle them until the juices are released.
Add the blueberry vodka, elderflower liqueur, and ice to the shaker. Shake vigorously for 10–15 seconds.
Strain the mixture into a rocks or highball glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with club soda, pouring gently to preserve the bubbles. Stir lightly to combine.
Add a sprig of fresh rosemary for a festive aroma and extra blueberries for a decorative touch.

name: Blushing Agave
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the pink lemon liqueur, tequila, elderflower cordial, and a few dashes of grapefruit bitters.
Add a pinch of salt and fill the shaker with ice.
Shake vigorously until well-chilled.
Strain the mixture into a glass filled with ice and garnish with edible flower.
Serve immediately and enjoy your refreshing Blushing Agave cocktail.

name: Blushing Apricot Sour
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.
Add the apricot brandy, gin, grenadine, and egg white to the shaker.
Shake vigorously to ensure the egg white blends smoothly and forms a frothy texture.
Strain the mixture into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a cherry before serving.

name: Bobby Burns
ingredients: 1 ounce blended Scotch whisky (aged at least 12 years)
instructions: Fill a mixing glass with ice.
Add the scotch, sweet vermouth, and Benedictine to the mixing glass.
Stir the mixture until it is well-chilled.
Strain the mixture into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a lemon peel.

name: Boilermaker
ingredients: 1  shot of whiskey (bourbon, rye, Irish whiskey, tequila, or genever)
1  glass of beer (lager, ale, IPA, pilsner, black and tan, shandy, or any other beer of your choice)
instructions: Pour the beer into a pint glass or any other suitable glassware.
Pour the shot of whiskey into a shot glass.
Drop the shot glass into the beer. You can either drop it directly into the glass or use a depth charge method, where you drop the shot glass into the beer from a higher distance.
Drink the cocktail quickly, either by sipping or by chugging it down.

name: Boo Moon
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine raspberry vodka, vodka, blue curaçao, peppermint syrup, lime juice, and silver cake shimmer with ice.
Shake well until the mixture is thoroughly chilled and the shimmer is fully incorporated.
Strain the mixture into a glass.
Top with prosecco and ginger beer, then gently stir to combine.
Garnish with a mint sprig for a festive finish.

name: Boozy Fall Punch
ingredients: Garnish: cinnamon sticks (orange slices, sage leaves)
instructions: In a shaker, combine the spiced rum, orange juice, apple cider, lemon juice, pumpkin puree, and spiced simple syrup.
Shake well to mix all the ingredients thoroughly.
Right before serving, add sparkling water to the mixture to add a refreshing fizz.
Pour the punch into individual glasses.
Garnish each glass with an orange slice, a cinnamon stick, and a sage leaf for a festive touch.

name: Boozy Frozen Baja Blast
instructions: Add the blue Gatorade, Mountain Dew, and vodka into a blender with ice.
Blend until smooth and slushy.
Pour the mixture into a glass.
Garnish with a lemon slice for a pop of citrus and visual appeal.

name: Boulevardier
instructions: Fill your mixing glass with ice
Using your jigger to measure your pour, add 1 ½ ounces bourbon, 1 ounce Campari, and 1 ounce sweet vermouth to the mixing glass
Stir evenly for 30 seconds. Do not shake as it will cause the drink to foam
Strain into chilled cocktail glass
Use orange twist to garnish

name: Bourbon and Apple Cider Cocktail
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.
Add the chilled apple cider, bourbon, and maple syrup (if using) to the shaker.
Shake vigorously until the mixture is well chilled.
Strain the mixture into a glass filled with fresh ice.
Top the cocktail with chilled ginger beer and stir gently to combine.
Garnish with a fresh apple wedge for a touch of seasonal flair.
Serve immediately and enjoy the crisp, spiced flavors of this autumn-inspired cocktail.

name: Bourbon and Champagne Cocktail
instructions: In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, combine the bourbon and cider honey syrup.
Shake the mixture well to chill and combine the ingredients.
Strain the cocktail into a coupe glass.
Add Prosecco champagne to top off the glass, gently stirring to combine.
Garnish with a sprig of fresh rosemary for an aromatic touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Bourbon and Champagne Cocktail!

name: Bourbon Apple Cider Fizz
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the bourbon, apple cider, lemon juice, and a bit of ice.
Shake well until thoroughly chilled.
Strain the mixture into a glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with sparkling wine to add a bubbly finish.
Garnish with a cinnamon stick for an aromatic touch.

name: Bourbon Autumn Rickey
instructions: Fill a highball glass with ice, then add the lime wheels for a fresh, zesty garnish.
Pour in the maple syrup, lime juice, and bourbon.
Top the drink with chilled club soda to add a fizzy, refreshing finish.
Stir briefly to combine all the ingredients.
Serve immediately and enjoy the tangy, sweet, and smooth flavors of the Autumn Rickey!

name: Bourbon Bunny
instructions: Add bourbon, absinthe, carrot juice, lemon juice, ginger syrup, and maple syrup to a cocktail shaker.
Add a small amount of crushed ice to the shaker and give it a very short shake, just enough to blend the ingredients.
Dump the entire mixture, including the ice, into a Collins glass.
If needed, top off with additional crushed ice.
Garnish with a fresh mint sprig and serve.

name: Bourbon Caramel Milkshake
ingredients: Whipped cream, additional caramel sauce, and salt  (for garnish, optional)
instructions: Begin by chilling a tall glass in the freezer to keep your milkshake cold.
In a milkshake machine or blender, combine the vanilla ice cream, heavy whipping cream, caramel sauce, bourbon, and a pinch of salt.
Blend until the mixture is smooth and creamy.
Pour the milkshake into the chilled glass.
Top with a generous dollop of whipped cream and drizzle with extra caramel sauce. Add a sprinkle of salt, if desired, for a salty-sweet touch.
Serve with a tall spoon and a straw, and enjoy the rich, boozy flavors of this indulgent milkshake.

name: Bourbon Chai Tea
instructions: In a medium saucepan, combine the hot water, tea bags, crushed spices, cinnamon sticks, ground nutmeg, ginger, and vanilla extract.
Bring the mixture to a gentle boil over medium-high heat, then reduce to a simmer and let it infuse.
Stir in the vanilla almond milk and honey, whisking to ensure everything is well combined.
Remove the saucepan from heat and let the chai tea steep for about 10 minutes.
Strain the mixture through a fine mesh sieve to remove the tea bags and spices, leaving only the spiced liquid.
Transfer the strained chai tea to a heatproof serving pitcher and stir in the bourbon.
Serve warm and enjoy!

name: Bourbon Coconut Milk
instructions: In a saucepan over medium-high heat, combine the whole milk, coconut milk, brown sugar, and vanilla extract.
Heat the mixture until it begins to steam, then whisk vigorously until frothy.
While the milk mixture heats, warm your mug in the microwave for a few seconds.
Pour the bourbon into the warmed mug.
Top with the steaming milk mixture, then garnish with freshly grated nutmeg.
Serve immediately and enjoy the cozy flavors.

name: Bourbon Cranberry Old Fashioned
ingredients: ½ ounce simple syrup (adjust to taste)
instructions: Fill an old-fashioned glass with ice.
Add the cranberry-infused bourbon, a few fresh cranberries, orange zest, and orange bitters.
Stir the mixture to combine the flavors, then taste the cocktail.
If desired, add simple syrup a little at a time, stirring between additions, until the cocktail reaches your preferred sweetness.
Garnish with additional cranberries and an orange wedge for a festive finish.

name: Bourbon Peach Old-Fashioned
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the peach-infused bourbon, brown sugar, and bitters.
Add a handful of ice to the shaker, then secure the lid.
Shake the mixture vigorously until the ingredients are well-chilled and the brown sugar is fully dissolved.
Strain the cocktail into an old-fashioned glass filled with fresh ice cubes.
Garnish with a fresh peach slice and a light sprinkle of ground cinnamon for an aromatic and flavorful finish.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Bourbon Peach Old-Fashioned.

name: Bourbon Pear Cider
ingredients: Pear slice sage leaves, cinnamon, and sugar (for garnish, optional)
instructions: In a rocks glass, pour the bourbon and pear sage syrup.
Add the apple cider and soda water to the glass, stirring well to combine all the ingredients.
Fill the glass with ice to chill the cocktail.
For an extra touch of flavor and presentation, sprinkle the top with a mixture of cinnamon and sugar.
Garnish with a slice of pear and a few fresh sage leaves to enhance the drink’s aroma and appearance.
Serve immediately and enjoy your refreshing Pear Cider Cocktail!

name: Bourbon Pear Fizz
ingredients: ½ ounce Spiced Pear Simple Syrup
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the bourbon, Spiced Pear Simple Syrup, and lemon juice.
Add ice to the shaker, secure the lid, and shake until the mixture is well-chilled.
Strain the mixture into a chilled coupe glass.
Gently top with Prosecco, allowing it to create a light, bubbly layer.

name: Bourbon Persimmon Cocktail
instructions: Add the bourbon, persimmon syrup, and orange bitters to a mixing glass filled with fresh ice.
Stir thoroughly until the drink is well chilled.
Strain into a cocktail glass over a large ice cube.
Garnish with a persimmon wheel  for a seasonal touch.
Enjoy!

name: Bourbon Pumpkin Latte
ingredients: 6 ounces unsweetened almond milk (frozen into ice cubes)
Almond milk foam or whipped cream (for garnish)
Cinnamon powder or grated nutmeg (for garnish)
instructions: Begin by pouring the unsweetened almond milk into an ice cube tray and freezing it until solid.
Once the almond milk cubes are frozen, add them to a blender along with the bourbon, espresso shots, maple syrup, canned pumpkin, and pumpkin spice.
Blend on the highest setting until the mixture is smooth and fully blended, with a creamy, frosty consistency.
Pour the blended mixture into glasses.
Top with almond milk foam or plain whipped cream for an extra layer of richness.
Garnish with a grated nutmeg or pinch of cinnamon to enhance the pumpkin spice flavors.
Serve immediately and enjoy this frosty fall treat.

name: Bourbon Renewal
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the bourbon whiskey, lemon juice, simple syrup, crème de cassis, and Angostura bitters.
Add ice to the shaker and shake vigorously until well-chilled.
Strain the mixture into rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a blackberry and lemon wheel, serve immediately.

name: Bourbon Strawberry Iced Tea
instructions: In a shaker, muddle the sliced strawberries until they are well crushed and juicy.
Add the lemon juice, bourbon, and rich simple syrup to the shaker.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously for about 15 seconds.
Strain the mixture into a tall glass filled with ice.
Top off the drink with unsweetened iced tea.
Garnish with a few blueberries, a strawberry slice, and a mint sprig.

name: Bourbon Whiskey Sangria
ingredients: Fresh fruit and whole spices for garnish (optional)
instructions: In a large bowl or pitcher, combine the red wine, low-carb apple cider, sugar-free keto grenadine, apple pieces, orange pieces, fresh cranberries, and all the whole spices (cloves, cinnamon sticks, cardamom pods, and star anise).
Stir the mixture well to combine the ingredients and release the flavors of the spices.
Taste the mixture, and if desired, add bourbon whiskey to your preferred strength and flavor.
Cover the sangria and allow it to chill in the refrigerator for a few hours, or ideally overnight, to let the flavors infuse and deepen.
Before serving, give the sangria a final stir and garnish with additional fresh fruit slices and whole spices, if desired, for an attractive presentation.
Serve the sangria chilled in glasses over ice, if preferred, and enjoy!
This sangria can be made a day or so ahead of your gathering and will keep in the fridge in an airtight container for up to 3 days.

name: Brain Hemorrhage Shot
instructions: Pour the peach schnapps into a shot glass.
Using a spoon, slowly pour the Irish cream liqueur over the schnapps. Be sure to pour it gently so that it clumps and curdles on top of the schnapps, creating the appearance of a brain membrane.
Finally, pour a splash of grenadine syrup on top of the Irish cream. The grenadine will sink to the bottom of the glass and form a red layer, resembling a blood clot.

name: Brandy Crusta
ingredients: Simple syrup (optional, for those who like it sweeter)
instructions: Rim your glass with sugar to start off with a sweet edge.
In a shaker, combine brandy, maraschino liqueur, lemon juice, bitters, and ice.
Shake well until the mixture is chilled.
Strain into your sugar-rimmed glass.
Garnish with a lemon peel for that aromatic finishing touch.

name: Brandy Old Fashioned
instructions: Put the sugar cube in your glass and soak it with bitters.
Add a little splash of water and muddle (squish) it with the orange slice and cherry to mix the flavors.
Fill the glass with ice, pour in the brandy, and top it with a bit more soda water or lemon-lime soda.
Stir it gently, garnish with a new orange slice or cherry, and enjoy!

name: Brandy-Pecan Flip
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the pecan milk, brandy, rum, simple syrup, and egg.
Shake vigorously for about 5 seconds to emulsify the ingredients.
Add ice to the shaker, then shake vigorously to chill and further mix the drink.
Strain the mixture into a chilled highball glass.
Garnish with freshly ground nutmeg for a fragrant, spiced finish.
Serve immediately and enjoy the rich, creamy flavors of the Brandy-Pecan Flip.

name: Broncos Sunset
instructions: Add the blue curaçao to the bottom of a rocks glass and fill the glass with crushed ice.
In a cocktail shaker, combine the silver tequila, Ancho Reyes chile liqueur, Aperol, Campari, orange juice, lemon juice, and simple syrup.
Shake the mixture vigorously until well-chilled.
Strain the mixture into the prepared glass over the crushed ice, adding more ice if needed.
Garnish with a blood orange slice and serve immediately.

name: Bubbles in the Sky
ingredients: Lime twist or grapefruit slice (for garnish)
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the gin, blue curaçao, lime juice, grapefruit juice, and simple syrup.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously until well chilled.
Strain the mixture into a Champagne flute or coupe glass.
Top with Prosecco.
Garnish with a twist of lime or a slice of grapefruit.
Enjoy your refreshing Bubbles in the Sky cocktail!

name: Bubbly Gin Martini
instructions: In a mixing glass filled with ice, combine the gin, sherry, and blanco vermouth.
Stir gently to chill and combine the ingredients.
Strain the mixture into a Nick & Nora glass.
Gently top the cocktail with 2 ounces of VdV Ice Rosé.
Garnish with a lemon twist or a cherry.
Enjoy your Bubby Gin Martini!

name: Bubbly Lavender Rosé
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, muddle the sliced strawberries to release their juices.
Add the rum, lime juice, and lavender syrup to the shaker.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously until well chilled.
Strain the mixture into a wine glass or coupe glass.
Top with Prosecco Rosé.
Garnish with a fresh strawberry and a sprig of lavender.
Enjoy your floral and refreshing Bubbly Lavender Rosé Hour!

name: Bubbly Paper Plane
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the Michter’s Whiskey, Aperol, Amaro Nonino, and lemon juice.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously until well chilled.
Strain the mixture into a coupe glass.
Gently top the cocktail with Prosecco.
Garnish with a paper plane for a playful touch (optional).
Enjoy your Bubbly Paper Plane!

name: Bubbly Raspberry Sorbet Margarita
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the tequila, lime juice, agave syrup, and a scoop of raspberry sorbet.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously until well chilled and the sorbet is slightly melted.
Place a cucumber slice in the bottom of your glass.
Strain the mixture into a glass filled with ice.
Top off the drink with Prosecco Rosé.
Stir gently to combine the flavors.
Garnish with fresh raspberries.
Enjoy your refreshing Bubbly Raspberry Sorbet Margarita!

name: Bushwacker
instructions: Add all of the ingredients into a blender with 1 cup of ice.
Blend until the mixture is smooth and frothy.
Pour the mixture into a hurricane glass.
Garnish with grated nutmeg and a maraschino cherry.

name: Butter Pecan White Russian
instructions: In a rocks glass filled with ice, combine the vodka, coffee liqueur, and buttered pecan syrup.
Gently pour in the heavy cream, allowing it to swirl into the drink.
Stir gently to combine all the ingredients.
Garnish with a few pecans for added flavor and texture.
Serve immediately and enjoy the smooth, creamy flavors of this decadent Butter Pecan White Russian.

name: Butterball Shot
instructions: Fill your shaker with ice to chill the ingredients properly.
Pour 1 oz of Butterscotch Schnapps and 1 oz of Irish Cream into the shaker.
Shake well until the outside of the shaker feels cold.
Strain the mixture into a shot glass.
Serve immediately and enjoy the creamy goodness.

name: Butterfly Bees Knees
instructions: In a shaker, mix hot water with honey, stirring until the honey is completely dissolved.
Add gin, lemon juice, and orange liqueur to the shaker.
Add ice and shake the mixture thoroughly.
Strain the shaken cocktail over the ice cubes in the rocks glass and slowly pour butterfly pea flower tea .
Garnish with a lemon twist.

name: California Harvest Fall Sangria
ingredients: Grapes, apples, figs, lime, and blackberries (for garnish)
instructions: In a large pitcher, combine the Concord grapes, figs, apple slices, lime wheels, blackberries, and red wine. Using a long wooden spoon, stir and gently press the fruit into the wine, breaking it up slightly with the back of the spoon.
Cover the pitcher and refrigerate for at least 1 hour to allow the flavors to meld.
Once the sangria is chilled, stir in the sparkling grapefruit juice and apple brandy.
Fill each wine glass with ice, pour the sangria, and top with the reserved fruit for a decorative and flavorful garnish.
Serve immediately and enjoy the fresh, fruity flavors of this California Harvest Fall Sangria!

name: Calypso Cooler
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice cubes.
Add the spiced rum, peach schnapps, orange juice, and lime juice to the shaker.
Shake vigorously to blend the ingredients.
Strain the mixture into a chilled glass filled with fresh ice.
Slowly pour the grenadine over the top, allowing it to settle for a layered effect.
Garnish with orange slices and cocktail cherries for a tropical touch.

name: Campari Limoncello Spritzer
ingredients: Orange slice and mint sprig for garnish (optional)
instructions: Fill a glass with ice.
Pour in the orange juice, Campari, and limoncello.
Top off the glass with soda water.
Stir gently to mix the ingredients.
Garnish with an orange slice and a mint sprig if desired.

name: Campari Spritz
ingredients: 1 oz Soda water or flavored sparkling water
Orange wedge or slice for garnish
instructions: Fill a wine glass with ice cubes.
Add 2 oz. of Campari to the glass.
Pour 3 oz. of Prosecco or sparkling wine into the glass.
Top off the glass with soda water or flavored sparkling water.
Stir the ingredients together gently.
Garnish with an orange wedge or slice.

name: Campfire Mule
instructions: Fill your mule mug  with plenty of ice.
Add the  Rum, lime juice, and maple syrup to the glass.
Stir gently to combine the ingredients.
Top with ginger beer, filling the glass about three-quarters of the way.
Garnish with a skewer of toasted marshmallows for a fun, campfire effect, and serve immediately.

name: Candy Cane Margarita
instructions: Rub a lime wedge along the rim of a cocktail glass and dip the rim into sugar on a plate to coat.
Fill the glass with ice.
In a shaker, combine cranberry juice, tequila, orange liqueur, and peppermint extract. Shake for 15 seconds.
Pour the mixture into the glass and top with raspberry seltzer water.
Sprinkle crushed candy cane on top and hang a candy cane on the rim for garnish.

name: Candy Cane Martini
instructions: Prepare the glass by pouring a small amount of water onto a plate. Dip the rim of the martini glass into the water, then into a plate of crushed candy canes, coating the rim evenly. Set the glass aside.
In a cocktail shaker, combine the peppermint vodka, peppermint schnapps, candy cane-infused vodka, and crème de cacao.
Add ice to the shaker, then shake vigorously until the mixture is well-chilled.
Strain the cocktail into the prepared martini glass.
Serve immediately and enjoy this cool, festive treat.

name: Candy Corn Cocktail
ingredients: 2 oz whipped cream vodka infused with candy corn
instructions: Pour the orange juice into a martini glass.
Hold a spoon, back side up, against the inside wall of the martini glass.

Slowly pour the candy corn-infused vodka over the back of the spoon. Make sure the vodka touches the inside of the glass before reaching the orange juice to create a layered effect, with the vodka sinking to the bottom.
Top the drink with whipped cream.
Garnish with additional candy corn.
Serve and enjoy your Candy Corn Martini!

name: Candyland Crush
instructions: In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, combine the Starburst-infused vodka, watermelon liqueur, simple syrup, lemon juice, and orange juice.
Shake the mixture well to chill the ingredients and blend the flavors.
Strain the shaken mixture into the glass, allowing the flavors to meld as the drink chills.
Garnish with jelly beans.
Serve and enjoy your Candyland Crush Cocktail!

name: Caramel Apple Cider Crush
instructions: If desired, rim a small section of your glass with cinnamon sugar by running an apple slice along the rim and dipping it into the sugar mixture.
Fill the glass with crushed ice.
Add the apple cider and salted caramel vodka to the glass, stirring to combine.
Top with ginger ale, adjusting the amount based on your taste preference.
Garnish with fresh apple slices and serve immediately.

name: Caramel Apple Manhattan
instructions: In a mixing glass filled with ice, combine the bourbon, apple brandy, butterscotch liqueur, and Angostura bitters.
Stir gently to chill and combine the ingredients.
Strain the mixture into a rocks glass with a large ice cube.
Garnish with a caramel syrup for a sweet and decorative touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy the rich, spiced flavors of this Caramel Apple Manhattan!

name: Caramel Apple Martini
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice, then add the sour apple schnapps, butterscotch schnapps, and vodka.
Shake the mixture vigorously until the shaker feels very cold in your hands.
If using caramel sauce, drizzle it inside a chilled martini glass for a sweet, decorative touch.
Strain the cocktail into the prepared martini glass.
Serve immediately and enjoy the sweet and tangy flavors of this indulgent Caramel Apple Martini!

name: Caramel Apple Moscow Mule
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the caramel vodka, apple cider, and lime juice. Shake until well mixed.
Fill copper mugs 3/4 of the way full with crushed ice.
Divide the cocktail mixture between the mugs.
Top off each mug with chilled ginger beer, filling to the top.
Sprinkle a pinch of ground cinnamon on top of each drink.
Garnish with a cinnamon stick and an apple slice.
Serve immediately and enjoy!

name: Caramel Apple Sangria
ingredients: 2 ounces caramel syrup (plus more for garnishing)
instructions: Start by placing the chopped apples in the bottom of a large pitcher.
Drizzle the caramel syrup over the apples, coating them evenly.
Pour in the white wine, apple cider, and vodka.
Stir the mixture well to combine all the ingredients.
Cover the pitcher and refrigerate for at least four hours to allow the flavors to meld and chill the sangria.
Before serving, swirl additional caramel syrup around the inside of each glass for a decorative touch.
Fill the glasses with the chilled sangria, making sure to include some of the chopped apples in each glass.
Serve with a straw if desired, and enjoy your Caramel Apple Sangria!

name: Caramel Apple & Spiced Rum Cocktail
ingredients: 2 oz Apple cider or apple juice
Sprinkle of ground cinnamon or cinnamon stick (for garnish (optional))
instructions: Pour half of the caramel syrup onto a small plate. Roll the rim of your glass around in the caramel to coat it, similar to rimming a margarita glass with salt.
In a cocktail shaker, combine the remaining caramel syrup, spiced rum, and apple cider with ice. Shake well until the ingredients are thoroughly mixed and chilled.
Pour the cocktail into the prepared glass.
For an extra touch of flavor and visual appeal, sprinkle a little ground cinnamon on top or garnish with a cinnamon stick.
Serve immediately and savor the rich, sweet, and spiced flavors of this comforting fall cocktail.

name: Caramel Apple Spritz
ingredients: caramel sauce and cinnamon sugar (for rimming)
instructions: Dip the rim of your glass in caramel sauce, then into a shallow dish of cinnamon sugar to coat the edge.
In the prepared glass, add the vanilla vodka, apple cider, and caramel syrup.
Gently pour prosecco to fill the glass, leaving room for the garnish.
Use a cocktail stirrer to combine the ingredients without disturbing the bubbles.
Add an apple slice to the rim of the glass. Serve immediately and enjoy!

name: Caramel Apple Whiskey Sour
instructions: Combine the whiskey, caramel sauce, apple cider, lemon juice, and egg white in a cocktail shaker.
Dry shake (without ice) vigorously to create a frothy texture.
Add ice to the shaker and shake again until well-chilled.
Strain the mixture into a caramel-rimmed rocks glass.
Garnish with a slice of green apple and serve immediately.

name: Caramel Hot Toddy
instructions: In a tea kettle, coat the bottom with the caramel syrup, ensuring an even layer.
Add the dark rum and lemon juice to the kettle and mix gently.
In a separate cup or mug, steep the tea bag in 8 ounces of hot water for a few minutes until the tea is infused.
Once the tea is ready, pour it into the kettle with the caramel, rum, and lemon mixture, stirring to combine.
Serve the drink in a tea cup, garnishing with a lemon wheel for a fresh, zesty touch.
Enjoy the sweet, warm flavors of this Caramel Hot Toddy!

name: Caramel Irish Coffee
ingredients: 2.5 ounces freshly brewed coffee (adjust to taste)
instructions: Warm your mug or Irish coffee glass by filling it with hot water. Let it sit for a few minutes, then discard the water.
In the warm glass, pour in the Irish whiskey, Irish cream liqueur, and butterscotch schnapps.
Fill the glass with freshly brewed coffee and stir the mixture to combine.
Top with a generous swirl of whipped cream.
Drizzle caramel syrup over the whipped cream for an extra touch of sweetness.
Serve immediately and enjoy this rich, cozy Caramel Irish Coffee.

name: Caramel Vodka Apple Cider Cocktail
instructions: Fill a glass with ice.
Pour 2 ounces of caramel vodka over the ice.
Fill the rest of the glass with 4 ounces of apple cider.
Stir gently to combine the flavors.
Garnish with a fresh apple slice for a festive touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy the sweet and crisp flavors of this Caramel Vodka Apple Cider Cocktail!

name: Caribbean Blossom
instructions: In a shaker tin, combine the rum, Campari, blanc vermouth, crème de cacao, simple syrup, lime juice, and orange juice.
Add three cubes of ice to the shaker and shake well until the mixture is chilled.
Strain the cocktail into a snifter glass filled with crushed ice.
Garnish with a lime wedge and an edible flower for a refined and elegant presentation.
Serve and enjoy your Caribbean Blossom cocktail!

name: Caribbean Citrus Pina Colada
ingredients: 2 oz fresh or frozen pineapple chunks
instructions: If using frozen pineapple chunks, allow them to thaw slightly for easier blending.
In a blender, combine the rum, pineapple chunks, orange juice, coconut milk, and ginger kombucha (if using).
Blend on high until smooth and creamy.
Taste and adjust the consistency with a little more coconut milk or orange juice if needed.
Pour the mixture into a chilled glass.
Garnish with a pineapple slice or an orange wheel, if desired.
Serve immediately and enjoy your refreshing Caribbean Citrus Piña Colada.

name: Caribbean Sunset
instructions: Fill a cocktail glass with ice and add a blue curaçao at the bottom.
In a shaker, combine ice, vodka, coconut rum, and orange juice.
Shake well until the mixture is chilled.
Strain the mixture into the ice-filled glass over the blue curaçao.
Gently stir the drink to create a beautiful layered effect.
Garnish with an orange wheel and a maraschino cherry.

name: Carnival Cosmo
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.
Add the vodka, limoncello, cranberry juice, and freshly squeezed juice from a lime wedge.
Shake vigorously until well-chilled.
Strain the mixture into a martini glass.
Garnish with a lime wheel and serve immediately.

name: Carrot Cake Cocktail
instructions: Begin by preparing your glass. Dip half of the rim in cream cheese frosting, then dip it into a small plate of crushed pecans to coat evenly. Set the glass aside.

Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Add the vanilla vodka, spiced rum, pineapple juice, carrot juice, simple syrup, Licor 43, a dash of salt, a sprinkle of cinnamon, and white chocolate liqueur to the shaker.
Shake the mixture vigorously to thoroughly combine the ingredients and chill the cocktail.
Strain the mixture over a large ice cube in the prepared glass, allowing the flavors to meld as the drink chills.
Serve and enjoy your Carrot Cake Cocktail!

name: Carrot Cake Espresso Martini
ingredients: 1/4 oz Maple Syrup (you can adjust to desired sweetness)
Powdered sugar on top for garnish
Grated Nutmeg or Cinnamon Stick for garnish
instructions: Chill Your Glass:
Start by placing your martini glass in the freezer to chill. A cold glass will keep your martini crisp and refreshing.
Combine Ingredients:

In a shaker, add the vodka, coffee liqueur, chilled espresso, carrot juice, maple syrup, Irish cream, and a pinch of ground cinnamon. The simple syrup adds a subtle sweetness that complements the carrot and espresso flavors beautifully.
Shake It Up:
Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously for about 15-20 seconds. This not only chills the mixture but also ensures that all the flavors are well combined.
Strain and Serve:
Strain the mixture into your chilled martini glass. The frothy top from the shaken espresso adds a delightful texture to the drink.
Garnish:
If desired, top with powdered sugar and a sprinkle of grated nutmeg or a cinnamon stick for an extra touch of carrot cake flavor.
Enjoy:
Serve immediately and enjoy the perfect balance of coffee and carrot cake flavors in this Carrot Cake Espresso Martini cocktail.

name: Chai Tea Irish Negroni
instructions: In a mixing glass, combine the Campari, Irish whiskey, sweet vermouth, and chai tea syrup.
Fill the mixing glass with ice and stir gently to chill and combine the ingredients (about 20-30 seconds).
Strain the mixture over a fresh ice cube in a rocks glass.
Garnish with an orange slice and a cinnamon stick.
Enjoy your spicy and bold Chai Tea Irish Negroni!

name: Chambord Cosmopolitan
ingredients: 1 ounce cranberry juice (100% juice, no sugar added)
1/2 ounce fresh lime juice (from about 1 small lime)
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice to chill the ingredients effectively.
Pour the raspberry vodka, Grand Marnier, Chambord, cranberry juice, and fresh lime juice into the shaker.
Shake vigorously until well combined and the shaker feels cold, usually about 15-20 seconds.
Strain the mixture into a chilled martini glass.
Garnish with a twist of lime peel or fresh raspberries if desired.

name: Chambord French Manhattan
instructions: Chill Your Glass: Begin by chilling your cocktail glass (either a martini glass or a coupe) by filling it with ice water and setting it aside while you prepare the drink.
Mix Ingredients: In a mixing glass, combine the Chambord, bourbon, and vermouth rosso. Add 2-3 dashes of orange bitters. This will bring a citrusy depth to the cocktail.
Stir: Fill the mixing glass with ice and stir the mixture gently. The aim is to chill the drink while diluting it slightly to enhance the flavors. Stir for about 30 seconds.

Prepare the Garnish: While the cocktail is chilling, prepare your orange twist. Use a vegetable peeler or a knife to cut a thin strip of orange peel. Try to get as little of the pith (the white part) as possible to avoid bitterness.
Serve: Empty the ice water from your cocktail glass and strain the cocktail mixture into it.

Garnish and Serve: Twist the orange peel over the drink to release its oils, then rub the rim of the glass with the peel to infuse it with a hint of orange. Drop the twist into the drink as a garnish.
Enjoy: Your Chambord French Manhattan is ready to be enjoyed.

name: Chambord Margarita
instructions: In a shaker, combine the silver tequila, lime juice, simple syrup, and Chambord. Fill the shaker with ice.
Shake vigorously until the outside of the shaker feels cold.
Strain into a chilled margarita glass or over ice in a glass. Optionally, you can salt the rim of the glass before adding the cocktail.
Garnish with a lime wheel or fresh raspberries if desired.

name: Chambord Sidecar
instructions: Chill a cocktail glass in the freezer to prepare for serving.
Fill a cocktail shaker with ice to ensure the ingredients are well chilled.
Add the cognac, Chambord, dry Curacao, and lemon juice to the shaker.
Shake vigorously for about 15-20 seconds until the mixture is well chilled.
Strain the cocktail into the chilled glass.
Garnish with a twist of lemon peel, if desired, to enhance the citrus notes.

name: Champagne and Chambord
instructions: Pour the Chambord into your champagne flute.
Slowly add the champagne to the flute. You'll see it mix with the Chambord and start to fizz.
Give it a gentle stir, and then it's ready to enjoy.

name: Charcuterie Margarita
ingredients: Cheese, grapes, salami, and rosemary (for garnish)
instructions: Start by brushing the rim of your glass with agave syrup, then dip it into crushed crackers. Place the glass in the freezer to chill.
In a cocktail shaker, muddle a few dark grapes with simple syrup.
Add orange liqueur, tequila, a pinch of black pepper, and lime juice to the shaker. Add ice and shake well.
Strain the mixture into the chilled glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with cheese, grapes, salami, and a sprig of rosemary for a charcuterie-inspired twist.
Enjoy your Charcuterie Margarita!

name: Chartreuse Sour
instructions: Add the gin, green chartreuse, simple syrup, lime juice, and egg white to a cocktail shaker.
Dry shake (without ice) to emulsify the egg white and create a frothy texture.
Add ice to the shaker and shake again until well chilled.
Strain the mixture into a rocks glass over a large ice cube.
Garnish with a lime wheel and cherry before serving.

name: Cheeky Peach Cocktail
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the vodka, peach schnapps, pineapple juice, simple syrup, Peychaud’s bitters, and mint leaves.
Fill the shaker with cubed ice and shake vigorously until the mixture is well-chilled and the flavors are fully infused.
Double-strain the mixture into a double rocks glass filled with crushed ice. This ensures a smooth cocktail without any mint leaves or large ice pieces.
Top off the drink with chilled club soda to add a refreshing effervescence.
Garnish with a fresh mint sprig for a fragrant and visually appealing touch. Serve immediately.

name: Cheesecake Factory Cheesecake Martini
instructions: If you choose to rim the glass, pour a bit of honey onto a small saucer and dip the rim of your glass into it. Then dip the honey-coated rim into graham cracker crumbs. Set the glass aside.
Add a handful of ice to a cocktail shaker if desired.
Pour the vanilla vodka, cream, amaretto, and Kahlua into the shaker.
Shake well to combine the ingredients.
Strain the mixture into the prepared glass.
Enjoy!

name: Cherry Almond Snow Cocktail
instructions: Fill a coupe or rocks glass with ice and set it aside to chill while preparing the cocktail.
In a cocktail shaker, combine cherry brandy, amaretto, and half-and-half.
Add ice to the shaker and shake vigorously for 15–20 seconds to achieve a creamy, frothy texture.
Discard the ice from the chilled glass and strain the cocktail into the glass. Serve over fresh ice if preferred.
For a festive touch, top with a dollop of whipped cream and a maraschino cherry.

name: Cherry Basil Smash
instructions: Place the cherries, lime juice, and simple syrup in a cocktail shaker.
Muddle the mixture to release the juices from the cherries.
Add basil leaves and gently press them with the muddler to release their aroma without tearing the leaves.
Pour in the gin and add ice to the shaker.
Shake until the mixture is well chilled.
Strain the cocktail into a glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with club soda and garnish with a basil leaf or cherry.

name: Cherry Blossom Spritz
instructions: In a mixing glass filled with crushed ice, combine the gin and cherry shrub.
Stir gently to blend the flavors.
Pour the mixture into a glass, then top with soda water for a refreshing finish.
Garnish with a cherry or two for a touch of elegance.
Serve immediately and enjoy!

name: Cherry Bourbon Chocolate
ingredients: Shaved Chocolate or Cocoa Powder (optional, for garnish)
instructions: Prepare your favorite hot chocolate using milk or water, adjusting for your desired level of creaminess and richness.
Pour the cherry bourbon into a mug, followed by the hot chocolate. Stir gently to blend the flavors evenly.
Top the drink with a generous dollop of whipped cream.
Garnish with a cherry and, if desired, sprinkle with shaved chocolate or a light dusting of cocoa powder for an extra touch of indulgence.

name: Cherry Bourbon Delight
instructions: In an old-fashioned glass, place a large ice cube.
Pour the bourbon and cherry liqueur over the ice.
Stir the mixture well until it is thoroughly chilled and the flavors are well combined.
Generously top the drink with whipped cream, creating a thick layer.
For an optional garnish, sprinkle a little cinnamon powder on top of the whipped cream.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Cherry Bourbon Delight.

name: Cherry Bourbon Lemonade
ingredients: Small wedge of fresh lemon for garnish
instructions: Fill a glass with ice cubes.
Pour 2 ounces of lemonade into the glass.
Add 2 ounces of bourbon.
Pour in 1/2 ounce of cherry syrup.
Stir well to combine.
Garnish with a maraschino cherry and a small wedge of fresh lemon.
Serve immediately and enjoy.

name: Cherry Collins
instructions: Mix the Ingredients: Fill a shaker with ice. Add the cherry vodka, lemon juice, and cherry syrup. Shake well until chilled.
Pour: Strain the mixture into a tall glass filled with ice.
Top Off: Add tonic water to fill the glass.
Garnish: Garnish with a cherry or a lemon wheel.
Serve and Enjoy.

name: Cherry Cosmopolitan
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, muddle the 5 pitted cherries until they are well mashed.
Add the vodka, triple sec, lime juice, simple syrup, and cranberry juice to the shaker.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake well until the mixture is well-chilled.
Strain the mixture into a chilled martini glass or a coupe glass.
Garnish with 3 fresh cherries on a cocktail pick.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Cherry Cosmopolitan.

name: Cherry Daiquiri
instructions: Measure out 3 oz of cherry juice.
Measure out 1/2 oz of lime juice.
Measure out 2 oz of white rum.
Ensure you have 4 oz of frozen sweet cherries (pitted).
Place the frozen sweet cherries in a blender.
Add the cherry juice, lime juice, and white rum to the blender.
Blend the mixture until smooth.
Pour the blended mixture into a chilled glass.
Garnish with a cherry or lime slice if desired.
Serve immediately and enjoy your refreshing Cherry Daiquiri.

name: Cherry Garcia Martini
instructions: Dip the rim of a martini glass in chocolate syrup, then coat it with crushed Oreos.
Drizzle chocolate syrup along the inside of the glass for extra flavor and presentation.
Fill a cocktail shaker with ice and add the cherry rum, white chocolate Irish cream, and grenadine.
Shake vigorously until well-chilled.
Strain the mixture into the prepared martini glass.
Serve and enjoy your delicious Cherry Garcia Martini!

name: Cherry Lime Gin Fizz
instructions: Pit three fresh cherries and add them to a shaker glass along with the lime juice and cherry liqueur. Muddle well to release the cherry flavors.
Add ice and gin to the shaker.
Shake vigorously to chill the drink.
Strain the mixture into a tall glass filled with fresh ice.
Top the drink with lemon-lime soda.
Garnish with lime slices and fresh cherries.
Serve and enjoy!

name: Cherry Lime Slushie
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the tart cherry juice, lime juice, simple syrup, orange liqueur, and vodka.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake it well to combine and chill the mixture.
Strain the mixture over a glass filled with crushed ice.
Garnish with a lime wheel or a cherry and get ready to enjoy!

name: Cherry Manhattan
ingredients: 1/2 ounce cherry liqueur or cherry syrup
instructions: Chill the Glass: Start by placing your cocktail glass in the freezer to chill.
Mix the Cocktail: In a mixing glass, combine the rye whiskey (or bourbon), sweet vermouth, cherry liqueur (or syrup), and bitters. Fill the mixing glass with ice, reaching about three-quarters full.
Stir Well: Stir the mixture gently for about 30 seconds or until well-chilled. The key is to stir, not shake, to ensure the cocktail remains clear and not cloudy.
Strain: Take the chilled glass from the freezer and strain the cocktail mixture into it.
Garnish and Serve: Garnish with a maraschino cherry on a cocktail stick. For an extra touch of cherry, you can also add a small splash of the juice from the cherry jar.

name: Cherry Rose Mudslide
instructions: Fill a rocks glass with ice cubes.
Pour the Kahlua, Tequila Rose, and half & half cream into the glass.
Gently stir the mixture to combine the ingredients.
Garnish with two maraschino cherries on top.
Serve and enjoy your Cherry Rose Mudslide cocktail!

name: Children of the Candy Corn
instructions: In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, combine the candy corn-infused vodka, lemon juice, and cinnamon simple syrup.
Shake the mixture vigorously for about 15 seconds until well-chilled.
Strain the cocktail over fresh ice into a highball glass.
Top with club soda to add a refreshing fizz.
Garnish with a lemon wheel and a skewer of candy corn for a festive touch.

name: Chocolate Cherry Old Fashioned
instructions: Place a large ice cube in an Old Fashioned glass.
In a mixing glass, combine the bourbon, cherry liqueur, simple syrup, chocolate bitters, and Angostura bitters.
Add ice to the mixing glass and stir until well-chilled.
Strain the mixture into the prepared Old Fashioned glass over the large ice cube.
Garnish with a cherry and an orange peel. Express the orange peel over the drink by twisting it to release the oils, then drop it into the glass.

name: Chocolate Covered Strawberry Martini
instructions: Add vodka, Rumchata, chocolate liqueur, and strawberry syrup to a cocktail shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously for at least 15 seconds to combine and chill the ingredients.
Drizzle chocolate syrup inside the martini glass to create a decorative swirl.
Strain the mixture from the shaker into the prepared martini glass.
Top off the drink with a generous amount of whipped cream.
Drizzle more chocolate syrup over the whipped cream.
Sprinkle cacao bits on top.
Garnish with a fresh strawberry.
Enjoy your Chocolate Covered Strawberry Martini!

name: Chocolate Espresso Martini
ingredients: 1 ounce coffee liqueur (you can use Kahlúa)
1 ounce fresh espresso (cooled to at least room temperature)
1/2 ounce chocolate syrup (plus a little extra for garnish)
instructions: Prepare the Glass:
Drizzle chocolate syrup around the inside of a martini glass.
Place the glass in the freezer to chill while you prepare the drink.
Mix the Drink:
In a shaker, combine the vodka, coffee liqueur, espresso, and chocolate syrup.
Fill the shaker with ice, ensuring there's enough to chill the liquid thoroughly.
Shake:
Secure the lid on the shaker and shake vigorously for about 15 seconds. The goal is to chill the mixture quickly while slightly diluting it with the melted ice, improving the drink's texture.
Serve:
Strain the mixture into your chilled martini glass. The drink should have a nice froth on top from the shaking.
Garnish:
If you like, float three coffee beans on the froth for a classic espresso martini garnish. A swirl of chocolate syrup can also add an extra touch of elegance.

name: Chocolate Peppermint Martini
instructions: Begin by decorating your martini glass. Pour a small amount of chocolate syrup onto a plate, dip the rim of the glass into it, and then dip into the crushed candy cane to coat.
In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, combine the crème de cacao, peppermint vodka, half & half, cocoa powder, and chocolate syrup.
Shake the mixture vigorously to blend all ingredients and chill the cocktail.
Taste the mixture and adjust the chocolate or peppermint flavor to your liking, if desired.
Strain the cocktail into your prepared martini glass.

name: Christmas Champagne Cocktail
instructions: Pour a small amount of pomegranate syrup onto a saucer and spread green rimming sugar evenly on a separate plate. Dip the rim of a champagne flute in the syrup, then coat it with the green sugar for a festive touch.
Place a few pomegranate seeds in the bottom of the glass, then add a pomegranate simple syrup.
Pour in the pomegranate juice, and top off with champagne.
Cheers to your holiday-inspired bubbly!

name: Christmas Collins
instructions: Fill a Collins glass with ice.
Pour in the gin, pomegranate juice, lime juice, and rosemary simple syrup.
Stir gently to combine the ingredients.
Top with club soda, stirring lightly to maintain the bubbles.
Garnish with a sprinkle of pomegranate seeds, a sprig of rosemary, and a lime wedge for a festive finish.
Serve immediately and enjoy the refreshing holiday vibes.

name: Christmas in the Sand
instructions: In a shaker filled with ice, combine tequila reposado, triple sec, clementine juice, and lime juice. Shake vigorously until chilled.
Strain the mixture into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with ginger beer, pouring gently to avoid losing the bubbles.
Place a orange slice and a sprig of rosemary on top for a festive finish.

name: Christmas Kentucky Buck
instructions: In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, combine the bourbon, lemon juice, simple syrup, and cranberry juice.
Seal the shaker and shake vigorously until well-chilled.
Strain the mixture into an old fashioned glass filled with crushed ice.
Add 2 ounces of club soda on top, giving it a gentle stir to mix.
Add a few fresh cranberries for a festive touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy this refreshing holiday cocktail!

name: Christmas Martini
instructions: Add vodka, cranberry juice, Cointreau, lemon juice, and simple syrup to a cocktail shaker filled with ice.
Shake the shaker vigorously until the mixture is thoroughly chilled.
Strain the cocktail into a chilled martini glass.
Top with fresh cranberries and a sprig of rosemary for a festive presentation. Serve immediately.

name: Christmas Old Fashioned
ingredients: 0.5 ounce cranberry simple syrup (adjust to taste)
instructions: If you prefer a sugared rim, dip the rim of a rocks glass in cranberry simple syrup, then in sugar to coat.
Place 3 fresh cranberries in the glass and muddle them gently to release their flavors.
Add an ice ball or large ice cube to the glass.
In a separate mixing glass, combine the rye whiskey, cranberry simple syrup, and Angostura bitters.
Add ice to the mixing glass, then stir the mixture until thoroughly chilled.
Strain the cocktail into the prepared rocks glass over the ice ball.
Garnish with an orange slice and additional cranberries for a festive presentation.

name: Christmas Rum Cocktail
instructions: Begin by filling a tall glass with a few ice cubes.
Pour the spiced rum over the ice, followed by the lemon juice.
Add the cranberry juice and gently stir to combine the flavors.
Top with ginger beer to fill the glass.
Garnish with a lemon wheel and a sprig of rosemary for a festive presentation.

name: Christmas Spiced Rum Sour
instructions: In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, combine the spiced rum, simple syrup, and lemon juice.
Shake well until the mixture is thoroughly chilled.
Strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with an orange slice and a cherry for a festive touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy!

name: Christmas White Russian
ingredients: Crushed candy cane or mini candy cane (for garnish)
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the vodka, coffee liqueur, chocolate syrup, vanilla extract, simple syrup, and ground ginger. Shake vigorously to mix the ingredients thoroughly.
Add ice to the shaker and shake again until well-chilled.
Strain the mixture into a glass.
Slowly pour the heavy cream over the cocktail to create a layered effect.
Add a dollop of whipped cream on top, and garnish with a crushed candy cane or a mini candy cane on the rim.
Serve immediately and enjoy this festive, dessert-like cocktail.

name: Chrysanthemum
instructions: Fill your mixing glass with ice to get it nice and cold.
Pour in the dry vermouth, Benedictine, and absinthe.
Stir everything together gently until it's well mixed and chilled.
Strain the mix into your chilled martini glass.
Garnish with a twist of orange for that extra zing.

name: Cider and Maple Old Fashioned
instructions: In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, add the bourbon, pure maple syrup, apple cider, and orange bitters.
Shake to combine the ingredients well.
Strain the mixture into two rocks glasses filled with ice.
Garnish each glass with a cinnamon stick.
Enjoy your Cider and Maple Old Fashioned!

name: Cinco de Derby
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the blackberry cinnamon syrup, lime juice, and tequila.
Add ice to the shaker and shake well to chill and mix the ingredients.
Strain the mixture over fresh ice in your serving glass.
Top off the cocktail with your favorite sparkling wine.
Stir gently and garnish with a mint sprig.
Place a sugar cube soaked in 151 proof rum in the hollowed-out lime half.
Light up that soaked sugar cube with a match or lighter—watch the flames dance! Sprinkle a pinch of ground cinnamon for a fiery show that'll take it to the next level.
Enjoy your Cinco de Derby!

name: Cinnamon Apple Margarita
instructions: Begin by preparing your rocks glass. Use a brush or your finger to paint the rim with agave syrup, then dip it into a small plate of cinnamon sugar to coat evenly. Set the glass aside.
In a cocktail shaker, combine the apple cider, cinnamon-infused tequila, triple sec, and lemon juice.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously until the mixture is well mixed and chilled.
Strain the mixture into the prepared glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a lemon wheel and a cinnamon stick for a festive and aromatic touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy the warm, spiced flavors of your Cinnamon Apple Margarita!

name: Cinnamon Bourbon Old Fashioned
instructions: In a mixing glass filled with ice, combine the bourbon, orange bitters, and cinnamon syrup.
Stir well to mix and chill the ingredients.
Strain the mixture into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a thin orange slice, and add a cinnamon stick and rosemary sprig if desired for extra warmth and aroma.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Cinnamon Bourbon Old Fashioned!

name: Cinnamon Cream Martini
ingredients: 1/2 tablespoon ground cinnamon (plus more for garnish)
instructions: Place the ground cinnamon on one shallow plate and honey on another. Dip the rim of the martini glass into the honey, then into the cinnamon to coat the rim. Set the glass aside.
In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, combine the Irish cream liqueur, cinnamon whiskey, vanilla vodka, and cream. Shake vigorously to chill and mix the ingredients.
Strain the mixture into the prepared martini glass.
Sprinkle a pinch of additional ground cinnamon on top for a beautiful garnish.
Serve immediately and enjoy the creamy, spiced flavors of the Cinnamon Cream Martini!

name: Cinnamon Grapefruit Paloma
instructions: Moisten the edge of your glass with a grapefruit wedge. Rim the glass with cinnamon salty sugar.
Fill the glass with crushed ice.
Add a few ice cubes to a cocktail shaker.
Pour in the tequila, Grand Marnier, grapefruit juice, orange juice, and cinnamon simple syrup.
Shake well for about 20 seconds to combine and chill the ingredients.
Strain the mixture into the prepared glass over the crushed ice.
Top with a splash or two of club soda.
Stir gently to combine.
Garnish with a grapefruit wedge.
Enjoy immediately!

name: Cinnamon Maple Whiskey Sour
ingredients: Cinnamon sticks and lemon wheel (for garnish)
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker about two-thirds full with ice.
Pour in the bourbon, lemon juice, maple syrup, and, if desired, a pinch of ground cinnamon.
Securely fasten the lid of the shaker and shake well until the mixture is thoroughly chilled.
Fill your cocktail glass with fresh ice.
Strain the cold whiskey sour mixture into the glass. Garnish with cinnamon stick and lemon wheel.
Serve immediately and enjoy the sweet, tangy, and spiced flavors of this Cinnamon Maple Whiskey Sour!

name: Cinnamon Pear and Rum Cocktail
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker halfway with ice.
Add the pear nectar, dark rum, vanilla simple syrup, and ground cinnamon to the shaker.
Cover and shake vigorously until the cocktail shaker is cold to the touch, about 10-15 seconds.
Strain the mixture into a rocks glass.
Garnish with fresh pear slices for a beautiful presentation.
Serve immediately and enjoy the cozy flavors of this seasonal cocktail.

name: Cinnamon Tequila Sour
instructions: Add the tequila, simple syrup, lemon juice, cinnamon, egg white (if using), and ice to a cocktail shaker.
Shake vigorously for 30 seconds to combine and chill the ingredients.
Strain the mixture into a glass.
Enjoy your Cinnamon Tequila Sour!

name: Cinnamon Toast Crunch Martini
ingredients: 1 ounce Cinnamon Whisky (you can use Fireball)
Cinnamon Toast Crunch Cereal (for garnish or rimming the glass)
instructions: Prepare the Glass: (Optional)
Pour a small amount of honey or light corn syrup onto a plate.
On a separate plate, spread out the crushed Cinnamon Toast Crunch cereal.
Dip the rim of your martini glass first into the honey or syrup to coat it lightly, then dip into the crushed cereal to create a flavorful rim.
Mix the Drink:
Fill a cocktail shaker with ice to chill the ingredients properly.
Pour the RumChata, cinnamon whisky, and vanilla vodka into the shaker.
Secure the lid and shake vigorously for about 15-20 seconds, or until the mixture is well-chilled.
Serve:
Strain the mixture into the prepared martini glass, being careful not to disturb the rim.
Optionally, you can garnish with a small sprinkle of ground cinnamon or a few Cinnamon Toast Crunch pieces for an extra decorative touch.
Enjoy:
Serve immediately and enjoy the creamy, spicy, and sweet flavors of your Cinnamon Toast Crunch Martini.

name: Cinnamon Toast Crunch Shot
instructions: First, rim a shot glass with cinnamon sugar. To do this, mix granulated sugar and cinnamon in a 2:1 ratio, then dip the rim of the shot glass in simple syrup and then into the cinnamon sugar mixture.
Fill a cocktail shaker with ice, then add 1 part Fireball Whiskey and 1 part RumChata.
Shake the cocktail shaker vigorously for 15 seconds to combine the ingredients and chill the drink.
Strain the mixture into the cinnamon sugar-rimmed shot glass.
Garnish with whipped cream or cinnamon if desired.

name: Clausmopolitan
instructions: Prepare the martini glass by moistening the rim with lime juice and dipping it into sugar arranged in a shallow dish. Set the glass aside.
Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Add the vodka, cranberry juice, triple sec, and lime juice.
Shake the mixture vigorously until the ingredients are thoroughly chilled.
Strain the cocktail into the prepared martini glass.
Garnish with a few fresh cranberries for a festive and elegant finish.
Serve immediately and enjoy your holiday cheer!

name: Clementine Mezcal Margarita
instructions: In a shallow dish, mix together salt, paprika, and citrus zest to create the rim mixture.
Moisten the rim of a rocks glass with a lime wedge, then dip it into the salt mixture. Fill the glass with ice and set aside.
In a cocktail shaker or pint glass, combine the clementine juice, lime juice, Mezcal, and Grand Marnier. Stir or shake well to mix the ingredients.
Pour the mixture into the prepared glass.
Serve immediately.

name: Coastal Breeze
instructions: Rim your glass with desiccated coconut by running a lime wedge along the edge and dipping it into the coconut.
In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, combine the gin, mezcal, lime juice, blue curaçao, and coconut syrup.
Shake vigorously until well-chilled.
Strain the mixture into the prepared glass.
Garnish with lime wheels and enjoy your tropical, smoky cocktail.

name: Cobalt Breeze
instructions: In a shaker, combine  simple syrup, lemon juice, silver rum, and blue curaçao. Add a few ice cubes.
Shake well until the mixture is chilled.
Strain into a cocktail glass filled with ice.
Slowly pour the grenadine over the back of a spoon along the side of the glass. The grenadine will sink to the bottom, creating a layered effect.
Slightly stir the bottom of the drink to create a dark purple layer, while keeping the top of the drink bright blue.
Serve and enjoy!

name: Strawberry Serenade
instructions: Stem the strawberry and add it to a cocktail shaker. Muddle gently to release the flavors.
Add the dark rum, Chocolate Strawberry Liqueur, cream of coconut, and chocolate bitters to the shaker.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake until well-chilled.
Strain the mixture into a cocktail glass.
Garnish with a chocolate and strawberry. Serve immediately.

name: Cocoa Island Wave
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the rum blanco, crème de cacao, blue curaçao, fresh-squeezed lime juice, and pineapple juice.
Add ice and shake vigorously until chilled.
Strain the mixture into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with mint sprig or as desired, and serve immediately.
Enjoy!

name: Coconut Aperol Margarita
ingredients: 1/2 ounce simple syrup (adjust sweetness to taste)
Lime wheel or shredded coconut (for garnish)
instructions: Rim a margarita glass with lime juice and dip it into shredded coconut if available, or just use salt if you prefer a classic touch.
Place the glass in the freezer to chill while you mix the drink.
In a shaker, combine the tequila, Aperol, lime juice, coconut milk, and simple syrup.
Fill the shaker with ice, covering the liquid.
Shake the mixture vigorously for about 15 seconds or until the outside of the shaker feels cold.
Strain the mixture into the chilled margarita glass.
If desired, add fresh ice to the glass before pouring the cocktail.
Garnish with a lime wheel or a sprinkle of shredded coconut on top.
Serve immediately and enjoy the tropical twist on a traditional margarita!

name: Coconut Blackberry Mojito
instructions: Mix lime zest, sugar, and kosher salt on a plate. Run a lime wedge around the rim of your glass, then dip it in the mixture. Fill the glass with ice.
In a shaker, muddle mint leaves and blackberries.
Add white rum, lime juice, coconut cream, and ice. Shake until chilled.
Strain into the prepared glass.
Top with soda water and stir gently.
Garnish with mint, a blackberry, and a lime wheel.
Serve and enjoy!

name: Coconut Carajillo
instructions: Brew a fresh double shot of espresso.
In a shaker, mix together fresh espresso, Licor 43, rum, and Mozart Coconut.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously to chill and blend the ingredients.
Strain the mixture over fresh ice in a serving glass.
Add a dash of cocoa powder on top for a hint of chocolate flavor.
Garnish with a crispy coconut roll.
Enjoy!

name: Coconut Chocolate Pumpkin Martini
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the vodka, Irish cream, pumpkin syrup, and organic chocolate smoothie.
Add a handful of ice to the shaker and shake vigorously until the mixture is well-chilled and frothy.
Strain the cocktail into your favorite martini glass.
Top off the martini with a generous dollop of whipped cream.
Sprinkle a pinch of cinnamon over the whipped cream for an aromatic and festive garnish.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Coconut Chocolate Pumpkin Martini!

name: Coconut Collins
instructions: Prepare a Glass: Fill a Collins glass with ice cubes.
Mix Ingredients: In a cocktail shaker, combine the lime juice, cream of coconut, and white rum. Fill the shaker with ice and shake well until the mixture is chilled.
Strain and Pour: Strain the mixture into the prepared Collins glass.
Add Soda Water: Top off the drink with soda water.
Garnish: Garnish with a lime wheel or a coconut slice, if desired.
Serve: Serve immediately and enjoy your refreshing Coconut Collins.

name: Coconut Cosmopolitan
instructions: Take a cocktail glass and moisten the rim with a lemon wedge.
Dip the rim into shredded coconut to coat it evenly.
Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.
Add 2 oz of Coconut Vodka.
Pour in 1 oz of Lemon Juice.
Add 2 oz of Cranberry Juice.
Shake the mixture well until it is chilled.
Strain the mixture into the prepared cocktail glass.
Garnish with a twist of lemon or a piece of coconut if desired.

name: Coconut Daiquiri
ingredients: Lime wheel or coconut flakes for garnish (optional)
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.
Pour 2 oz of white rum into the shaker.
Add 1 oz of freshly squeezed lime juice.
Add 1.5 oz of coconut cream.
Add 1/2 oz of simple syrup.
Secure the lid on the shaker and shake vigorously for about 15-20 seconds until the mixture is well-chilled and combined.
Strain the mixture into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a lime wheel or sprinkle with coconut flakes for an added touch (optional).
Serve immediately and enjoy your refreshing Coconut Daiquiri.

name: Coconut Dole Whip
ingredients: Pineapple slice and pineapple leaves  for garnish
instructions: In a blender, combine the frozen pineapple, frozen mango, pineapple juice, coconut cream, rum, Licor 43, and a handful of ice.
Blend until smooth, then pour into your go-to glass.
Garnish with pineapple leaves and a pineapple slice and you're ready to enjoy!

name: Coconut Espresso Martini
instructions: Chill the Glass:
Begin by chilling your martini glass. This can be done by filling it with ice water and setting it aside as you prepare your drink.
Mix the Drink:
In a shaker, combine the freshly brewed espresso, coconut rum, vodka, and coffee liqueur.
Fill the shaker with ice, ensuring there's enough to cool the drink but not too much to dilute it.
Shake It Up:
Secure the lid on your shaker and shake vigorously for about 15 seconds. The goal is to chill the drink thoroughly and add a slight frothiness from the espresso.
Prepare the Garnish:
While your drink is chilling, prepare your garnish.
Toast some coconut flakes until they're golden brown and fragrant. This will add a lovely aroma and a crunchy texture to the drink.
Serve:
Empty the ice water from your martini glass.
Strain the cocktail mixture into the glass, ensuring a smooth pour.
Garnish and Enjoy:
Sprinkle the toasted coconut flakes over the top of the drink.
Add a few espresso beans for an extra coffee kick and an elegant look.

name: Coconut Gin Fizz
ingredients: Lime wheel or coconut flakes for garnish
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.
Add 2 oz of gin, 1 oz of coconut milk, 1 oz of lime juice, 1/2 oz of simple syrup, and 1 egg white to the shaker.
Shake vigorously for about 15 seconds to mix and chill the ingredients.
Remove the ice from the shaker and shake again (dry shake) for another 10-15 seconds to create a frothy texture from the egg white.
Strain the mixture into a tall glass filled with ice.
Top up with soda water, pouring slowly to maintain the frothy top.
Garnish with a lime wheel or a sprinkle of coconut flakes.
Serve immediately and enjoy your refreshing Coconut Gin Fizz.

name: Coconut Habanero Margarita
instructions: Brush the rim of your glass with agave syrup, then dip it into Tajin seasoning to coat. Set the glass aside.
In a cocktail shaker, combine tequila, orange liqueur, coconut cream, pineapple juice, one slice of habanero, lime juice, and agave syrup.
Shake the mixture vigorously to blend all the flavors.
Strain the mixture into the prepared glass over a large ice cube.
Garnish with the remaining habanero slice and an orange slice for an extra touch of flair.

name: Coconut Kiss of Death
instructions: Rim your shot glasses by dipping the edges in grenadine, creating a bloody effect.
In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, add the vodka, maraschino liqueur, and coconut cream.
Shake well until the mixture is chilled.
Strain the mixture into the prepared shot glass.
Serve immediately and enjoy your chillingly delicious Coconut Kiss of Death!

name: Coconut Lavender Margarita
ingredients: Edible mini flowers or lavender sprig (for garnish)
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine lavender syrup, coconut cream, tequila, lime juice, and orange liqueur.
Add ice to the shaker and shake vigorously.
Brush the rim of your coupe glass with agave syrup and dip it into salt to coat.
Strain the mixture into the prepared coupe glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with two mini edible flowers.
Enjoy your Coconut Lavender Margarita!

name: Coconut Paloma
ingredients: Optional: honey and shredded coconut for rim
instructions: If using the honey and shredded coconut rim, dip the rim of the glass into honey, then into shredded coconut to coat.
In a cocktail shaker, combine the grapefruit juice, blanco tequila, and coconut rum.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake well until the mixture is chilled.
Strain the mixture into the prepared glass filled with ice.
Garnish with grapefruit slices.
Add optional mint leaves for a fresh touch.

name: Coconut Rum Punch
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine rum, pineapple juice, and coconut cream.
Add ice to the shaker and shake until well chilled.
Strain the mixture into a glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with grenadine for a beautiful color contrast.
Garnish with a pineapple slice and leaves for a tropical touch.

name: Coconut Vodka Lemonade
ingredients: Lemon slices and mint leaves for garnish
instructions: Fill a shaker with ice.
Add 2 oz coconut vodka, 1 oz coconut water, 1 oz lemon juice, and 1/2 oz simple syrup to the shaker.
Shake well until the mixture is chilled.
Fill a glass with ice and strain the mixture into the glass.
Top off with 3 oz club soda and stir gently.
Garnish with lemon slices and mint leaves.

name: Coconut Vodka Sour
instructions: Prep Your Ingredients: Measure out the coconut vodka, fresh lemon juice, and simple syrup. If you're using an egg white, separate it from the yolk.
Without Egg White: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Add the coconut vodka, lemon juice, and simple syrup. Shake well for about 15-20 seconds until chilled.

With Egg White: Add the coconut vodka, lemon juice, simple syrup, and egg white to a cocktail shaker without ice. Dry shake (shake without ice) for about 15 seconds to create frothiness. Then add ice and shake again for another 15-20 seconds.
Strain and Serve: Strain the mixture into a chilled coupe or rocks glass.
Garnish: Top the drink with toasted coconut flakes and a lemon slice.
Enjoy: Sip and enjoy your Coconut Vodka Sour

name: Corpse Reviver No. 1
ingredients: Green olive or lemon peel (for garnish)
Optional: orange bitters (absinthe, or orange liqueur)
