instructions: Fill a mixing glass with ice.
Add brandy or cognac, apple brandy, and sweet vermouth to the mixing glass.
Stir the ingredients until well-chilled.
Strain the mixture into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a green olive or a twist of lemon peel.
Optionally, consider adding a splash of orange bitters, absinthe, or orange liqueur for an extra kick.

name: How to Make a Corpse Reviver No 2
instructions: Rinse a chilled cocktail glass with absinthe and toss the excess.
In a shaker, add 1 ounce of gin, 1 ounce of Lillet Blanc or Cocchi Americano, 1 ounce of orange liqueur, and 1 ounce of freshly squeezed lemon juice.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake until well-chilled.
Strain the cocktail into the prepared glass.
Garnish with an orange peel.

name: Cranberry Apple Cocktail
instructions: Begin by filling a highball glass with ice.
Pour in the apple juice, allowing it to settle at the bottom.
Next, add the orange juice, creating a layered effect.
Gently top the drink with the cranberry vodka, letting it float on the surface for a beautiful gradient.
Garnish with a twist of orange peel for a citrusy aroma and elegant finish.

name: Cranberry Apple Fizz
ingredients: 1 ounce seltzer water or soda water
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the cranberry juice, apple brandy, and simple syrup.
Use a long spoon to stir the mixture until well combined.
Fill a rocks glass with ice.
Pour half of the cocktail mixture into each glass.
Float the seltzer water on top of the cocktail.
Garnish with a few fresh cranberries for a festive touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy the refreshing, fruity flavors of the Cranberry Apple Fizz!

name: Cranberry Apple Spice Mule
instructions: Add ice to a cocktail shaker, filling it about halfway.
Pour in the vodka, apple cider, and cranberry sauce, then seal the shaker.
Shake vigorously until the shaker feels ice-cold to the touch.
Fill a copper mug halfway with ice, then strain the shaken mixture into the mug.
Top with ginger beer and stir gently with a spoon or a cinnamon stick.
Garnish with a cinnamon stick, cranberry and a lime wheel. Enjoy responsibly!

name: Cranberry Bourbon Punch
ingredients: rosemary sprig, orange slice, cranberries  (for garnish)
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.
Add the bourbon, sweet vermouth, orange juice, cranberry juice, and simple syrup.
Shake well for about 15–20 seconds until chilled.
Strain the mixture over fresh ice into a serving glass.
Garnish with a rosemary sprig, a slice of orange, and a few cranberries for a festive touch.

name: Cranberry Bourbon Smash
ingredients: Mint sprig and cranberries for garnish
instructions: Muddle: In a cocktail shaker, muddle the fresh cranberries and mint leaves together to release their flavors.
Add Liquids: Add the bourbon, cranberry juice, fresh lemon juice, and simple syrup to the shaker.
Shake: Fill the shaker with ice cubes and shake vigorously for about 20 seconds.
Strain: Strain the mixture into a rocks glass filled with ice.
Top Off: If desired, top off with a splash of club soda for a bit of fizz.
Garnish: Garnish with a sprig of mint and a few cranberries.
Serve: Enjoy your refreshing Cranberry Bourbon Smash.

name: Cranberry Bourbon Sour
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the cranberry syrup, bourbon, lemon juice, cranberry juice, and orange bitters.
Add ice to the shaker, then shake vigorously until well-chilled.
Strain the mixture into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with an orange slice and a sprig of rosemary for a festive touch.

name: Cranberry Campari Spritz
instructions: Fill a wine glass with ice.
Add the Campari and cranberry juice. Stir gently to combine.
Top with Prosecco, pouring slowly to preserve the bubbles.
Garnish with a fresh sprig of rosemary for an aromatic finish.
Serve immediately and enjoy this festive delight. Cheers!

name: Cranberry Champagne Cocktail
instructions: In a chilled Champagne flute, add 1 ounce of cranberry juice and squeeze in the juice from a lime wedge.
Slowly fill the flute with chilled Champagne to preserve the bubbles.
Skewered 3 or 4 fresh cranberries into the glass for a festive touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy this refreshing, bubbly cocktail!

name: Cranberry Collins
instructions: Fill a Collins glass with ice cubes.
In a cocktail shaker, combine the gin, lemon juice, cranberry juice, and cranberry simple syrup.
Add ice to the shaker and shake well until chilled.
Strain the mixture into the prepared Collins glass over ice.
Top off with club soda.
Garnish with frozen cranberries and a lemon slice.
Stir gently and enjoy your refreshing Cranberry Collins.

name: Cranberry Daiquiri
instructions: Measure out all the ingredients and have them ready to go.
Fill a cocktail shaker halfway with ice.
Pour the white rum, cranberry juice, lime juice, and simple syrup into the shaker.
Shake well for about 15-20 seconds until the mixture is well chilled.
Strain the mixture into a chilled cocktail glass.
Twist the orange peel over the glass to release the oils, then drop it in as a garnish.
Serve immediately and enjoy your refreshing Cranberry Daiquiri.

name: Cranberry Gimlet
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.
Add the gin, unsweetened cranberry juice, lime juice, and simple syrup to the shaker.
Shake well until the mixture is chilled.
Strain the mixture into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with cranberries.
Enjoy your refreshing Cranberry Gimlet.

name: Cranberry Gin Fizz
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the gin, lemon juice, cranberry simple syrup, and egg white.
Dry shake (shake without ice) vigorously for about 15 seconds to emulsify the egg white.
Add ice to the shaker and shake again for about 15-20 seconds, until well-chilled.
Strain the mixture into a chilled highball or Collins glass.
Top off with soda water, gently stirring to combine.
Optionally, garnish with a few fresh cranberries or a twist of lemon peel.

name: Cranberry Ginger Paloma
ingredients: Salt and cinnamon for rimming the glass
instructions: Rim a highball glass with a mixture of salt and cinnamon.
In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, combine the tequila, cranberry juice, grapefruit juice, and agave syrup.
Shake the mixture well to chill and blend the ingredients.
Strain the mixture into the prepared highball glass over fresh ice.
Top with ginger beer to finish the cocktail.
Garnish and enjoy!

name: Cranberry Jalapeño Margarita
ingredients: Fresh cranberries and jalapeño slices (for garnish)
instructions: Brush the rim of a rocks glass with lime juice, then dip it in sugar to coat.
Fill the glass with ice and set aside.
In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, combine cranberry juice, tequila, jalapeño simple syrup, and lime juice.
Shake well to chill and mix the ingredients.
Strain the mixture into the prepared glass.
Garnish with fresh cranberries and slices of jalapeño for a festive and spicy touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Cranberry Jalapeño Margarita!

name: Cranberry Margarita with Apple-Cinnamon Tequila
ingredients: Apple wedge or lime twist for garnish
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the apple-cinnamon tequila, triple sec, cranberry juice, and lime juice.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake well until the mixture is thoroughly chilled.
Strain the mixture into a chilled margarita or cocktail glass.
Garnish with an apple wedge or lime twist.
Serve and enjoy.

name: Cranberry Margarita
ingredients: Salt or sugar (for rimming the glass)
instructions: Run a lime wedge around the rim of your glass.
Dip the rim into salt or sugar (whichever you prefer).
Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.
Add tequila, triple sec, cranberry juice, lime juice, and simple syrup to the shaker.
Shake well for about 15-20 seconds until the mixture is well-chilled.
Fill your prepared glass with ice.
Strain the margarita mixture into the glass.
Garnish with a lime wedge and a few fresh cranberries.

name: Cranberry Orange Bourbon Cocktail
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the orange juice, cranberry juice, bourbon, and maple syrup.
Add ice to the shaker, then secure the lid and shake vigorously until the mixture is well-chilled.
Strain the cocktail into a rocks glass over fresh ice.
Garnish with a few fresh cranberries and a rosemary sprig to add a festive touch.

name: Cranberry Orange Fizz
instructions: Place about 8-10 cranberries and half an orange, cut up, into a large glass or shaker.
Muddle the cranberries and orange pieces until well mashed.
Add gin or vodka, freshly squeezed lemon juice, cranberry juice, orange juice, and ice to the muddled mixture.
Stir thoroughly to combine and chill the ingredients.
Strain the mixture into a cocktail glass filled with ice.
Top off the glass with Prosecco or sparkling water, or a combination of both.
Garnish with an orange slice and sugar-coated cranberries.
Enjoy your Cranberry Orange Fizz Cocktail!

name: Cranberry Orange Sangria
instructions: In a large pitcher, pour in the white wine, tequila, cranberry juice, triple sec, orange juice, and simple syrup.
Stir gently to combine the flavors.
Add the frozen cranberries and orange slices to the pitcher for a festive touch.
Serve immediately or let it chill in the fridge for 1-2 hours to enhance the flavors.
Pour into glasses and enjoy this vibrant holiday sangria!

name: Cranberry Orange Whiskey Punch
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice and add the whiskey, brandy, simple syrup, lemon juice, cranberry juice, and orange juice.
Stir gently until all the ingredients are well combined and chilled.
Strain the mixture into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with an orange slice and a few fresh cranberries for a festive presentation.
Serve immediately and enjoy this delightful holiday punch!

name: Cranberry Peppermint Twist
ingredients: Crushed candy canes (for rimming the glass)
instructions: Begin by preparing the glass: place a small amount of water in a shallow bowl and dip the rim of the glass into it.
Spread the crushed candy canes on a plate, then dip the moistened rim into the crushed candy to coat.
In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, combine the vodka, cranberry juice, and peppermint schnapps.
Shake well until the mixture is chilled.
Strain the drink into the prepared glass and serve immediately.

name: Cranberry Spritz
instructions: Fill a wine glass with ice.
Pour in 1 oz of Aperol.
Add 1 oz of cranberry juice.
Top off with 3 oz of Champagne or Prosecco.
Gently stir to combine.
Garnish with an orange slice if desired.

name: Cranberry Thyme Spritz
ingredients: Star anise and grapefruit slice (for garnish (optional))
instructions: In a medium pot, bring 4 ounces of water, honey, cranberries, thyme, and sliced ginger to a boil over high heat. Let boil for about 5 minutes, or until the cranberries start to burst.
Remove the pot from the heat and allow the mixture to cool. Remove the thyme and ginger slices. For a smoother syrup, strain out the cranberries if desired.
In a large pitcher, combine the cranberry syrup mixture with the vodka, elderflower liqueur, grapefruit juice, and lime juice. Chill until ready to serve.
Just before serving, add the ginger beer to the pitcher, stirring gently.
Garnish each glass with a slice of grapefruit and a star anise for an aromatic, festive touch.

name: Cranberry-Vodka Fizz
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine cranberry juice, pomegranate juice, vodka, and grenadine syrup.
Add ice to the shaker and shake vigorously for about 10 seconds.
Strain the mixture into a highball glass filled with ice.
Top with sparkling water to add a refreshing fizz.
Garnish with sprigs of fresh rosemary and a handful of frozen cranberries.
Serve and enjoy!

name: Cranberry Vodka Lemonade
instructions: Fill a tall glass with ice cubes.
Pour vodka over the ice.
Add cranberry juice and lemonade.
Top it off with ginger beer.
Stir gently to combine all the ingredients.
Garnish with a sprig of mint and a few slices of fresh ginger.
Enjoy your refreshing Cranberry Vodka Lemonade.

name: Cranberry Whiskey Sour
ingredients: Lemon slice and cranberries for garnish
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine whiskey, lemon juice, cranberry juice, and simple syrup.
Add a few ice cubes and shake well until the mixture is chilled.
Strain the cocktail into a glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a slice of lemon and a few cranberries for a festive touch.

name: Chocolate Martini
instructions: Drizzle chocolate syrup inside a martini glass.
In a shaker, put ice and add vanilla vodka, chocolate liqueur, and Baileys.
Shake it until it's very cold.
Strain the mix into your glass.
Grate some dark chocolate on top for a special touch.

name: Creamy Pumpkin Spice Martini
instructions: Combine the cinnamon and sugar in a shallow bowl or dish. Moisten the rim of a martini glass with water and dip it into the cinnamon sugar mixture to coat evenly.
Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Add the RumChata, vanilla vodka, pumpkin puree, and pumpkin pie spice.
Shake vigorously for 15-20 seconds to thoroughly mix and chill the ingredients.
Strain the cocktail into the prepared martini glass.
Enjoy your Creamy Pumpkin Spice Martini chilled.

name: Crown Apple Crème Martini
ingredients: 2 oz Crown Royal Regal Apple Whisky
½ oz caramel syrup (plus more for garnish)
Apple slice and caramel drizzle for garnish
Crushed graham crackers (optional, for rimming the glass)
instructions: Prepare the glass: If desired, rim a martini glass with caramel syrup, then dip it into crushed graham crackers for a sweet, crunchy edge.
Shake the martini: In a cocktail shaker, combine the Crown Royal Apple Whisky, vanilla vodka, Irish cream, caramel syrup, and half-and-half (or heavy cream). Add a handful of ice.
Shake well for about 15-20 seconds until the mixture is frothy and well-chilled.
Serve: Strain the mixture into your prepared martini glass.
Garnish: Add a drizzle of caramel syrup on top, and place a thin slice of apple on the rim of the glass for a perfect fall touch.
Enjoy this smooth and creamy martini with a rich blend of apple whiskey, vanilla, and caramel flavors!

name: How to Make a Crown Royal and Cranberry
instructions: Add Crown Royal to a glass filled with ice.
Top with cranberry juice, to taste.
Stir and enjoy!

name: Cuban Peach
instructions: Start by muddling the fresh peach slice in the bottom of a cocktail shaker to release its juices and flavor.
Fill the cocktail shaker with ice.
Add the white rum, peach schnapps, lime juice, and simple syrup to the shaker.
Shake well to combine and chill the ingredients.
Fill the rocks glass with ice.
Strain the mixture over the ice in each glass.
Garnish with a peach wedge and a sprig of fresh mint for a vibrant and aromatic touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Cuban Peach!

name: Cucumber Crush
ingredients: Cucumber slice and mint sprig for garnish
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, muddle the cucumber slices and mint leaves together to release their flavors.
Add the vodka (or gin), lime juice, and simple syrup to the shaker.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake well until the mixture is chilled.
Strain the mixture into a glass filled with ice.
Top with club soda for a refreshing fizz.
Garnish with a slice of cucumber and a sprig of mint.
Enjoy your Cucumber Crush.

name: Cucumber Gin Blossom
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, muddle the cucumber slice and mint leaves to release their fresh flavors.
Add the lime juice, simple syrup, apple juice, elderflower liqueur, and ice to the shaker.
Cover and shake vigorously until well chilled.
Double strain the mixture into a glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with Empress 1908 Gin, allowing the vibrant color to float on top.
Garnish with a cucumber slice and mint sprig for a refreshing and elegant presentation. Serve immediately.

name: Cuke Skywalker
instructions: Begin by preparing your glass. Use a brush or your finger to coat the rim with agave syrup, then roll it in Tajin until evenly coated. Set the glass aside.
In a cocktail shaker, muddle the cucumber slices with simple syrup to release their fresh, cooling flavor.
Add vodka, elderflower liqueur, lime juice, and chile bitters to the shaker.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously to chill and blend the ingredients.
Strain the mixture into the prepared glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a cucumber slice for a crisp, refreshing touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Cuke Skywalker!

name: Cupids Coffee
instructions: Add all ingredients to shaker tin with ice.
Shake and then double strain into coup glass.
Garnish with rose petal or fresh raspberries.

name: Dad's Breakfast
ingredients: - 2oz Jeptha Creed Bottled in Bond KY Straight Bourbon
- 2 dashes Jeptha Creed Ne Oublie Walnut Bitters
instructions: Combine all ingredients into mixing glass. Fill mixing glass with ice and stir. Strain into rocks glass over ice. Garnish with maple bacon and luxardo cherry.

name: Dark Chocolate Old Fashioned
instructions: Take an Old Fashioned glass and fill it with ice to chill. Set aside.
In a mixing glass, combine 2 oz of bourbon, 2 dashes of orange bitters, and 1 oz of Sweetend dark chocolate syrup.
Fill the mixing glass with ice and stir for about 30 seconds until well chilled.
Discard the ice from the chilled Old Fashioned glass.
Strain the mixed drink into the glass over one large ice cube or a few smaller ice cubes.
Garnish with a dehydrated orange slice by placing it on the edge of the glass or floating it on top of the drink.
Sip and savor the rich, complex flavors of the Dark Chocolate Old Fashioned.

name: Dark n Stormy Daniels
ingredients: 1/2 oz Jack Daniel's Whiskey (for the float)
instructions: Prepare the Glass: Fill a highball glass with ice to chill it.
Mix the Base: In the glass, pour 1 1/2 oz of Gosling's Dark Rum and 1/2 oz of fresh lime juice.
Add Ginger Beer: Slowly top the mixture with 3 oz of ginger beer, gently stirring to combine without losing the carbonation.
Float the Whiskey: Carefully pour 1/2 oz of Jack Daniel's Whiskey over the back of a spoon so it floats on top of the drink.
Garnish and Serve: Garnish with a lime wheel or a thin slice of lime on the rim of the glass. Serve immediately.

name: Day of the Dead
instructions: Begin by rimming a highball glass with salt. Fill the glass with ice and set aside.
In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, add the blood orange syrup, tequila, and lime juice.
Shake hard to combine and chill the ingredients.
Fine strain the mixture into the prepared highball glass over fresh ice.
Top with club soda for a light, bubbly finish.
Garnish with a slice of blood orange for a vibrant and festive touch.
Serve and enjoy your Day of the Dead cocktail, a perfect blend of citrus and tequila!

name: Dead Man's Potion
instructions: Fill a wine glass with ice.
In a cocktail shaker, combine grenadine, lemon juice, blue curaçao, pomegranate juice, vodka, and a pinch of purple glitter.
Shake well until the mixture is cold and the glitter is evenly mixed.
Strain the cocktail into the wine glass over the ice.
Top with club soda and garnish with a lemon wheel.

name: Deadpool Cocktail
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, muddle the wild blueberries to release their juices.
Add the vodka, lemon juice, and grenadine to the shaker.
Shake vigorously to blend the flavors and chill the drink.
Fine strain the mixture into an ice-filled highball glass, filtering out the blueberry skins and seeds.
Top up with club soda, giving the drink a light, bubbly fizz.
Stir gently to combine, then garnish with a sprig of fresh mint for a refreshing aromatic touch.

name: Death in the Afternoon
ingredients: Garnish with a rose petal or lemon twist
instructions: Chill your champagne flute or coupe in the freezer for at least 10 minutes before making the cocktail.
Pour a jigger of absinthe (1.5 ounces) into the chilled glass. Note that you can use any brand of absinthe, but Hemingway's favorite was Pernod.
Top the absinthe with chilled champagne or sparkling wine. You can also use prosecco or cava as an alternative to champagne.
Stir gently to combine the ingredients. Be careful not to stir too vigorously, as this can cause spontaneous emulsification, resulting in an opalescent milkiness in the cocktail.
Garnish with a sugar cube or a lemon twist. Some people also like to add a dash of bitters for extra flavor.

name: Devil's Kiss
instructions: Begin by preparing the glass: on a small plate, mix together granulated sugar and a pinch of cayenne pepper. Wet the rim of your glass with a bit of water or citrus, then dip the rim into the sugar and cayenne pepper mixture to coat it evenly.
Fill a cocktail shaker with ice and add the dark rum, Kahlua, and two dashes of Grand Marnier.
Shake the mixture well until the ingredients are fully combined and chilled.
Strain the cocktail into the prepared glass, being careful not to disturb the sugared rim.
Serve immediately and enjoy the sweet heat of this devilishly delicious cocktail.

name: Devil’s Lemonade
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker halfway with ice.
Pour the bourbon whiskey, lemonade, and pomegranate juice into the shaker.
Secure the lid and shake vigorously  to combine and chill the ingredients.
Strain the mixture into a double old-fashioned glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a lemon wedge for a finishing touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy your refreshing Devil’s Lemonade!

name: Devil's Smash
instructions: Fill your glass halfway with ice cubes.
Pour in the spiced rum, red wine, and vanilla simple syrup.
Stir gently to combine the flavors.
Top with ginger beer, then stir again to ensure everything is mixed well.
Garnish with cherries, if desired, and serve immediately.

name: Diamond Blue
instructions: Chill a champagne flute by placing it in the freezer for a few minutes or filling it with ice water while you prepare the cocktail.
In a shaker, combine gin, creme de violette, blue curaçao, and freshly squeezed lemon juice.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake well for about 15 seconds until the mixture is chilled.
Discard the ice water from the champagne flute if you used it for chilling.
Double strain the mixture from the shaker into the chilled champagne flute.
Slowly top the cocktail with the chilled Champagne.
Lightly dust the top of the cocktail with edible silver powder for a shimmering finish.
Serve immediately and enjoy your elegant Diamond Blue cocktail.

name: Dill-ightful Cocktail
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, muddle cucumber and a sprig of dill until well combined.
Add fresh ground black pepper, vodka or gin, and lemon juice to the shaker.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously.
Prepare your serving glass by brushing the rim with lemon juice and sprinkling it with a mix of salt and pepper.
Double strain the mixture into the prepared glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a rolled cucumber slice and a fresh sprig of dill.
Enjoy!

name: Dirty Banana
instructions: Put the banana, coffee liqueur, dark rum, milk (or cream), and chocolate syrup into a blender.
Add a cup of ice cubes.
Blend everything until it's smooth.
Pour the mixture into your chilled glass.
Garnish with a slice of banana or a sprinkle of chocolate shavings.

name: Dirty Girl Scout
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker halfway with ice cubes.
Add the green crème de menthe, Baileys, vodka, and Kahlua to the shaker.
Shake well until chilled and thoroughly combined.
Strain the mixture into a shot glass.
Serve and enjoy immediately!

name: Dirty Irishman Cocktail
instructions: Chill Your Glass:
Start by chilling a cocktail glass in the freezer to keep your drink cool and refreshing.
Mix the Base:
In a shaker, combine the Irish whiskey, Irish cream, and chilled coffee. This will form the alcoholic base of your cocktail.
Shake it Up:
Add ice to the shaker until it is about halfway full.
Secure the lid and shake vigorously for about 15 seconds. This not only chills the mixture but also dilutes it slightly, balancing the flavors.
Prepare the Glass:
Remove your cocktail glass from the freezer. If you like, you can swirl a little Irish cream around the inside of the glass for an extra touch of creaminess and visual appeal.
Strain:
Strain the mixture from the shaker into your chilled cocktail glass, leaving the ice behind in the shaker.
Float the Cream:
Carefully pour the heavy cream over the back of a spoon onto the top of the drink. This technique helps the cream float on top rather than mixing in, creating a layered effect.
Garnish (optional):
For a classic touch, you can garnish with a sprinkle of cocoa powder or a few coffee beans on top of the cream.
Serve and Enjoy:
Serve immediately and enjoy the rich, creamy, and invigorating flavors of your Dirty Irishman Cocktail.

name: Dirty Santa
instructions: Coat the rim of your glass with coconut cream, then dip it into coconut flakes to create a snowy rim.
In a shaker filled with ice, combine the vodka, lime juice, and grenadine. Shake vigorously for 10–15 seconds until well chilled.
Strain the mixture into the prepared glass filled with fresh ice.
Add Sprite to fill the glass and gently stir to combine.
Add a maraschino cherry for a festive finishing touch. Serve immediately and enjoy!

name: Dirty Snowman
instructions: Place two scoops of vanilla ice cream into your favorite cocktail glass or mug.
Pour the Baileys Irish Cream and chocolate liqueur over the ice cream.
Slowly pour hot chocolate over the ice cream and liqueurs, allowing it to mix naturally.
Top generously with whipped cream.
Sprinkle mini chocolate chips over the whipped cream for a festive and delicious garnish. Serve immediately.

name: Double Cherry Old Fashioned
ingredients: 1/2 ounce Cherry Syrup (from the cherry luxardo jar)
instructions: Chill the Glass:
Begin by chilling an Old Fashioned glass by placing it in the freezer or filling it with ice water for a few minutes.
Mix Ingredients:
In a mixing glass, combine the bourbon, cherry syrup, and maraschino liqueur.
Add a dash of aromatic bitters and a dash of orange bitters.
Stir:
Fill the mixing glass with ice and stir the mixture well until it is well-chilled. This usually takes about 30 seconds.
Prepare the Glass:
Remove your Old Fashioned glass from the freezer or empty the ice water if you were chilling it that way and fill the glass with ice.
Strain:
Strain the cocktail mixture over the ice in the prepared Old Fashioned glass. Make sure to pour it slowly to maintain clarity and texture.
Garnish:
Express the oils of an orange twist over the drink and then rim the glass with the twist. Drop the twist into the drink as a garnish.
Serve:
Serve immediately and enjoy your Double Cherry Old Fashioned.

name: Dr Pepper Margarita
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the tequila, triple sec, and lime juice.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously for about 10 seconds.
Strain the mixture into a glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with Dr. Pepper cola
Garnish with a lime wheel.
Enjoy!

name: Dracula's Blood Cocktail
ingredients: Maraschino cherries or plastic vampire teeth (garnish, optional)
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice and add the white rum, peach schnapps, black cherry juice, and Grenadine.
Shake the mixture vigorously until it is well chilled and the ingredients are fully combined.
Strain the cocktail into a chilled martini glass, allowing the deep red liquid to pool dramatically in the glass.
Garnish with a fresh cherry, a maraschino cherry, or for a fun, spooky touch, add a pair of plastic vampire teeth on the rim.
Serve immediately and enjoy this blood-red, hauntingly delicious cocktail.

name: Dracula’s Daiquiri
instructions: On a small plate, mix the honey and 1 drop of red food coloring. Dip the rim of a coupe glass into the mixture, coating it evenly. Place the glass in the freezer to set the red honey.
In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, add the rum, lime juice, and grenadine.
Shake vigorously until the mixture is well-chilled.
Strain the cocktail into the prepared coupe glass with the red honey rim.
Garnish with plastic vampire fangs for an eerie touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy your spine-chilling Dracula’s Daiquiri!

name: Dracula's Punch
instructions: In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, combine the apple juice, cranberry juice, berry vodka, orange liqueur, lime juice, and fruit punch.
Shake well until thoroughly mixed and chilled.
Strain the cocktail into a glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with ginger ale for a touch of fizz.
Garnish with a sprig of fresh thyme for an earthy aroma and spooky vibe.
Serve and enjoy your Dracula's Punch, a deliciously fruity cocktail with a mystical twist!

name: Draculas Tequila
instructions: Begin by muddling the blackberries in the bottom of a Collins glass to release their rich, dark juices.
Fill the glass with ice to prepare it for the cocktail.
In a cocktail shaker, add the jalapeño slices and muddle them gently to release their spicy flavor.
Add the tequila, grapefruit juice, simple syrup, and crème de cassis to the shaker.
Add ice to the shaker and give it a short, brisk shake to combine and chill the ingredients.
Strain the mixture into the prepared Collins glass over the muddled blackberries and ice.
Top off the cocktail with grapefruit soda, then stir gently to combine the flavors.
Serve immediately and enjoy your  Draculas Tequila cocktail.

name: Dragon Fruit Coconut Margarita
instructions: In your blender, add the dragon fruit smoothie pack, pineapple juice, orange liqueur, tequila, coconut cream (with added water), and a handful of ice. Blend until smooth.
Prepare your rocks glass by brushing the rim with agave syrup and dipping it in salt.
Pour the blended mixture into the prepped glass.
Garnish with a slice of fresh dragon fruit and get ready to enjoy!

name: Dragonade
instructions: Fill a glass with ice to keep your drink cool.
Pour 2 oz of Fireball Cinnamon Whiskey over the ice.
Fill the rest of the glass with lemonade, according to how strong you want your drink to be.
Stir well to make sure the whiskey and lemonade are fully mixed.
Garnish with a slice of lemon for an extra touch of freshness, if you like.

name: Dragonfruit Diva
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, muddle a few chunks of dragonfruit until well mashed.
Add tequila, dry vermouth, lime juice, agave syrup, and egg white to the shaker.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously until the mixture is chilled and frothy.
Fine strain the cocktail into a chilled coupe glass to remove the pulp.
Garnish with a slice of dragonfruit and serve.

name: Dragonfruit Lemonade Cocktail
instructions: Let the frozen dragonfruit chunks defrost for about 5 minutes.
Place the dragonfruit chunks in a cocktail shaker.
Add the freshly squeezed lemon juice and simple syrup (optional) to the shaker.
Muddle the dragonfruit, lemon juice, and simple syrup together until well combined.
Add the citron vodka and ice to the shaker and shake vigorously for 15 seconds.
Fill a wine glass with ice.
Strain the contents of the shaker into the wine glass.
Top off the glass with lemonade.
Enjoy your Dragonfruit Lemonade Cocktail!

name: Drunk Ghost
instructions: Fill a highball glass with ice.
Pour Malibu rum and anilla vodka into the glass.
Add coconut cream.
Top up with Sprite.
Skewer a marshmallow and place it on the rim of the glass for garnish.
Stir gently and serve immediately.

name: Drunk Pumpkin
instructions: Fill a mason jar with ice.
Pour in the vodka, pumpkin spice syrup, ginger beer, and add the orange food coloring.
Stir gently with a bar spoon until the ingredients are well combined and evenly colored.
Garnish with a ghost peep on the rim for a spooky touch.

name: Drunk Reindeer
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice, then add vodka and chocolate liqueur.
Pour the hot chocolate into the shaker.
Seal the shaker and shake vigorously until the ingredients are well-mixed and chilled.
Strain the drink into a glass or mug.
Top with whipped cream, then garnish with chocolate shavings, two cinnamon sticks, and a cherry placed on the whipped cream.
Serve and enjoy your festive creation!

name: Drunk Witch
instructions: Begin by dipping the rim of your glass into corn syrup, ensuring an even coating. Next, dip the rim into green sugar to create a vibrant, festive edge. Set the glass aside.
Fill a cocktail shaker with ice, then add the vodka, blue curaçao, and grenadine.
Cover the shaker and shake well until the ingredients are thoroughly chilled and mixed.
Strain the mixture into the prepared glass filled with fresh ice.
Top the cocktail with Sprite, filling the glass to the desired level. with star sprinkles for an extra magical touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Drunk Witch cocktail!

name: Drunken Mermaid
instructions: Chill a large cocktail glass by filling it with ice water. Let it sit while you prepare the cocktail.
In a cocktail shaker, combine the vodka, Blue Curaçao, simple syrup, and lime juice.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake well for about 15-20 seconds until the mixture is well-chilled.
Empty the ice water from the chilled glass.
Strain the shaken mixture into the glass.
Top off with the watermelon-flavored spiked sparkling water to add a refreshing fizz.
Add a slice of lemon or lime to the rim of the glass for a finishing touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy your refreshing Drunken Mermaid cocktail.

name: Dublin Old Fashioned
instructions: Place the sugar cube in the bottom of the Old Fashioned glass.
Add the bitters and a splash of water.
Muddle (smash) these ingredients together until the sugar is mostly dissolved.
Fill the glass with ice cubes.
Pour the Irish whiskey over the ice.
Stir the drink gently to mix well.
Garnish with a twist of orange peel.

name: Dubliner
instructions: Step 1: mix all ingredients with ice in a mixing glass
Step 2: strain into a chilled coupe or martini glass
Step 3: garnish with a cherry

name: Duck Fart Shot
instructions: Pour 1/2 oz. Kahlua directly into the shot glass.
Layer 1/2 oz. Bailey's on top. Slowly pouring over the bar spoon.
Layer 1/2 oz. of whiskey on top by slowly pouring over the bar spoon.

name: Earl Grey Blackberry Bourbon Cocktail
ingredients: ½ oz St. George Spiced Pear Liqueur (optional)
Garnish: blackberry and a sprig of rosemary
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, muddle the blackberry with the simple syrup until well mashed.
Add the bourbon, chilled Earl Grey tea, spiced pear liqueur (if using), and ice to the shaker.
Stir the mixture until very cold.
Strain the cocktail through a fine mesh strainer into a coupe glass to remove any pulp and seeds.
Garnish with a blackberry and a sprig of rosemary. For a fancy touch, poke the rosemary sprig into the blackberry and lay it across the top of the glass.
Enjoy your Earl Grey Blackberry Bourbon Cocktail!

name: Earl Grey–Bourbon Punch
ingredients: 2 ounces Earl Grey tea (4 tea bags)
2  sprigs fresh rosemary (plus more for garnish)
instructions: In a heatproof bowl, combine the loose Earl Grey tea (or tea bags) with 10 ounces of boiling water. Let steep for 5 minutes, then strain through a fine-mesh sieve into a measuring glass. Allow the tea to cool.

In a small saucepan, bring the honey, thyme, rosemary sprigs, and 4 ounces water to a gentle simmer over medium heat, stirring to combine. Once the honey is dissolved, let the mixture cool and remove the herbs.
In a large pitcher or punch bowl, mix the cooled tea, honey syrup, lemon juice, bourbon, Cognac, and bitters. Add 2 cups of ice, stirring until the ice melts and the punch is well-chilled.
Pour the punch into tumblers filled with ice. Garnish each glass with a rosemary sprig and a lemon wheel for a festive presentation.

name: Eggnog Martini
instructions: Pour a small amount of amaretto onto a plate. Dip the rim of the martini glass into the amaretto, then coat the rim with brown sugar mixed with a pinch of ground nutmeg.
Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Add the vanilla vodka, amaretto, and eggnog.
Shake vigorously until the ingredients are well-mixed and chilled. Strain into the prepared martini glass.
Sprinkle ground nutmeg over the top of the drink for a festive touch. For added touch, place a cinnamon stick into the glass.

name: Eggnog Mimosa
instructions: Start by adding eggnog to a champagne flute, letting the creamy base settle in the glass.
Slowly pour Champagne over the eggnog to maintain the fizz. Be cautious to prevent any overflow as the bubbles rise.
Stir gently with a bar spoon if desired, or simply let the bubbles naturally mix with the eggnog for a layered effect.
Finish by sprinkling a dash of ground nutmeg over the top and adding a cinnamon stick for a touch of warmth and festive aroma.
Raise your glass, toast to the season, and enjoy the unique twist on a holiday classic!

name: Eggnog with Baileys
instructions: Mix the Liquids:
In a large pitcher, combine the Baileys Irish Cream Liqueur with the chilled eggnog.
Stir gently to mix well.
Add Spices:
Sprinkle a generous amount of ground cinnamon and a pinch of ground nutmeg into the mixture.
Stir these spices into the eggnog and Baileys mixture to blend the flavors together.
Chill:
Place the pitcher in the refrigerator to allow the flavors to meld together and the mixture to chill thoroughly.
Serve:
Pour the chilled eggnog mixture into individual glasses.
Garnish:
Top each glass with a sprinkle of ground cinnamon and nutmeg.
Add a cinnamon stick to each glass for a festive touch.
Enjoy:
Serve immediately and enjoy the creamy richness of Baileys blended with traditional holiday eggnog.

name: Elderflower Apple Martini
instructions: Add ice to your cocktail shaker, followed by the elderflower liqueur, vodka, apple juice, honey, and lime juice.
Shake vigorously for 30 seconds to chill and mix all the ingredients thoroughly.
Strain the mixture into a chilled coupe or martini glass.
For an extra touch of drama, add a chunk of dry ice (optional) to the glass.
Garnish with a green apple slice and serve immediately.

name: Elderflower Citrus Fizz
instructions: Begin by preparing your glass. Brush the rim of a highball glass with agave syrup, then dip it into a small plate of salt to coat evenly. Set the glass aside.
In a cocktail shaker, combine the vodka, elderflower liqueur, grapefruit juice, lime juice, and simple syrup.
Shake the mixture vigorously to blend the flavors and chill the ingredients.
Strain the mixture into the prepared glass filled with fresh ice.
Top the cocktail with sparkling grapefruit to add a fizzy, refreshing finish.
Garnish with a rolled grapefruit wheel and a sprig of mint for a refreshing touch.
Serve and enjoy your Elderflower Citrus Fizz!

name: Electric Lemonade
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.
Add vodka and blue curaçao to the shaker.
Pour in lemonade.
Shake well until the mixture is chilled.
Strain the mixture into a glass filled with ice.
Garnish with a lemon slice on the rim of the glass.

name: Electric Raspberry Splash
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the blue curaçao, vodka, lemon juice, and simple syrup.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake it well to chill and combine the ingredients.
Prepare your rocks glass by brushing the rim with agave syrup and dipping it into the red popping candy.
Strain the mixture into the prepped glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with soda, garnish with two raspberries, and get ready to enjoy!

name: Electric Shark Cocktail
instructions: Fill a cocktail glass with ice cubes.
Pour the Captain Morgan rum, blue curaçao, and pineapple juice over the ice.
Gently stir to combine the ingredients.
Top off the drink with ginger beer for a fizzy finish.
Garnish with an orange slice and maraschino cherry.

name: Elf Mojito
instructions: Place fresh mint leaves and lime juice in a glass. Use a muddler to gently press the mint to release its oils.
Pour in the rum and midori, giving the glass a gentle stir to combine.
Fill the glass with ice and top with soda water to your preference.
Finish with a fresh mint leaf and a lime wheel for garnish. Serve immediately and enjoy!

name: Espresso Martini
instructions: Add all the ingredients into a shaker, then fill with ice
Shake hard for about 30 seconds, make sure to shake well, as this is what creates the froth
Double strain into your glass. You can use a sieve to double strain in one pour
Garnish the froth with three coffee beans

name: Espresso Negroni
ingredients: 1 oz Freshly Brewed Espresso (cooled to room temperature)
instructions: Chill the Glass:
Start by chilling your serving glass in the freezer. A cold glass will keep your drink crisp.
Mix the Ingredients:
In a mixing glass, combine the gin, Campari, sweet vermouth, and espresso.
Fill the mixing glass with ice, stirring well for about 30 seconds to chill the mixture and dilute it slightly.
Strain:
Take your chilled glass out of the freezer and strain the mixture into it. A fine-mesh strainer can ensure a smooth drink without any coffee grounds or ice chips.
Garnish:
Express the oil of an orange peel over the drink by twisting it, then run the peel around the rim of the glass before dropping it in as a garnish.
Serve:
Enjoy your Espresso Negroni immediately for the best taste experience.

name: Espresso Rumtini
ingredients: Coffee beans or grated chocolate (for garnish)
instructions: Chill Your Glass:
Start by placing your martini glass in the freezer to chill. A cold glass will keep your Espresso Rumtini crisp.
Brew Espresso:
Brew a strong shot of espresso and allow it to cool. This will be the base of your cocktail, offering a robust coffee flavor.
Mix the Drink:
In a cocktail shaker, combine the dark rum, cooled espresso, coffee liqueur, and simple syrup.
Add ice if desired.
Shake It Up:
Shake the mixture vigorously for about 15 seconds. Shaking not only chills the drink but also introduces a slight frothiness.
Strain and Serve:
Strain the mixture into your chilled martini glass. The fine strain will ensure a smooth drink without ice chips.
Garnish and Enjoy:
Garnish your Espresso Rumtini with a few coffee beans or a sprinkle of grated chocolate on top for an added touch of elegance.

name: Espresso Sugar Cookie Martini
instructions: Add espresso, vanilla vodka, amaretto, Baileys Irish Cream, and cream to a cocktail shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously for at least 15-30 seconds; the longer you shake, the more froth you will create.
Pour the mixture from the shaker into a chilled martini glass.
Sprinkle cacao bits on top of the froth.
Enjoy your Espresso Sugar Cookie Martini!

name: Fall from the Tree
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the bourbon, apple juice, cinnamon syrup, lemon juice, and aromatic bitters.
Add ice to the shaker and shake until the mixture is well-chilled.
Strain the mixture into a chilled coupe glass.
Garnish with an apple slice.
Enjoy your Fall from the Tree cocktail!

name: Fall Gin and Tonic
instructions: Fill a glass with ice.
Add 2 oz of apple-infused London gin to the glass.
Top with 4 oz of tonic water.
Stir gently to combine.
Garnish with a cinnamon stick and a star anise.
Cheers and enjoy!

name: Fall Gin Sangria
ingredients: 1 bottle Dry White or Sparkling wine
instructions: In a large pitcher or punch bowl, combine Empress 1908 Indigo Gin, brandy, sparkling wine, pomegranate juice, black tea, soda water, and cinnamon syrup.
Add cinnamon sticks, apple slices, pear slices, and orange slices to the mixture.
Stir thoroughly to ensure all ingredients are well combined.
Cover and let the sangria sit in the refrigerator overnight to allow the flavors to meld.
Before serving, add ice to the pitcher or punch bowl to keep the sangria chilled.
Serve in glasses, making sure to include some of the fruit slices and a cinnamon stick in each serving.

name: Fall in Paradise
instructions: Begin by filling a highball glass with crushed ice to chill.
In a cocktail shaker, combine the Demerara rum, apple cider, pineapple juice, allspice dram, lime juice, and bitters.
Add a handful of ice to the shaker.
Shake the mixture vigorously until well-chilled and all the flavors are thoroughly combined.
Strain the cocktail into the prepared highball glass over the crushed ice.
Garnish with cherries and a pineapple wedge for a tropical touch, if desired.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Fall in Paradise cocktail.

name: Fall Margarita
ingredients: Cinnamon sticks (rosemary, and apple slices for garnish)
instructions: In a shaker, combine the lime juice, maple syrup, Mezcal, apple juice, and ice. Stir for 30 seconds to ensure all the ingredients are well mixed.

For the sugar rim (optional), mix the sugar and cinnamon in a shallow bowl. Rub a lime wedge around the rim of your rocks glass, then dip the rims into the cinnamon-sugar mixture, twisting slightly to coat evenly.
Carefully pour the margarita mixture into the rimmed glass.
Garnish each glass with a cinnamon stick, a sprig of rosemary, and a slice of apple.
Cheers and enjoy your Fall Margarita!

name: Fall Pumpkin Spice Margarita
ingredients: Pumpkin pie spice and granulated sugar (for rimming)
Orange peel and/or cinnamon stick (garnish, optional)
instructions: On a small plate, mix pumpkin pie spice and granulated sugar. Run an orange slice around the rim of your cocktail glass, then roll the rim in the pumpkin spice sugar mixture to coat it evenly.
In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, add the pumpkin puree, orange juice, lemon juice, triple sec, tequila, and orange bitters.
Shake vigorously until well chilled.
Strain the mixture into the prepared glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with an orange peel or a cinnamon stick for a festive touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy the warm, spiced flavors of this fall-inspired margarita.

name: Fall Spiced Whiskey Sour
ingredients: Apple slice (sprig of rosemary, or other festive garnish (optional))
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, add the whiskey, apple cider, lemon juice, maple syrup and pumpkin pie spice.
Fill the shaker with plenty of ice.
Secure the lid and shake well until the mixture is thoroughly combined and ice cold.
Strain the cocktail into a glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with an apple slice, a sprig of rosemary, or any other festive fall-inspired garnish of your choice.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Fall Spiced Whiskey Sour. Cheers!

name: Fantarita
instructions: Fill a shaker with ice.
Add the tequila, triple sec, lime juice, and simple syrup to the shaker.
Shake well until the mixture is chilled.
Strain the mixture into a glass filled with ice.
Top with Fanta.
Garnish with a lime wheel.
Serve and enjoy your refreshing Fantarita

name: Fig and Ginger Gin Cocktail
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, muddle the fresh figs thoroughly with a muddler to release their juices and flavors.
Add the gin, ginger syrup, lime juice, and ice cubes to the shaker.
Shake well for 5-8 seconds to combine and chill the ingredients.
Using a tea strainer and the shaker’s built-in strainer, double strain the mixture into cocktail glasses filled with crushed ice.
Top the cocktail with soda water and give it a quick swizzle to mix.
Garnish with skewered fig slices and a sprig of thyme.
Enjoy your Fig and Ginger Gin Cocktail!

name: Fig Daiquiri
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice cubes, then add the white rum, lime juice, and fig syrup.
Secure the lid and shake vigorously for about 20 seconds until the mixture is well-chilled.
Strain the mixture into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a fresh slice of fig on the rim or floating in the drink.

name: Fig Old Fashioned
ingredients: Orange peel and fresh fig slice for garnish
instructions: In a mixing glass, add ice, bourbon whiskey, fig simple syrup, and 2 dashes of Angostura bitters.
Stir for about 15–20 seconds.
Strain the mixture into an old-fashioned glass with an ice ball.
Garnish with a fresh fig.

name: Fig Swizzle
instructions: Fill your glass halfway with crushed ice.
Add the rum, lemon juice, and a spoonful of fig jam to the glass.
Swizzle the ingredients vigorously using a bar spoon or swizzle stick to mix and chill the drink, ensuring the fig jam dissolves and incorporates fully.
Add more crushed ice to the glass and swizzle again to ensure the drink is fully chilled and the flavors are evenly blended.
Top the drink with a final layer of crushed ice and dash the chocolate bitters over the top.
Garnish with a fresh slice of fig for a touch of elegance.
Enjoy immediately, savoring the sweet, smoky, and complex flavors.

name: Fig Thyme Shrub
instructions: Fill a glass with crushed ice.
Pour in the vodka, lime juice, and fig thyme shrub.
Stir well to combine all the ingredients.
Add the club soda and stir gently to integrate the fizz.
Garnish with halved fresh figs and a sprig of thyme for a delightful presentation.

name: Figgin' Vanilla Gin Fizz
ingredients: 1/2 ounce fig and vanilla bean simple syrup
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.
Add the gin, fig and vanilla bean simple syrup, and orange bitters to the shaker.
Stir well to combine and chill the ingredients.
Strain the mixture into a glass with an ice cube.
Top with tonic water to your taste preference.
Garnish with a fresh fig slice.
Serve immediately and enjoy!

name: Fireball Campfire
instructions: Layer the Grenadine: Start by pouring 1 teaspoon of grenadine into the bottom of your glass.
Fill with Ice: Fill the glass to the top with ice. This will help keep your drink cold and maintain the layered look.
First Layer: In a cocktail shaker, combine rum and cranberry juice. Shake well.
Pour Carefully: Slowly pour the rum and cranberry juice mixture into the glass over the ice. Be gentle to keep the grenadine at the bottom.
Rinse and Shake Again: Rinse the cocktail shaker to remove any remaining cranberry juice. Then, add Fireball Cinnamon Whiskey,  bourbon, and peach nectar. Shake well.
Second Layer: Slowly pour the Fireball, bourbon, and peach nectar mixture into the glass. Pour carefully to create a layered effect, with red on the bottom, followed by orange, and gold on top.

name: Fireball Eggnog
instructions: Pour a bit of water or eggnog onto a small plate. Dip the rim of the glass in the liquid, then into cinnamon sugar to coat the rim evenly. Set the glass aside.
Fill a cocktail shaker with ice and add the eggnog, Fireball cinnamon whiskey, and vanilla vodka.
Shake vigorously until the mixture is well-chilled and frothy.
Strain the cocktail into the prepared glass.
Optionally, garnish with a sprinkle of cinnamon or a cinnamon stick for added flavor. Enjoy immediately!

name: Fireball Sunrise
instructions: Fill a highball glass with ice cubes to chill the glass.
Pour the Fireball Cinnamon Whiskey over the ice.
Add the orange juice gently on top of the whiskey. The idea is to maintain distinct layers before adding the grenadine.
Slowly pour the grenadine into the drink. It should sink and then gradually rise to mix with the other ingredients, creating a “sunrise” effect—gradual shading from red at the bottom to orange above.
Garnish with a slice of orange and a maraschino cherry on the rim of the glass or dropped into the drink.
Serve immediately and enjoy!

name: Fireball Thanksgiving Punch
ingredients: Optional garnishes: sliced apple halves (sliced orange halves, cinnamon sticks, star anise)
instructions: The night before your event, freeze an ice ring in a mold. Decorate the ice ring with orange slices, cinnamon sticks, or star anise for added visual appeal. Alternatively, freeze a few small apples to keep the punch chilled.
In a large punch bowl, pitchers, or a beverage dispenser, combine the chilled apple cider, Fireball whiskey, orange juice concentrate, and chilled prosecco. Stir gently to mix.
Add optional garnishes such as sliced apple halves, orange halves, cinnamon sticks, and star anise to the punch for extra flavor and a festive presentation.
Use a ladle to serve the punch into glasses. Add ice cubes, frozen apples, or the decorative ice ring to keep the punch cool.
Raise a glass and enjoy the spicy, fruity flavors of this Thanksgiving punch with your guests!

name: Firecracker Margarita
ingredients: Light Corn Syrup (for rimming the glass)
Red Pop Rocks (for rimming the glass)
instructions: Pour a small amount of light corn syrup onto a plate.
Spread red Pop Rocks onto another plate.
Dip the rim of your margarita glass first into the corn syrup, then into the Pop Rocks to coat the rim.
In a shaker, combine the tequila, lime juice, and Blue Curaçao.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake well until the mixture is chilled.
Strain the mixture into the prepared margarita glass filled with ice.
Garnish with a lime wedge if desired.

name: Firecracker Martini
instructions: Chill a martini glass by filling it with ice and water. Let it sit while you prepare the cocktail.
In a cocktail shaker, add the vodka, lemonade, and blue curacao.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously for about 15-20 seconds.
Empty the ice water from the chilled martini glass.
Strain the mixed cocktail into the glass.
Optionally, garnish with a lemon wheel or a cherry to add a festive touch.

name: Fizzy Herb Garden
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the gin, lemon juice, simple syrup, mint leaves, and basil leaves.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously until well chilled.
Strain the mixture into a wine glass filled with fresh ice.
Gently float the Lambrusco on top of the cocktail.
Garnish with lemon peel zest and additional fresh mint and basil leaves.
Enjoy your refreshing Fizzy Herb Garden!

name: Flaming Dr. Pepper Shot
ingredients: Half a pint of beer (about 6 ounces)
instructions: Fill the pint glass with the beer, leaving some room at the top.
Pour amaretto into the shot glass.
Carefully add the rum on top of the amaretto in the shot glass.
Ignite the rum with a lighter.
Once lit, quickly drop the shot glass into the pint glass.
Drink immediately after the shot glass hits the beer.

name: Fleur De Vigne
instructions: Combine Juliette, gin, lemon juice, simple syrup and bitters with ice and shake until cold.
Strain into an ice-filled, tall chilled glass.
Top with sparkling wine and garnish with lemon peel.

name: Flirtini
instructions: Add the vodka, champagne, and pineapple juice to a mixing glass filled with ice.
Gently stir the mixture to combine and chill.
Carefully strain the cocktail into a chilled martini glass.
Garnish with a pineapple slice and cherry.
Serve and enjoy!

name: Fourth of July Cocktail
instructions: Fill a tall glass with ice cubes to chill it.
In a shaker, combine the blue curacao, peach schnapps, and clear rum.
Shake well to mix the ingredients thoroughly.
Strain the mixture from the shaker into the prepared glass filled with ice.
Gently pour the club soda over the mix to top off the drink.
Stir lightly to combine.
Add a maraschino cherry on top for a festive touch.

name: Franken-Rita
ingredients: Black and white margarita salt (optional, for rimming the glass)
instructions: Lightly dampen the rim of your margarita glass with a lime wedge or a bit of water. Dip the rim into a mixture of black and white margarita salt to coat it evenly.
In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, add silver tequila, lime juice, pineapple juice, and blue curaçao.
Secure the lid on the shaker and shake vigorously until all the ingredients are well combined and chilled.
Strain the mixture into your prepared margarita glass.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Franken-Rita!

name: Frankenstein's Fizz
ingredients: Lime wheel and cherry for garnish
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice, then pour in the dark rum, Midori, pineapple juice, lime juice, and simple syrup.
Shake thoroughly until well chilled.
Strain the mixture into a glass with fresh ice, top with club soda, and gently stir.
Garnish with a lime wheel and cherry to add a festive flair.

name: The French Connection
instructions: Fill your mixing glass with ice to chill it.
Pour 1 ½ ounces of cognac and ¾ ounce of amaretto over the ice.
Stir the mixture gently with a bar spoon for about 30 seconds to combine and chill the ingredients.
Strain the cocktail into an old-fashioned glass.
Optional: Add ice to the glass if desired.

name: French Martini
ingredients: 0.5 oz Chambord or other raspberry liqueur
A pineapple wedge (lemon twist, or raspberry to garnish (optional))
instructions: Pour the vodka, Chambord, and pineapple juice into a shaker, with some ice cubes
Shake the mixture well to blend the ingredients together
Pour the blend into your cocktail glass and decorate with a pineapple wedge or other garnish, if desired

name: Front Porch Swing
ingredients: Garnish: mint or tarragon sprig (use same herb as used in the drink")
instructions: Add the white wine, vodka and St. Germain, grapes, mint or tarragon, orange wheel and strawberry into a shaker and fill three-quarters of the way with ice.
Shake for 10 seconds until well-chilled, and pour unstrained into a large wine glass. Garnish with a mint or tarragon sprig.

name: Frostbite
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with cubed ice.
Add the tequila blanco, blue curaçao, white crème de cacao, and heavy cream to the shaker.
Shake vigorously until well-chilled, about 15 seconds.
Strain the mixture into a lowball glass over a clear ice ball for a frosty presentation.
Garnish with a cherry for a vibrant finishing touch.
Serve and enjoy your creamy, winter-inspired Frostbite cocktail!

name: Frosty Blue Cocktail
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice cubes.
Add vodka, blue curaçao, white cranberry juice, and lemonade to the shaker.
Shake well until the mixture is thoroughly chilled.
Strain into a glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with fresh cranberries and a sprig of rosemary for a festive, aromatic touch.

name: Frosty Flurry
ingredients: Edible flower or lime wheel (for garnish (optional))
instructions: In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, add the tequila, maraschino liqueur, blue curaçao, crème de violette, pineapple juice, simple syrup, and lime juice.
Shake vigorously for 15–20 seconds until the mixture is well-chilled and slightly frothy.
Strain into a chilled coupe or highball glass over fresh ice.
Top with an edible flower or a lime wheel for a frosty and festive finish.

name: Frosty Lemonade
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice and add blueberry vodka, peach liqueur, blue curaçao, lemonade, lemon juice, and lime juice.
Shake vigorously for 15–20 seconds until well-chilled and blended.
Add a splash of club soda and a splash of lemon-lime soda to the shaker.
Strain the mixture into a highball or rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Serve immediately and enjoy the frosty, refreshing flavors.

name: Frosty-Rita
instructions: Add the blanco tequila, orange liqueur, coconut cream, coconut water, blue curaçao, and lime juice to a cocktail shaker filled with ice.
Seal the shaker and shake vigorously until well-chilled.
Strain the cocktail into your glass of choice.
Serve immediately and enjoy the frosty, tropical flavors.

name: Frosty Root Beer Float
instructions: Choose a tall glass or mug for serving. Add a few ice cubes if you prefer your cocktail extra chilled.
Pour the whipped cream vodka into the glass.
Slowly add the root beer to minimize foaming, and stir gently to combine the ingredients.
Top with a generous swirl of whipped cream.
For a classic touch, add a maraschino cherry on top.

name: Frozen Bourbon Old Fashioned
ingredients: ½  a frozen orange (cut into wedges (about 5 wedges))
½ ounce brown sugar simple syrup
instructions: Begin by freezing fresh orange wedges until solid.
In a blender, combine ½ a frozen orange (around 5 wedges), 2-3 frozen cherries, ½ ounce brown sugar simple syrup, 2 ounces bourbon, and 3 dashes of bitters.
Add 1 cup of ice and blend until smooth.
Pour the mixture into a glass and garnish with an orange wedge and a cherry.

name: Frozen Dragonfruit Margarita
instructions: Add the frozen dragonfruit chunks, tequila, orange liqueur, lime juice, and agave to a blender.
Blend the mixture until smooth. Add ice gradually to reach your desired consistency.
Pour the frozen cocktail into a martini glass.
Garnish with a lime slice and a sprinkle of coconut flakes.
Enjoy your refreshing Frozen Dragonfruit Margarita!

name: Frozen Peach Bourbon Mule
instructions: Place the bourbon, chopped fresh peaches, lime juice, and ginger beer into a blender.
Add a generous handful of ice, then blend on the lowest setting to start, gradually increasing to the highest setting until the mixture is smooth.
For a thicker consistency, add more ice and blend again until the desired texture is achieved.
Pour the frozen mixture into copper mugs if available; otherwise, any cocktail glass will work just as well.
Garnish each drink with a fresh mint sprig and a lime wheel to complete the presentation.

name: Frozen Peach Margarita
ingredients: Mint and lime wheel (for garnish, optional)
instructions: Start by preparing the glasses. Pour coarse sea salt onto a small plate.
Lightly brush the rims of the glasses with simple syrup or lime juice.
Dip the rims of the glasses into the sea salt, coating them evenly. Set the glasses aside.
In a blender, combine the chopped peaches, lime juice, tequila, triple sec, honey, and ice.
Blend the mixture on high until it is smooth and slushy.
Pour the frozen peach margarita into the prepared glass.
Garnish with a sprig of fresh mint if desired.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Frozen Peach Margarita!

name: Frozen Raspberry Colada
ingredients: Coconut Flakes (for rimming the glass and topping)
instructions: Add the white rum, pineapple puree syrup, cream of coconut, and frozen raspberries to a blender.
Blend until smooth, adding ice as needed to achieve your desired consistency.
Rim your cocktail glass with agave and then dip it into coconut flakes to coat.
Pour the blended cocktail into the prepared glass.
Top with additional coconut flakes.
Garnish with fresh raspberries.
Enjoy your Frozen Raspberry Colada!

name: Frozen Raspberry Limoncello
instructions: Start by placing vodka, simple syrup, limoncello, lemon juice, and a few frozen raspberries in a blender.
Add a cup of ice. Blend until the mixture is smooth and reaches a slushy consistency.
Pour the slushy mixture into your favorite glass.
Garnish with a lemon wheel and two fresh raspberries.
Enjoy your refreshing treat!

name: Full Monte
instructions: Add all liquid ingredients to a mixing glass over cracked ice. Stir until visibly chilled or dilution is apparent.
Single strain into a rocks glass over ice.
Express the oil from the orange peel over the glass and line the rim, then discard.
Skewer your cherry of choice and use it as a garnish.
Enjoy!

name: Full Moontini
ingredients: Mixed berries or lime wheel (for garnish)
instructions: Start by infusing the vodka with charcoal powder. In a small container, combine  gin with of charcoal powder, stirring until fully dissolved.
In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, add the black vodka, pineapple juice, and lime juice.
Shake well to mix and chill the ingredients.
Strain the mixture into a martini or rocks glass.
If desired, add an ice sphere to the glass for a dramatic presentation.
Top the cocktail with a splash of club soda to add a refreshing fizz.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Full Moontini!

name: Galway Fizz
instructions: Add all ingredients into a cocktail shaker (except for soda water)
Add ice and shake
Strain into a highball glass with ice
Top with soda water

name: Garibaldi
ingredients: 4 oz orange juice (it's best when you squeeze it yourself)
instructions: Fill your tall glass with ice.
Pour 1.5 oz of Campari over the ice.
Add 4 oz of fresh orange juice.
Stir gently to mix the Campari and orange juice together.
Garnish with a slice of orange if you like.

name: Gazpacho Cocktail
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the fresh watermelon chunks, three grape tomatoes, one rolled cucumber slice, and one slice of jalapeño.
Use a muddler to thoroughly crush the ingredients, releasing their juices and flavors.
Add the vodka, salt, pepper, basil leaves, and lime juice to the shaker.
Add ice to the shaker and shake the mixture vigorously to chill and blend the flavors.
Strain the mixture over a large ice cube in a rocks glass, allowing the flavors to meld as the drink chills.
Garnish the cocktail with a skewer of a grape tomato and a cucumber ribbon for an elegant presentation.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Gazpacho Cocktail!

name: Georgia Peach
instructions: Fill a rocks Glass with ice.
Add the peach schnapps, white rum, and orange juice to the glass.
Stir the mixture gently to combine the flavors.
Slowly pour the cranberry juice into the center of the glass, allowing it to create a layered effect.
Garnish with a fresh peach slice and a sprig of mint if desired. Serve immediately.

name: Ghostbuster
instructions: Add the gin, melon liqueur, peach liqueur, lime juice, simple syrup and cubed ice to a cocktail shaker.
Shake vigorously until well chilled.
Strain the mixture into a martini glass.
Carefully drop 4 drops of Irish cream liqueur into the glass for a ghostly effect.
Serve immediately and enjoy your hauntingly delicious cocktail!

name: Ghoul’s Mule
instructions: Rim your glass by dipping the edge in grenadine, then coating it with red sprinkles for a spooky effect.
In the prepared glass, add the grenadine, lime juice, and vodka. Stir well to combine the ingredients.
Fill the glass with ice, then top with ginger beer for a fizzy finish.
Garnish with a gummy eye for a ghoulish touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy your eerie Ghoul’s Mule!

name: Gin and Aperol Spritz
ingredients: 2 oz Rivi Gin Grapefruit Flavored Gin
instructions: Step 1: Combine gin, Aperol, and fresh grapefruit juice in a wine glass filled with ice.
Step 2: Top with Prosecco or other sparkling wine.
Step 3: Garnish with a grapefruit slice.

name: Gin and Apple Fall Cocktail
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the gin, apple cider, lime juice, simple syrup, and a pinch of ground cinnamon.
Add ice to the shaker and shake vigorously until well-chilled.
Fill two glasses with ice and add the diced or matchstick apples.
Strain the shaken cocktail into the prepared glasses.
Garnish each glass with a sprig of thyme.
Enjoy

name: Gin and Jam Cocktail
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the blackberry jam, gin, freshly squeezed lemon juice, and cream.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously for 15 seconds to mix and chill the ingredients.
Fill your cocktail glass with ice.
Strain the mixture from the shaker over the ice in the cocktail glass.
Garnish with fresh blackberries.
Enjoy your Gin and Jam Cocktail!

name: Gin Apple Cider & Ginger Beer Cocktail
ingredients: ¾ oz  apple cider (or apple juice)
instructions: Place your glass in the freezer to chill.
In a cocktail shaker, combine the gin, lemon juice, and apple cider (or apple juice) with ice.
Shake well until the mixture is chilled.
Remove the glass from the freezer and fill it with ice.
Strain the mixture from the shaker into the chilled glass.
Top off the drink with chilled ginger beer.
Stir gently to combine the ingredients.
Garnish with a slice of apple and a pinch of freshly grated nutmeg.

name: Gin Apple Pie Cocktail
instructions: Run a lemon wedge over the rim of the glass you plan to use, then dip the rim into the cinnamon-sugar mixture. Set the glass aside.
In a cocktail shaker, combine gin, apple cider, and cinnamon simple syrup.
Add ice to the shaker and shake vigorously until the mixture is well combined and chilled.
Pour the mixture over large ice cubes in the prepared glass.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Gin Apple Pie Cocktail!

name: Gin Mandarin Smash
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, muddle the peeled mandarin until thoroughly crushed and juicy.
Add the lemon juice, honey, and gin to the shaker.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake well until the ingredients are combined and chilled.
Strain the mixture into a rocks glass filled with ice.
Garnish with a mandarin slice and a mint sprig before serving.

name: Gin Tidings
instructions: Fill a highball or rocks glass with ice.
Pour the gin over the ice, followed by the grenadine.
Top with lemon-lime soda and gently stir to combine the ingredients.
Garnish with a lime wedge or maraschino cherry for a festive finish, if desired.

name: Gin & Vodka Mimosa
instructions: Fill a tall glass with ice.
Add the orange juice, vodka, gin, and simple syrup to the glass.
Stir gently to combine the ingredients.
Top with dry Cava, filling the glass to the top.
Garnish with an orange slice before serving.

name: Gin & Watermelon Juice
ingredients: watermelon slices and jalapeño slice for garnish
instructions: In a shaker, muddle the watermelon to release its juices.
Add the gin, elderflower liqueur, simple syrup, lime juice, and a slice of jalapeño.
Shake vigorously to combine the ingredients.
Strain the mixture into a glass over fresh ice.
Garnish with two watermelon slices and a jalapeño slice.
Serve and enjoy!

name: Ginger Ale Highball
instructions: Fill the highball glass with ice cubes.
Pour in the liquor.
Top with ginger ale.
Gently stir to combine.
Garnish with a slice of lime or lemon, if you like.
Enjoy your Ginger Ale Highball.

name: Ginger Cynar Sling
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine light rum, orange bitters, lemon juice, cherry juice, Cynar, and ginger syrup.
Add a dash of black pepper for a subtle spice note.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously to thoroughly mix and chill the ingredients.
Strain the mixture into a cocktail glass over a large ice cube, ensuring a smooth and balanced drink.
Garnish with an orange wheel to add a touch of citrus aroma and visual appeal.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Ginger Cynar Sling Cocktail!

name: Ginger Pear Bourbon
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the bourbon, pear nectar, ginger honey simple syrup, and lemon juice. Fill the shaker halfway with ice.
Secure the lid and shake vigorously until the mixture is well chilled and the shaker feels cold to the touch.
Add a few ice cubes to two chilled rocks glass.
Strain the cocktail into the prepared glass and top with a splash of ginger ale.
Garnish with a slice of fresh pear, a cinnamon stick, and a ginger skewer if desired. Serve immediately.

name: Ginger Pear Snap
instructions: Rim a Highball glass with gingerbread spice. To do this, moisten the rim with a lemon wedge or some of the ginger liqueur, then dip the rim into a plate of gingerbread spice.
In a cocktail shaker, combine the pear vodka, ginger liqueur, lemon juice, fresh ginger, and a sprig of rosemary.
Add ice to the shaker and shake vigorously to mix and chill the ingredients.
Fill the rimmed glass with ice.
Strain the mixture from the shaker into the prepared glass. Top with rhubarb bitters and sparkling pear juice.
Enjoy your Ginger Pear Snap cocktail!

name: Gingerbread Eggnog
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice and add the spiced rum, gingerbread syrup, and eggnog.
Shake vigorously for about 15–20 seconds, ensuring the mixture is well chilled and frothy.
Strain the cocktail into a coupe glass filled with ice for a cool, refreshing sip.
Garnish with a generous dollop of whipped cream and a sprinkle of crushed gingerbread cookies. Serve immediately and enjoy!

name: Gingerbread Latte Rum Cocktail
ingredients: Crushed gingerbread cookies (for rimming and garnish)
instructions: Run the orange wedge around the rim of your cocktail glass to moisten it and dip the rim into a shallow plate of crushed gingerbread cookies. Rotate until the entire rim is coated.
Fill a cocktail shaker halfway with ice. Add the whole milk, gingerbread syrup, spiced rum, and coffee liqueur. Secure the shaker lid and shake for about 20 seconds, or until well chilled.
Strain the mixture into the prepared glass.
Top with a generous dollop of whipped cream. Sprinkle additional crumbled gingerbread cookies on top and finish with a cinnamon stick for a festive touch.

name: Gingerbread Man
ingredients: whipped cream and a mini gingerbread cookie (for garnish (Optional))
instructions: Crush gingerbread cookies into fine crumbs and place them on a small plate. Moisten the rim of a rocks or martini glass with water or a small amount of Irish cream, then dip the rim into the crumbs to coat evenly.
In a shaker filled with ice, combine Irish cream, butterscotch schnapps, cinnamon schnapps, and half-and-half. Shake vigorously until well-chilled and blended.
Strain the mixture into the prepared glass.
Top with a swirl of whipped cream and a mini gingerbread cookie for a festive touch.

name: Gingerbread Martini
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the Irish cream liqueur, vodka, coffee liqueur, milk, and gingerbread syrup.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously for 15–20 seconds until well-chilled and frothy.
Strain the mixture into a chilled martini glass.
Top with a generous swirl of whipped cream and a sprinkle of crushed gingerbread cookies.
Serve immediately and enjoy the holiday cheer!

name: Gingerbread White Russian
instructions: On a shallow plate, mix the ground cinnamon and granulated sugar. Run an orange wedge around the rim of a rocks glass, then dip the rim into the cinnamon-sugar mixture to coat.
Carefully add ice to the prepared glass.
Pour in the vodka, coffee liqueur, simple syrup, and heavy cream.
Stir the cocktail gently to combine the flavors. Garnish with a gingerbread cookie for a festive touch and serve immediately.

name: How to Make a Godfather
instructions: Mix the whiskey and Amaretto in a metal shaker and stir until blended and cold
Pour over cubed ice and enjoy

name: Golden Garden Fizz
instructions: In a shaker, combine gin, lemon juice, elderflower liqueur, simple syrup, and a pinch of edible gold glitter.
Shake well to mix and chill the ingredients.
Strain the mixture into a coupe glass.
Carefully top off with champagne.
Garnish with a rolled lemon peel.

name: Grape Harvest Cocktail
instructions: Add the fresh lime juice to a cocktail shaker and muddle the concord grapes thoroughly.
Add the gin and rosemary syrup to the shaker.
Add ice and shake the mixture vigorously.
Strain the mixture through a mesh cocktail strainer into a glass.
Top the drink with a splash of club soda.
Garnish with tiny champagne grapes and/or a sprig of rosemary.

name: Grapefruit Blossom
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine gin, dry vermouth, elderflower liqueur, fresh lemon juice, and fresh grapefruit juice.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake well to chill and blend the ingredients.
Strain the mixture into a coupe glass.
Top the cocktail with sparkling wine.
Garnish with a grapefruit slice.
Enjoy your elegant drink!

name: Grapefruit Bourbon Smash
instructions: Muddle grapefruit and mint in the shaker.
Add bourbon, simple syrup, and lemon juice, then shake with ice.
Strain into an ice-filled glass. Optionally top with club soda.
Garnish with a grapefruit slice or mint.

name: Grapefruit Collins
instructions: Combine Ingredients: In a shaker, add the gin, grapefruit juice, lemon juice, simple syrup and bitters.
Dry Shake: Shake vigorously without ice.
Shake with Ice: Add ice to the shaker and shake again until well chilled.
Strain: Strain the mixture into a Collins glass filled with ice.
Top with Club Soda: Gently top off the drink with chilled club soda, giving it a light stir to mix.
Garnish: Garnish with a twist of grapefruit peel.

name: Grapefruit Crush
ingredients: Grapefruit slice or wedge for garnish
instructions: Prepare the Ingredients: Juice a fresh grapefruit to get about 2 oz of fresh grapefruit juice. Prepare the simple syrup if you don’t have any on hand (mix equal parts sugar and water, heat until sugar dissolves, then cool).
Mix the Cocktail: In a cocktail shaker, add the fresh grapefruit juice, vodka, triple sec, and simple syrup.
Shake Well: Fill the shaker with ice and shake well for about 15 seconds until the mixture is well chilled.
Strain into Glass: Fill a highball glass with ice and strain the mixture from the shaker into the glass.
Top with Soda Water: Top off the drink with soda water to give it a fizzy finish.
Garnish: Garnish with a slice or wedge of grapefruit on the rim of the glass.
Serve and Enjoy: Serve immediately and enjoy your refreshing Grapefruit Crush.

name: Grapefruit Daiquiri
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.
Pour in the white rum, grapefruit juice, lime juice, and agave syrup.
Shake well until the mixture is chilled.
Strain the cocktail into a chilled glass.
Garnish with fresh mint leaves.

name: Grapefruit Gimlet
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.
Add the grapefruit juice, gin, and simple syrup to the shaker.
Shake well until the mixture is chilled.
Strain the mixture into a chilled coupe or martini glass.
Garnish with a grapefruit slice or twist.

name: Grapefruit Gin Fizz
ingredients: 2 oz tonic water or club soda
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.
Pour in the gin and grapefruit juice.
Shake well until the mixture is chilled.
Strain the mixture into a glass filled with ice.
Top with tonic water or club soda.
Gently stir to combine.
Garnish with a sprig of rosemary and a slice of grapefruit.

name: Grapefruit Lemon Drop Martini
ingredients: Grapefruit twist or lemon slice for garnish
instructions: Prepare the Glass: Rim a martini glass with sugar by dipping the rim in lemon juice and then in sugar. Set aside.
Shake: In a cocktail shaker, add vodka, grapefruit juice, lemon juice, simple syrup, and ice.
Mix: Shake well until the mixture is chilled.
Serve: Strain the mixture into the prepared martini glass.
Garnish: Add a grapefruit twist or a lemon slice for garnish.

name: Grapefruit & Sage Champagne
instructions: In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, combine the pink grapefruit juice, sage simple syrup, and 2-3 dashes of Angostura bitters.
Shake the mixture vigorously until well chilled and the ingredients are thoroughly combined.
Strain the mixture into a glass filled with fresh ice.
Top the cocktail with champagne, pouring slowly to maintain the bubbles.
Garnish with a few fresh sage leaves for an aromatic touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Grapefruit & Sage Champagne Cocktail!

name: Grapefruit Vodka Lemonade
ingredients: 2 oz Deep Eddy Ruby Red Vodka
instructions: Fill a glass with ice.
Pour 2 oz of Deep Eddy Ruby Red Vodka over the ice.
Add 5 oz of Lemonade and stir gently to combine.
Top with a splash of Club Soda if desired.
Garnish with a Grapefruit wedge.
Serve and enjoy.

name: Grapefruit Vodka Sour
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.
Add the vodka, fresh grapefruit juice, fresh lemon juice, and simple syrup to the shaker.
Shake well until the mixture is well chilled.
Strain the cocktail into a rocks glass filled with ice.
Garnish with a grapefruit slice or twist.
Serve and enjoy.

name: Green Apple Jolly Rancher
instructions: Fill your cocktail shaker with ice.
Add the sour apple Pucker, green apple vodka, sweet and sour mix, and white cranberry juice to the shaker.
Shake the shaker vigorously until the mixture is very cold.
Strain the chilled drink into your glass.
Garnish as desired, with a green apple slice or a candy.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Green Apple Jolly Rancher Drink!

name: Green Apple Spritzer
instructions: Fill a flute glass with ice.
Pour in the chilled semi-sparkling wine, followed by the seltzer water, and then the green apple flavored vodka.
Gently stir the mixture to combine the flavors without losing the bubbles.
Garnish with a slice of green apple and a few fresh mint leaves for a refreshing touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Green Apple Spritzer!

name: Green Beetlejuice Cocktail
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine vodka, green apple liqueur, raspberry liqueur, blue curaçao, and lime juice, and a drop of yellow food dye.
Add pebble ice to the shaker and shake until well chilled.
Rim a rocks glass with agave and dip it into black sugar for a spooky effect.
