Fill the glass with fresh pebble ice and strain the cocktail into the prepared glass.
Garnish with a straw and enjoy your eerie, green concoction!

name: Green Dublin Apple
instructions: Fill your shaker with ice cubes.
Pour in the Irish whiskey, sour apple schnapps, white cranberry juice, lemon juice, and simple syrup.
Shake well until everything is perfectly chilled and mixed.
Strain the mixture into your highball glass filled with ice.
Enjoy your Green Dublin Apple cocktail.

name: Green Garden Smash
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, muddle 2 slices of jalapeño and 1 sprig of fresh thyme with the simple syrup.
Add the vodka, elderflower liqueur, cucumber juice, and lime juice to the shaker.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously until well-chilled.
Strain the mixture into a glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a sprig of thyme and a lime wheel for a vibrant presentation.
Serve and enjoy the spicy, refreshing flavors of the Green Garden Smash!

name: Green Goblin
instructions: Pour black sanding sugar onto a saucer, making sure the layer is at least ¼ inch high and wider than the rim of your goblet or cocktail glass.

Dab the rim of your goblet with simple syrup (or another sticky liquid). Then, dip the coated rim into the black sanding sugar on the saucer, gently twisting the goblet to ensure the entire rim is evenly covered with sugar.
In a cocktail shaker filled halfway with ice, combine the dark rum, pineapple juice, fresh lemon juice, and Blue Curacao syrup. Shake well to chill and mix the ingredients.
Carefully strain the cocktail into your prepared goblet, taking care not to splash the sugar-coated rim.
Top off the cocktail with lemon-lime soda, adding a fizzy finish.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Green Goblin Cocktail!

name: Green Hawaiian Cocktail
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, add the white rum, blue curaçao, and pineapple juice along with ice cubes.
Shake well to combine and chill the ingredients.
Strain the drink into a glass filled with fresh ice.
Add the lime juice to the glass and stir gently.
Garnish with a slice of lime for a refreshing touch.
Enjoy your Green Hawaiian Cocktail!

name: Green Iguana Cocktail
instructions: In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, add the blue curaçao, vodka, coconut rum, coconut cream, and orange juice.
Shake the mixture vigorously until well combined and chilled.
Pour the shaken mixture into a glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with pineapple juice and stir gently to combine the layers.
Garnish with cherries for a tropical touch.
Serve and enjoy your Green Iguana Cocktail!

name: Green Lightning
instructions: Fill a highball glass with ice to the top.
Pour the melon liqueur over the ice, followed by the citrus vodka.
Add the sweet & sour mix and stir gently to combine.
Top off the drink with a splash of lemon-lime soda.
Garnish with a lime slice and a cherry before serving.

name: Green Screwdriver
instructions: Fill a glass with ice cubes to chill.
Pour the Blue Curaçao into the glass over the ice.
Gently add 3 oz of lemon-lime soda on top. Pour slowly to maintain the layers.
Add the vodka
Slowly pour 1 oz of orange juice over the mixture. The orange juice should create a beautiful gradient effect.
Garnish with a slice of lime or orange on the rim of the glass and a cocktail stirrer.
Serve immediately and enjoy your vibrant and refreshing Green Screwdriver.

name: Green Stinger Cocktail
instructions: Fill a rocks glass with crushed ice.
Add the brandy and green crème de menthe.
Stir gently to combine the flavors.
Garnish with mint sprig and serve immediately. Enjoy!

name: Green Tea Shot
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.
Pour the Jameson Irish Whiskey, Peach Schnapps, and Sweet and Sour Mix over the ice.
Shake well until the outside of the shaker feels cold.
Strain the mixture into a shot glass.
Top it off with a splash of Lemon-Lime Soda.
Serve immediately and enjoy!

name: Grilled Mango Basil Margarita
ingredients: Grilled mango piece and basil sprig  (for garnish)
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, muddle the grilled mango with the triple sec until well combined.
Add the simple syrup, tequila, lime juice, orange juice, and basil leaves to the shaker.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake it well to chill and blend the ingredients.
Prepare your glass by brushing the rim with simple syrup and sprinkling it with Tajin.
Strain the mixture into the prepped glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a grilled mango piece and a basil sprig.
Enjoy!

name: Grilled Peach Spicy Margarita
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine peach syrup, chili, tequila, orange liqueur, and lime juice.
Shake the mixture well to blend the flavors.
Prepare your rocks glass by brushing the rim with agave syrup.
Sprinkle Tajín over the rim to coat it evenly.
Strain the shaken mixture into the prepared glass.
Garnish with a grilled peach slice.
Enjoy your spicy and fruity cocktail!

name: Grilled Pineapple Margarita
ingredients: Grilled pineapple slice and pineapple leaves ( for garnish)
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, muddle a few of grilled pineapple with the orange liqueur until well combined.
Add the tequila, lime juice, and coconut cream to the shaker.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake it well to chill and blend the ingredients.
Brush the rim of your serving glass with agave syrup. Dip the rim into Tajin to coat evenly.
Strain the mixture into the prepped glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a slice of grilled pineapple or two pineapple leaves and get ready to enjoy!

name: Grown Up Pumpkin Juice
instructions: Start by preparing your glass. Pour a small amount of maple syrup onto a shallow plate. On a separate plate, combine cinnamon and sugar.
Dip the rim of an Irish coffee mug or highball glass into the maple syrup, then into the cinnamon-sugar mixture, coating the rim evenly.
Fill the mug halfway with crushed ice and set it aside.
In a cocktail shaker, combine the apple cider, bourbon whiskey, pumpkin puree, simple syrup, and pumpkin spice.
Add ice to the shaker and shake vigorously for 30 seconds to thoroughly mix and chill the ingredients.
Strain the mixture into the prepared glass over the crushed ice.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Grown Up Pumpkin Juice Cocktail!

name: Habanero Ginger Apple Cider
ingredients: 3 ounces apple cider (plus more for rimming the glass)
instructions: On a small plate, mix together the cinnamon and coarse sugar. Lightly brush the rim of your cocktail glass with a bit of apple cider, then dip the rim into the cinnamon-sugar mixture to coat it evenly.
Fill the prepared glass with ice and set aside.
In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, combine the habanero ginger simple syrup, apple cider, and dark rum.
Shake vigorously until well combined and chilled. Pour the shaken cocktail into the prepared glass.
Garnish with a slice of fresh apple for a crisp, aromatic finish.
Serve immediately and enjoy the fiery, sweet, and spiced flavors of this unique fall cocktail.

name: Halloween Mimosa
instructions: Begin by pouring the orange juice into your champagne flute.
Add a splash of blue curaçao, creating a spooky greenish tint.
Top off the glass with champagne for a bubbly, festive finish.
Serve and enjoy your Halloween Mimosa, a perfect drink for the Halloween season!

name: Halloween Spritz
instructions: Start by filling a wine glass or large cocktail glass with ice.
Pour Aperol and apple cider into the glass.
Top the mixture with Prosecco, filling the glass almost to the top.
Add a splash of sparkling water to finish, giving the drink a light and refreshing fizz.
Gently stir to combine all the ingredients.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Halloween Spritz!

name: Harvest Apple Spritz
instructions: In a large pitcher, combine the sage-ginger syrup, vodka, orange liqueur, apple juice, and lemon juice. Stir well, then refrigerate until ready to serve.
Just before serving, pour the sparkling water into the pitcher and stir gently to incorporate the flavors.
Fill serving glasses with ice, then pour the spritz mixture over the ice.
Garnish each glass with an apple slice and a fresh sage leaf for a festive, aromatic touch.

name: Harvest Moon Applejack Cocktail
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice, then add the Applejack, almond syrup, and lemon juice.
Shake the mixture well until thoroughly chilled.
Strain the cocktail into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a slice of lemon for a fresh, zesty touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy the sweet and tangy flavors of the Harvest Moon Applejack Cocktail.

name: Harvest Punch
ingredients: 2  Oranges (sliced into triangles, plus more for rimming)
instructions: Fill a large punch bowl with ice. Pour in the apple cider, Prosecco, vodka, and ginger beer.
Add the sliced apples, oranges, and cinnamon sticks.
Moisten the rims of your glasses with an orange slice, then dip them into cinnamon sugar to coat.
Serve the punch in the prepared glasses.

name: Haunted Horchata
instructions: On a small plate, mix cinnamon and sugar. Wet the rim of your glass and dip it into the cinnamon-sugar mixture to coat the rim.
Fill the glass with ice cubes.
Pour in the horchata, vodka, and vanilla extract.
Stir gently to combine all the ingredients.
Sprinkle a light dusting of cinnamon on top and garnish with a cinnamon stick.
Serve and enjoy your spiced horror-inspired treat!

name: Haunted Pumpkin Patch Margarita
ingredients: Apple slices, cinnamon sticks, sprinkle of cinnamon sugar  (for garnish)
instructions: Begin by dipping the rim of your glass into water or a bit of the apple cider, then dip it into a plate of cinnamon sugar to coat the rim evenly.
Fill the prepared glass with ice, setting it aside.
In a cocktail shaker, combine the pumpkin butter, apple cider, tequila, and orange liqueur.
Shake the mixture vigorously to ensure all ingredients are well incorporated, then add ice to the shaker and shake for an additional minute until the cocktail is thoroughly chilled.
Pour the shaken cocktail into the prepared glass.
Top off the drink with a splash of ginger beer to add a fizzy, refreshing finish.
Garnish with a few slices of apple, a cinnamon stick, and an extra sprinkle of cinnamon sugar for a festive touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy this hauntingly delicious fall cocktail.

name: Hawaiian Mimosas
instructions: In a champagne glass, pour the coconut rum and pineapple juice.
Top the glass with champagne.
Garnish with pineapple slice and cherry.
Serve immediately and enjoy!

name: Hibiscus in Hawaii
instructions: In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, combine the white rum, blue curaçao, ginger syrup, lime juice, and pineapple juice.
Shake vigorously to blend and chill the ingredients.
Strain the mixture into an ice-filled highball glass.
Gently float the hibiscus-infused rum on top by pouring it over the back of a spoon to create a layered effect.
Garnish with a lime wheel and a cherry for a tropical presentation.

name: Hibiscus Rose Spritz
instructions: In a wine glass, combine gin, lime juice, and hibiscus syrup. Stir gently to blend the ingredients.
Add ice to the glass, then top with rose lemonade and give it a light stir to mix.
Garnish with an edible flower for an elegant touch.
Serve and enjoy your beautiful, floral-infused spritz!

name: Hocus Pocus Fizz
instructions: Begin by lightly dipping the rim of your coupe glass into chilled simple syrup. Next, dip the rim into orange sanding sugar to create a colorful, festive rim. Set the glass aside on the counter or place it in the freezer to allow the sugar to set.
In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, combine the rum, cranberry juice, orange juice, simple syrup, and a pinch of orange zest.
Cover the shaker and shake vigorously until the mixture is thoroughly chilled.
Strain the cocktail mixture into your prepared coupe glass.
Gently top off the cocktail with chilled Prosecco to add a fizzy, bubbly finish.
Garnish with an orange twist for an elegant and aromatic touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Hocus Pocus Fizz!

name: Holiday Cheer Sangria
instructions: In a large pitcher, combine the bourbon, pomegranate juice, orange zest, and orange juice. Stir well and chill in the refrigerator until ready to serve.
When it’s time to serve, fill a punch bowl with ice and pour in the bourbon mixture.
Top with chilled Prosecco, gently stirring to combine.
Garnish with fresh pomegranate arils, orange slices, and rosemary sprig for a festive look and added flavor.

name: Holiday French 75
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the gin, lemon juice, and cranberry syrup.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake until well chilled.
Strain the mixture into a flute or coupe glass.
Top with champagne until the glass is full.
Garnish with a few fresh cranberries and a sprig of rosemary for a festive touch.

name: Holiday Lemon Drop
ingredients: cranberries and a rosemary sprig (for garnish)
instructions: Run the cut side of a lemon along the rim of your glass. Dip the rim into a plate of sugar, coating it evenly. Place the glass in the freezer to chill while you prepare the cocktail.
In a cocktail shaker, combine vodka, lemon juice, cranberry juice, and simple syrup. Add ice and shake vigorously until well-chilled, about 10–15 seconds.
Strain the cocktail into your prepped glass.
Add a sprig of rosemary and a few cranberries for a festive touch. Serve immediately and enjoy!

name: Holiday Mai Tai
ingredients: pineapple slices and pomegranate arils (for garnish)
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the rum, orgeat syrup, simple syrup, lime juice, pomegranate juice, pineapple juice, and aromatic bitters.
Fill the shaker with crushed ice, cover tightly, and shake vigorously for about 30 seconds, until the outside of the shaker is frosty.
Strain the mixture into a glass filled with crushed ice.
Garnish with a slice of pineapple and a handful of pomegranate arils for a festive touch. Serve immediately.

name: Holly Jolly Margarita
instructions: To prepare the glass, rub a lime wedge around the rim, then dip it into a plate of Tajín seasoning to create a spicy, flavorful rim (optional).
In an empty cocktail shaker, combine the tequila, Midori, and lime juice.
Add ice to the shaker, then shake vigorously until the mixture is well-chilled.
Strain the cocktail into the prepared margarita glass.
Garnish with a lime slice, if desired, and serve immediately.

name: Holly Jolly Mimosa
instructions: Place a champagne flute in the freezer for a few minutes to chill.
In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, combine vanilla vodka and cranberry juice. Shake gently to chill the mixture.
Strain the cranberry-vodka mixture into the chilled flute, filling it about halfway.
Top the glass with champagne or sparkling wine.
Garnish with a few fresh cranberries and a sprig of rosemary for a festive presentation.

name: Holy Margarita
instructions: Add ice to your shaker
Pour in each ingredient
Shake until well chilled
Pour into a rocks glass filled with ice
Garnish with a lime

name: Holy Water
instructions: Fill a large glass with crushed ice and strawberry slices
Add vodka and rum
Add peach schnapps and lemonade
Add blue curacao to the top
Top with a splash of pineapple juice
Add a strawberry garnish

name: Honey Bee Pom Punch
ingredients: 3  fresh mint leaves (plus more for garnish)
A handful of pomegranate arils (for garnish)
instructions: Place the honey simple syrup in a cocktail shaker.
Add the fresh mint leaves and muddle until the mint is well crushed and the flavors are released.
Add the vodka, pomegranate juice, and orange juice to the shaker.
Fill the shaker with ice, put the lid on, and shake vigorously until well chilled.
Fill two rocks glasses with ice.
Strain the cocktail mixture into the prepared glasses.
Garnish each glass with a fresh mint sprig, a slice of orange, and a sprinkle of pomegranate arils.
Serve immediately and enjoy!

name: Honey Deuce
instructions: Fill a chilled highball glass with crushed ice.
Pour vodka over the ice.
Top off the glass with chilled lemonade, filling it just below the rim.
Gently pour Chambord over the top, allowing it to slowly infuse the drink.
Skewer honeydew melon balls and place them on top of the glass as a garnish.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Honey Deuce cocktail!

name: Honey Elderflower Margarita
instructions: Rim your glass with honey, then dip it into the salt to coat.
Combine tequila, orange liqueur, elderflower liqueur, lime juice, and honey in a cocktail shaker.
Shake vigorously.
Pour over ice in the prepared glass.
Garnish with orange slice. Enjoy!

name: Honey Ginger French 75
ingredients: ½ oz ginger honey simple syrup
instructions: Ensure all ingredients are chilled in advance.
Pour the gin, lemon juice, and ginger honey simple syrup into a chilled champagne flute.
Top with chilled champagne.
Add a lemon twist and a piece of candied ginger to the glass for an elegant garnish, if desired.
Serve immediately and enjoy!

name: Honey Pear Margarita
instructions: Place the pear juice, tequila, triple sec, honey, rosemary sprig, and cinnamon (if using) into a cocktail shaker.
Shake vigorously to combine and dissolve the honey.
Transfer the mixture to the refrigerator and let it chill for at least one hour to allow the flavors to meld.
Pour the chilled mixture into glasses.
Enjoy your Honey Pear Margarita!

name: Honey Pumpkin Whiskey Smash
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, add the mint leaves and a little crushed ice. Use a muddler to gently smash the mint leaves, releasing their flavor.
Add the whiskey, honey pumpkin syrup, and a splash of lemon juice to the shaker.
Fill the shaker with ice cubes, cover, and shake vigorously to combine and chill the ingredients.
Double strain the mixture over a rocks glass filled with crushed ice.
Garnish with freshly grated nutmeg and a sprig of fresh mint for an aromatic finish.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Honey Pumpkin Whiskey Smash!

name: Honey Rosemary Bourbon Cocktail
instructions: Place ice cubes into a rocks glass and set aside.
In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, combine the bourbon, rosemary honey syrup, and Angostura bitters.
Stir gently to combine and chill the mixture.
Strain the cocktail into the prepared rocks glass over ice.
Twist the orange peel over the cocktail to release its oils, then drop it into the glass.
Garnish with a fresh rosemary sprig for an aromatic finish.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Honey Rosemary Bourbon Cocktail!

name: Honeycrisp Apple Cider Rum Punch
instructions: In a large pitcher or punch bowl, combine the Honeycrisp apple cider, rum, orange juice, cinnamon sticks, and sliced fruit.
Stir the mixture well to ensure all ingredients are fully combined.
Place the pitcher or punch bowl in the refrigerator and let the punch sit for at least one hour to allow the flavors to meld.
Serve the punch cold, garnished with additional fruit slices and cinnamon sticks for an extra festive touch.

name: Honeycrisp Apple Sangria
instructions: In a large pitcher, place the cinnamon sticks, chopped honeycrisp apples, and orange slices. Pour in the red wine, apple cider, brandy, orange juice, and lemon juice. Stir to combine.
Cover the pitcher and refrigerate for 6 to 24 hours to let the flavors meld together.
Before serving, taste the sangria. If you prefer it sweeter, stir in 1 ounce honey, or agave, as desired.
To create a festive cinnamon-sugar rim, moisten the rims of your glasses with water, then dip them into a mix of cinnamon and sugar.
Pour the sangria into the prepared glasses, making sure to include some fruit in each serving. Add a splash of club soda to each glass for a fizzy finish.
Garnish with a cinnamon stick for extra flair, if desired.
Serve and enjoy the refreshing, fruity, and spiced flavors of the Honeycrisp Apple Sangria!

name: Honeymoon Cocktail
instructions: In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, combine the apple brandy, curacao, Bénédictine, and lemon juice.
Shake well until the mixture is well-chilled.
Strain the cocktail into a chilled cocktail glass.
Serve immediately and enjoy the bright, balanced flavors of this classic drink.

name: Honeysuckle Berry Fizz
instructions: In a blender, purée the sliced strawberries and honey simple syrup until smooth.
Pour the strawberry purée and honeysuckle vodka into a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake until the mixture is well-chilled.
Strain the mixture into a rocks glass filled with ice.
Top with club soda for a refreshing sparkle.
Garnish with strawberry on top.
Serve immediately and enjoy!

name: Hot Apple Buttered Rum
instructions: In a medium saucepan, whisk together the apple cider, unsalted butter, apple butter, and brown sugar. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium-high heat and whisk continuously for 1 minute.
Remove the saucepan from the heat and whisk in the dark spiced rum.
If preferred, strain the mixture through a fine-mesh strainer to remove any solids.
Pour the hot buttered rum into a mug, garnish with dried apple slices and a cinnamon stick if desired, and serve warm.

name: Hot Buttered Bourbon
instructions: In a small saucepan over low heat, bring the apple cider to a gentle simmer.
In a small bowl, combine the softened butter, honey, cloves, cinnamon, and ginger. Mix with a spoon until fully combined.
Add the spiced butter mixture to the simmering cider, whisking gently until the butter is melted and the mixture is smooth.
Remove the pan from heat and whisk in the bourbon.
Pour the Hot Buttered Bourbon into a mug or heat-safe glass. Garnish with a cinnamon stick for an extra touch of warmth and aroma.
Serve immediately and enjoy the comforting flavors of this festive drink.

name: Hot Honey Aperol Spritz
instructions: In a wine glass, mix together Aperol, hot honey syrup, lemon juice, and sparkling water.
Fill the glass with ice to chill the drink.
Top off the mixture with a splash of Prosecco.
Stir gently to blend all the ingredients.
Garnish with an orange slice and a small chili pepper.

name: Hot Honey Rum Punch
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine 2 slices of chili, hot water, and honey. Stir until the honey is completely dissolved and infused with the heat from the habanero.
Add light rum, lemon juice, and ice to the shaker.
Shake vigorously until the mixture is well-chilled.
Strain the cocktail over a large ice cube in your serving glass.
Garnish with the remaining slice of chili pepper.
Enjoy your Hot Honey Rum Punch!

name: Hot Honey Strawberry Bourbon Smash
ingredients: 1 oz hot honey (Must make a syrup first - see notes)
instructions: Prepare the Strawberries: In a cocktail shaker, muddle the fresh strawberries until they are well mashed and release their juice.
Add the Bourbon: Pour the bourbon into the shaker with the muddled strawberries.
Sweeten with Hot Honey: Add the hot honey to the shaker. If you prefer more sweetness, you can add a bit more.
Add Lemon Juice: Squeeze in the fresh lemon juice to add a tart balance to the sweetness and spice.
Shake Well: Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously for about 15 seconds to mix all the ingredients thoroughly.
Strain and Serve: Strain the mixture into a glass filled with ice.
Top with Club Soda: Add a splash of club soda to give the drink a refreshing fizz.
Garnish: Garnish with fresh mint leaves and a slice of strawberry.

name: Hot Sauce Margarita
ingredients: 3  dashes of El Yucateco Black Label Reserve hot sauce
instructions: Add the tequila, mezcal, pineapple juice, lime juice, agave syrup, and hot sauce to a cocktail shaker.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously until well chilled.
Strain the mixture over ice into a rocks glass.
Garnish with a dehydrated citrus wheel.
Enjoy your spicy and smoky Hot Sauce Margarita!

name: Hot Spiked Caramel Apple Cider
instructions: In a medium-sized saucepan, bring the apple cider and caramel flavoring syrup to a boil over medium-high heat. Once boiling, reduce the heat and let it simmer.
Stir in the apple brandy, then remove the saucepan from the stovetop.
Using a ladle, divide the mixture evenly into four 8-ounce glass mugs.
Top each mug with a generous dollop of sweetened whipped cream.
Drizzle caramel syrup over the whipped cream for an extra touch of sweetness.
Serve immediately while the drink is still warm and enjoy the comforting, rich flavors of this spiked cider.

name: Hot Vodka Ginger
ingredients: 1  Chilli pepper slice (plus extra for garnish)
Lemon wheel or chilli slice (for garnish)
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, muddle the red pepper chunks and ginger slices with simple syrup.
Add vodka, lemon juice, and a slice of chili pepper to the shaker.
Shake the mixture vigorously.
Strain the mixture over fresh ice in a glass.
Top off the drink with ginger beer.
Stir gently to combine.
Garnish with a lemon wheel and a slice of chili pepper.

name: Hudson River Sunset
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, add the vodka, rum, gin, tequila, blue curaçao, pineapple juice, and coconut cream along with ice.
Shake well until the mixture is chilled and well-combined.
Fill a highball or hurricane glass with ice, then pour the strawberry syrup into the glass, letting it settle at the bottom.
Slowly pour the shaken mixture over the strawberry syrup to create a layered effect.
Garnish with a cherry and serve immediately.

name: Indigo
instructions: Pour the cranberry juice and the lemon juice into the shaker, then add the Mezcal Amarás Espadín and the Curaçao; add two ice cubes, close tightly and shake for a few seconds. Frost a low glass with sugar and add a couple more ice cubes.

name: Insomniac Cocktail
ingredients: 1 oz heavy cream (optional for a smoother drink)
Grated nutmeg or chocolate shavings for garnish
instructions: Chill the Glass: Start by chilling a highball glass in the freezer to keep your cocktail cold and refreshing.

Mix the Spirits: In a shaker, combine the dark rum and coffee liqueur. Add the vanilla syrup and cold brew coffee. If you like your cocktails on the creamier side, this is when you'd add the heavy cream.

Shake: Fill the shaker with ice. Seal it tightly and shake vigorously for about 15-20 seconds or until the outside of the shaker feels cold. This not only chills the drink but also dilutes it slightly, balancing the flavors.
Strain: Take your chilled glass out of the freezer and strain the cocktail into it. The aim is to leave the ice from the shaker behind, resulting in a smooth, chilled drink.
Garnish: Sprinkle a little grated nutmeg or chocolate shavings over the top for an aromatic touch that complements the drink's flavors.
Serve: Serve immediately. The Insomniac Cocktail is best enjoyed fresh and cold, perfect for savoring during those late-night moments of relaxation.

name: Irish Car Bomb
instructions: Slowly pour the cream into the whiskey so you get a nice layered effect
Drop this quickly into the shortened pint of Guinness.
This really gives the best effect, though some philistines do actually just combine all three in one glass. You lose all the visual effects if you do this, however, so we can't recommend it.

name: Irish Coffee
ingredients: 1 to 2 tablespoons brown sugar (adjust to taste)
instructions: Start by warming your glass with some hot water, then dump the water out.
Add the brown sugar to the glass.
Pour in the hot coffee and stir until the sugar is fully dissolved.
Add the Irish whiskey and stir again.
Gently float the whipped cream on top by pouring it over the back of a spoon.
Enjoy your Classic Irish Coffee.

name: Irish Espresso Martini
instructions: Put ice in your cocktail shaker.
Add the Irish whiskey, cool espresso, and simple syrup.
Shake it really well until it's super cold.
Strain it into your martini glass.
Enjoy right away.

name: Irish Flag Shot
instructions: Pour the green crème de menthe into the shot glass. This is your first layer.
Carefully layer the Irish cream liqueur on top. To do this, pour it slowly over the back of a spoon so it doesn't mix with the green layer.
Finally, add the orange liqueur using the same spoon method. This creates the top orange layer.
Admire your work before drinking.

name: Irish Gold
ingredients: Ginger ale to top it off
instructions: Fill your highball glass with ice cubes to keep your drink cool.
Pour in the Irish whiskey and peach schnapps.
Add the orange juice, which brings a nice citrus kick.
Top it off with ginger ale for that bubbly sparkle.
Stir gently to mix all the flavors together.
Garnish with a slice of orange for that extra touch.

name: Irish Holiday Coffee
instructions: Add the Irish cream, whiskey, and spiced coffee to a glass.
Stir well to combine the ingredients.
Enjoy!

name: Irish Maid
instructions: In your shaker, muddle the cucumber slices to release their flavor.
Add the Irish whiskey, elderflower liqueur, lemon juice, simple syrup, and ice.
Shake well until everything is nicely chilled.
Strain into your highball glass filled with ice.
Garnish with a slice of cucumber to make it look as good as it tastes.

name: Irish Margarita
ingredients: 1 oz lime juice (freshly squeezed is best)
instructions: Fill your shaker halfway with ice cubes.
Pour in the Irish whiskey, orange liqueur, lime juice, and agave syrup.
Secure the lid on your shaker and shake vigorously for about 15 seconds.
Strain the mixture into your margarita glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a lime wheel on the rim.
Enjoy your refreshing Irish Margarita.

name: Irish Mojito
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, muddle the lime juice, simple syrup, and minced mint leaves to release the mint’s flavor.
Add the Irish whiskey, Bacardi Lemon, green food coloring, and ice to the shaker.
Shake well until all ingredients are combined and chilled.
Strain the mixture into an ice-filled rocks glass.
Top with club soda for a refreshing fizz.
Garnish with lime wedges and a sprig of fresh mint.

name: Irish Mudslide
ingredients: Green food coloring (just a drop or two to get that perfect green color)
instructions: Add the Irish cream, coffee-flavored liqueur, vodka, vanilla ice cream, and milk into the blender.
Put a drop or two of green food coloring. Start with a little; you can always add more to get the color you want.
Blend until smooth.
Pour it into your glass and enjoy.

name: Irish Mule
instructions: Fill your copper mug or glass with ice cubes.
Pour 2 ounces of Irish whiskey over the ice.
Add 1/2 ounce of fresh lime juice.
Top it off with 6 ounces of ginger beer.
Stir gently to mix.
Garnish with a lime wedge.
Enjoy your delicious Irish Mule.

name: Irish Potato Martini
ingredients: 2 ounces vodka (you can use potato vodka for an authentic touch)
Ground cinnamon and sugar for rimming the glass
Shaved coconut or a small piece of chocolate for garnish (optional)
instructions: Prepare the Glass:
Mix a little ground cinnamon and sugar on a small plate.
Wet the rim of your martini glass with a little water or use a lemon wedge, then dip it into the cinnamon-sugar mix to coat the rim.
Mix the Drink:
In a shaker, combine the vodka, Irish cream liqueur, coconut cream, and a splash of cinnamon schnapps with ice.
Shake well until the mixture is well-chilled.
Serve:
Strain the mixture into your prepared martini glass.
For an extra touch, garnish with shaved coconut or a small piece of chocolate on top.
Enjoy:
Serve immediately and enjoy your Irish Potato Martini!

name: Irish Sipper
ingredients: 1/2 oz honey syrup (mix equal parts honey and warm water)
instructions: In your cocktail shaker, combine the Irish whiskey, honey syrup, and lemon juice.
Add a handful of ice cubes to the shaker.
Shake well until the outside of the shaker feels cold.
Use the strainer to pour the drink into your highball glass filled with ice.
Garnish with a twist of lemon on top.
Enjoy your refreshing Irish Sipper.

name: Irish Sunrise
instructions: Fill your shaker with ice.
Pour the Irish whiskey and orange juice into the shaker.
Shake well until it's nicely chilled.
Strain the mixture into a highball glass filled with ice.
Carefully pour the grenadine into the drink. It will sink and then slowly rise to create the sunrise effect.
Enjoy your Irish Sunrise.

name: Irish Trash Can
instructions: Get a tall glass and pour in Blue Curaçao
Fill it with ice
Pour in vodka, gin, rum, triple sec, and peach schnapps
Top the mix with the energy drink and leave the can inserted, upside-down

name: Italian Greyhound
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the grapefruit juice, vodka, Aperol, and simple syrup. Add ice and shake vigorously until well-chilled.
Strain the mixture into the glass.
Top with sparkling grapefruit soda.
Garnish with a slices of grapefruit and sprig of thyme and serve immediately.

name: Italian Lambrusco Spritz
instructions: Prepare the Glass: Fill a large wine glass or a highball glass with ice cubes.
Pour the Aperol: Add 2 oz of Aperol over the ice.
Add Lambrusco: Pour in 2 oz of chilled Lambrusco wine.
Top with Club Soda: Add 1 oz of chilled club soda to the mixture.
Stir Gently: Use a stirrer or a long spoon to gently mix the ingredients.
Garnish: Add a slice of orange to the glass for a refreshing touch.
Serve: Enjoy your Italian Lambrusco Spritz immediately while it's cold.

name: Italian Margarita
instructions: Start by salting the rim of your margarita glass. Rub a lime wedge around the edge and dip it into salt.
Fill your shaker with ice.
Add tequila, amaretto, orange juice, and lime juice to the shaker.
Shake well until everything is nicely chilled.
Strain the mix into your prepared glass.
Garnish with a lime wedge. Enjoy!

name: Italian Prosecco Strawberry Lemon Drop
instructions: Rim your serving glass with sugar by dipping the rim in lemon juice and then into sugar spread on a plate.
In a cocktail shaker, combine the vodka, limoncello, lemon juice, and strawberry syrup.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously until well chilled.
Strain the mixture into the prepared serving glass.
Top with Prosecco Rosé.
Garnish with a fresh strawberry and a lemon slice.
Enjoy your sparkling Italian Prosecco Strawberry Lemon Drop!

name: Jack Frost Mimosa
instructions: Prepare the glasses by dipping the rims in honey, then coating them with sweetened coconut flakes. Set aside to allow the rims to set.
Divide the blue curaçao evenly between each glass.
Pour lemonade into each Champagne glass until the glasses are about half full.
Top with Champagne or sparkling wine, and serve immediately for a refreshing, frosty treat.

name: Jack Frost Winter Cocktail
instructions: Pour a thin layer of light corn syrup onto one shallow plate. Spread coconut flakes on another shallow plate. Dip the rim of the cocktail glass into the corn syrup, ensuring an even coating, then dip it into the coconut flakes. Set the rimmed glass aside.
In a blender, combine ice, pineapple juice, Blue Curaçao, light rum, and coconut cream. Blend until the mixture reaches a smooth, slushy consistency.
Pour the blended mixture into the prepared glass and serve immediately.

name: Jack-o-Lantern Punch
instructions: In a mixing glass, muddle the sugar cube, cloves, and 1 ounce of club soda until the sugar dissolves and the cloves release their flavor.
Add the spiced rum, ground nutmeg, lemon juice, apple juice, and ice to the mixing glass. Stir until the mixture is well-chilled.
Strain the punch into a mug glass.
Top with the remaining 2 ounces of club soda for a fizzy finish.
Garnish with apple slices, a cinnamon stick, and a few pumpkin seeds for an autumnal touch.

name: Jack-O'-Lantern Spritz
instructions: Begin by filling your glass with ice.
Pour the orange vodka, Aperol, orange juice, and pineapple juice directly into the glass.
Stir gently to mix the flavors.
Top with Prosecco to your taste, adding a light, refreshing fizz.
Garnish with a fresh orange slice for a citrusy finish that mirrors the vibrant, festive colors of a Jack-O'-Lantern.
Serve and enjoy this bubbly, autumn-inspired cocktail!

name: Jack Rose
ingredients: ¾ oz. lemon or lime juice
instructions: Fill the cocktail shaker with ice.
Add the applejack, lemon or lime juice, and grenadine syrup to the shaker.
Shake the cocktail shaker vigorously for about 15 seconds to combine the ingredients and chill the cocktail.
Strain the cocktail into a chilled coupe glass.
Garnish the cocktail with a lemon twist or a slice of apple.

name: Jameson & Ginger Ale
instructions: Fill a highball glass with ice.
Add 1.5 oz of Jameson Irish Whiskey to the glass.
Pour 4 oz of ginger ale into the glass.
Squeeze a quarter of a lime wedge into the glass and drop it in.
Gently stir the ingredients together with a bar spoon.
Garnish with a large lime wedge.
Serve and enjoy!

name: Jingle Bell Fizz
instructions: Fill a wine glass or champagne flute with ice to create a chilled base.
Pour the Moscato wine into the glass, followed by the club soda. Gently stir to combine.
Pour Chambord over the top, allowing it to swirl into the drink for a pop of flavor and color. Gently stir to combine.
Drop in a few fresh raspberries for a festive touch. Optionally, add a sprig of rosemary for an aromatic finish.

name: Jingle Bell Rock Mimosa
ingredients: Orange twist or edible flower (for garnish)
instructions: Place a champagne flute or coupe glass in the freezer for a few minutes.
In a shaker filled with ice, combine citrus vodka, crème de violette, and Grand Marnier. Shake gently to chill the mixture.
Strain the mixture into the chilled glass.
Slowly pour the Prosecco over the mixture to fill the glass.
Add an orange twist or edible flower for an elegant, festive touch.

name: Jingle Bell Smash
ingredients: Fresh cranberries and rosemary sprig (for garnish)
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.
Pour in the cranberry juice, bourbon, rosemary simple syrup, and your choice of lemon juice.
Shake or stir the mixture well to combine and chill.
Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with fresh cranberries and a sprig of rosemary.
Sip, savor, and enjoy the holiday cheer!

name: Jingle Juice Cocktail
instructions: In a rocks glass filled with ice, pour the vodka and sparkling rosé.
Add Cran-Apple Juice to fill the glass, giving the drink a bubbly and fruity finish.
Use a bar spoon to gently stir the cocktail, blending the flavors without losing too many bubbles.
Drop a few fresh cranberries into the glass for a festive pop of color.
Enjoy your Jingle Juice Cocktail immediately, and toast to the holiday season!

name: Joe's Crab Shack Ya Ya Punch
instructions: Fill a highball glass with ice.
Add the pineapple juice, cranberry juice, vodka, peach schnapps, and coconut rum.
Stir well to combine.
Add a splash of grenadine for color.
Garnish with a slice of pineapple (optional) and fresh cranberries.
Serve immediately and enjoy!

name: John Daly
instructions: Fill a glass with ice.
Add vodka to the glass.
Pour in the iced tea and lemonade mix.
Stir gently to combine the ingredients.
Garnish with a lemon wheel.
Serve and enjoy.

name: Joker Cocktail
instructions: Add several ice cubes to a chilled rocks glass.
In a separate mixing glass, combine the blue curaçao, whiskey, amaretto, and cranberry juice.
Stir the mixture well to combine the flavors.
Pour the mixture over the ice in the rocks glass.
Serve immediately and enjoy your vibrant and flavorful Joker cocktail!

name: Jolly Spiced Rum
instructions: Fill your glass with ice to chill the cocktail.
Pour in the spiced rum, cranberry juice, and cinnamon simple syrup.
Top off with ginger beer and stir gently to combine the flavors without losing the ginger beer’s fizz.
Garnish with sugared cranberries and a sprig of rosemary. For an added wintery touch, sprinkle powdered sugar over the garnish to resemble snow.
Serve immediately and enjoy the holiday spirit!

name: Juicy Apple Bourbon Fall Cocktail
ingredients: 2 slices fresh red apple (thinly sliced (for garnish))
instructions: In a rocks glass, pour the lemon juice add the simple syrup and a dash of maple syrup to the glass.
Fill the glass with ice.
Pour in the bourbon and apple juice.
Stir with a long bar spoon until completely combined and chilled.
Garnish with thin slices of fresh red apple or a little orange peel.
For a sparkling touch, top off with a splash of sparkling water.
Serve chilled and enjoy your Juicy Apple Bourbon Fall Cocktail!

name: How to Make a Jungle Bird
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.
Add 1 1/2 oz of dark Jamaican rum, 3/4 oz of Campari, 1 1/2 oz of fresh pineapple juice, 1/2 oz of fresh lime juice, and 1/2 oz of demerara syrup to the shaker.
Shake the ingredients vigorously for about 10-15 seconds.
Strain the mixture into an old-fashioned glass filled with crushed ice.
Garnish the drink with a pineapple wedge and a maraschino cherry.

name: Justin Sajda’s Classic Paloma
ingredients: Grapefruit peel garnish (expressed, rolled up, and placed on top)
instructions: Start by adding ice and saline solution to glass
Add a dash of grapefruit bitters and ¼ oz lime juice
Pour Cutwater Tequila Paloma over ice
Garnish with grapefruit peel

name: Kentucky Bourbon Lemonade
ingredients: 1 cup bourbon (Kentucky bourbon like Maker's Mark or Woodford Reserve is ideal)
1 cup freshly squeezed lemon juice (about 4-6 lemons, depending on size and juiciness)
1/2 cup simple syrup (you can make this by heating equal parts sugar and water until the sugar dissolves, then cooling it)
Lemon slices and mint sprigs (for garnish)
instructions: Squeeze the lemons to get about 1 cup of juice. It’s best to use fresh lemons for the brightest flavor.
Combine equal parts of sugar and water in a saucepan. Heat until the sugar dissolves completely, then allow it to cool. This mixture is your simple syrup.
In a pitcher, combine the bourbon, freshly squeezed lemon juice, simple syrup, and cold water. Stir well.
Fill glasses with ice cubes. Pour the lemonade mixture over the ice. Garnish each glass with a slice of lemon and a sprig of mint.
If the lemonade is too sweet, add more lemon juice. If it’s too tart, add more simple syrup. You can also add more bourbon if you prefer a stronger drink.
Serve immediately and enjoy the refreshing taste of your Kentucky Bourbon Lemonade!

name: Kentucky Lemonade
ingredients: 2 oz Jeptha Creed Bottled in Bond KY Straight Bourbon
instructions: Combine bourbon, lemon juice, and orange liqueur into mixing glass with ice. Stir, then strain into collins glass filled with ice. Top with lemon-lime soda, garnish with lemon and orange slice.

name: Kentucky Peach Bourbon and Vodka Cocktail
instructions: Place the peach slices into a cocktail shaker and muddle them thoroughly until they are soft and juicy.
Add the peach vodka, lemonade, simple syrup, and bourbon to the shaker along with a generous amount of ice.
Secure the lid and shake vigorously until the mixture is well chilled and fully combined.
Strain the cocktail into an ice-filled glass.
Garnish with additional peach slices for a beautiful and aromatic presentation. Serve immediately.

name: Kiwi Bourbon Smash
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, add the sliced kiwis and a few fresh mint leaves.
Use a muddler to gently mash the kiwis and mint together until the kiwis are well crushed and the mint is fragrant.
Pour in the bourbon, simple syrup, and fresh lemon juice.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake well until the mixture is chilled.
Strain the mixture into a glass filled with ice.
Add a splash of club soda to the glass and gently stir to combine.
Garnish with a slice of kiwi and a sprig of mint.
Enjoy your refreshing Kiwi Bourbon Smash.

name: Kiwi Collins
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, muddle the sliced kiwi until it is thoroughly mashed.
Add the vodka, lemon juice, and simple syrup to the shaker.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously until the mixture is well-chilled.
Strain the mixture into a Collins glass filled with ice.
Top off the drink with club soda, stirring gently to combine.
Garnish with a slice of kiwi on the rim of the glass.
Serve immediately and enjoy your refreshing Kiwi Collins.

name: Kiwi Cosmopolitan
ingredients: Kiwi slice and lime wedge for garnish
instructions: Prepare the Kiwi Puree: Peel and blend one ripe kiwi until smooth. Strain to remove seeds if desired.
Mix the Drink: In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, combine the vodka, triple sec, fresh lime juice and kiwi puree.
Shake Well: Shake vigorously for about 15-20 seconds until well chilled.
Strain and Serve: Strain the mixture into a chilled martini glass.
Garnish: Garnish with a slice of kiwi and a lime wedge on the rim of the glass.

name: Kiwi Daiquiri
instructions: In a blender, combine the peeled and sliced kiwi fruit, sugar, and lime juice.
Blend until smooth.
Add the rum and a handful of ice to the blender.
Blend again until smooth and well mixed.
Pour the mixture into a chilled glass.
Garnish with kiwi slices.

name: Kiwi Gin Fizz
ingredients: Kiwi slices and lime wheel for garnish
instructions: In a blender, blend the sliced kiwis until smooth. Strain the puree through a fine mesh sieve to remove the seeds.
In a cocktail shaker, combine the kiwi puree, gin, fresh lime juice, and simple syrup. Add ice and shake well until chilled.
Strain the mixture into a glass filled with ice. Top with club soda and gently stir.
Garnish with kiwi slices and a lime wheel.

name: Kiwi Lemon Drop
ingredients: Lemon slice and kiwi slice for garnish
instructions: Rub a lemon slice around the rim of a cocktail glass.
Dip the rim into a plate of sugar to coat it evenly.
In a cocktail shaker, muddle the sliced kiwi until well mashed.
Add vodka, triple sec, simple syrup, and lemon juice to the shaker.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously for about 15-20 seconds until well chilled.
Strain the mixture into the prepared glass.
Garnish with a lemon slice and a kiwi slice on the rim.
Serve immediately and enjoy your refreshing Kiwi Lemon Drop cocktail.

name: Kiwi Paloma
ingredients: Lime wheel or kiwi slice for garnish
instructions: Peel and chop 1-2 ripe kiwis.
Blend the kiwi pieces in a blender or food processor until smooth.
Fill a cocktail shaker with ice cubes.
Add 2 oz silver tequila, 1 oz freshly squeezed lime juice, 1 oz kiwi puree, and 0.5 oz simple syrup to the shaker.
Shake vigorously until well-chilled.
Fill a glass with ice cubes.
Strain the shaken mixture into the glass.
Top off with 2 oz grapefruit soda.
Stir gently to combine.
Garnish with a lime wheel or kiwi slice.
Enjoy your refreshing Kiwi Paloma.

name: Kiwi Spritz
ingredients: Kiwi slices and mint sprigs for garnish
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, add the sliced kiwis and simple syrup.
Muddle them together until the kiwi is well mashed and the mixture is fragrant.
Add the vodka, elderflower liqueur, and fresh lime juice to the shaker.
Fill the shaker with ice cubes.
Shake well until the mixture is thoroughly chilled.
Strain the mixture into a glass filled with ice.
Top off the glass with club soda for a refreshing fizz.
Garnish with a slice of kiwi and a sprig of mint.
Serve immediately and enjoy your refreshing Kiwi Spritz.

name: Kiwi Vodka Lemonade
ingredients: Kiwi slices and lemon wheels for garnish
instructions: Prepare the Kiwi Juice: Peel and blend 2-3 kiwis until smooth. Strain the juice through a fine mesh sieve to remove the seeds and pulp.
Mix the Cocktail: In a cocktail shaker, combine the vodka, fresh kiwi juice, lemon juice, and simple syrup. Add ice cubes.
Shake: Shake the mixture vigorously for about 15-20 seconds until well chilled.
Serve: Fill a glass with ice cubes and pour the mixture over the ice. Top with club soda, depending on your preference.
Garnish: Garnish with kiwi slices and lemon wheels.
Enjoy: Stir gently and enjoy your refreshing Kiwi Vodka Lemonade.

name: Kiwi Vodka Sour
ingredients: Kiwi slice or lemon twist for garnish
instructions: Prepare the Kiwi: In a cocktail shaker, muddle the diced kiwis until well mashed and juicy.
Mix the Cocktail: Add the vodka, fresh lemon juice, and simple syrup to the shaker. Fill the shaker with ice cubes.
Shake: Shake well until the mixture is chilled, about 15-20 seconds.
Strain: Strain the mixture into a rocks glass filled with ice. If you prefer a smoother texture, you can double strain the mixture to remove the kiwi seeds and pulp.
Garnish: Garnish with a kiwi slice or a lemon twist.
Serve: Enjoy your refreshing Kiwi Vodka Sour.

name: Klondike Cocktail
instructions: In a blender, combine the vanilla vodka, light crème de cacao, white chocolate liqueur, vanilla ice cream, and a scoop of ice (optional).
Blend until smooth and creamy.
Pour the mixture into a serving glass.
Carefully squeeze the chocolate syrup over the top of the drink.
Allow the chocolate syrup to harden.
Serve and enjoy!

name: Kringle Krusher
instructions: Fill a highball or rocks glass with ice to keep the drink refreshingly cold.
Pour the whipped vodka and ginger ale over the ice. Stir gently to combine the flavors without losing the ginger ale's fizz.
Slowly pour the grenadine into the glass. Allow it to settle at the bottom for a layered effect, or stir lightly for an even color.
Top the drink with a maraschino cherry for a festive and decorative finishing touch.

name: LA Water
instructions: Fill a tall glass with ice to chill.
Pour in the vodka, gin, tequila, rum, triple sec, melon liqueur, raspberry liqueur, and blue curaçao. Add the sweet & sour mix.
Stir well to blend all the flavors and achieve that unique LA Water color.
Garnish with a fresh orange wedge and a cherry on top.

name: Lavender Sangria
ingredients: 16 oz Club Soda (choose your favorite flavor)
instructions: Combine sugar and water in a saucepan over medium heat. Stir until the sugar dissolves.
Add dried culinary lavender and bring to a simmer. Reduce heat and let simmer for about 2-3 minutes.
Remove from heat and add fresh lavender sprigs. Let the mixture steep for about 20 minutes for the flavors to infuse.
Strain the mixture to remove lavender particles, then set aside to cool.
In a large pitcher, combine the Pinot Grigio, Brandy, and Grand Marnier.
Stir in the Lavender Simple Syrup. Start with 1/3 cup and add more to taste.
Add sliced strawberries and frozen peaches to the pitcher.
Chill in the refrigerator for at least 4 hours, ideally overnight, to allow the flavors to meld.
Just before serving, stir in the club soda to add a refreshing fizz.
Serve over ice, garnishing with extra strawberries or a sprig of lavender if desired.

name: Lavender Tom Collins
ingredients: lemon wheel or lavender sprig  (for garnish)
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the lavender syrup, gin, lemon juice, and elderflower liqueur.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake it well.
Prepare your serving glass by layering it with ice and two lemon halves. Set aside.
Strain the mixture into the prepped glass.
Top with soda water.
Garnish with a lemon wheel or a few lavender sprigs and get ready to enjoy!

name: Leatherneck Cocktail
instructions: In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, add the whiskey, blue curaçao, and lime juice.
Shake vigorously for about 15 seconds to ensure the drink is well-mixed and properly chilled.
Strain the mixture into a chilled martini or coupe glass.
Place a lime wheel on the rim of the glass or float it in the drink for a simple yet elegant presentation.

name: Lemongrass Cooler
instructions: Add lemongrass rice vodka, Midori, green juice, lime juice, lemon simple syrup, and celery bitters to a cocktail shaker with ice.
Give the mixture a quick, vigorous shake.
Strain the mixture into a glass filled with fresh ice.
Gently top with a splash of elderflower tonic.
Garnish with a cucumber ribbon for a refreshing and elegant finish.

name: Leprechaun Lemonade
ingredients: 2 oz clear liquor (like vodka or gin)
Blue curaçao or other green food coloring
instructions: Fill your shaker with ice cubes.
Pour the clear liquor and lemonade into the shaker.
Add a splash of blue curaçao. This is what gives our drink its magical green color.
Shake well until the mixture is cold.
Strain the drink into your tall glass filled with ice.
Garnish with fresh mint leaves and a slice of lemon.

name: Lime Basil Mezcalita
ingredients: Bacon salt for the rim of the glass
instructions: Place lime wedges and basil leaves in the cocktail shaker and muddle them together to release their flavors.
Add Mezcal, lime juice, and agave syrup to the shaker, followed by a generous amount of ice. Shake vigorously until well chilled.
Moisten the rim of an old fashioned glass with a lime wedge, then dip the rim into bacon salt to coat it evenly.
Fill the glass with ice and strain the cocktail into the prepared glass.
Garnish with a lime wedge and a few basil leaves. Serve immediately.

name: Limoncello Lavender Cocktail
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice and add the limoncello, gin, lavender syrup, crème de violette, and lemon juice.
Shake vigorously until well-chilled.
Strain the mixture into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice and a lemon wedge.
Top with tonic water and stir gently.
Garnish with lemon wheels and lavender flowers.
Serve and enjoy!

name: Limoncello Whiskey Sour
ingredients: 1/2 oz lemon juice (juice from about 1/2 lemon)
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.
Add the whiskey, limoncello, and fresh lemon juice to the shaker.
Shake well until the mixture is well-chilled.
Strain the mixture into a rocks glass filled with ice.
Add a splash of club soda on top.
Garnish with a maraschino cherry and a lemon wedge.
Serve immediately and enjoy your refreshing Limoncello Whiskey Sour.

name: Liquid Marijuana
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.
Add all of the above ingredients to the shaker.
Shake the mixture for about 20-30 seconds.
Strain the mixture into a shot glass.

name: Lost Irish's Custom Maid
instructions: In a shaker, muddle the cucumber slices.
Add remaining ingredients and fill shaker with ice.
Shake vigorously, and fine-strain into a chilled rocks glass filled with ice.
Garnish with a cucumber slice

name: Love Potion Cocktail
instructions: Begin by filling your cocktail shaker with regular ice cubes. Add the vodka, peach schnapps, cranberry juice, and pomegranate juice.
Secure the lid on the shaker and shake vigorously until the shaker becomes cold to the touch, ensuring the ingredients are well mixed and chilled.
Pour the shaken cocktail into your glasses, leaving some room at the top.
Top off each glass with a splash of club soda to add a refreshing fizz.

If desired, use tongs to carefully place a pellet or two of dry ice into each glass. The dry ice will create a bubbling, smoky effect that adds a dramatic flair to your drink. Make sure the dry ice remains at the bottom of the glass; as long as it does, the drink is safe to consume.
Serve immediately while the drink is bubbling for a captivating presentation.

name: Lychee & Blackberry Martini
instructions: Add the gin, lychee liqueur, lime juice, simple syrup, and crème de mûre to a cocktail shaker filled with ice.
Shake well to combine and chill the mixture.
Strain the cocktail into a martini glass.
Garnish with fresh blackberries, lychee and serve.

name: Lynchburg Lemonade
ingredients: 1.5 ounces lemon juice (freshly squeezed is best)
instructions: Fill a highball glass or a mason jar with ice cubes to keep your drink chilled.
In the glass, combine 1.5 ounces of Jack Daniel's Tennessee Whiskey, 1.5 ounces of triple sec, and 1.5 ounces of fresh lemon juice. Stir well to mix the ingredients.
Top off the glass with 6 ounces of lemon-lime soda. Stir gently to combine everything without losing the fizz.
Garnish with a slice of lemon and a maraschino cherry on top. Optionally, you can add a sprig of mint for a touch of freshness.
Serve immediately and enjoy the refreshing taste of your Lynchburg Lemonade.

name: Maleficent Halloween Cocktail
instructions: In a large cocktail shaker, combine the vodka, raspberry liqueur, lime juice, silver edible glitter, and purple food coloring.
Shake the mixture vigorously to ensure all the ingredients are well combined and the silver edible glitter is evenly distributed.
Pour the mixture into a cocktail glass filled with ice.
Top off the drink by filling the remainder of the glass with lemon-lime soda.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Maleficent Halloween Cocktail!

name: Malibu Dragon Breeze
instructions: In a wine glass, add the blue curaçao and Malibu rum.
Fill the glass with crushed ice.
Using a bar spoon, slowly pour the dragonfruit juice over the back of the spoon to layer it on top of the rum and curaçao.
Garnish with fresh raspberries and a sprig of mint.
Serve immediately and enjoy!

name: Malibu Lagoon
instructions: Dip the rim of a wine glass in blue curaçao, then coat it with salt.
Fill the glass with ice.
Add Malibu rum, blue curaçao, and lime juice to the glass.
Top with Sprite and stir gently to combine.
Garnish with a lime wheel and a sprig of fresh mint.
Serve immediately and enjoy!

name: Malibu Mai Tai Cocktail
instructions: In a glass, combine the Malibu rum, amaretto, maraschino cherry juice, grenadine, sweet and sour mix, and pineapple juice.
Add ice to the glass and stir well to combine.
Garnish with fresh pineapple and a cherry.
Serve immediately and enjoy!

name: Malibu Passion Sunrise
instructions: In a highball glass, add the Malibu rum and passion fruit juice. Stir until well combined.
Slowly pour the grenadine down the side of the glass to create a layered effect.
Garnish with a maraschino cherry and serve immediately.

name: Mango Aperol Sour
ingredients: Garnish with a slice of mango
instructions: Pour the lemon juice, simple syrup, vodka, Aperol, mango purée, and egg white into a cocktail shaker.
Dry shake (shake without ice) the mixture vigorously to emulsify the egg white and create a frothy texture.
Add ice to the shaker and shake again until well chilled.
Strain the cocktail into a glass, using a fine mesh strainer if desired for an extra smooth finish.
Garnish with a slice of mango, a lemon twist, or a few drops of bitters for a decorative touch.

name: Mango Aperol Spritz
ingredients: 1 oz mango puree (fresh or from a can)
instructions: If you are using fresh mangoes, peel and dice the mango. Blend it in a blender until smooth. Strain it through a sieve to ensure a smooth texture. If you're using canned puree, it's ready to use.
In a shaker, combine the mango puree, Aperol, and vodka with a handful of ice cubes. Shake well until the mixture is well chilled.
Fill a glass with ice cubes. Strain the mixture from the shaker into the glass.
Gently top up the glass with Prosecco to maintain a nice fizz.
Garnish with a slice of mango and a sprig of mint on top.
Give the drink a gentle stir before serving.

name: Mango Bourbon Smash
ingredients: 1/2  ripe mango (peeled and chopped (or about 3 tablespoons of mango puree))
1/2 oz simple syrup (adjust based on the sweetness of the mango)
Garnish: mint sprig and/or a slice of mango
instructions: In a shaker, muddle the chopped mango and mint leaves to release the mint oils and create a mango mash. If you’re using mango puree, just stir it with the mint leaves to mix well.
To the shaker, add the bourbon, simple syrup, and lemon juice. Fill the shaker with ice, covering the liquid.
Shake vigorously for about 15 seconds to chill the mixture and mix the flavors.
Strain the cocktail into a rocks glass filled with ice. If you like a bit lighter drink, you can top it up with a splash of club soda.
Garnish with a mint sprig and a slice of mango on the rim of the glass.

name: Mango Paloma
ingredients: Mango wedge and lime wheel (for garnish)
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, muddle 4 oz of fresh mango until it is well mashed and juicy.
Add 2 oz of tequila, 0.5 oz of lime juice, and a pinch of salt to the shaker.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake well until the mixture is chilled.
Strain the mixture into a glass filled with ice.
Top off the drink with grapefruit soda, stirring gently to combine.
Garnish with a mango wedge and a lime wheel.
Serve immediately and enjoy your refreshing Mango Paloma.

name: Mango Rum Swizzle
instructions: In a double old fashioned glass, muddle the mint leaves with the simple syrup and lime juice to release the mint’s flavor.
Fill the glass halfway with crushed ice.
Pour in the white rum and mango juice.
Using a bar spoon, swizzle the ingredients by spinning the spoon between your palms until the mixture is well combined and frothy.
Add more crushed ice to fill the glass and top with 4 dashes of bitters.
Garnish with a fresh mint sprig and a lime wheel. Serve immediately.

name: Mango Tango
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, muddle the ripe mango with the hot agave syrup until well combined.
Add the whiskey, lemon juice, and egg white to the shaker. Shake it well without ice to emulsify the egg white and create a frothy texture.
Add ice to the shaker and shake again vigorously to chill the mixture.
Double strain the mixture into a glass over a large ice cube.
Garnish with a lemon wheel and get ready to enjoy!

name: Mango Whiskey Sour
instructions: Prepare the Mango Puree: In a blender, combine the mango chunks with a small amount of water and blend until smooth. You need enough puree to fill about half a cup.
Mix the Cocktail: In a shaker, add the mango puree, bourbon or whiskey, lemon juice, simple syrup, bitters, and egg white.
Dry Shake: First, shake the mixture without ice. This is to help the egg white become frothy and mix well with the other ingredients.
Add Ice: After the initial shake, add a handful of ice to the shaker.
Shake Again: Shake the mixture vigorously with the ice. This will chill the drink and ensure everything is well combined.
Strain and Serve: Strain the drink into a glass. Some people prefer using a fine mesh to make sure no ice or mango fibers end up in the drink.
Garnish (optional): You can garnish with a slice of mango or a twist of lemon peel for an extra touch.

name: Manhattan Project
instructions: Add Rye, Averna and Sherry into a mixing glass
Add ice
Stir
Strain into a chilled Nick & Nora glass
Express orange oil and discard peel
Garnish with a Luxardo Cherry

name: Manhattan
ingredients: 2 oz. Whiskey (preferably rye for its spicy character)
instructions: Fill your mixing glass with ice.
Pour the whiskey, sweet vermouth, and bitters over the ice.
Stir the mixture gently for about 30 seconds to chill and dilute the drink slightly.
Strain the cocktail into your chilled martini glass or over fresh ice in a rocks glass.
Garnish with a maraschino cherry.

name: Manzanasada
ingredients: Spice sugar for rimming the glass
instructions: Rim the edge of a Collins glass with spice sugar. Fill the glass with ice and set it aside.
In a cocktail shaker, combine the blanco tequila, mezcal, apple cider, and freshly squeezed lemon juice. Add ice to the shaker and shake until the mixture is well-chilled.
Strain the mixture into the prepared Collins glass.
Top the cocktail with chilled ginger beer for a refreshing fizz. Garnish with diced red apples for a festive touch.
Serve immediately and savor the layered flavors of this autumn-inspired cocktail.

name: Maple Apple Toddy
instructions: In a saucepan, combine the water, maple syrup, nutmeg, cinnamon, and diced apple.
Heat the mixture over medium heat for 3-5 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld.
Pour the hot mixture into a mug.
Add the bourbon and stir to combine.
Garnish with an apple slice for a touch of elegance.
Serve immediately and enjoy the warm, comforting flavors of this maple-infused toddy.

name: Maple Bacon Old Fashioned
instructions: Pour the bourbon, maple syrup, and both bitters in a cocktail mixing glass filled with ice.
Stir until well-chilled.
Strain the mixture into an Old Fashioned glass over a large hunk of ice.
Garnish with a slice of bacon and cocktail cherries.

name: Maple Bourbon Harvest
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine bourbon, lemon juice, apple cider, and maple syrup.
Shake the mixture well to blend the flavors.
Prepare your serving glass by adding a layer of ice and placing a lemon wheel on top.
Add more ice, another lemon wheel, and top off with additional ice. Set the glass aside.
Strain the shaken mixture into the prepared glass.
Garnish with a sprig of rosemary. For an extra touch, briefly ignite the rosemary sprig to release its aromatic oils.
Enjoy your aromatic and flavorful cocktail!

name: Maple Bourbon Pecan Pie
instructions: Fill a rocks glass with ice.
Pour the bourbon, Evangeline Pecan Praline liqueur, and maple syrup over the ice.
Stir gently until all the ingredients are well combined and chilled.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Maple Bourbon Pecan Pie!

name: Maple-Bourbon Smash
instructions: In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, pour the bourbon, maple syrup, and lemon juice.
Stir the mixture until thoroughly chilled and well combined.
Strain the drink into a double old-fashioned glass with a large ice cube.
Garnish with a lemon twist for a touch of citrusy aroma.
Serve immediately and enjoy the smooth, sweet, and citrusy flavors of this Maple-Bourbon Smash.

name: Maple Cranberry Bourbon
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice and add the bourbon, cranberry juice, and maple syrup.
Shake vigorously until well-chilled.
Strain the mixture into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with a splash of club soda for a refreshing finish.
Garnish with maple cranberries and a sprig of rosemary to enhance the festive presentation.

name: Maple Ginger Hot Toddy
instructions: In a heatproof glass or mug, muddle the ginger slices to release their flavor.
Add the cinnamon stick, star anise pods, and the tea bag to the glass.
Pour the whiskey and maple syrup into the glass over the spices and tea.
Pour hot water over the ingredients in the glass, filling it to your desired level.
Let the mixture steep for 3-4 minutes, allowing the flavors to infuse.
After steeping, add the lemon juice and give the drink a gentle stir.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Maple Ginger Hot Toddy!

name: Maple Leaf
instructions: Start by filling a cocktail shaker with ice cubes.
Add the Canadian whisky, lemon juice, and maple syrup to the shaker.
Shake vigorously until the mixture is well-chilled and fully combined.
Strain the cocktail into a chilled cocktail glass.
Serve immediately and enjoy the rich flavors of this classic cocktail.

name: Maple Margarita
instructions: Rim the edge of a coupe glass with salt by moistening it with lime juice and dipping it in salt on a small plate.
In a cocktail shaker, combine tequila, orange liqueur, mezcal, maple syrup, and lime juice.
Add ice to the shaker and shake vigorously until the mixture is well-chilled.
Strain the mixture into the prepared coupe glass.
Garnish with a maple leaf for a festive touch.

name: Maple Paloma
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice, then add the grapefruit juice, lime juice, tequila, and maple syrup.
Shake vigorously until the cocktail is thoroughly chilled.
Pour the granulated maple sugar onto a plate. Take one half of the grapefruit slice and rub it around the rim of a cocktail glass. Dip the rim into the maple sugar to coat it evenly.
Strain the shaken Maple Paloma into the prepared glass.
Top the cocktail with sparkling water, adding a fizzy finish.
Garnish with the remaining grapefruit slice and enjoy immediately.

name: Maple Pumpkin Flip
instructions: Add the pumpkin ale, apple brandy, rye whiskey, maple syrup, and whole egg into a cocktail shaker.
Dry-shake the mixture (without ice) vigorously to combine the ingredients and emulsify the egg.
Add ice to the shaker and shake again until the mixture is well-chilled.
Strain the cocktail into a coupe glass.
Garnish with freshly grated nutmeg and serve immediately.

name: Maple Whiskey Sour
instructions: If using the egg white, begin by adding the whiskey and egg white to a cocktail shaker. Shake vigorously without ice (dry shake) until the egg white becomes very frothy.
Add the lemon juice, maple syrup, bitters, and a handful of ice to the shaker.
Shake for a few seconds to combine and chill the drink.
Strain the mixture into a glass over ice.
Serve immediately and enjoy the rich, frothy flavors of this delightful Maple Whiskey Sour.

name: Maraschino Sunset
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the vodka, Cointreau, maraschino liqueur, and pear liqueur with ice.
Shake vigorously until the mixture is well-chilled.
Strain the cocktail into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Add a dash of grenadine, letting it swirl gently into the drink.
Garnish with fresh mint leaves before serving.

name: Margarita Milkshake
ingredients: 1 ounce orange liqueur or triple sec
instructions: Blend Ingredients: In a blender, combine the vanilla ice cream, silver tequila, orange liqueur, and lime juice.
Blend until Smooth: Blend on high until the mixture is smooth and creamy.
Serve: Pour the milkshake into a chilled glass.
Garnish (optional): Garnish with a lime wedge or a sprinkle of salt on the rim of the glass.

name: Marshmallow Web Chocolate Cocktail
instructions: In a mixing glass, combine the chocolate liqueur, vodka, and milk (or cream). Stir well to blend the ingredients.
Pour the mixture into a rocks glass.
In a microwave-safe bowl, heat the jumbo marshmallow for about 30 seconds until it puffs up. Stir briefly and allow it to cool slightly.

Using your thumb and forefinger, pick up some of the melted marshmallow and carefully stretch it across the top of the glass to create a "web." Repeat this process until you have created enough webbing to cover the top of the glass.
Garnish with candy spider sprinkles for an extra spooky touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy the rich, sweet flavors of this fun and festive chocolate cocktail!

name: Meet Me at Midnight Champagne Cocktail
instructions: Prepare the Glass:
Pour a small amount of corn syrup onto a plate.
On a separate plate, spread out the gold sprinkles.
Dip the rim of your champagne flute first into the corn syrup, ensuring it's lightly coated. Then, dip it into the gold sprinkles, creating a decorative gold rim around the top of your glass.
Layer the Cocktail:
Carefully pour the grenadine into the bottom of your prepared glass, using a spoon or pouring it down the side of the glass to minimize mixing.
Slowly add the blue curaçao liqueur over the back of a spoon or by pouring it down the side of the glass to maintain distinct layers.
Add the Champagne:
Gently pour the champagne over the back of a spoon or along the side of the glass to preserve the layered effect. Aim for a gentle pour to keep the fizz and maintain the layers as much as possible.
Final Touch:

The champagne will mix with the blue curaçao and grenadine, creating a beautiful midnight rain effect in the glass. The colors should blend slightly, but you'll get to enjoy the beautiful gradient from the bottom to the top of the glass.
Enjoy:
Serve immediately and enjoy the magical, bubbly sensation of the "Midnight Rain" cocktail, inspired by the enchanting themes of Taylor Swift's music.

name: Melon Basil Breeze
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, muddle a few pieces of honeydew melon with the Midori.
Add vodka, simple syrup, basil leaves, and lime juice to the shaker.
Shake with ice to combine and chill the ingredients.
Strain the shaken mixture into the prepared glass.
Add ice to glass and top off the cocktail with club soda.
Garnish with skewered melon spheres and a sprig of basil.
Enjoy your refreshing drink!

name: Mermaid Lemonade
ingredients: 4 inch round piece of blue cotton candy (optional)
instructions: In a shaker, combine the pineapple juice and orange juice.
Add the white rum and blue Curaçao to the shaker.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake well until the mixture is chilled.
Fill a tall glass with ice. Strain the mixture from the shaker into the glass.
Pour the lemonade into the glass, giving it a gentle stir to combine.
If using turquoise luster dust, add it now and stir gently to distribute the shimmer.
Garnish the drink with a pineapple wedge and a maraschino cherry.
For a fun twist, place the blue cotton candy on top of the glass. Pour a bit of lemonade over it to dissolve and add sweetness to the drink.

name: Mermaid Rum Punch
instructions: Measure out all your ingredients: spiced rum, coconut rum, blue curacao, pineapple juice, and lime juice.
Slice a large lime into wheels for garnish.
Fill a cocktail shaker halfway with ice.
Pour the spiced rum, coconut rum, blue curacao, pineapple juice, and lime juice into the shaker.
Secure the lid on the shaker.
Shake vigorously for about 15-20 seconds. This helps to chill the drink and mix the flavors well.
Fill a tall glass with ice.
Strain the mixture from the shaker into the glass.
Place a lime wheel on the rim of the glass for a refreshing touch.
Give your drink a gentle stir.
Sip and enjoy the tropical flavors of your Mermaid Rum Punch!

name: Mermaid Water
instructions: Mix the Rums and Juices: In a shaker filled with ice, combine the spiced rum, coconut rum, pineapple juice, and lime juice.
Shake: Shake well until the mixture is chilled.
Prepare the Glass: Fill a glass with ice to prepare for serving.
Pour: Strain the mixture from the shaker into the prepared glass over the ice.
Add a Splash of Color: Top the drink with a splash of blue curaçao to give it a beautiful, ocean-like color.
Garnish (optional): You can garnish with a slice of lime or a pineapple wedge to enhance the tropical feel.
Serve and Enjoy: Serve immediately and enjoy your refreshing Mermaid Water cocktail!

name: Merry Berry Bourbon Cocktail
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice cubes.
Add blackberry liqueur, bourbon, cranberry juice, lemon juice, and simple syrup to the shaker.
Shake vigorously for about 15–20 seconds until the mixture is well chilled.
Strain into a glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a fresh blackberry and a lemon wedge before serving.

name: Merry Margarita
instructions: In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, combine the tequila, orange liqueur, lime juice, pomegranate juice, and coconut milk.
Shake well until the mixture is thoroughly chilled and slightly frothy.
Strain the cocktail into a rocks glass filled with ice.
Garnish with a few pomegranate arils and a sprig of rosemary for a festive touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy the holiday flavors!

name: Mexican Firing Squad
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the pineapple jalapeño tequila, tequila blanco, lime juice, grenadine, and aromatic bitters.
Add cubed ice to the shaker and shake until well-chilled.
Strain the mixture into a rocks glass filled with fresh cracked ice.
Garnish with a lime slice and serve immediately.

name: Mexican Sunset
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice and add the Amaretto, Peach Schnapps, silver tequila, and pineapple juice.
Cover the shaker with the lid and shake vigorously until the mixture is well combined and the shaker feels cold to the touch.
Fill a tall glass with ice and pour the tequila cocktail mixture into the glass, leaving just enough room for the grenadine.
Slowly pour the grenadine down the side of the glass, allowing it to settle at the bottom and create a beautiful sunset effect.
Garnish the cocktail with a slice of lime and three maraschino cherries skewered on a cocktail toothpick.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Mexican Sunset!

name: Mezcal Blue Moon
ingredients: Blue edible glitter (for a magical touch)
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the mezcal, blue curaçao, lime juice, and simple syrup.
Add ice to the shaker and shake vigorously until well-chilled, about 15 seconds.
Strain the mixture into a goblet filled with ice.
For the finishing touch, sprinkle a pinch of blue edible glitter over the top for a shimmering, magical effect.
Serve and enjoy your Mezcal Blue Moon, an enchanting cocktail sure to light up any occasion!

name: Mezcal Mule
ingredients: Lime Wedge or Candied Ginger Garnish (optional)
instructions: Fill a copper mug or rocks glass with ice.
Add mezcal and lime juice to the glass.
Top the glass with ginger beer and stir gently.
Garnish with a lime wedge or candied ginger, if desired.

name: Mezcal Negroni
ingredients: Orange twist or orange peel (for garnish)
instructions: Fill a cocktail mixing glass or mason jar with fresh ice.
Add the mezcal, Campari, and sweet vermouth to the mixing glass.
Stir the ingredients with a bar spoon until they are well combined and chilled.
Strain the mixture into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with an orange twist or orange peel.

name: Mezcal Paloma
instructions: Rub a lime wedge around the rim of a highball glass.
Dip the rim in a mixture of Tajín and salt to coat.
Add the mezcal and lime juice to the glass.
Fill the glass with ice.
Top with grapefruit soda and stir briefly and gently to combine.
Garnish with a lime wedge and serve immediately.

name: Mezcal Passion Fruit Cocktail
ingredients: 2 oz mezcal (or 1 oz mezcal and 1 oz tequila for a slightly different twist)
Juice and pulp from 1 large passion fruit
½ oz agave syrup (adjust sweetness to taste)
Garnish: Lime wheel (passion fruit half, and a pineapple frond)
instructions: Cut the passion fruit in half and scoop out the pulp and seeds into a shaker.
Add the mezcal (or mezcal and tequila), lime juice, and agave syrup to the shaker.
Fill the shaker with ice, covering the liquid and fruit pulp.
Secure the lid on the shaker and shake vigorously for about 15-20 seconds to chill the mixture and blend the flavors.
Strain the mixture into a chilled cocktail glass. You can choose to double strain if you prefer to keep the seeds out of your drink.
Garnish with a lime wheel, a fresh half of passion fruit, and a pineapple frond for a tropical look.
Serve immediately and enjoy the exotic blend of smoky, tangy, and sweet flavors.

name: Mezcalita
instructions: Start by salting the rim of your rocks glass. Rub a lime wedge around the edge and dip it into salt.
In your shaker, combine mezcal, lime juice, orange liqueur, and agave syrup with ice.
Shake well until the outside of the shaker feels cold.
Strain the mix into your prepared glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a lime wedge. Enjoy your Mezcalita!

name: Miami Margarita
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the reposado tequila, blue curaçao, orange juice, pineapple juice, lime juice, and jalapeño agave syrup.
Add ice to the shaker and shake vigorously until well-chilled.
Strain the mixture into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with an orange peel and serve immediately.

name: Midnights Martini
ingredients: Lavender sprigs and/or blueberries for garnish
instructions: Step 1: Combine your gin, Cointreau, lemon juice, vermouth, absinthe, and creme de violette in a cocktail shaker with ice.Step 2: Shake hard and strain into a chilled martini or coupe glass.Step 3: Garnish and serve.

name: Mind Eraser Shot
instructions: Fill a rocks glass with ice.
Add coffee liqueur to the glass.
Using a bar spoon, slowly layer vodka over the coffee liqueur.
Carefully use the bar spoon to layer club soda to the top of the glass.
Grab a straw and chug the shot in one swift, exhilarating motion.

name: Mint Hot Chocolate
ingredients: 6 oz Hot Chocolate (prepared and kept hot)
instructions: Prepare your favorite hot chocolate using milk or water, ensuring it stays warm.
Pour the spearmint vodka into a mug, then carefully add the hot chocolate. Stir gently to blend the flavors.
Top the drink with a generous swirl of whipped cream for a creamy, indulgent finish.
Garnish with colorful sprinkles or mint sprig for a festive and cheerful touch.

name: Mint Sour
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the gin, crème de menthe, lemon juice, simple syrup, and egg white.
Dry shake (without ice) vigorously to emulsify the egg white.
Add ice to the shaker and shake again until well-chilled.
Strain the mixture into an ice-filled glass.
Garnish with a fresh mint leaf, lemon peel, and 3 drops of bitters.
Serve immediately and enjoy!
