name: Mistletoe Kiss Cocktail
instructions: In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, combine the vodka, lemon juice, and rosemary simple syrup.
Cover and shake well until the ingredients are thoroughly chilled and mixed.
Fill a rocks glass with ice, then strain the mixture from the shaker into the glass.
Top with a splash of club soda for a bubbly finish.
Garnish with a few fresh cranberries and place the rosemary sprig in the glass for a festive drink.

name: Mistletoe Manhattan
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.
Add the whiskey, maraschino cherry juice, cranberry juice, sweet vermouth, and Angostura bitters to the shaker.
Gently shake or stir the mixture a few times to combine and chill the ingredients.
Strain the cocktail into a chilled glass.
Garnish with a maraschino cherry, cranberries, and a sprig of rosemary for a festive presentation.
Serve immediately and enjoy!

name: Mistletoe Margarita
instructions: Rim a rocks glass with lime juice, then dip the rim into sugar to create a frosted effect. Fill the glass with ice and set aside.
In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, combine tequila, cranberry juice, triple sec, agave syrup, and lime juice.
Shake vigorously until well-chilled, then strain the mixture into the prepared glass over fresh ice.
Add a few fresh cranberries and a sprig of rosemary for a festive and aromatic finishing touch. Serve immediately.

name: Mistletoe Martini
instructions: Begin by filling a cocktail shaker halfway with ice.
Measure and add the vodka, elderflower liqueur, cranberry juice, and simple syrup to the shaker.
Secure the shaker lid and shake vigorously until the mixture is well chilled.
Using a strainer, pour the cocktail into a chilled martini glass.
Garnish with a few fresh cranberries and float mint leaves on the surface for a festive touch.

name: Mistletoe Mintini
instructions: In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, add the Irish cream, green crème de menthe, and white crème de cacao.
Shake vigorously until the mixture is well-chilled and frosty.
Strain the cocktail into a chilled coupe glass.
Garnish with a fresh mint sprig and sprinkled with cinnamon powder (optional) for a festive, aromatic finish.
Serve immediately and enjoy the Mistletoe Mintini—a creamy, minty delight perfect for holiday celebrations!

name: Mocha Espresso Martini
ingredients: 1 ounce coffee liqueur (you can use Kahlúa)
Coffee beans or grated chocolate (for garnish)
instructions: Chill Your Martini Glass:
Begin by placing your martini glass in the freezer for a few minutes to chill. This step ensures your drink stays cold longer.
Mix the Ingredients:
In a cocktail shaker, combine the vodka, coffee liqueur, chocolate liqueur, and freshly brewed espresso.
Fill the shaker with ice.
Shake It Up:
Seal the shaker tightly and shake vigorously for about 15 seconds. The shaking process chills the drink and creates a little froth from the espresso.
Strain and Serve:
Strain the mixture into your chilled martini glass. Ensure to leave the ice behind in the shaker.
Garnish:
For a finishing touch, garnish your Mocha Espresso Martini with a few coffee beans or a sprinkle of grated chocolate on top.
Enjoy:
Serve immediately and enjoy the rich flavors of your Mocha Espresso Martini!

name: Mocha Tequila Twist
instructions: Begin by preparing your martini glass. Dip half of the rim in caramel, then roll it in chocolate shavings to coat evenly. Place the glass in the freezer to set while you prepare the cocktail.
In a shaker tin, combine the freshly brewed espresso, Reposado Tequila, and brown sugar. Stir thoroughly to ensure the sugar melts and blends with the liquid.
Add the coffee liqueur, orange liqueur, and a handful of ice to the shaker.
Shake the mixture well to chill and blend the ingredients, ensuring a smooth and balanced cocktail.
Remove the prepared martini glass from the freezer and strain the mixture into the glass.
Garnish with a dried orange wheel for an elegant and aromatic touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Mocha Tequila Twist!

name: Mojito Margarita
ingredients: Lime wedge and mint sprig (for garnish)
instructions: Coat the rim of a glass with simple syrup and dip it into salt for a salted rim.
In the bottom of the rocks glass, muddle the mint leaves, lime juice, and simple syrup until fragrant.
Add the tequila to the muddled mixture.
Fill the glass with ice and top with club soda.
Stir gently to combine.
Garnish with fresh mint leaves and a lime wedge.
Serve and enjoy!

name: Monsters Inc
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice, then add the vodka, melon liqueur, limoncello, lime juice, and simple syrup.
Shake well for about 15 seconds until the mixture is thoroughly chilled.
Strain the cocktail into a glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a candy eyeball for a fun, monster-themed presentation.
Serve and enjoy your Monsters Inc cocktail, a zesty and delightful tribute to the lovable one-eyed character!

name: Montenegro Breeze
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the lemon juice, simple syrup, light rum, crème de cassis, Amaro Montenegro, and egg white.
Shake the mixture vigorously without ice to emulsify the egg white, creating a smooth and frothy texture.
Add ice to the shaker and shake until the mixture is well chilled.
Double strain the mixture using a fine mesh strainer into a rocks glass over a large ice cube, ensuring a smooth and velvety finish.
To enhance the rosemary’s aroma, gently fluff the sprig by rubbing it between your fingers, then place it atop the foam as a fragrant garnish.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Montenegro Breeze cocktail!

name: Mrs. Claus Vodka Punch
instructions: Add the raspberry vodka, cointreau, pomegranate juice, and sweet & sour mix to a cocktail shaker.
Fill the shaker with ice, secure the lid, and shake vigorously for 15–20 seconds until well-mixed and thoroughly chilled.
Strain the cocktail into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with a few pomegranate seeds, a rosemary sprig, and lightly dust with powdered sugar to resemble a fresh snowfall.
Serve immediately and toast to a festive season!

name: Mrs. Claus's Eggnog
instructions: Mix equal parts cinnamon and sugar on a small plate. Moisten the rim of a rocks glass or festive mug with water or eggnog, then dip the rim into the cinnamon sugar mixture to coat.
In a shaker filled with ice, combine eggnog, Cinnamon Whiskey, RumChata, and a splash of half and half.
Shake gently to mix and chill the ingredients.
Strain the mixture into the prepared glass, either over ice or served straight up.
Garnish with a cinnamon stick for stirring and an aromatic touch.

name: Mudslide
ingredients: Chocolate shavings or chocolate syrup for garnish
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice cubes.
Add  vodka, coffee liqueur,  Baileys Irish cream, and heavy cream to the shaker.
Shake the mixture well until it's chilled and frothy.
Strain the mixture into a rocks glass filled with ice.
Garnish with chocolate shavings or chocolate syrup.
If you prefer a frozen mudslide, you can blend the ingredients with ice in a blender instead of shaking them in a cocktail shaker.
You can also add a scoop of vanilla ice cream to the blender for a creamier and richer drink.

name: Naughty but Nice Christmas Cocktail
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Add rye whiskey, orange juice, ginger syrup, and cranberry juice.
Shake vigorously for 15–20 seconds to fully combine and chill the ingredients.
Strain the mixture into a highball or rocks glass filled with ice. Top with club soda, gently stirring to mix.
Add an orange slice and a few fresh cranberries for a festive finish.

name: Naughty Elf Cocktail
instructions: Prepare the glass by adding a few ice cubes to your glass.
In a mixing glass or directly in the serving glass, combine the pomegranate liqueur, orange liqueur, spiced rum, cranberry juice, and grapefruit juice. Stir gently to blend.
Pour Sprite over the mixture for a touch of fizz.
Add a candy cane for a festive, holiday-themed garnish.
Serve immediately and enjoy the Naughty Elf Cocktail—a spirited and colorful addition to your holiday festivities!

name: Necromancer
ingredients: ¾ oz freshly squeezed lemon juice
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.
Add the absinthe, elderflower liqueur, Lillet Blanc, London dry gin, and freshly squeezed lemon juice to the shaker.
Shake the mixture vigorously until it is well-chilled.
Using a Hawthorne strainer, strain the mixture into a chilled coupe glass.
Garnish the cocktail with a twist of lemon.

name: Negroni Sbagliato
ingredients: 1 1/2 ounces Prosecco or other sparkling wine
Orange peel or slice for garnish
instructions: Fill a rocks glass with ice and set it aside.
In a cocktail shaker or pitcher, combine the sweet vermouth and Campari.
Add ice to the shaker or pitcher and stir to combine and chill the mixture.
Strain the mixture into the prepared rocks glass.
Top the drink with Prosecco or other sparkling wine.
Garnish the drink with an orange slice or peel.

name: Negroni
instructions: Fill your mixing glass with ice cubes.
Pour the gin, Campari, and sweet vermouth over the ice.
Stir well for about 30 seconds to chill and mix the ingredients.
Strain the drink into an old-fashioned glass filled with large ice cubes.
Garnish with a twist of orange peel.

name: Negroski
instructions: Fill a mixing glass with ice cubes.
Add 1 oz of vodka, 1 oz of sweet vermouth, and 1 oz of Campari to the mixing glass.
Stir the mixture for about 30 seconds until it's well-chilled.
Strain the mixture into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice cubes.
Garnish the drink with an orange peel or slice.

name: New York Sour Shot
instructions: Combine Ingredients: In a shaker, combine the rye whiskey or bourbon, lemon juice, simple syrup, and egg white (if using).
Dry Shake: If using egg white, dry shake (without ice) for about 10-15 seconds to emulsify the egg white.
Add Ice: Add ice to the shaker and shake again until well-chilled.
Strain: Strain the mixture into a shot glass.
Float the Red Wine: Gently pour the red wine over the back of a spoon to float it on top of the shot.
Serve: Serve immediately and enjoy your New York Sour Shot.

name: New York Sour
ingredients: 15 ml Red wine (a dry, robust wine like Malbec or Shiraz works well)
instructions: Dry Shake: In a shaker, combine the whiskey, fresh lemon juice, simple syrup, and egg white. Shake the mixture without ice for about 10-15 seconds. This is known as a "dry shake" and it helps to emulsify the egg white, creating that desired frothiness.
Shake with Ice: Add ice to the shaker and continue to shake the mixture until well chilled, about another 15 seconds.
Strain: Strain the cocktail into a rocks glass filled with ice.

Add the Wine: Using the back of a spoon, gently pour the red wine over the concoction. As with the classic version, aim to have the wine float on top of the drink for a layered effect. To achieve this, place the spoon upside down, close to the drink's surface, and slowly pour the wine over it.
Garnish: Garnish with a lemon wheel or cherry if desired.
Enjoy: Relish in the smooth and frothy texture of your New York Sour, complemented by the rich depth of the red wine.

name: Nuclear Zombie
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice and add the mandarin vodka, sour apple mix, lime juice, and optional green food coloring.
Shake the mixture briskly two times to combine and chill.
Strain into a highball glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with ginger ale and stir gently to combine.
Serve and enjoy your zesty, electrifying drink!

name: Nutty Irishman
instructions: Brew a cup of hot coffee and pour it into an old-fashioned glass.
In a cocktail shaker, add Frangelico hazelnut liqueur, Baileys Irish Cream, and Irish whiskey.
Add ice to the shaker and shake until the mixture is well combined.
Pour the mixture into the glass with hot coffee.
Top with whipped cream and sprinkle some nutmeg on top of the whipped cream for garnish.

name: Oak Smoked Old Fashioned
instructions: Place a handful of oak wood chips in a smoker or a smoking gun.
Light the chips until they begin to smoke.
Capture the smoke in an empty Old Fashioned glass by inverting the glass over the smoke source.
Allow the smoke to infuse the glass for about 30 seconds. Then, flip the glass back over.
Place one orange slice in the smoked glass.
Gently muddle the orange slice to release its juices and oils.
Add 1/2 oz of maple syrup and 3 dashes of orange bitters to the glass.
Pour in 2 oz of bourbon.
Add a large ice cube to the glass.
Stir the mixture gently for about 20-30 seconds until well chilled.
Garnish with the second orange slice.
Enjoy your Oak Smoked Old Fashioned.

name: Ocean Mist
instructions: Pour the blue curaçao into the bottom of a coupe glass.
In a cocktail shaker, add the silver tequila, apricot brandy, lemon juice, egg white, and sea salt. Dry shake (without ice) vigorously to emulsify the egg white.
Add ice to the shaker and shake again until well-chilled.
Strain the mixture into the prepared coupe glass, letting it layer over the blue curaçao.
Garnish with an orange twist and serve immediately.

name: Ocean Water Cocktail
instructions: Rim a glass with colored sugar by dipping it in water or simple syrup, then rolling it in the sugar.
Fill the glass with ice.
In a shaker, combine coconut rum, blue curaçao, pineapple juice, and coconut water. Shake well.
Pour the mixture into the prepared glass.
Serve and enjoy!

name: Old Fashioned Paloma
ingredients: Squeeze of a lemon or lime wedge (optional but recommended to balance sweetness)
instructions: Prepare the Glass: Fill a highball glass or a large tumbler with ice to chill.
Mix the Ingredients:
Pour 2 oz of bourbon over the ice.
Add 2 dashes of Angostura bitters.
If you’re using a lemon or lime wedge, squeeze it into the glass now. This adds a fresh zesty note that complements the grapefruit soda.
Add the Soda: Slowly pour 4-6 oz of grapefruit soda over the bourbon mix, depending on your taste preference. The amount of soda can alter the strength and sweetness of your drink.
Stir Gently: Stir the mix gently to combine the flavors without losing too much carbonation from the soda.
Garnish (optional): Add a slice of grapefruit or a twist of lime or lemon on the rim of the glass for an extra touch of flair and flavor.

name: How to Make an Old Pal
instructions: Fill a mixing glass with ice.
Add 1 oz of rye whiskey, 1 oz of Campari, and 1 oz of dry vermouth to the mixing glass.
Stir the ingredients until well-chilled, for about 10-15 seconds. Be careful not to over-dilute the drink.
Strain the mixture into a chilled coupe glass.
Garnish with a lemon twist or peel.

name: Olive Garden Italian Rum Punch
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with 1 cup of ice.
Add the sour mix, amaretto, strawberry passion syrup, and Bacardi Superior rum to the shaker.
Shake vigorously until the mixture is well-chilled.
Fill a highball glass two-thirds full with ice.
Strain the rum punch into the prepared glass.
Garnish with an lime wedge and strawberry. Serve immediately.

name: Olive Garden Limoncello Lemonade
instructions: In a blender, combine the citrus vodka, limoncello liqueur, lemonade, lemon syrup, and 1 cup of ice.
Blend on high speed until the ice is crushed and the drink reaches a slushy consistency.
If needed, add more ice to achieve the desired texture.
Pour the slushy mixture into a highball glass.
Garnish with a thin slice of lemon on the rim and serve immediately.

name: Orange Bourbon Smash
ingredients: ½ oz Grand Marnier (or Triple Sec or another orange liqueur of your choice)
A few dashes of Angostura bitters
instructions: Muddle the Mandarin: In a shaker, muddle the mandarin segments to release their juice and essential oils. You want to break them down well to blend the flavors into the drink.
Add Liquids: Pour the Bourbon, Grand Marnier, sweet Vermouth, and a few dashes of Angostura bitters into the shaker.
Shake: Fill the shaker with ice, covering the liquid. Secure the lid and shake vigorously for about 15 seconds to chill and mix the ingredients thoroughly.
Strain and Serve: Strain the mixture into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice. The straining helps remove the mandarin pulp, leaving you with a clear, smooth cocktail.
Garnish: Optionally, garnish with a sprig of mint or a wheel of mandarin on the rim of the glass for an extra touch of flair.
Enjoy: Serve immediately and enjoy the vibrant, citrusy notes of your Orange Bourbon Smash.

name: Orange Creamsicle Cocktail
instructions: Add the whipped cream vodka, orange liqueur, orange juice, cream, and ice to a cocktail shaker.
Shake vigorously for at least 15-30 seconds to ensure a creamy consistency.
Pour all contents, including the ice, into your cocktail glass.
Add more ice as needed to fill the glass.
Garnish with a fresh orange slice.
Enjoy your Orange Creamsicle Cocktail!

name: Orange Fizz Halloween Cocktail
instructions: Start by rubbing the rim of a tall glass with a slice of fresh orange. Then, dip the rim into orange sanding sugar to coat it evenly.
Fill the glass about 3/4 full with fresh ice cubes.
Pour the orange juice and vodka over the ice.
Top off the drink with sparkling orange soda.
Using a long spoon or a bar spoon, gently stir the mixture until everything is well combined.
Garnish with a fresh orange slice and a sprig of mint if desired for a festive touch.
Serve chilled and enjoy your Orange Fizz Halloween Cocktail!

name: Orange Push-Pop
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the vodka, Licor 43, orange liqueur, cream, and orange juice.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake it well to chill and blend the ingredients.
Strain the mixture over fresh ice in your highball glass.
Garnish with a push-pop and get ready to enjoy!

name: Orange Sherbet Margarita
instructions: Rim your glass with salt by dipping the rim in lime juice and then into salt spread on a plate.
In a cocktail shaker, combine the blanco tequila, lime juice, orange sherbet, and agave syrup.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously to chill and thoroughly combine the ingredients.
Strain the mixture over fresh ice in the prepared glass.
Garnish with an orange slice or a twist of orange zest.
Enjoy your creamy and refreshing Orange Sherbet Margarita!

name: Outback Castaway Cocktail
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.
Add the mandarin vodka, passion fruit rum, coconut rum, pineapple juice, blood orange juice, simple syrup, and lemon juice to the shaker.
Shake well until thoroughly chilled.
Add ice cubes to a rocks glass.
Strain the cocktail into the prepared glass.
Garnish with a blood orange wedge and pineapple wedge, then serve immediately.

name: Paradise Cocktail
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine lemon juice, orgeat syrup, orange juice, blue curaçao, and vodka.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake well until the mixture is chilled.
Strain the cocktail into a glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a mint leaf, an orange slice, and a cherry for a tropical finish.

name: Passion Fruit Lemonade
instructions: In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, combine the vodka, yellow Chartreuse, passion fruit syrup, and lemon juice.
Shake well to mix and chill the ingredients.
Strain the mixture into a glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with club soda to add a fizzy, refreshing finish.
Garnish with a sprig of fresh basil to bring out the drink’s herbal notes.
Serve and enjoy the tropical and vibrant flavors of your Passion Fruit Lemonade!

name: Passion Fruit Whiskey Sour
instructions: Add the bourbon, passion fruit puree, lemon juice, simple syrup, and egg white into a cocktail shaker.
Shake the mixture without ice for about 15 seconds. This helps to emulsify the egg white, creating a frothy texture.
Add ice to the shaker and shake vigorously for another 20-30 seconds until the mixture is well-chilled.
Strain the cocktail into a rocks glass filled with ice.
Garnish with a Luxardo cherry.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Passion Fruit Whiskey Sour.

name: Passion Sunrise
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the gin, passion fruit pulp, orange juice, Aperol, simple syrup  and egg white.
Dry shake (without ice) vigorously to emulsify the egg white.
Add ice to the shaker and shake again until well-chilled.
Double strain the mixture into a chilled coupe glass.
Garnish with a slice passion fruit pulp and serve immediately.

name: Passionfruit Breeze
instructions: In a highball glass, add the scoops of passion fruit pulp.
Pour in the vodka, lime juice, and pineapple juice.
Fill the glass with crushed ice.
Top the drink with 1 oz of Aperol, allowing it to gently mix with the other ingredients.
Stir gently to combine the flavors.
Garnish with a lime wheel or passion fruit seeds for an extra tropical touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Passionfruit Breeze!

name: Passionfruit Margarita
instructions: Rub a lime around the rim of a rocks glass and dip it into tajin or a mix of chili powder, coarse salt, and lime zest to coat.
In a cocktail shaker, combine the passionfruit syrup, agave syrup, tequila, and lime juice.
Add ice and shake vigorously until well-chilled.
Strain the mixture into the prepared coupe glass filled with ice.
Garnish with a lime wheel and a sprig of fresh mint. For an optional kick, add 1-2 slices of jalapeño.

name: Patriotic Punch
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the whisky, lemon juice, hibiscus tea, simple syrup, Licor 43, and fee foam.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake it well to chill and combine the ingredients.
Strain the mixture over a large ice cube in your serving glass.
Garnish with a star sprinkles and you're ready to enjoy!

name: Peach and Basil Bourbon Smash
instructions: In the bottom of a cocktail shaker, muddle the peach slices and basil leaves together until they release their juices and flavors.
Add the bourbon, honey syrup, and lemon juice to the shaker, along with a handful of ice.
Secure the lid and shake vigorously until the mixture is well chilled and fully combined.
Strain the mixture into an old-fashioned glass filled with fresh ice.
Optionally, garnish with an additional peach slice or a sprig of basil for extra aroma and visual appeal. Serve immediately.

name: Peach Aperol Spritz
ingredients: 1 oz. peach liqueur or peach syrup
instructions: Begin by filling a wine glass with ice.
Pour in 3 oz. of Prosecco, 2 oz. of Aperol, 1 oz. of peach liqueur or syrup, and 1 oz. of club soda directly over the ice.
Give the drink a gentle stir to combine all the flavors.
Garnish the cocktail with 2-3 fresh peach slices.
Serve with a straw if desired, and enjoy your refreshing Peach Aperol Spritz. Cheers!

name: Peach Bourbon Arnold Palmer
instructions: Prepare the Glass:
Place the whiskey ball or fill the glass with crushed ice. This helps to chill the drink while slowly diluting it for a smooth taste.
Mix the Drinks:
In a cocktail shaker, combine the lemonade, sweet tea, bourbon, and peach liqueur. Shake well to mix all the ingredients thoroughly.
Add the Peach:
Add the sliced peach to the prepared glass. These slices not only add flavor but also enhance the visual appeal of the drink.
Pour the Mixture:
Strain the mixture from the shaker over the ice and peach slices in the glass. The straining helps to keep the drink smooth by removing any unwanted ice shards or pulp.
Garnish and Serve:
Garnish with a peach slice or sprig of mint. This not only adds a touch of elegance but also a fresh aroma that complements the peach and bourbon flavors.
Enjoy:
Stir gently before sipping to mix the flavors from the peach slices into the drink.

name: Peach Bourbon Lemonade
ingredients: peach slices and lemon wedges for garnish
instructions: Prepare the Glass: Fill a tall glass with ice cubes.
Mix the Ingredients: In a cocktail shaker, combine the bourbon, peach schnapps, fresh lemon juice, peach puree, and simple syrup.
Add ice to the shaker and shake vigorously for about 15 seconds until well chilled.
Pour and Top: Strain the mixture into the prepared glass over the ice.
Finish with Club Soda: Top off the glass with club soda, gently stirring to combine.
Garnish and Serve: Garnish with fresh peach slices and lemon wedges.
Add a mint sprig if desired for an extra touch of freshness.
Enjoy: Sip and savor your refreshing Peach Bourbon Lemonade!

name: Peach Bourbon Spritz
ingredients: Extra peach slices (fresh basil or mint sprigs (Optional garnishes))
instructions: In a large cocktail shaker, combine the peach syrup, lemon juice, and bourbon whiskey.
Fill the shaker with ice, then shake vigorously until the mixture is well-chilled.
Strain the mixture into the glass filled with fresh ice cubes.
Top the glass with club soda for a fizzy finish.
Garnish with extra peach slices and a sprig of fresh basil or mint if desired. Serve immediately.

name: Peach Bourbon Thyme Smash
ingredients: 2  sprigs fresh thyme (one stripped of leaves)
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the bourbon, lemon juice, and jalapeño simple syrup.
Cut the ripe peach in half, remove the pit, and squeeze the peach, smashing it in your hand over the martini shaker to release the juices. Allow any peach pieces that fall into the shaker to remain.
Add the leaves from one sprig of fresh thyme into the shaker.
Shake the mixture vigorously to ensure all the ingredients are well infused.
Fill a lowball glass with fresh ice and strain the bourbon mixture into the glass.
Garnish with a sprig of fresh thyme and a peach wedge if desired. Serve immediately and enjoy.

name: Peach Daiquiri
instructions: If using fresh peaches, start by muddling a few slices in the bottom of a cocktail shaker to release their juices and flavor.
Add the white rum, peach schnapps, lime juice, simple syrup, and orange juice to the shaker.
Add two handfuls of ice to the shaker, then secure the lid and shake vigorously until the mixture is well chilled.
Strain the cocktail into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a fresh peach slice if desired. Serve immediately and enjoy your refreshing Peach Daiquiri.

name: Peach Gimlet
instructions: Peel and pit a ripe peach.
Cut the peach into chunks and place them in a blender.
Blend until smooth.
Strain the puree through a fine mesh strainer to remove any solids.
Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.
Add 2 oz of gin, 1 oz of fresh lime juice, 1 oz of peach puree, and1/2 oz of simple syrup to the shaker.
Shake vigorously for about 15 seconds until well chilled.
Strain the mixture into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a fresh peach slice and a lime wheel.

name: Peach Gin Fizz
ingredients: Peach slices and blueberries for garnish
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.
Add peach simple syrup, gin, and a pinch of superfine sugar to the shaker.
Shake well until the mixture is chilled.
Strain the mixture into a highball glass filled with ice.
Top off the drink with club soda.
Garnish with peach slices and blueberries.

name: Peach Ginger Bourbon
instructions: Tear the mint leaves with your hands and place them into a cocktail shaker. Lightly muddle the mint a few times to release its aroma and flavor.
Add the bourbon whiskey, ginger liqueur, peach nectar, and about 10 ice cubes into the shaker.
Secure the shaker lid and shake vigorously until the mixture is well chilled.
Fill a glass cup with 4 to 5 ice cubes.
Strain the cocktail into the prepared glass, leaving some room at the top.
Top off the drink with a splash of club soda, and give it a quick stir to combine.
Garnish with fresh peach slices and a sprig of mint for a touch of elegance. Serve immediately.

name: Peach Me Cocktail
instructions: In a mixing glass, combine the bourbon whiskey, Peachtree peach schnapps, and orange bitters.
Add ice to the mixing glass and stir the ingredients gently with a bar spoon until well-chilled and properly mixed.
Strain the mixture into an rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Serve immediately and enjoy.

name: Peach Paloma Spritz
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine peach syrup, tequila, lime juice, and grapefruit juice.
Shake the mixture vigorously for 8 seconds to blend the flavors.
Pour the mixture over fresh ice in a glass.
Top with Prosecco.
Stir gently to combine.
Garnish with a peach fan for an elegant touch.

name: Peach Rosé Sangria
instructions: Mix the Liquids: In a large pitcher, combine the rosé wine, brandy, and peach juice. Stir well to blend the flavors.
Add the Fruit: Add the sliced peaches and raspberries to the pitcher. Stir gently to distribute the fruit evenly.
Chill: Refrigerate the sangria for at least 2 hours, or up to 4 hours. This allows the flavors to meld together and the fruit to infuse the sangria.

Serve: Just before serving, give the sangria a gentle stir. Pour into glasses, making sure to include some fruit in each glass. Top off each glass with a splash of sparkling water for a refreshing fizz.
Garnish (Optional): Add a few ice cubes to each glass if desired, or garnish with a sprig of mint or a slice of peach for an extra touch of summer.

name: Peach Tequila Sunrise Punch
instructions: Start by pouring the silver tequila into a large pitcher.
Fill the pitcher halfway with ice to keep the punch chilled.
Add the orange juice, pineapple juice, and Peach Bellini mix to the pitcher.
Stir the mixture gently to combine all the flavors without disturbing the ice too much.
Slowly pour the grenadine into the pitcher, allowing it to sink to the bottom and create a beautiful layered effect.
To serve, pour the punch into glasses and garnish each with orange slices and maraschino cherries for a festive touch.

name: Peach Vodka Spritz
ingredients: 1 oz club soda or sparkling water
instructions: Fill a large wine glass or highball glass with ice cubes.
In a cocktail shaker, combine the vodka, peach schnapps, peach nectar, and fresh lime juice.
Shake well to combine.
Strain the mixture into the prepared glass over the ice.
Top off with club soda or sparkling water for a fizzy finish.
Garnish with fresh peach slices and mint leaves if desired.
Give the drink a gentle stir to combine all the ingredients.
Serve immediately and enjoy your refreshing Peach Vodka Spritz.

name: Peached Whale
instructions: Fill the glass with ice.
Add all the ingredients into the glass
Stir to mix
Garnish with a cherry.

name: Peach & Coconut Cream
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the peach syrup, vodka, peach schnapps, a squeeze of lemon, and Coconut Cream.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake it well to combine ingredients.
Strain the mixture into a glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a peach and get ready to enjoy!

name: Peaches & Dreams
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, add the fresh mint leaves and peach syrup.
Use a muddler to gently crush the mint leaves, releasing their natural oils and blending them with the peach syrup.
Add the lemon juice, Bourbon Whiskey, and a handful of ice to the shaker.
Shake the mixture vigorously until well-chilled and thoroughly combined.
Pour the cocktail into a glass, straining out the ice if desired.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Peaches & Dreams cocktail!

name: Peachy Keen Cocktail
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the anejo tequila, bourbon, peach jam, lime juice, and light agave syrup.
Add ice to the shaker and shake vigorously until the ingredients are well mixed and chilled.
Double strain the mixture through a fine mesh strainer into a rocks glass containing a large ice cube to ensure a smooth, pulp-free drink.
Garnish with a fresh peach slice if desired for an extra touch of sweetness and visual appeal.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Peachy Keen Cocktail.

name: Peanut Butter & Berry Smash
instructions: Begin by dipping the rim of your serving glass in peanut butter, then roll it in coconut shavings for a tasty coating. Place the glass in the freezer to chill while you prepare the drink.
In a blender, combine frozen açaí, blueberries, peanut butter whiskey, chocolate coconut liqueur, a spoonful of peanut butter, and a handful of ice.
Blend the ingredients until the mixture is smooth and creamy.
Once blended, pour the mixture into the chilled, prepared glass.
Garnish with a few fresh blueberries on top.
Enjoy your indulgent creation!

name: Peanut Butter Cup Martini
instructions: Rim the edge of a martini glass with chocolate syrup and set it aside.
In a shaker filled with ice, combine 2 ounces of Skrewball Peanut Butter Whiskey, 1 ounce of chocolate liqueur, and 1 ounce of Creme de Cocoa.
Shake the mixture well to combine.
Pour the mixture into the prepared martini glass.
Garnish the glass with a mini peanut butter cup.

name: Peanut Butter & Jelly Cocktail
instructions: Fill a glass with ice
Pour in whiskey and raspberry
Top with soda
Stir to mix
Garnish with raspberries and/or strawberries

name: Peanut Butter Old Fashioned
ingredients: 1 1/2 ounces Bourbon (you can use smooth bourbon)
1/2 ounce Crème de Cacao (or Chocolate-flavor Whiskey)
instructions: Chill Your Glass:
Begin by placing an Old Fashioned glass in the freezer to chill while you prepare your drink.
Combine Ingredients:
In a mixing glass, combine the bourbon, peanut butter whiskey, crème de cacao (or chocolate whiskey), chocolate bitters, and cherry bark vanilla bitters if using.
Fill the mixing glass with ice, reaching about three-quarters full.
Stir Well:
Stir the mixture gently yet thoroughly for about 30 seconds. This method ensures that your drink is well-chilled and slightly diluted, smoothing out the strong flavors.
Prepare the Glass:
Remove the Old Fashioned glass from the freezer.
Optionally, you can rub a small amount of peanut butter on the rim or add a thin layer at the bottom of the glass for an extra peanut butter flavor.
Strain the Drink:
Strain the cocktail into the chilled Old Fashioned glass over a large ice cube. A large cube melts slower, keeping your drink cool without diluting it too quickly.
Garnish and Serve:
Garnish with a Reese’s Peanut Butter Cup. You can place it on the rim of the glass or on a small skewer.
Optionally, add a small drizzle of melted peanut butter over the top for a dramatic effect.

name: Pear Bourbon Smash
instructions: Begin by slicing the pear in half and removing any overly soft pulp, seeds, and the stem.
Roughly dice the pear and place it in a medium bowl.
Mash the pear thoroughly using a fork or a potato masher until it is well broken down.

Transfer the mashed pear into a fine mesh strainer set over a wide-mouthed measuring cup or another bowl. Press the pear pulp firmly against the strainer to extract as much juice and pulp as possible.
Once you have extracted the pear juice, add the bourbon, maple syrup, lemon juice, vanilla extract, and allspice to the juice.
Add ice to the mixture and stir vigorously until all ingredients are well combined and chilled.
Fill two glasses with ice and evenly divide the pear bourbon mixture between them.
Serve immediately and enjoy the warm, spiced flavors of this autumnal cocktail.

name: Pear Cider Aperol Spritz
instructions: Fill a large wine glass with ice to the brim.
Pour in the Aperol, pear cider, and apple juice. Gently stir to combine the flavors.
Slowly add the Prosecco and give it a light stir to maintain the bubbly fizz.
Garnish with a thin pear slice and a sprig of rosemary for a festive, aromatic touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy the sparkling holiday vibes.

name: Pear Collins
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice cubes.
Add the gin and pear puree to the shaker.
Shake well to combine and chill the mixture.
Strain the mixture into a highball glass filled with ice.
Top with club soda.
Garnish with 1-2 fresh thyme sprigs.
Enjoy your Pear Collins Cocktail!

name: Pear Cosmopolitan Cocktail
instructions: Combine the pear-flavored vodka, Cointreau, lime juice, and white cranberry juice cocktail in a cocktail shaker.
Add ice to the shaker and shake vigorously until the mixture is well chilled.
Strain the cocktail into a martini glass.
Garnish with a slice of fresh pear, if desired, for an elegant finishing touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy the crisp, fruity flavors of this refined cosmopolitan.

name: Pear Drop Martini
instructions: Chill a martini glass in the freezer while you prepare the cocktail.
In a shaker, add a slice of fresh pear and muddle it to release the juices.
Add ice, then pour in the pear vodka, lemon juice, triple sec, and simple syrup.
Shake well to combine and chill the ingredients.
Rim the chilled martini glass with a slice of lemon and dip the rim into sugar for a sweet finish.
Strain the mixture into the prepared glass.
Serve immediately and enjoy the crisp, fruity flavors of this delightful martini.

name: Pear & Elderflower Collins
ingredients: Thin slice of pear for garnish
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, add the vodka or gin, elderflower liqueur, pear liqueur, pear puree, freshly squeezed lemon juice, and honey syrup.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake until well-chilled.
Strain the mixture into a Collins glass filled with fresh ice.
Top the drink with club soda and stir briefly to combine.
Garnish with a thin slice of pear and a sprinkle of freshly grated cinnamon.

name: Pear Ginger Lemonade
ingredients: Lemon slice and gold sugar (for rimming )
instructions: Wet the rim of a tall glass with a lemon wedge or water. Dip the rim into gold sugar to coat it evenly.
Fill the glass with ice.
Pour the pear vodka and lemon juice into the glass.
Stir gently with a swizzle stick or spoon to combine the ingredients.
Top with ginger ale to give the drink a sparkling, fizzy finish.
Garnish with a lemon slice for a bright, citrusy touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy the light, refreshing flavors of this Pear Ginger Lemonade.

name: Pear Martini with Elderflower Liqueur
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with a cup of ice or two large ice cubes.
Add the pear vodka, elderflower liqueur, lemon juice, and simple syrup to the shaker.
Shake vigorously until the mixture is well chilled.
Double strain the cocktail into a chilled coupe glass to ensure a smooth, refined texture.
Garnish with slices of fresh pear for an elegant presentation.
Serve immediately and enjoy the refreshing, floral flavors of this refined martini.

name: Pear Moscow Mule
instructions: Fill a mule mug with ice cubes.
Pour the pear-flavored vodka and lime juice into the mug.
Top up with ginger beer, stirring gently to combine.
Garnish with 3 fresh pear slices for a decorative and aromatic touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy the refreshing, spicy, and fruity flavors of this mule variation.

name: Pear Rosemary Cocktail
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.
Add the pear vodka, pear nectar, and rosemary syrup to the shaker.
Shake well until the mixture is chilled and well-combined.
Strain the cocktail into a glass.
Top off with sparkling water to add a refreshing, bubbly finish.
Garnish with a fresh sprig of rosemary for a fragrant and visually appealing touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy the delightful blend of sweet pear and herbal rosemary flavors.

name: Pear Tree Cocktail
ingredients: Fresh rosemary, cinnamon sticks, pear slices  (for garnish, optional)
instructions: Begin by slicing a fresh pear. Place a few of the pear slices into a cocktail shaker with the pear vodka.
Use a muddler to press and break up the pear slices, releasing their juices and flavor into the vodka.
Add the cranberry juice, cinnamon simple syrup, and lime juice to the shaker, along with a generous scoop of ice.Cover and shake the mixture vigorously until it is well chilled.
Strain the cocktail into a glass filled with ice. Top off the drink with ginger beer, adding a refreshing effervescence.

Garnish as desired with the remaining pear slices, a sprig of fresh rosemary, and a cinnamon stick for an aromatic finish. Serve immediately and enjoy the rich, fruity, and spiced flavors of this festive cocktail.

name: Pear Vanilla Gin Fizz
ingredients: Sugar and vanilla bean (for rimming, optional)
instructions: Prepare the glass by rimming it with a mixture of sugar and vanilla bean for a sweet and aromatic touch.
Add the gin and pear vanilla syrup to the glass, and whisk or stir together until well combined.
Pour the club soda into the glass, filling it almost to the top.
Add ice to the glass and gently stir to mix everything together.
Serve immediately and enjoy the light, refreshing flavors of the Pear Vanilla Gin Fizz!

name: Pear Vodka and Cranberry Cocktail
ingredients: fresh pear slices, fresh mint sprigs  (for garnish)
instructions: In a large pitcher, combine the cranberry juice, pear vodka, triple sec, and lime juice. Stir well to mix the ingredients.
Fill four glasses to the brim with ice.
Pour the cocktail mixture over the ice in each glass.
Garnish with a slice of fresh pear and a sprig of mint for an elegant and aromatic touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy the refreshing, fruity flavors of this delightful cocktail.

name: Pear Vodka Breeze
instructions: Fill a highball glass with ice cubes.
Add the pear-flavored vodka, apple juice, and cranberry juice directly into the glass.
Stir gently to combine the ingredients.
Garnish with a fresh slice of apple for a crisp and elegant touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy the crisp, fruity flavors of this refreshing cocktail.

name: Bourbon Pecan Old Fashioned
ingredients: Strip of orange peel, candied pecan (optional, for garnish)
instructions: In a cocktail mixing glass, combine the light brown sugar, pecan bitters, water, and bourbon. Stir until the sugar has fully dissolved.
Once the sugar has melted into the mixture, stir in the pecan liqueur.
Place a large ice cube into a double rocks glass.
Add a strip of orange peel to the glass for a bright citrusy garnish.
Pour the pecan bourbon old fashioned over the ice.
Top with a candied pecan for an extra touch of sweetness, if desired.
Serve immediately and enjoy the rich, nutty flavors of this elegant Pecan Bourbon Old Fashioned.

name: Pecan Pie Bourbon Milkshake
instructions: In a blender, combine the vanilla ice cream, milk, bourbon, and chopped pecan.
Blend until the mixture reaches your desired consistency. If it's too thick, add more milk; if it's too thin, add more ice cream.
Pour the milkshake into a glass.
Garnish with crumbled pecan on top for an extra layer of texture and flavor.
Serve immediately and enjoy this rich, boozy, and nutty Pecan Pie Bourbon Milkshake!

name: Pecan Pie Hot Buttered Rum
instructions: Boil 8 ounces of water in a kettle or saucepan.
In amug, add the spiced compound butter, pecan pie syrup, and dark rum.
Pour the boiling water into the mug, stirring with a long-handled spoon until the butter fully dissolves and the ingredients are well combined.
Top with whipped cream, candied pecans, or a cinnamon stick for garnish, if desired.
Serve immediately and enjoy this warm, cozy drink.

name: Pecan Pie Manhattan
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the sweet vermouth, Angostura bitters, and pecan pie bourbon.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously until well chilled.
Strain the mixture into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a pecan, if desired, and serve immediately.

name: Pecan Pie Martini
ingredients: 1/4 cup finely chopped toasted pecans ( for rimming)
instructions: Place the caramel sauce on a small plate and the finely chopped toasted pecans on a second plate.
Coat the rim of the martini glass by dipping it into the caramel sauce, then into the chopped pecans to create a sweet and crunchy edge.
In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, combine the RumChata, crème de cacao, bourbon, and half-and-half.
Shake well until the mixture is cold and fully combined.
Strain the mixture into the prepared martini glass.
Top with a spoonful of whipped cream and garnish with a whole pecan for a festive touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy the creamy, nutty flavors of this indulgent cocktail.

name: Penicillin
ingredients: 3/4 ounce of freshly squeezed lemon juice
1/4 ounce of Islay single malt scotch
instructions: Add the blended scotch, lemon juice, and syrup into a cocktail shaker with ice.
Shake until well-chilled.
Strain into a rocks glass over fresh ice.
Float the Islay single malt scotch on top.
Garnish with candied ginger.

name: Penitent Punch
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the tequila, vodka, and lemonade.
Shake well to mix the ingredients.
Fill a rocks glass with ice cubes and pour the mixture over the ice.
Gently top the drink with the red wine, allowing it to float on top for a layered effect.
Serve and enjoy your Penitent Punch!
Garnish with lemon wheel and a mint sprig.

name: Peppermint Espresso Martini
ingredients: peppermint candies or candy canes (crushed (optional, for garnish))
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, add ice, peppermint vodka, coffee liqueur, espresso, and simple syrup.
Shake vigorously until the mixture becomes frothy.
Strain the mixture into a martini glass, giving the shaker an extra shake at the end to pour out all the foam.
Serve immediately. For a festive touch, garnish with crushed peppermint around the rim or sprinkle a bit on top.

name: Peppermint Martini
instructions: Prepare the glass by pouring simple syrup onto a small plate. Dip the rim of the martini glass into the syrup, then into the crushed candy canes to coat the rim lightly.
Fill a cocktail shaker two-thirds full with ice. Add the peppermint vodka, coffee liqueur, and milk.
Shake the mixture well until it's thoroughly chilled and blended.
Strain the cocktail into the prepared martini glass.
Serve immediately for a festive, minty treat.

name: Peppermint Mocha Cocktail
instructions: Pour a small amount of simple syrup onto a plate. Dip the rim of a rocks glass into the syrup, ensuring it’s fully coated. Then, dip the rim into crushed candy canes, pressing gently so they adhere. Set the glass aside to allow the rim to set.
Add ice to the prepared glass.
In a cocktail shaker, combine the Kahlua Peppermint Mocha, vodka, chocolate syrup, and heavy cream. Add ice to the shaker and shake vigorously until the mixture is well-chilled.
Strain the cocktail into the prepared rocks glass. Enjoy immediately for a delicious, festive treat.

name: Peppermint Mocha Espresso Martini
ingredients: Melted chocolate and crushed candy canes (for rimming (Optional))
A sprinkle of cacao powder and coffee bean (for garnish)
instructions: If rimming the glass, dip the rim in melted chocolate, then into crushed candy canes for a festive look.
Add vodka, coffee liqueur, half and half, cacao powder, peppermint extract, and vanilla extract to a cocktail shaker filled with ice.
Pour in the hot espresso as the final ingredient to keep the ice from melting too quickly.
Shake the mixture vigorously for 30 seconds until well-chilled and frothy.
Strain into the prepared martini glass.
Garnish with a light dusting of cacao powder and a few coffee beans.

name: Peppermint Moscow Mule
instructions: Fill a copper mule mug with ice and add a handful of fresh mint leaves.
In a cocktail shaker, combine the peppermint vodka and lime juice. Shake vigorously to chill and blend.
Pour the cocktail mixture over the ice in the mug, then top with ginger beer for a refreshing fizz.
Garnish with additional fresh mint, a few cranberries, and a sprinkle of crushed peppermints for a festive look. Serve immediately.

name: Peppermint Mudslide
instructions: In a blender, combine the vanilla ice cream, peppermint vodka, Irish cream, and coffee liqueur. Blend until the mixture is smooth and creamy.
Add half of the crushed peppermint to the blender and pulse briefly to incorporate.

Set up two plates: one with a layer of chocolate syrup and the other with the remaining crushed peppermint. Dip the rim of a highball glass into the chocolate syrup, then into the crushed peppermint to coat.
Drizzle additional chocolate syrup along the inside of the glass for a decorative effect.
Pour the blended ice cream mixture into the prepared glass.
For an extra festive touch, top with whipped cream, a drizzle of chocolate syrup, and a sprinkle of crushed peppermint.

name: Peppermint Piña Colada
instructions: Prepare the glass by pouring a thin layer of honey onto one plate and spreading crushed peppermint evenly across another plate.
Dip the rim of the glass into the honey, then into the crushed peppermint, ensuring the rim is evenly coated.
In a blender, add a handful of ice, cream of coconut, pineapple juice, light rum, peppermint schnapps, and grenadine.
Blend until smooth, adding more ice if a thicker consistency is desired.
Pour the drink into the prepared glass and garnish with a candy cane. Enjoy!

name: Peppermint Snowflake Cocktail
instructions: Pour a small amount of sugar onto a plate. Moisten the rim of your glass with water, then dip it into the sugar to create a frosty rim.
Fill a cocktail shaker with ice, then add the vanilla vodka, half and half, and peppermint schnapps.
Secure the shaker lid and shake well until the mixture is thoroughly chilled.
Strain into your prepared glass, garnish with a peppermint stick if desired, and enjoy your Peppermint Snowflake Cocktail!

name: Peppermint Vodka Hot Chocolate
instructions: In a heatproof mug, pour in the crème de cacao and Smirnoff Peppermint Twist Vodka.
Pour in the freshly brewed hot coffee and hot chocolate.
Give the drink a gentle stir to combine the flavors.
Top with whipped cream and a candy cane for a festive touch. Serve immediately and enjoy the warmth of this holiday treat.

name: Peppermint White Christmas
instructions: Dip the rim of a Champagne flute in a small dish of white crème de cacao, then roll it in crushed candy cane to create a festive rim.
Pour 1 ounce of white crème de cacao into the prepared Champagne flute, then slowly top with 5 ounces of chilled Champagne.
Add a whole candy cane to the glass. As it melts, it will infuse the cocktail with a light peppermint flavor and a touch of color.
Serve immediately and enjoy this festive holiday cocktail!

name: Peppermint White Russian
instructions: Prepare the glass by dipping the rim in white chocolate syrup, then in crushed peppermints to create a festive, candy-cane-like rim.
In a cocktail shaker, combine the peppermint vodka, Peppermint Kahlua, and half and half. Stir gently to combine.
Add ice to the prepared glass, then pour the cocktail over the ice.
Garnish with a candy cane for a final festive touch.

name: How to Make a "Perfect Manhattan"
ingredients: brandied cherry or lemon twist (for garnish)
instructions: Fill a mixing glass with ice.
Add rye whiskey or bourbon, dry vermouth, sweet vermouth, and 2 dashes of bitters.
Stir the mixture until it's well-chilled.
Strain the mixture into a chilled Nick & Nora glass or cocktail glass.
Garnish the cocktail with a brandied cherry or a lemon twist.

name: Perfect Pear Cocktail
instructions: In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, combine the gin, St-Germain, lemon juice, simple syrup, and pear puree.
Shake vigorously until well chilled.
Double-strain the mixture into a chilled coupe glass to ensure a smooth and refined texture.
Top the drink with a splash of Champagne for a refreshing, bubbly finish.
Garnish with a fresh pear slice for an elegant presentation.
Serve immediately and enjoy the light, fruity, and sparkling flavors of the Perfect Pear cocktail.

name: Persimmon Aperol Spritz
instructions: In a wine glass, combine prosecco, Aperol, and persimmon syrup.
Stir gently to mix the ingredients together.
Add ice to the glass and top with a splash of club soda.
Garnish with a fresh wedge of persimmon and a sprig of thyme for a fragrant, festive touch.
Serve and enjoy!

name: Persimmon Old Fashioned
instructions: In a mixing glass, combine the bourbon, persimmon syrup, and orange bitters.
Fill the mixing glass with ice and stir until well-chilled.
Strain the mixture into a rocks glass over a large ice cube or fresh ice.
Garnish with a slice of persimmon and a star anise pod.
Serve and savor the warm, spiced flavors.

name: Picon Punch
instructions: Fill your glass with ice to chill.
Pour 2 oz. of Amer Picon over the ice.
Add 1/2 oz. of grenadine.
Top the glass with club soda, leaving some room at the top.
Carefully float 1/2 oz of brandy on top by pouring it over the back of a spoon.
Garnish with a twist of lemon.
Stir gently before drinking to blend the flavors together.

name: Pina Colada Moscow Mule
instructions: Fill a mule mug or a highball glass with ice.
Pour in the coconut rum.
Add the lime juice and piña colada mix.
Top off with the ginger beer.
Stir gently to combine.
Garnish with a lime wedge and a pineapple slice if desired.

name: Pine Old Fashioned
instructions: In the bottom of a rocks glass, combine the pine simple syrup and aromatic bitters.
Add the bourbon whiskey and stir gently to combine the flavors.
Place a large ice cube in the glass to chill the drink.
Garnish with a small pine branch for an aromatic, festive touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy this seasonal classic. Cheers!

name: Pineapple Aperol Spritz
instructions: Fill a wine glass with ice cubes to chill it.
Pour the pineapple and Aperol mixture over the ice in your prepared glass.
Top off with prosecco
Garnish with a slice of fresh pineapple on the rim of the glass.
Serve immediately and enjoy.

name: Pineapple Blueberry Margarita
instructions: Rim your glass with salt by dipping the rim in lime juice and then into salt spread on a plate.
In a cocktail shaker, combine the Tequila Blanco, lime juice, pineapple juice, and blueberry syrup.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously until well chilled.
Strain the mixture over fresh ice into the prepared glass.
Garnish with fresh blueberries and a slice of pineapple.
Enjoy your tropical Pineapple Blueberry Margarita!

name: Pineapple Bourbon Lemonade
ingredients: Pineapple and lemon slices for garnish
instructions: Fill a shaker with ice.
Add 1 oz pineapple juice, 2 oz bourbon, 2 oz lemon juice and simple syrup to the shaker.
Shake well until chilled.
Strain the mixture into a glass filled with ice.
Garnish with pineapple and lemon slices.

name: Pineapple Lychee Margarita
instructions: In a blender, combine the pineapple, lychee syrup, and lime juice. Blend until smooth. Set the pineapple and lychee mixture aside.
In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, add the tequila and orange juice.
Pour the blended pineapple and lychee juice into the shaker.
Shake vigorously until well-chilled.
Rim your glass with salt if desired, and strain the mixture into the prepared glass.
Garnish with a slice of pineapple and serve immediately.

name: Pineapple Passion Punch
ingredients: Pineapple slice or lime wheel (for garnish)
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the rum, lime juice, and pineapple juice.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously until well chilled.
Strain the mixture into a rocks glass filled with crushed ice.
Slowly pour the red passion fruit syrup over the top, allowing it to cascade through the ice.
Garnish with a pineapple slice or lime wheel.
Enjoy your tropical Pineapple Passion Punch

name: Pineapple Screwdriver
instructions: In a mixing glass, combine the pineapple juice, orange juice, and vodka. Stir well to ensure all the flavors blend together.
Fill a highball glass with ice, then pour the juice and vodka mixture over the ice.
Add your choice of garnishes, such as fresh mint, cherries, orange wedge, or pineapple slice, to elevate the presentation and taste.

name: Pineapple Tequila Sour
ingredients: Pineapple slice or lime wheel (for garnish)
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the tequila, pineapple juice, lime juice, agave syrup, and egg white.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously until well chilled (about 15-20 seconds).
Strain the mixture to remove the ice, then return it to the shaker.
Shake again without ice (a "dry shake") to create a frothy texture (about 10-15 seconds).
Strain the cocktail into a rocks glass or coupe glass.
Garnish with a slice of pineapple or a lime wheel.
Enjoy your frothy and tropical Pineapple Tequila Sour!

name: Pineapple Vanilla Spritz
instructions: Place dried edible flowers in each compartment of your ice cube tray and fill with water.
Freeze the tray for at least 3 hours.
Once frozen, add the custom-made ice cubes to your wine glass.
Pour in vanilla vodka and pineapple juice.
Top off the drink with Prosecco.

name: Pineapple Whiskey Smash
instructions: Muddle (smash) the pineapple and mint leaves together in a shaker.
Add the whiskey, simple syrup, and lemon juice.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake it up really well.
Strain it into a glass filled with ice.
Garnish with a pineapple slice and a mint sprig.

name: Pineapples and Cream Margarita
ingredients: 1 oz Orange Liqueur (Cointreau or Triple Sec)
instructions: Add tequila, orange liqueur, lime juice, pineapple juice, coconut milk, and agave to a cocktail shaker.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously for 30 seconds.
Coat the rim of your cocktail glass with lime juice.
In a dish, mix the sugar with a bit of lime zest.
Dip the rim of the glass into the sugar and lime zest mixture to coat.
Fill the glass with ice.
Strain the cocktail mixture over the ice in the glass.
Garnish with a lime wedge and a sprinkle of additional lime zest.
Enjoy your Pineapples and Cream Margarita!

name: Pink Gin Sour
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the lemon juice, Empress 1908 Gin, gin, ginger liqueur, and simple syrup.
Add ice to the shaker and shake well until chilled.
Strain the mixture into your prepared serving glass.
Garnish with an edible flower for a beautiful presentation and serve immediately.

name: Pink Jalapeño Kiss
ingredients: Jalapeño slice and edible flower (for garnish)
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, muddle a few slices of jalapeño with the coconut syrup to release the spice.
Add the pink gin, rose liqueur, lime juice, and a dash or two of rhubarb bitters to the shaker.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously until well-chilled, about 15 seconds.
Strain the cocktail into your preferred glass.
Garnish with additional slices of jalapeño for a spicy touch and edible flower for an elegant finish.
Serve and enjoy the magical flavors of the Pink Jalapeño Kiss!

name: Pink Mountain Apple Rum Cocktail
instructions: Fill a highball or rocks glass with ice, then pour in the fresh mountain apple juice and lime juice.
Stir gently to combine the juices.
Slowly pour the Koloa Dark Rum over the back of a spoon to float it on top of the juice.
Garnish with a few slices of fresh mountain apple and a lime wedge.
Serve immediately and enjoy.

name: Pisco Sky
ingredients: Pineapple slice or pineapple fronds (for garnish)
instructions: In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, combine the pisco, lime juice, blue curaçao, and pineapple juice.
Shake vigorously until well-chilled.
Strain the mixture over fresh ice cubes into a  highball glass.
Garnish with fresh pineapple slice or pineapple fronds for a tropical finishing touch.

name: Pistachio Martini
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the vanilla vodka, amaretto, Irish cream, and blue curacao.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously for at least 25 seconds until well chilled.
Pour the simple syrup or maple syrup onto a plate.
Dip the rim of your martini glass into the syrup, coating it evenly.
Spread the crushed pistachios on a separate plate. Dip the syrup-coated rim into the pistachios, ensuring an even coating.
Strain the cocktail mixture from the shaker into the prepared martini glass.
Enjoy your luxurious Pistachio Martini!

name: Pistachio Vodka Lemonade
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, add the pistachio vodka and pistachio liqueur. Shake well with ice to chill the mixture.
Strain the mixture into a glass filled with fresh ice.
Pour in 4 oz of lemonade and gently stir to combine the flavors.
Garnish with lime slices and a sprig of mint for a fresh, vibrant touch.
Serve and enjoy your refreshing Pistachio Vodka Lemonade!

name: Plum Bourbon Sour
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, start by muddling a few slices of fresh plum to release their juices and flavor.
Add the lemon juice, bourbon, egg white, and simple syrup to the shaker.
Shake the mixture vigorously without ice (a “dry shake”) to emulsify the egg white and create a frothy texture.
Add ice to the shaker and shake again until the mixture is well-chilled.
Strain the cocktail into a glass. For a smoother texture, you can double strain the mixture using a fine mesh strainer.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Plum Bourbon Sour.

name: Plum Collins
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the gin, Plum & Honey syrup, and lemon juice.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake well until chilled.
Strain the mixture into a highball glass filled with ice.
Top off with soda water.
Gently stir to combine.
Garnish with a slice of plum or a lemon wheel.
Serve immediately and enjoy your refreshing Plum Collins.

name: Plum Cosmopolitan
instructions: Prepare the cocktail shaker: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.
Add the ingredients: Pour in the vodka, plum liqueur, cranberry juice, lime juice, and simple syrup (if using).
Shake it up: Shake the mixture vigorously for about 15-20 seconds until well chilled.
Strain into a glass: Strain the mixture into a chilled martini glass or a coupe glass.
Garnish: Garnish with a fresh plum slice on the rim of the glass or float a thin slice on the surface of the drink.
Serve: Serve immediately and enjoy.

name: Plum Daiquiri
instructions: Prepare the Plum: Dice the ripe plum and muddle it in a cocktail shaker to release its juices.
Add Ingredients: Add the simple syrup, white rum, sloe gin, and lime juice to the shaker.
Shake: Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously for about 15 seconds until well chilled.
Strain: Double strain the mixture into a chilled cocktail glass to remove the plum solids and any ice shards.
Garnish: Garnish with a thin slice of plum on the rim of the glass.
Serve: Enjoy your refreshing Kiwi Plum Daiquiri.

name: Plum Gimlet
ingredients: Plum slice and mint sprig for garnish
instructions: Muddle Plum: In a cocktail shaker, muddle the plum slices until they are well mashed.
Add Ingredients: Add the gin, fresh lime juice, and simple syrup to the shaker.
Shake: Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously for about 15 seconds.
Strain: Strain the mixture into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish: Garnish with a slice of plum and a sprig of mint.

name: Plum Gin Fizz
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine 2 ounces of gin, 0.5 ounces of lemon juice, the egg white, and the plum puree.
Dry shake (without ice) vigorously for about 15 seconds to emulsify the egg white.
Add ice to the shaker and shake for another 15 seconds until well-chilled.
Strain the mixture into a chilled highball glass.
Gently pour 2 ounces of club soda over the top.
Garnish with a sprig of lavender.

name: Plum Lemon Drop Cocktail
ingredients: Lemon twist and plum slice for garnish
instructions: Rub a lemon wedge around the rim of a martini glass.
Dip the rim in sugar to coat it evenly.
Set the glass aside.
In a cocktail shaker, add the sliced plum and muddle until the fruit is broken down and juices are released.
Add vodka, freshly squeezed lemon juice, and simple syrup to the shaker.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously for about 15 seconds until well chilled.
Strain the mixture into the prepared martini glass.
Garnish with a lemon twist and a slice of plum on the rim of the glass.

name: Plum Martini
instructions: Prepare the Glass: Chill a martini glass by filling it with ice water. Set it aside.
Muddle the Plum: In a cocktail shaker, add the ripe plum slices. Muddle them until they release their juices.
Add Ingredients: Fill the shaker with ice cubes.
Pour in 2 oz of vodka, 1 oz of plum liqueur, 1 oz of fresh lime juice, and 1/2 oz of simple syrup.
Shake: Shake the mixture vigorously for about 15-20 seconds until well chilled.
Strain: Empty the ice water from the chilled martini glass.
Strain the mixture into the glass.
Garnish: Garnish with a slice or twist of plum on the rim of the glass

name: Plum Negroni Sour
instructions: Add the plum-infused gin, Campari, sweet vermouth, plum syrup, lemon juice, and egg white to a cocktail shaker.
Dry shake (without ice) vigorously to emulsify the egg white.
Add a couple of ice cubes to the shaker and shake again until well-chilled.
Double strain the mixture into a glass.
Garnish with a sage leaf and serve immediately.

name: Plum Paloma
ingredients: Plum slices and a lime wheel (for garnish)
instructions: In a shaker, muddle the ripe plum until it's well mashed and juicy.
Add the tequila or mezcal and lime juice to the shaker.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake well until chilled.
Strain the mixture into a glass filled with ice.
Top with grapefruit soda.
Garnish with plum slices and a lime wheel.
Enjoy your refreshing Plum Paloma.

name: Plum Spritz
ingredients: 1 oz plum brandy or plum liqueur
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, muddle the sliced plums until they are well mashed and juicy.
Add the plum brandy (or plum liqueur), vodka, simple syrup, and fresh lemon juice to the shaker with the muddled plums.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously for about 15-20 seconds until well chilled.
Strain the mixture into a wine glass filled with ice, ensuring to catch the pulp and seeds.
Slowly top off the glass with Prosecco or your preferred sparkling wine, filling it to the brim.
Garnish with fresh mint leaves and a slice of plum.
Give it a gentle stir to combine the flavors.

name: Plum Vodka Lemonade
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, muddle the ripe plum slices until they are well mashed and release their juice.
Add the vodka, lemon juice, and simple syrup to the shaker with the mashed plums.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously for about 15-20 seconds until well chilled.
Strain the mixture into a glass filled with ice.
Top off the drink with club soda, giving it a gentle stir to combine.
Garnish with fresh plum slices.
Serve immediately and enjoy your refreshing Plum Vodka Lemonade.

name: Plum Vodka Sour
ingredients: 1  egg white (optional for a frothy texture)
Plum slice and lemon twist (for garnish)
instructions: Wash and pit a medium-sized plum.
Blend the plum in a blender or food processor until smooth.
Strain the puree to remove any skin and excess pulp.
In a cocktail shaker, combine vodka, plum puree, lemon juice, and simple syrup.
If using, add the egg white for a frothy texture.
Add ice cubes to the shaker and shake vigorously for about 15 seconds.
If using egg white, first dry shake (without ice) to emulsify the egg white, then add ice and shake again.
Strain the mixture into a chilled glass.
Garnish with a slice of plum and a twist of lemon.
Serve immediately and enjoy your refreshing Plum Vodka Sour.

name: Poinsettia Champagne Cocktail
instructions: Pour the orange liqueur and cranberry juice into a chilled Champagne flute. Stir well to blend the flavors.
Slowly pour in the Champagne to avoid overflowing and to preserve the bubbles.
Add a few fresh cranberries and a small sprig of rosemary for a festive, aromatic touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy this refreshing holiday cocktail!

name: Poison Apple Martini
instructions: Chill a martini glass by filling it with ice water. Let it sit while you prepare the cocktail.
In a cocktail shaker, add apple cider, cranberry juice, grenadine, and caramel vodka.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake well for about 15-20 seconds until the mixture is well chilled.
Discard the ice water from the glass.
Strain the mixture from the shaker into the chilled glass.
Add an apple slice to the rim of the glass for garnish.

name: Poisoned Apple Cider
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.
Add the apple cider, spiced rum, pomegranate juice, grenadine, and edible luster dust to the shaker.
Secure the lid and shake vigorously until the mixture is well chilled and the luster dust is fully blended, creating a shimmering effect.
Strain the mixture into your glass, allowing the shimmering liquid to flow in.
Serve immediately and enjoy the enchanting, sweet, and spicy flavors of this magical cocktail.

name: Polar Bear Cocktail
instructions: In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, combine the raspberry vodka and blue curaçao.
Shake vigorously for about 10 seconds to mix and chill the ingredients.
Strain the mixture into a glass filled with fresh ice.
Add Sprite and pour in the lemon juice, gently stirring to combine.
Serve immediately and enjoy the refreshing flavors of the Polar Bear Cocktail.

name: Polar Blue Potion
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the Blue Frost Gatorade, vodka, lime juice, blue curaçao, and simple syrup.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously to thoroughly mix and chill the ingredients.
Strain the mixture over fresh ice in a rocks glass.
Top the drink with ginger ale to add a fizzy, refreshing finish.
Garnish with a lime wheel for a citrusy touch.
Serve and enjoy your Polar Blue Potion while cheering on the Lions!

name: Pomegranate Bourbon Smash
ingredients: 1/2 oz simple syrup (1:1 sugar to water)
instructions: Muddle Mint: In a cocktail shaker, add a few fresh mint leaves and the simple syrup. Gently muddle the mint to release its aroma and flavor.
Add Liquids: Add the bourbon, pomegranate juice, and fresh lemon juice to the shaker.
Shake: Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously for about 15 seconds.
Strain and Serve: Strain the mixture into a rocks glass filled with ice.
Garnish: Garnish with a few pomegranate seeds and a sprig of fresh mint.
Enjoy: Serve immediately and enjoy your refreshing Pomegranate Bourbon Smash.

name: Pomegranate Champagne Spritz
ingredients: rosemary sprig and an orange slice or a few pomegranate arils (for garnish)
instructions: Add the orange juice and pomegranate juice to a wine glass.
Top with champagne, pouring slowly to maintain the bubbles.
Garnish with a rosemary sprig and either an orange slice or a few pomegranate arils for a pop of color and added fragrance.
Serve immediately and enjoy!

name: Pomegranate Collins
instructions: Prepare the Glass: Fill a Collins glass with ice to chill it.
Mix the Cocktail: In a cocktail shaker, combine the gin, fresh lemon juice, pomegranate juice, and simple syrup. Add ice to the shaker.
Shake Well: Shake the mixture vigorously for about 15 seconds until well chilled.
Pour into Glass: Strain the mixture into the prepared Collins glass over the ice.
Top with Soda: Top off the drink with club soda, filling the glass.
Garnish: Garnish with a few pomegranate seeds and a lemon wheel.
Serve: Stir gently and serve immediately.

name: Pomegranate Daiquiri
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.
Pour in the rum, pomegranate juice, maraschino liqueur, lime juice, and simple syrup.
Shake well until the mixture is chilled.
Strain the mixture into a chilled coupe or martini glass.
Garnish with a lime wheel or wedge on the rim of the glass.
Serve immediately and enjoy your refreshing Pomegranate Daiquiri.

name: Pomegranate Gin and Tonic
instructions: Fill a glass with a few pomegranate arils and crushed ice.
Pour 2 oz of gin over the ice.
Add 4 oz of tonic water to the glass.
Stir in 2 oz of pomegranate juice and 1 oz of lime juice.
Add a few lime wedges to the glass.
Stir a few times to combine all the ingredients.
Garnish with a sprig of rosemary and sprinkle additional pomegranate arils on top.
Serve immediately and enjoy!

name: Pomegranate Gin Fizz
instructions: Dry Shake: Add gin, pomegranate juice, lemon juice, simple syrup, and egg white to a cocktail shaker. Shake vigorously without ice for about 15 seconds. This helps to emulsify the egg white and create a nice frothy texture.
Shake with Ice: Add ice to the shaker and shake again until well-chilled, about 30 seconds.
Strain: Strain the mixture into a chilled highball or Collins glass.
Top with Soda Water: Gently pour the soda water into the glass to create a light fizz.
Garnish: Add a sprig of rosemary for a touch of aroma and presentation, if desired.
Serve: Enjoy your refreshing Pomegranate Gin Fizz.

name: Pomegranate Lemon Drop Martini
instructions: Rim a martini glass with lemon juice, then dip it in sugar to coat the rim. Set aside.
Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.
Add the vodka, pomegranate juice, fresh lemon juice, triple sec, and simple syrup.
Shake well until the mixture is chilled, about 15-20 seconds.
Strain the mixture into the prepared martini glass.
Garnish with a lemon slice or twist and a few pomegranate seeds if desired.
Sip and enjoy your refreshing Pomegranate Lemon Drop Martini.

name: Pomegranate Orange Champagne
instructions: Pour the pomegranate juice and orange juice into a wine glass.
Slowly top with champagne, allowing the bubbles to mix gently with the juices.
Garnish the cocktail with an orange slice on the rim of the glass and a few pomegranate seeds dropped into the drink for a festive touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Pomegranate Orange Champagne Cocktail!

name: Pomegranate Paloma
instructions: Rub a lime wedge around the rim of a glass.
Dip the rim into salt to coat it evenly.
In a shaker, combine the pomegranate juice, lime juice, simple syrup, and tequila.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake well until the mixture is chilled.
Fill the prepared glass with ice.
Strain the mixed drink into the glass.
Top off with club soda and stir gently.
Garnish with a sprig of rosemary for a fresh aroma and a beautiful presentation.

name: Pomegranate Prosecco Smash
instructions: Place the pomegranate arils in a cocktail shaker and muddle them gently to release their juice.
Add the pomegranate juice, maple syrup, and vodka to the shaker.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake well until the mixture is chilled.
Strain the mixture into a glass (preferably a champagne flute or a cocktail glass).
Slowly pour the prosecco into the glass, filling it to your desired level.
Garnish with a sprig of rosemary.
Serve immediately and enjoy your refreshing Pomegranate Prosecco Smash.

name: Pomegranate Rosemary Gin Fizz
instructions: In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, combine the gin, lemon juice, rosemary simple syrup, and pomegranate juice.
Shake vigorously until the mixture is well chilled.
Strain the cocktail into a lowball glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with chilled club soda and stir gently to blend.
Garnish with a sprig of rosemary and a generous spoonful of pomegranate arils for a festive touch.

name: Pomegranate Rosemary Mojito
instructions: Add rum, lime juice, pomegranate juice, mint leaves, and the rosemary sprig to a cocktail shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously for at least 15 seconds to blend the flavors.
Fill a large cocktail or wine glass three-quarters full with ice.
Strain the mixture from the shaker into the glass.
Top off the glass with Prosecco or sparkling water.
Garnish with a fresh lime slice and a mint leaf sprig.
Enjoy your Pomegranate Rosemary Mojito!

name: Pomegranate Vanilla Sangria
instructions: In a large pitcher, add the sliced orange, chopped apples, chopped pears, cinnamon sticks, and pomegranate arils.

Pour in the Spanish red wine, sparkling pomegranate soda, brandy, sugar, and vanilla extract over the fruit. Scrape the vanilla beans out of their pods and add the seeds to the pitcher. Then, throw in the empty vanilla pods for extra flavor.
Stir the mixture thoroughly with a large spoon to combine all the ingredients. Place the pitcher in the refrigerator and let it chill for about 1 hour, allowing the flavors to meld.
Before serving, taste the sangria and add more sugar if desired to adjust the sweetness.
Spoon some of the fruit into glasses, add ice, and pour the sangria over the top. Garnish with additional fruit or cinnamon sticks if desired.
Serve immediately and enjoy the bold, fruity, and spiced flavors of the Pomegranate Vanilla Sangria!

name: Pomegranate Vodka Lemonade
instructions: Fill a shaker with ice.
Add 2 oz vodka, 1 oz pomegranate juice, 1 oz lemon juice, and 1/2 oz simple syrup to the shaker.
Shake well until the mixture is chilled.
Strain the mixture into a tall glass filled with ice.
Top off with club soda and stir gently.
Garnish with pomegranate seeds and a lemon wheel.
Serve and enjoy

name: Pomegranate Vodka Sour
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.
Add the vodka, pomegranate juice, lemon juice, and simple syrup to the shaker.
Shake well until the mixture is chilled.
Strain the mixture into a glass filled with ice.
Garnish with pomegranate seeds and a lemon twist.
Serve and enjoy.

name: Port of Call
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the dry gin, ruby port, lemon juice, cinnamon syrup, and cranberry preserves.
Add ice to the shaker and shake until well-chilled.
Strain the mixture into a rocks glass filled with crushed or cracked ice.
Garnish with a mint sprig and a skewer of blackberry and raspberry.
Serve immediately and enjoy!

name: Pot of Gold
instructions: In your cocktail shaker, combine the whiskey, lemon juice, honey syrup, and orange bitters.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake it vigorously for about 15 seconds.
Strain the mixture into a rocks glass filled with ice.
Garnish with an orange twist.
Enjoy your Pot of Gold.

name: Presbyterian
ingredients: 2 ounces of Scotch whisky (blended Scotch whisky is recommended)
instructions: Fill a highball glass with ice.
Pour 2 ounces of Scotch whisky over the ice.
Top the glass with equal amounts of chilled ginger ale and club soda.
Stir the contents of the glass well.
Garnish the cocktail with a lemon twist, if desired.
Serve and enjoy!

name: Pretty in Pink
ingredients: lemon slice or sprig of mint ( for garnish)
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with crushed ice, then add the gin, lemon juice, orgeat syrup, triple sec, and pink food coloring.
Shake vigorously to combine all the ingredients and chill the mixture thoroughly.
Strain the cocktail into a glass filled with fresh ice, or for a more casual presentation, dirty dump the contents of the shaker (including the ice) into your serving glass.
Garnish with a lemon slice or a sprig of mint for a fresh, elegant finish.
Serve and enjoy the Pretty in Pink—a sweet, zesty, and visually stunning cocktail!

name: Prickly Pear Cinnamon Gin
ingredients: slice of apple or lemon peel (garnish)
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.
Add apple cinnamon gin, Thatcher’s Prickly Pear Liqueur, simple syrup, and lemon juice to the shaker.
Shake well to combine and chill the ingredients.
Strain the mixture into a coupe glass.
Garnish with a slice of apple or a lemon peel, if desired.
Enjoy your Prickly Pear Cinnamon Gin Cocktail!

name: Prickly Pear Vodka Sour
instructions: Muddle cucumber slices in a cocktail shaker or mixing glass until fully crushed and juicy.
Add the lime juice, simple syrup, prickly pear purée, and vodka to the muddled mixture.
In a separate mixing glass, vigorously shake the egg white with the coil from your strainer until frothy.
Combine the frothy egg white with the cocktail ingredients in the shaker and shake again, ensuring a smooth, frothy texture.
Strain the mixture over ice into your serving glass.
Garnish with a small orchid or edible flower for a beautiful presentation.

name: Prickly Pink Margarita
ingredients: Agave syrup ( for rimming the glass)
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, muddle jalapeño slices. Add tequila, coconut cream, lime juice, orange liqueur, and prickly pear syrup to the shaker.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake it well to chill and blend the ingredients.
Brush the rim of your serving glass with agave syrup. Dip the rim into salt to coat it evenly, then set the glass aside.
Strain the mixture into the prepared glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with 2 jalapeño slices. Enjoy your spicy, refreshing cocktail!

name: Prosecco Cranberry Apple Cider Thanksgiving Punch
