instructions: In a large punch bowl, pour in the apple cider, cranberry juice, and bourbon. Stir gently to combine.
Just before serving, pour in the chilled bottle of prosecco, stirring gently to maintain the bubbles.
Float thin slices of red apple on top of the punch. Add cinnamon sticks, star anise, and sprigs of fresh thyme for a festive, aromatic touch.

To serve, fill individual punch cups with ice and ladle the punch over. For extra garnish, tuck in an apple slice or a cinnamon stick in each cup, if desired. Serve immediately and enjoy this bubbly holiday punch chilled.

name: Psychedelic Frog Drink
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice cubes.
Add the Blue Curaçao, Coconut Rum, Midori Melon Liqueur, Amaretto, Pineapple Juice, and Orange Juice into the shaker.
Shake vigorously until the ingredients are well combined and chilled.
Fill a mason jar or glass with fresh ice cubes and strain the cocktail mixture into the glass.
Top off with a splash of Sprite for added fizz.
Garnish with a cherry, and your Psychedelic Frog Drink is ready to enjoy!

name: Pumpkin Aperol Margarita
instructions: Add tequila, Aperol, cointreau, pumpkin spice syrup, and lime juice into a cocktail shaker.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake until well chilled.
Strain the mixture into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a orange wheel for a seasonal finish.

name: Pumpkin Drop Martini
instructions: Pour black sugar onto a shallow plate, spreading it into an even layer. On another shallow plate, pour enough corn syrup to cover the bottom. Dip the rim of your martini glass into the corn syrup, then immediately dip it into the colored sugar, swirling it to create an even, sugared rim.
In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, combine the pumpkin spice liqueur, vanilla vodka, and Licor 43.
Secure the lid on the shaker and shake well until the mixture is thoroughly chilled.
Strain the cocktail into the prepared martini glass.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Pumpkin Drop Martini!

name: Pumpkin Gin Mule
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the dry gin, pumpkin purée, and lime juice.
Shake vigorously to thoroughly mix and chill the ingredients.
Strain the mixture into a Moscow mule mug filled with ice.
Top up the mug with ginger beer, stirring gently to combine the flavors.
Garnish with a lime wedge for a bright, citrusy touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Pumpkin Gin Mule!

name: Pumpkin Harvest
ingredients: Pumpkin spice or freshly grated nutmeg (for garnish)
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.
Add the bourbon, simple syrup, apple cider, amaretto, heavy cream, pumpkin puree, and Angostura bitters to the shaker.
Shake vigorously until the mixture is well chilled and frothy, ensuring the pumpkin puree is fully incorporated.
Strain the mixture into your glass.
Garnish with a light sprinkle of pumpkin spice or freshly grated nutmeg to enhance the autumnal flavors.
Serve immediately and enjoy the rich, creamy goodness of this fall-inspired cocktail.

name: Pumpkin Maple Flip
ingredients: Ground cinnamon, grated nutmeg, dash of salt, orange zest (for garnish)
instructions: Begin by adding only the egg white to a cocktail shaker without ice and shake vigorously using the dry shake method.
Add the bourbon, maple syrup, caramel, and pumpkin puree to the shaker.
Add ice to the shaker and shake vigorously again until the mixture is well chilled and fully combined.
Strain the cocktail into a chilled coupe glass.
Garnish the top of the drink with a sprinkle of ground cinnamon, a pinch of grated nutmeg, a dash of salt, and some freshly grated orange zest for a fragrant and festive finish.
Serve immediately and enjoy the creamy, spiced flavors of this indulgent fall cocktail.

name: Pumpkin Orange Saffron Cocktail
ingredients: 0.5 ounce aquafaba (liquid from a strained can of chickpeas)
instructions: Start by infusing the saffron: combine the saffron threads with maple syrup and let it sit for a few minutes to allow the flavors to meld.
In a separate container, stir together the orange juice, pumpkin puree, and vanilla extract until smooth. Add this mixture to the saffron infusion and stir well.
In a cocktail shaker, combine the saffron-orange-pumpkin mixture with the vodka and aquafaba.
Shake vigorously until the mixture is frothy and well-chilled.
Rub the inside of your glass with a fresh orange peel to release the citrus oils, enhancing the flavor of the drink.
Pour the shaken cocktail into the prepared glass.
Top with a pinch of cinnamon and garnish with the orange peel for an aromatic finish.
Serve immediately and enjoy the rich, layered flavors of this elegant cocktail.

name: Pumpkin Pie Martini
ingredients: ¼ tsp pumpkin pie spice (plus extra for garnish)
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the vanilla vodka, aged rum, pumpkin puree, maple syrup, half-and-half, pumpkin pie spice, and a handful of ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 20-30 seconds to ensure the ingredients are well blended and chilled.
Strain the mixture into a chilled martini glass.
Top with a dollop of frozen whipped cream if desired.
Sprinkle a light dusting of pumpkin pie spice over the top for garnish and serve immediately.

name: Pumpkin Pie Old Fashioned
instructions: Begin by adding the bourbon whiskey, Angostura bitters, brown sugar simple syrup, pumpkin purée, and pumpkin pie spice to a cocktail shaker.
Shake the mixture vigorously without ice to fully blend and emulsify the pumpkin purée and spices.
Add ice to the shaker and shake again to chill the drink.
Strain the cocktail into a whiskey glass over an ice ball or large ice cube.
Garnish the drink with a cinnamon stick for an aromatic touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Pumpkin Pie Old Fashioned!

name: Pumpkin Pie Spice Bourbon
instructions: In a rocks glass, combine the bourbon, simple syrup, pumpkin purée, and pumpkin pie spice.
Stir the mixture until all the ingredients are well blended and the pumpkin purée is fully incorporated.
Fill a rocks glass with ice.
Pour the pumpkin pie spice bourbon mixture over the ice.
Serve immediately and enjoy your cozy Pumpkin Pie Spice Bourbon!

name: Pumpkin Pie Whiskey Sour
instructions: Add the bourbon, pumpkin spice syrup, lemon juice, and egg white to a cocktail shaker.
Without adding ice, shake vigorously for about 15 seconds to create a frothy texture (this is called a dry shake).
Add ice to the shaker and shake again for another 15 seconds to chill and further mix the ingredients.
Strain the cocktail into a coupe glass, using a fine mesh strainer if needed for extra smoothness.
Garnish with a few dashes of Peychaud’s bitters and a light sprinkle of grated nutmeg.

name: Pumpkin Piña Colada
instructions: In a blender, combine the pineapple juice, pumpkin puree, coconut cream, rum, ice, and cinnamon.
Blend until smooth and creamy.
Pour the mixture into a glass.
Top with a dollop of whipped cream and a pinch of nutmeg for a festive touch.
Garnish with a pineapple wedge for a tropical vibe.
Serve and enjoy your Pumpkin Piña Colada—a perfect blend of tropical and autumn flavors!

name: Pumpkin Rum Milkshake
ingredients: Cinnamon or crumbled gingerbread (optional, for topping)
instructions: Place the dark rum, pumpkin purée, vanilla ice cream, milk, ground cinnamon, and ground nutmeg into a blender.
Secure the blender lid and blend the ingredients until smooth and well combined.
Pour the milkshake into glasses.
If desired, top with a pinch of cinnamon or crumbled gingerbread for an extra festive touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Pumpkin Rum Milkshake!

name: Pumpkin Rum Tini
instructions: Start by chilling your serving glass. Place a martini or coupe glass in the freezer for a few minutes or fill it with ice water while you prepare the cocktail.
In a cocktail shaker, combine the dark rum, Irish cream liqueur, pumpkin spice syrup, and half & half.
Cap the shaker and shake vigorously until the ingredients are well mixed and chilled.
Discard the ice water from the glass and strain the shaken mixture into the chilled serving glass.
Add a garnish of your choice, such as a sprinkle of cinnamon or a cinnamon stick, and serve immediately.
Enjoy your Pumpkin Rum Tini!

name: Pumpkin Salted Caramel Martini
ingredients: 1.5 oz Mozart Chocolate Pumpkin Spice Liqueur
instructions: In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, combine the Mozart Chocolate Pumpkin Spice Liqueur, caramel vodka, regular vodka, allspice dram, and a dash of salt.
Secure the lid on the shaker and shake vigorously until the mixture is well chilled.
Strain the cocktail into a martini glass.
Garnish with a marshmallow skewered on a cocktail pick or toothpick.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Pumpkin Salted Caramel Martini. Cheers!

name: Pumpkin Spice Dark and Stormy
instructions: In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, combine the dark rum, lime juice, orange juice, and pumpkin purée.
Shake well to mix and chill the ingredients thoroughly.
Strain the mixture into a tall glass filled with fresh ice.
Top off the cocktail with ginger beer, adjusting the amount to suit your taste.
Sprinkle a light dusting of grated nutmeg on top for a warm, spicy finish.
Garnish with an orange peel, if desired, for an extra citrusy aroma.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Pumpkin Spice Dark and Stormy!

name: Pumpkin Spice Gin Sour
ingredients: Dash of cinnamon powder or cinnamon sticks (for garnish)
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the gin, lemon juice, pumpkin butter, and egg white.
Add ice to the shaker and shake vigorously for about a minute to ensure the ingredients are well mixed and the egg white becomes frothy.
Strain the mixture into a chilled coup glass, ensuring a smooth, silky texture.
Garnish the drink with a dash of cinnamon or cinnamon sticks and a sprig of fresh thyme for an aromatic finish.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Pumpkin Spice Gin Sour!

name: Pumpkin Spice Highball
instructions: In a shaker, pour the blood orange gin, pumpkin syrup, lime juice, and ice.
Shake well to combine the ingredients.
Top off the drink with ginger ale, adding as much as desired to balance the flavors and achieve the right level of fizz.
Garnish with a few slices of fresh ginger for an aromatic and visually appealing finish.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Pumpkin Spice Highball!

name: Pumpkin Spice Hot Buttered Rum
ingredients: Whipped cream and Pumpkin Pie Sauce  (for garnish)
instructions: In a small bowl, whisk together the softened butter, dark brown sugar, Pumpkin Pie Sauce, cinnamon, and freshly grated nutmeg until the mixture becomes light and fluffy. Set aside.
Bring 6 ounces of apple cider to a boil.
In your desired glass, add a heaping tablespoon of the spiced butter mixture to the bottom of the glass.
Pour in the dark rum, followed by the hot cider, and stir until the butter mixture is fully incorporated and smooth.
Top the drink with whipped cream and drizzle with extra Pumpkin Pie Sauce for a rich, festive finish.
Serve immediately and enjoy the warm, spiced flavors of this decadent Pumpkin Spice Hot Buttered Rum.

name: Pumpkin Spice Moscow Mule
instructions: In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, add the vanilla vodka, pumpkin puree, pumpkin pie spice, and lime juice.
Shake well to combine the ingredients and chill the mixture.
Pour the shaken mixture into a copper mule mug filled with fresh ice.
Top off with ginger beer, stirring gently to combine.
Garnish with a sprinkle of pumpkin pie spice for an added touch of warmth and spice.
Serve immediately and enjoy the cozy, festive flavors of this fall-inspired cocktail.

name: Pumpkin Spice Mudslide
ingredients: Cinnamon stick and/or extra pumpkin spice (for garnish, optional)
instructions: In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, combine the coffee vodka, pumpkin purée, pumpkin spice, Baileys Irish Cream, and half-and-half.
Secure the lid on the shaker and shake well until the mixture is thoroughly chilled and well blended.
Drizzle caramel sauce on the inside of your cocktail glass, creating a decorative pattern.
Strain the cocktail into the prepared glass.
If desired, garnish with a cinnamon stick and/or a light dusting of extra pumpkin spice for a festive touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Pumpkin Spice Mudslide!

name: Pumpkin Spiced Apple Cider
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the Pumpkin Spiced Apple Cider, dark rum, cinnamon simple syrup, and lemon juice.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously until the container is ice-cold to the touch.
Fill chilled glass with fresh ice.
Strain the mixture from the shaker into the prepared glass.
Top off glass with chilled ginger ale, adding a refreshing fizz to the cocktail.
Gently stir to combine the flavors.
Garnish with a cinnamon stick for a festive and aromatic touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Pumpkin Spiced Apple Cider Cocktail.

name: Pumpkin Spiced Espresso Martini
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the vanilla vodka, espresso, coffee liqueur, and homemade pumpkin spice syrup.
Add cubed ice to the shaker.
Shake the mixture vigorously for 10-20 seconds until well-chilled and frothy.
Strain the cocktail into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish the drink with freshly grated nutmeg and three coffee beans for a classic touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Pumpkin Spiced Espresso Martini!

name: Pumpkin Tequila Crush
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the reposado tequila, pumpkin purée, and lime juice.
Add ice to the shaker and shake vigorously to blend the ingredients and chill the mixture.
Pour the contents of the shaker into a rocks glass.
Top off the drink with 3 oz of orange soda.
Sprinkle ground cinnamon over the top of the drink.
Garnish with an lime wheel for a citrusy finish.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Pumpkin Tequila Crush!

name: Pumpkin Whiskey Smash
ingredients: 1 ounce lemon juice (plus more to taste)
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the whiskey, pumpkin simple syrup, and lemon juice.
Stir the mixture well to blend the flavors.
Add ice to the shaker to chill the drink.
Pour the mixture into a glass filled with ice.
Adjust the lemon juice to taste if you prefer a more tart flavor.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Pumpkin Whiskey Smash Cocktail.

name: Purple Hooter
ingredients: A splash of soda water (optional for a fizzy touch)
instructions: Fill a shaker with ice.
Pour the vodka, raspberry liqueur, and lime juice into the shaker.
Shake well until the mixture is chilled.
Strain the mix into a shot glass or a small tumbler.
If you like, top it off with a splash of soda water for a little fizz.
Serve and enjoy!

name: Purple Paradise Punch
instructions: Fill a glass with ice cubes.
Pour the pink lemonade into the glass as the base layer.
Slowly pour the blue curaçao over the back of a spoon, directing it down the side of the glass to create a distinct blue layer.
In a separate dish, combine the Empress gin and crème de violette.
Carefully pour the gin mixture over the back of a spoon, letting it gently float on top of the blue curaçao for the final layer.
Garnish with a pineapple slice and a cherry for a tropical touch.
Serve and enjoy your Purple Paradise Punch!

name: Purple People Eater
instructions: Begin by preparing your glass: pour purple sugar onto a small plate. Lightly wet the rim of your glass with simple syrup, then gently press the rim into the purple sugar, coating it evenly. Set the glass aside.
Fill a cocktail shaker with ice, then add the vodka, blue curaçao, sweet and sour mix, grenadine, and cranberry juice.
Shake vigorously until the ingredients are well combined and the mixture is chilled.
Fill the glass with ice. Pour the dark purple cocktail mixture into the glass, filling it to the top.
Serve immediately and enjoy this visually stunning and deliciously sweet Purple People Eater cocktail.

name: Purple Pineapple Smash
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, muddle the pineapple juice and sage leaves to release the herb's flavor.
Add the Empress gin, crème de violette, lemon juice, and simple syrup to the shaker, along with ice.
Shake vigorously until the mixture is well-chilled and combined.
Strain the cocktail over a large ice cube in a rocks glass.
Garnish with a dried lemon wheel and a fresh sage leaf to enhance the presentation.

name: Purple Rain Cocktail
instructions: Fill a tall glass with ice cubes.
Add the vodka, blue curaçao, cranberry juice, and lemon juice to the glass.
Top with soda water.
Stir gently to combine all the ingredients.
Garnish with a lemon wheel and a cranberry for a pop of color.
Serve and enjoy your Purple Rain Cocktail!

name: Raspberry Aperol Spritz
instructions: Place 4-6 fresh raspberries into a cocktail shaker and pour in the Aperol.
Using a muddler, press down on the raspberries until they are thoroughly crushed.
Add the agave syrup and fill the shaker with ice.
Secure the lid on the shaker and shake vigorously for about 10 seconds.
Fill a wine glass with ice to your preference.
Strain the mixture into the glass, or pour it directly for more texture.
Pour Prosecco into the glass until it is about three-quarters full.
Top the glass off with sparkling water for a light fizz.
Garnish with the remaining fresh raspberries, and consider adding a few frozen ones for an extra chill.
Serve and savor the effervescent delight.

name: Raspberry Bloodtini
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.
Add the gin, raspberry liqueur, lime juice, and grenadine to the shaker.
Shake vigorously for about 15 seconds until the mixture is well-chilled.
Strain the cocktail into a chilled martini glass.
Garnish with a few fresh raspberries and lime wheel to give your drink a bloody, elegant finish.
Serve and enjoy the intriguing flavor and mysterious allure of the Raspberry Bloodtini!

name: Raspberry Bourbon Lemonade
instructions: Muddle Raspberries: In a cocktail shaker, muddle the raspberries until they are well crushed.
Add Bourbon and Lemonade: Add the bourbon and lemonade to the shaker with the raspberries.
Shake: Fill the shaker with ice and shake well to combine the ingredients.
Strain: Strain the mixture into a glass filled with ice.
Top with Club soda: Top off the drink with Club soda.
Garnish: Garnish with a few fresh raspberries and a lemon slice, if desired.

name: Raspberry Chocolate Truffle Cocktail
instructions: Chill your coupe or rocks glass in the freezer for a few minutes.
In a cocktail shaker, combine raspberry vodka, vanilla vodka, chocolate liqueur, and chocolate milk.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously for 15–20 seconds.
Strain the cocktail into the chilled glass.
Top with a dollop of whipped cream, a fresh raspberry, and a sprinkle of shaved chocolate for a decadent finishing touch.

name: Raspberry Coconut Mojito
instructions: Place about 5-7 raspberries, mint leaves, and lime juice in a cocktail shaker.
Use a muddler to thoroughly mash the raspberries and mint leaves.
Add the rum, simple syrup, and cream of coconut to the shaker.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously for at least 15 seconds.
Pour the mixture into a cocktail glass, either with or without straining, according to your preference.
Top up the glass with ice.
Garnish with coconut flakes, fresh raspberries, and a mint sprig.
Enjoy your refreshing Raspberry Coconut Mojito!

name: Raspberry Cream Pie
instructions: Muddle a  5 raspberries to a rocks glass to release their juices. Set the glass aside.
In a separate mixing glass, combine the Chambord, vanilla vodka, and heavy cream. Stir well to mix all the ingredients thoroughly.
Add large ice cubes to the muddled raspberries in the rocks glass.
Strain the cocktail mixture from the mixing glass into your prepared glass.
Garnish with the remaining fresh raspberries on top.

name: Raspberry Dream
instructions: Muddle the Raspberries: In a shaker, gently muddle the 4 raspberries to release their juice and flavor.
Combine Ingredients: Add the vodka, half-and-half, Chambord, and simple syrup to the shaker.
Shake: Fill the shaker with ice, secure the lid, and shake vigorously for about 15 seconds to chill and mix the ingredients thoroughly.
Strain and Serve: Strain the mixture into a chilled cocktail glass to remove the ice and raspberry seeds.
Garnish: Add a few fresh raspberries and, if you like, a sprig of mint to the glass for garnish.
Enjoy: Serve immediately and enjoy your creamy, berry-flavored Raspberry Dream cocktail!

name: Raspberry Hibiscus Moscow Mule
instructions: Add the fresh raspberries, mint leaves, and vodka or gin to a cocktail shaker.
Muddle the raspberries and mint leaves together using a muddler to release their flavors.
Add the simple syrup, lime juice, and ice to the shaker.
Shake vigorously for at least 15 seconds to combine the ingredients and chill the mixture.
Fill your mug or glass to the top with ice.
Strain the contents of the shaker into the glass.
Top off the glass with hibiscus ginger beer.
Garnish with mint leaves and fresh raspberries.
Enjoy your Raspberry Hibiscus Moscow Mule!

name: Raspberry Limoncello Martini
instructions: Muddle the raspberries and lemon juice in a cocktail shaker.
Add the Cointreau, vodka, and limoncello to the shaker.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake well until thoroughly chilled.
Double strain the mixture into a martini glass rimmed with sugar.
Serve immediately and enjoy!

name: Raspberry Sangria
ingredients: 1  bottle of dry red wine (750 ml)
8 ounces soda water (club soda or sparkling water)
instructions: Rinse the fresh raspberries and set them aside.
Slice the orange, lemon, and lime into thin rounds, removing any seeds.
In a large pitcher, combine the red wine, raspberry liqueur, brandy, and simple syrup. Stir well to mix.
Add the fresh raspberries, and the slices of orange, lemon, and lime to the pitcher. Stir gently to combine.
Cover the pitcher and refrigerate the sangria for at least 2 hours, allowing the flavors to meld together. For best results, let it chill overnight.
Just before serving, add the soda water to the pitcher and stir gently.
Fill glasses with ice cubes and pour the sangria over the ice, making sure to include some of the fruit in each glass.
Garnish with additional fresh raspberries or a slice of citrus fruit on the rim of the glass, if desired.
Serve immediately and enjoy your refreshing Raspberry Sangria.

name: Raspberry Sorbet 75
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the gin, lemon juice, honey, and a scoop of raspberry sorbet.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously until well chilled and the sorbet is slightly melted.
Strain the mixture into a Champagne flute or coupe glass.
Top with Prosecco.
Garnish with fresh raspberries.
Enjoy your bubbly and fruity Raspberry Sorbet 75!

name: Red Christmas Gin Cocktail
instructions: Fill a highball glass with ice.
Add the gin, cranberry juice, lime juice, orange juice, and maple syrup to the glass.
Stir gently with a spoon to mix the ingredients.
Top with a splash of soda water.
Garnish with a sprig of rosemary and a few fresh cranberries for a festive touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy the holiday flavors!

name: Red Headed Step Child
instructions: Fill a highball glass or tumbler with ice.
Pour the vodka and gin over the ice.
Fill the glass halfway with cranberry juice.
Top off the drink with ginger ale.
Stir gently to combine the ingredients.
Garnish with cranberry. Serve immediately and enjoy!

name: Red Hot Santa Tini
instructions: Combine cocoa powder and a small pinch of cayenne pepper on a plate.
Moisten the rim of a martini glass with water or chocolate liqueur, then dip it into the cocoa-cayenne mixture, coating the rim evenly.
In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, add the chili vodka, chocolate liqueur, and slightly cooled hot chocolate.
Shake vigorously for 15–20 seconds to chill and blend the ingredients thoroughly.
Strain the mixture into the prepared martini glass.
Top the drink with a swirl of whipped cream for a festive and creamy finish.
Lightly dust the whipped cream with cayenne pepper for an extra spicy touch.
Garnish with a whole red chili pepper for a striking visual and thematic flair.

name: Red Lobster Dew Garita
instructions: Cut a lime and run it along the rim of the margarita glass.
Dip the rim of the glass into cocktail sugar to coat.
Fill a shaker with tequila, Midori, sour mix, lime juice, triple sec, and Mountain Dew.
Add a cup of ice to the shaker and shake until well-mixed.
Strain the mixture into the prepared margarita glass filled with ice.
Serve immediately and enjoy!

name: Red Moon Over Manhattan
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the red wine, bourbon, and simple syrup.
Add ice to the shaker and shake well to mix and chill the ingredients.
Rub an orange peel around the rim of a rocks glass to release the citrus oils.
Fill the glass with ice cubes.
Strain the cocktail mixture over the ice in the prepared glass.
Scoop one maraschino cherry into the drink and skewer the remaining two cherries on a twig or cocktail stirrer to garnish the glass.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Red Moon Over Manhattan!

name: Red-Nosed Refresher
instructions: Add vodka, raspberry liqueur, lemon juice, and grenadine to a cocktail shaker filled with ice.
Shake well until the mixture is well-chilled.
Strain into a glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with club soda for a refreshing finish and garnish with rosemary sprig.
Serve immediately and enjoy this festive cocktail.

name: Red Queen
instructions: Add the gin, elderflower liqueur, cranberry juice, and lemon juice to a shaker filled with ice.
Shake well until thoroughly chilled.
Strain the mixture into a chilled cocktail glass.
Serve immediately and enjoy!

name: Red Snapper Shot
ingredients: A dash of hot sauce and Worcestershire sauce
instructions: Fill your shaker with ice.
Pour in the vodka and tomato juice.
Add a dash of hot sauce and Worcestershire sauce.
Season with a pinch of salt and pepper.
Shake it up until it's well mixed and chilled.
Strain it into your shot glass.
Garnish with a lemon wedge.

name: Red White and Blue Colada
ingredients: Pineapple soaked in Master of Mixes Blue Curacao (for garnish)
instructions: Rim the glass with some Blue Curacao to give it a blue tint.
Pour 1/4 oz of grenadine syrup into the bottom of the glass.
In a blender, combine 2 oz of rum and 4 oz of Pina Colada mixer.
Blend until smooth.
Slowly pour this mixture over the back of a spoon into the glass to create the white layer on top of the red grenadine.
Carefully pour 1/4 oz of Blue Curacao over the back of a spoon to float it on top of the white layer.
Skewer the pineapple soaked in Master of Mixes Blue Curacao and place it on the rim of the glass.

name: Red White and Blue Jello Shots
instructions: In a mixing bowl, dissolve the berry blue jello mix in the boiling water.
Stir in the cold water and blue raspberry vodka.
Pour the mixture evenly into shot glasses, filling them about one-third full.
Refrigerate until the jello is set.
In a mixing bowl, sprinkle the unflavored gelatin over the cold water and let it sit to bloom.
Add the boiling water and stir until the gelatin is completely dissolved.
Stir in the sweetened condensed milk and vodka until well combined.
Let the mixture cool to room temperature, then carefully pour it over the set blue layer, filling the shot glasses another third full.
Refrigerate until the white layer is set.
In a mixing bowl, dissolve the cherry jello mix in the boiling water.
Stir in the cold water and cherry vodka.
Once the white layer is set, carefully pour the red jello mixture over it, filling the shot glasses to the top.
Refrigerate until the red layer is set.
Once all layers are fully set, your Red, White, and Blue Jello Shots are ready to serve.
Keep them refrigerated until you’re ready to enjoy.

name: Red, White & Booze Popsicles
instructions: Mix the cherry-flavored vodka, black cherry juice, lemon juice, and simple syrup in a bowl.
Pour the mixture into popsicle molds, filling each about a third of the way.
Freeze until solid.
Combine the coconut rum, pineapple rum, coconut water, and simple syrup in a bowl.
Carefully pour the Piña Colada mixture over the frozen Cherry Bomb layer in the popsicle molds, filling each about two-thirds of the way.
Freeze until solid.
Mix the blue curaçao, vodka, orange-pineapple juice, simple syrup, and blue food coloring (if using) in a bowl.
Carefully pour the Blue Hawaii mixture over the frozen Piña Colada layer in the popsicle molds, filling each to the top.
Insert popsicle sticks and freeze until solid.
Once fully frozen, remove the popsicles from the molds.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Red, White & Booze Popsicles.

name: Redneck Margarita
instructions: Cut a lime and run it along the rim of the mason jar. Dip the rim of the glass into cocktail salt to coat.
In a mason jar, combine the frozen limeade concentrate, Sprite, Corona, and tequila.
Stir well until all ingredients are mixed.
Fill glasses with ice.
Pour the margarita mixture into the prepared glass.
Garnish with a lime wedge and serve immediately.

name: Rémy Espresso Martini
instructions: Prepare the Espresso:
Brew a strong espresso and allow it to cool. This ensures your cocktail remains chilled and doesn't get watered down.
Mix the Cocktail:
In a cocktail shaker, combine the Rémy Martin VSOP, cooled espresso, coffee liqueur, and simple syrup.
Fill the shaker with ice if you want it cold.
Shake:
Shake vigorously for about 15 seconds. This not only chills the drink but also creates a nice frothy top when poured.
Strain:
Strain the mixture into a chilled martini glass. The aim is to have a smooth liquid with a frothy top.
Garnish:
Place three coffee beans on top of the froth for a classic espresso martini garnish. This adds a visual appeal and a hint of coffee aroma.
Serve:
Serve immediately and enjoy the perfect balance of rich cognac and bold espresso in your Rémy Espresso Martini.

name: How to Make a Rhymes With Orange
ingredients: A splash of peated Scotch whisky
instructions: In a mixing glass filled three-quarters with ice, pour the orange bitters down the side to ensure they settle at the bottom.
Combine the sweet vermouth and amaro in a jigger, then add this mixture to the mixing glass.
Follow by adding the rye whiskey to the mix.
Stir all the ingredients thoroughly with ice until perfectly blended.
Strain the well-mixed concoction into the chilled glass, ideally over a substantial ice cube or block to maintain the drink's chill without rapid dilution.
Finally, garnish your Rhymes With Orange cocktail with a flamed orange zest twist. The flaming zest not only imparts a touch of sweetness but also adds a dramatic flair to your drink.

name: Rivi Lychee Tini
ingredients: 2 oz. Rive Gin Raspberry Honey Flavored Gin
1 oz. Lychee Simple Syrup (equal parts Lychee juice and simple syrup)
instructions: Step 1: In a cocktail shaker, add gin, lychee simple syrup, lemon juice, and egg white.Step 2: Dry ShakeStep 3: Double strain into a coupe glass.Step 4: Garnish with Peychaud Bitters (mix into egg white for color)

name: Roasted Peach Bourbon
ingredients: 1  small peach (cut in half and pit removed)
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, add the roasted peaches and the reserved juices. Use a muddler or the back of a wooden spoon to thoroughly muddle the peaches.
Add the bourbon, simple syrup, and ice to the shaker. Secure the lid and shake vigorously until the mixture is well chilled.
Place two large ice cubes into each of the highball glass
Strain the cocktail mixture through a small mesh sieve as you pour it into the highball glass, ensuring a smooth drink.
Top off the glass with a splash of club soda for a bit of fizz.
Garnish with fresh peach slices and a sprig of thyme. Serve immediately and enjoy!

name: Rosé Cobbler
instructions: Fill a tall glass or cobbler shaker with crushed ice.
In a shaker, combine the Vermouth, Aperol, strawberry puree, rhubarb shrub, lemon juice, and bitters.
Add ice and shake well until chilled.
Strain the mixture over the crushed ice in the prepared glass.
Garnish with a sprig of mint and a mix of berries.
Dust with powdered sugar for a festive touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy your refreshing Rosé Cobbler, perfect for celebrating the 4th of July.
*Rhubarb Shrub: To make a rhubarb shrub, combine 1 cup chopped rhubarb, 1 cup sugar, and 1 cup apple cider vinegar. Let it sit in the refrigerator, then strain out the solids.

name: Rosemary Bourbon Lemonade
ingredients: 1  stem of rosemary (about 1 Tbsp rosemary leaves)
instructions: Prepare the Rosemary Infused Bourbon:
Strip the leaves from the rosemary stem and place them in a small jar or glass.
Pour the bourbon over the rosemary leaves.
Allow the bourbon to infuse for at least 30 minutes. For a stronger rosemary flavor, you can let it infuse for up to 24 hours in the refrigerator.
Mix the Cocktail:
In a cocktail shaker, combine the rosemary-infused bourbon (strained), lemonade, egg white, and bitters.
Dry shake (shake without ice) vigorously for about 15 seconds. This helps to create a frothy texture from the egg white.
Add Ice and Shake Again:
Add a handful of ice to the shaker.
Shake again vigorously until the mixture is well chilled, about another 15 seconds.
Serve:
Strain the mixture into a chilled glass. You can use a fine mesh strainer to ensure no ice or rosemary bits make it into the glass.
Optionally, garnish with a small sprig of rosemary or a twist of lemon peel to enhance the presentation.
Enjoy:
Your Rosemary Bourbon Lemonade is ready! The herbal notes of the rosemary, combined with the richness of bourbon and the tanginess of lemonade, create a delightful spring cocktail.

name: Rosemary Gimlet
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the gin, rosemary simple syrup, and lime juice.
Add ice to the shaker and shake well until the mixture is thoroughly chilled.
Strain into a chilled coupe or rocks glass.
Serve immediately and enjoy this herbal twist on a classic gimlet.

name: Rosemary Peach Tequila Punch
instructions: Add the chopped peach and rosemary simple syrup to a blender. Blend until the mixture is smooth and well combined.
Pour the peach and rosemary puree into a rocks glass.
Add the tequila to the glass and stir gently to mix the ingredients.
Top off the drink with lemon-lime soda, adding a fizzy and refreshing finish.
Add frozen raspberries and ice to the glass to chill the punch and garnish with a pop of color.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Rosemary Peach Tequila Punch.

name: Rosita
instructions: To begin, fill a mixing glass with ice cubes. Add the tequila, sweet vermouth, dry vermouth, and Campari to the mixing glass.
Stir the ingredients together until they are well combined and chilled.
Next, strain the cocktail into an old-fashioned glass filled with ice cubes.
Add a dash of Angostura bitters to the top of the cocktail.
Finally, garnish the drink with an orange peel or twist.

name: Rosso Repo Refresher
instructions: Place two cucumber slices in a cocktail shaker and gently muddle them to release their juices.
Add reposado tequila, Cardamaro, sweet vermouth, and cynar to the shaker.
Fill the shaker with ice and stir the ingredients well to chill.
Fine strain the mixture into a coupe glass.
Garnish with a cucumber wheel. Enjoy!

name: Royal Hawaiian Cocktail
instructions: In a shaker, combine the pineapple juice, lemon juice, and orgeat syrup.
Add ice and shake vigorously until well chilled.
Strain the mixture into a Collins glass filled with crushed ice.
Gently pour the Empress 1908 Indigo Gin over the top, creating a vibrant layer.
Garnish with a pineapple slice for a tropical touch.

name: Royal Mojito
instructions: In a highball or Collins glass, gently muddle the fresh mint leaves with simple syrup and lime juice to release the mint’s aroma and oils. Be careful not to tear the mint leaves too much to avoid bitterness.
Add the white rum and fill the glass halfway with crushed ice. Stir to combine and chill the mixture.
Slowly pour champagne over the drink to top off the glass, allowing the bubbles to blend with the other flavors.
Stir gently to incorporate the champagne without losing its fizz.
Garnish with a mint sprig and a lime wheel for an elegant and refreshing presentation.

name: Rudolph's Tipsy Spritz
instructions: In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, combine the orange juice, cranberry juice, ginger ale, vodka, maraschino cherry juice, and lemon juice.
Shake well until the mixture is thoroughly chilled.
Strain the cocktail into a wine glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a handful of cranberries and a sprig of rosemary for a festive touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy the holiday flavors!

name: Rum and Apple Juice
ingredients: Cinnamon stick or apple slices (for garnish)
instructions: Fill a cocktail glass with ice.
Pour in the spiced rum and apple juice.
Stir the drink with a cinnamon stick to infuse the flavors and blend the ingredients.
Garnish with fresh apple slices for an extra touch of flavor and presentation.
Serve immediately and enjoy the warm, spiced flavors of this simple, refreshing cocktail.

name: Rum and Cherry Christmas Cocktail
instructions: In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, combine the rum, cherry brandy, Amarena syrup, and lemon juice.
Shake well until the mixture is thoroughly chilled.
Fine strain the cocktail into a coupe glass over a large rock of ice for a refined presentation.
Garnish with a few cherries for a festive touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy!

name: Rum and Ginger Christmas Cocktail
instructions: Place the chopped or grated fresh ginger in a cocktail shaker, then add the lime juice and honey. Muddle the mixture well to release the ginger’s flavor.
Add the rum, cranberry juice, and ginger wine to the shaker with ice.
Shake thoroughly to blend and chill the ingredients.
Strain the mixture into a champagne coupe or flute over fresh ice.
Top up with ginger beer, as preferred.
Finish with a light dusting of freshly grated nutmeg and serve immediately

name: Rum Cider
instructions: Add the rum, apple cider, chamomile tea, demerara syrup, and lemon juice to a pot.
Bring the mixture to a boil, stirring occasionally.
Once the mixture reaches a boil, remove from heat.
Pour the hot drink into a coffee mug.
Garnish with a lemon wheel and a sprinkle of freshly grated nutmeg.
Serve immediately and enjoy the rich, warming flavors of this spiced cocktail.

name: Rum Harvest Cocktail
instructions: Fill a highball glass with ice.
Add the spiced rum, cranberry juice, and lime juice to the glass. Stir gently to combine.
Top off the drink with about 4 ounces of Coke, adjusting to taste.
Garnish the cocktail with lime wedges for a bright, citrusy touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy the refreshing blend of spiced rum, tart cranberry, and cola flavors in this easy-to-make fall cocktail.

name: Rum Hot Chocolate
ingredients: 6 oz milk (plus a bit extra for froth)
instructions: Pour 6 oz of milk into a microwave-safe mug and heat in the microwave until it reaches a comfortable drinking temperature.
Stir in the raw cacao powder, mixing until fully dissolved and smooth.
Add the dark rum, stirring gently to combine.
In a mixing glass, froth a small amount of additional milk using a milk frother or whisk until it forms a light, creamy froth.
Pour the milk froth on top of the hot chocolate mixture.
Garnish with chocolate sprinkles and serve warm.

name: Rum Negroni
instructions: Fill a mixing glass with ice.
Add the rum, Campari, and sweet vermouth to the mixing glass.
Stir for about 20-30 seconds, or until the mixture is well chilled.
Strain the mixture into a rocks glass filled with ice.
Garnish with a slice of orange or a twist of orange peel, if desired.

name: Rum Spiked Pumpkin Pie Punch
instructions: In a large mixing bowl, combine the pumpkin puree, spiced apple cider, and spiced rum. Whisk together until smooth and well-combined.
Slowly pour in the cream soda and lightly stir to incorporate the bubbles.
Divide the punch evenly between four glasses.
Top each glass with a generous dollop of whipped cream and a sprinkle of pumpkin pie spice for a festive finish.
Serve immediately and enjoy the rich, spiced flavors of this pumpkin pie-inspired punch.

name: RumChata Apple Crisp
instructions: Brush the rim of your serving glass with simple syrup. Dip the rim into crushed graham crackers to coat evenly. Place the glass in the freezer to set.
In a cocktail shaker, combine the apple juice, spiced rum, Rum Chata, a dash of salt, and simple.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously to chill and blend the ingredients.
Strain the shaken mixture into the chilled glass over the large ice cube.
Garnish with a few apple slices and get ready to enjoy!

name: Russian Blue Moon
instructions: Begin by filling a rocks glass with ice.
Add the vodka and coffee liqueur, letting them mix over the ice.
Slowly pour the blue curaçao into the glass, creating a ghostly blue layer.
Gently pour the heavy cream over the drink to achieve a layered, moonlit effect.
Stir lightly to blend the colors for a dreamy swirl, or leave it layered for a hauntingly beautiful presentation.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Russian Blue Moon!

name: The Rusty Nail
instructions: Pour the scotch and Drambuie into a mixing glass with ice
Stir until thoroughly chilled
Strain into a rocks glass with one ice cube
Garnish with a lemon peel

name: Salted Caramel Apple Martini
ingredients: 2 tbsp sea salt (for rimming the glass)
instructions: Begin by preparing your cocktail glass: pour the caramel sauce onto a small plate, and on a separate plate, spread the sea salt. Dip the rim of the glass first into the caramel sauce, then into the sea salt, coating the rim evenly.
In a martini shaker, combine the caramel vodka and apple cider.
Add ice cubes to the shaker, then shake vigorously until the mixture is well chilled.
Carefully pour the shaken cocktail into the prepared glass, being mindful not to disturb the salted caramel rim.
Garnish with a slice of fresh apple for an added touch of elegance.
Serve immediately and enjoy the sweet and salty flavors of this luxurious martini.

name: Salted Caramel Espresso Martini
ingredients: 1 ounce Espresso (freshly brewed and cooled to room temperature)
Coffee beans or a caramel drizzle for garnish
instructions: Chill Your Glass:
Begin by placing your martini glass in the freezer for a few minutes. This keeps your cocktail cold for longer.
Combine Ingredients:
In a cocktail shaker, add the vodka, espresso, coffee liqueur, and syrup.
Shake It Up:
Fill the shaker with ice. Secure the lid tightly and shake vigorously for about 15-20 seconds. The goal is to cool the mixture while slightly diluting it for a smooth taste.
Strain:
Take your martini glass out of the freezer. Strain the cocktail into the glass, ensuring a smooth pour without any ice chips.
Garnish and Serve:
Garnish with a few coffee beans on top or a drizzle of caramel for that extra flair.
Serve immediately and enjoy drinking.

name: Salted Caramel Manhattan
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker three-quarters full with ice.
Add the whiskey, vermouth, bitters, caramel sauce, and salt to the shaker.
Shake well to combine the ingredients and chill the drink.
Strain the mixture into a chilled glass.
Serve immediately and enjoy the rich, balanced flavors of this Salted Caramel Manhattan.

name: Salted Caramel White Russian
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the vodka, coffee liqueur, a pinch of salt, a drizzle of caramel, simple syrup, and half & half.
Shake the mixture vigorously to ensure all the ingredients are well-blended and chilled.
Prepare your glass by dipping half of the rim of a rocks glass in caramel, then coating it with a pinch of salt.
Strain the shaken mixture into the glass over the coffee ice cubes, allowing the flavors to meld as the drink chills.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Salted Caramel White Russian!

name: Salty Pineapple Sipper
instructions: Rim your glass with salt by dipping the rim in lemon juice and then into salt spread on a plate.
In a cocktail shaker, combine Vodka, pineapple juice, lemon juice, and simple syrup.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously until well chilled.
Add grapefruit juice to your salted-rim glass.
Strain the mixture from the shaker over fresh ice into the glass.
Garnish with a grapefruit slice and pineapple fronds.
Enjoy your refreshing Salty Pineapple Sipper!

name: Santa Claus Smash
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the pomegranate juice, bourbon, lemon juice, and ginger syrup.
Add ice to the shaker and shake vigorously until well-chilled.
Strain the mixture into a rocks glass or tumbler filled with fresh ice.
Top with ginger beer, pouring gently to preserve the fizz.
Garnish with fresh mint leaves and a sprinkle of pomegranate arils for a festive touch, if desired.
Serve immediately and enjoy this refreshing holiday cocktail.

name: Santa Hat Martini
instructions: Dip the rim of a martini glass into cream of coconut, rotating to coat evenly. Press the coated rim into flaked coconut, rotating until fully covered. Set the prepared glass aside.
In a shaker filled with ice, combine tequila, raspberry liqueur, triple sec, sour mix, and grenadine.
Shake vigorously for 15–20 seconds until well-chilled.
Strain the mixture into the prepared martini glass for an elegant presentation or into a rocks glass with fresh ice for a casual option.
Add a lime wheel or skewer a few fresh raspberries to decorate, mimicking Santa’s festive hat. (optional)

name: Santa-Quila
instructions: Infuse the tequila: Combine 1 cup of reposado tequila with 2 tbsp of cacao nibs in a sealed container. Let it infuse for 24–48 hours, shaking occasionally. Strain out the nibs before using.
In a mixing glass, combine the infused tequila, sherry, maple syrup, and black walnut bitters.
Add ice to the mixing glass and stir until the mixture is well-chilled.
Strain the cocktail into a rocks glass over a large ice cube.
Express the oils of an orange peel over the drink by twisting it over the glass. Drop the peel into the cocktail for added aroma.

name: Santa's Pomegranate Punch
instructions: Fill a rocks glass with ice to keep the drink cool and refreshing.
Pour the light rum and pomegranate juice over the ice.
Add lime soda to fill the glass, giving the cocktail a fizzy, citrusy finish.
Gently stir with a bar spoon to blend the flavors without losing too many bubbles.
Add a lime wheel on the rim of the glass and sprinkle a few pomegranate arils on top for a festive look.
Enjoy your Santa’s Pomegranate Punch immediately and toast to the holiday season!

name: Santa’s Spritz
instructions: Fill a serving glass with ice.
Add the vodka and cranberry juice to the glass.
Pour in the prosecco, followed by a splash of club soda.
Stir gently to combine without disturbing the bubbles.
Garnish with a fresh sprig of rosemary. Serve immediately and enjoy!

name: Santa's Vodka Refresher
instructions: In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, combine the vodka, cranberry juice, lime juice, and simple syrup.
Shake well until the mixture is thoroughly chilled.
Pour the cocktail into a tall glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with club soda and stir gently to blend.
Garnish with a sprig of mint leaves and a lime wheel for a festive touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy the holiday flavors!

name: Santa's Whiskey Flip
instructions: Add the cinnamon whiskey, amaretto, egg, and heavy cream to a cocktail shaker.
Perform a dry shake (shaking without ice) for 15–20 seconds to emulsify the ingredients and create a creamy texture.
Add ice to the shaker and shake again for about 30 seconds until well chilled.
Strain the mixture into a chilled sour or cocktail glass.
Garnish with a light dusting of freshly grated nutmeg and serve immediately.

name: Scarecrow Sour
instructions: Add the whiskey, apple cider, lemon juice, ginger liqueur, allspice dram, and maple syrup to a cocktail shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously for about 15 seconds until the mixture is well-chilled and the flavors are combined.
Strain the cocktail into a rocks glass filled with crushed ice.
Garnish with a cinnamon stick and a lemon wheel for a festive touch.
Serve and enjoy the warm, spicy flavors of the Scarecrow Sour!

name: Scary Spiced Cocktail
ingredients: 1.5 ounces Spiced Orange Alcoholic Ginger Beer
instructions: Add the tequila, oregano syrup, and orange juice into a cocktail shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously to combine and chill the ingredients.
Double strain the mixture into a coupe glass to ensure a smooth texture.
Top the cocktail with Spiced Orange Alcoholic Ginger Beer.
Garnish with a fresh oregano sprig.

name: How to Make a "Scotch and Soda"
instructions: Fill the highball glass to the brim with ice
Pour the two ounces of scotch whiskey over the ice
Finish the drink off by pouring club soda up to the top of the glass
Additional but recommended step: garnish with a lemon twist
Enjoy the drink

name: Scotch Negroni
instructions: Mixing
Fill a mixing glass with ice.
Add 1 ounce of Scotch, 1 ounce of Campari, and 1 ounce of sweet vermouth to the mixing glass.
Stir the mixture until it is well chilled, which should take about 30 seconds.
Serving
Strain the mixture into a rocks glass filled with ice.
Garnish the drink with an orange twist or wedge.

name: Scotch Sour
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the Scotch whisky, orange juice, lemon juice, orgeat syrup, and simple syrup.
Add ice to the shaker and shake vigorously until well-chilled.
Strain the mixture into a highball glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with an orange slice and a fresh sprig of mint for a vibrant finish.

name: Sea Bird
instructions: Fill an ice sphere mold with water and freeze until solid.
In a cocktail shaker, combine the Aged Rum, Campari, pineapple juice, lime juice, coconut syrup, and a pinch of salt.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously until well chilled.
Place the ice sphere in a rocks glass.
Strain the mixture over the ice sphere.
Garnish with maraschino cherries and pineapple fronds.
Enjoy your Sea Bird cocktail!

name: Seafoam Margarita
ingredients: Pinch of salt or a few drops of saline solution
Lime wedge and/or salt for garnish (optional)
instructions: Optional: Rim the edge of a rocks glass with lime juice and dip it in salt. Set aside.
In a cocktail shaker, combine the Tequila Blanco, Cynar, Blue Curaçao, fresh lime juice, and a pinch of salt or a few drops of saline solution.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously for about 15-20 seconds until well-chilled.
Strain the mixture into the prepared rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a lime wedge on the rim of the glass.
Enjoy your Seafoam Margarita immediately.

name: Seven and Seven
instructions: Fill the highball glass with ice cubes.
Pour the Seagram's 7 Crown Whiskey over the ice.
Top with 7UP.
Gently stir to mix.
Garnish with a lemon or lime wedge.
Enjoy your drink.

name: Sex in the Driveway
ingredients: Lemon wedge and a cherry for garnish
instructions: Fill a highball glass with ice.
Add the peach schnapps, blue curaçao, and vodka to the glass.
Stir the ingredients together until they are well combined.
Top the glass off with Sprite.
Garnish the drink with a lemon wedge and a maraschino cherry.

name: Shamrock Grasshopper
instructions: Begin by preparing your coupe glass. Use a spatula or butter knife to spread a layer of vanilla frosting around half of the glass rim.
Dip the frosted rim into a small plate of clover sprinkles, gently pressing to coat evenly. Set the glass aside.
In a blender, combine the vanilla vodka, crème de menthe, crème de cacao, and vanilla ice cream.
Blend the mixture until it is smooth and creamy, ensuring all the ingredients are well combined.
Pour the blended drink into the prepared coupe glass, allowing the festive rim to shine.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Shamrock Grasshopper!

name: Shamrock Sour
ingredients: 1/4 oz green chartreuse or green food coloring for that signature green hue
A slice of lime or a cherry for garnish
instructions: Fill your shaker with ice.
Add the Irish whiskey, lemon juice, lime juice, simple syrup, and green chartreuse or food coloring.
Shake well until the mixture is cold.
Strain into a rocks glass filled with ice.
Garnish with a lime slice or a cherry.
Enjoy your Shamrock Sour.

name: Shrubarita
instructions: Pour the maple syrup onto one small plate. On a second plate, mix the salt and black pepper.
Dip the rim of a rocks glass into the maple syrup, then gently shake off any excess syrup. Next, dip the rim into the salt and pepper mixture to coat.
In a cocktail shaker, combine the mezcal, maple beet shrub, and lime juice with ice. Shake vigorously until well-chilled.
Strain the drink into the prepared rocks glass.
Garnish with a lime wheel for a bright, citrusy finish.
Serve immediately and enjoy the smoky, sweet, and tangy flavors of the Shrubarita!

name: Siesta
ingredients: 2 oz Tequila (preferably blanco for its crisp, clean taste)
instructions: Fill your cocktail shaker with ice to chill.
Pour in the tequila, Campari, lime juice, grapefruit juice, and simple syrup.
Shake vigorously for about 15 seconds or until the shaker feels ice-cold.
Double strain into a chilled coupe glass.
Garnish with a grapefruit twist, releasing its oils over the drink.

name: Silent Night Martini
instructions: In a shaker filled with ice, combine vanilla vodka, amaretto, Fireball, and coconut milk. Shake vigorously for 15–20 seconds to ensure the drink is creamy and well-chilled.
Strain the mixture into a chilled martini glass.
Lightly sprinkle freshly grated nutmeg over the top for a festive finish.

name: Sir Isaac Newton Cocktail
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the apple-cinnamon syrup, lemon juice, apple brandy, and Angostura bitters.
Add ice to the shaker and shake vigorously until the mixture is well-chilled and fully combined.
Strain the cocktail into a chilled cocktail glass.
Float a slice of apple on the surface of the drink as a garnish.
Serve immediately and enjoy the rich, spiced flavors of this elegant cocktail.

name: Skyline Cooler
instructions: Pour the vodka, gin, and blue curaçao into a tall glass filled with ice.
Top the drink with Sprite.
Stir the drink well to combine the ingredients evenly.
Garnish with a lemon wedge for a zesty finish.

name: Sleeping Beauty Cocktail
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice, then pour in the raspberry liqueur and vanilla vodka.
Shake vigorously until the mixture is well chilled and combined.
Strain the mixture into a cocktail glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with Sprite and stir gently to blend the flavors.
Garnish with maraschino cherries, if desired. Sip and enjoy!

name: Smashing Pumpkin
instructions: Start by filling a Collins glass with ice.
Add the aged rum and allspice liqueur to the glass.
Top the mixture with 3 oz of lemon-pumpkin soda.
Stir gently to combine the flavors.
Garnish with a bay leaf for an aromatic touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Smashing Pumpkin cocktail!

name: Smoked Cinnamon Apple Cider Bourbon Smash
ingredients: Thyme Cinnamon sticks, and Apple slices  (optional, for garnish)
instructions: To infuse your cocktail with a smoky flavor, take a fresh cinnamon stick (or sprig of thyme) and place it on a plate or wooden plank. Using a lighter, carefully ignite the end of the cinnamon stick or thyme until it begins to smoke. Place your cocktail glass over the smoking cinnamon stick or thyme to capture the aroma inside the glass. Let it sit for a few moments to absorb the smoke.
While the glass is smoking, fill a cocktail shaker with ice.
Add the apple cider, bourbon, orange bitters, and agave syrup (if using) to the shaker.
Shake vigorously until the mixture is well-chilled and fully combined.
Remove the smoking element from the glass and pour the shaken cocktail into the prepared glass.
Garnish with fresh thyme, a cinnamon stick, and/or apple slices. For an extra smoky experience, you can lightly char the garnish with a lighter before adding it to the drink.
Serve immediately and enjoy the rich, smoky flavors of this autumn-inspired cocktail.

name: Smoked Peach Maple Bourbon Smash
instructions: In a shaker add 8 ice cubes, a grilled peach half, a sprig of fresh thyme, 3 dashes of Angostura bitters, and 2 ounces of smoked maple bourbon whiskey.
Shake the mixture vigorously until the shaker becomes cold and the peach is thoroughly broken down, releasing its flavors into the mix.
Prepare a cocktail glass by filling it with 5-6 fresh ice cubes.

Strain the contents of the shaker into the glass. This may require some effort to get most of the peach flesh through the strainer, so keep shaking until the glass is more than half full. If your hand gets too cold, wrap a kitchen towel around the shaker for comfort.
Top off the drink with 2 ounces of spicy ginger beer, 1/2 ounce of fresh lemon juice, and 1 ounce of soda water.
Stir gently to combine all the flavors.
Garnish your Smoked Peach Maple Bourbon Smash with a grilled peach slice, a sprig of fresh thyme, and, if desired, edible flowers for a beautiful and aromatic finish.
Serve immediately and enjoy!

name: Smoked Rosemary Boulevardier
instructions: Place a fresh rosemary sprig on a heatproof surface and light it with a lighter or torch.

Once it starts smoking, invert the rocks glass over the rosemary to capture the smoke. Let it sit for a few moments to infuse the glass with the smoky aroma. In a mixing glass, combine the bourbon, campari, and sweet vermouth.
Fill the mixing glass with ice and stir gently until well chilled and diluted (about 30 seconds).
Strain the mixture over a large ice cube into the smoked rocks glass.
Garnish with an orange slice and a maraschino cherry.
Enjoy your Smoked Rosemary Boulevardier!

name: Smokey Margarita
instructions: First, get your rocks glass ready by rubbing the lime wedge around the rim and dipping it in salt.
In your shaker, mix the mezcal, orange liqueur, lime juice, and simple syrup with ice. Shake it like you're cheering for your favorite team!
Strain the mix into your glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a lime wedge.
Enjoy your masterpiece.

name: Smoking Blackberry Sage Margarita
ingredients: Blackberries and Dried sage leaves (for garnish)
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, muddle the blackberries and fresh sage leaves together until they are well broken down and fragrant.
Add the silver tequila, lemon juice, orange bitters, and maple syrup to the shaker.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously to blend the ingredients and chill the mixture.
If using dry ice, place a small cube in the glass and pour the mixture over it. If using regular ice, fill the glass with ice and strain the mixture into the glass.
For an added smoky effect, light the tip of a dried sage leaf on fire just before serving and allow the smoke to infuse the drink.
Garnish with a few fresh blackberries and the smoldering sage leaf.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Smoking Blackberry Sage Margarita!

name: Smoky Autumn Mezcal Spritz
instructions: Fill a snifter glass with ice.
Pour Mezcal, Aperol, and sweet vermouth over the ice.
Stir gently until the mixture is well chilled.
Top the cocktail with Prosecco or Cava.
Garnish with a twist of grapefruit and a sprig of smoked herbs. Serve immediately.

name: Smoky Cucumber Spritz
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, muddle the cucumber slices and mint leaves to release their flavors.
Add the mezcal, agave nectar, and lime juice to the shaker.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake until well-chilled.
Double strain the mixture into a highball glass filled with ice.
Top with club soda and stir gently.
Garnish with a mint sprig and a cucumber wheel.
Serve immediately and enjoy!

name: Smoky Harvest Apple Cider Margarita
ingredients: Cinnamon sugar and flaky sea salt (for rimming the glass)
instructions: Mix equal parts cinnamon sugar and flaky sea salt on a plate. Run a lime wedge around the rim of the glass and dip it into the cinnamon sugar and salt mixture to coat. Set the glass aside.
In a cocktail shaker, combine the mezcal (or tequila), orange liqueur, apple cider, lime juice, and maple syrup. Adjust the maple syrup to your desired level of sweetness.
Add ice to the shaker and shake vigorously to combine and chill the ingredients.
Strain the mixture into the prepared glass filled with ice.
Garnish with apple slices and a cinnamon stick. For an optional smoky effect, light the cinnamon stick on fire briefly before serving. You can also add a rosemary sprig for an extra aromatic touch.
Enjoy your Smoky Harvest Apple Cider Margarita!

name: Smoky Spiced Orange Cocktail
ingredients: Garnish: cinnamon stick (orange peel, salted cinnamon sugar)
instructions: Light the end of a cinnamon stick and place it on a ceramic plate, stone, or wood surface. Immediately place the cocktail glass over the cinnamon stick to trap the smoke. Let it sit while you prepare the cocktail.
Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Add mezcal, silver rum, orange juice, lemon juice, spiced honey syrup, ground cinnamon, ground ginger, and ground nutmeg.
Shake well to combine and chill the mixture.
Release the cocktail glass from the cinnamon stick and fill it with fresh ice.
Strain the cocktail into the prepared glass.
Garnish with the smoked cinnamon stick, an orange peel, and a sprinkle of salted cinnamon sugar.
Enjoy your Smoky Spiced Orange Cocktail!

name: Smoky Tamarind Margarita
instructions: If rimming the glass, start by moistening the edge of a rocks glass with a lime wedge and dipping it into Tajín seasoning. Set aside.
In a cocktail shaker, combine mezcal, tamarind concentrate, lime juice, and agave syrup.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously until well-chilled.
Strain the mixture into the prepared rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a lime wheel on the rim of the glass and serve immediately.

name: Snickerdoodle Martini
instructions: Measure out Rumchata, amaretto, and vanilla vodka using a cocktail jigger and add them to a cocktail shaker filled with ice.
Add milk to the shaker and shake all ingredients for at least 30 seconds until well chilled.
Pour a small amount of maple syrup onto a plate and coat the rim of your martini glass with it.
On a separate plate, spread some cinnamon and coat the rim of the glass in the cinnamon.
Strain the mixture from the shaker into the prepared martini glass.
Cut a small Snickers bar in half, place both pieces on a cocktail pick, and garnish the glass.
Sprinkle a few cacao bits on top and optionally drizzle with caramel syrup.
Enjoy your Snickerdoodle Martini!

name: Snow Miser Cocktail
ingredients: Mint Sprig or Lemon Twist (for garnish)
instructions: Fill a shaker with ice and combine the crème de menthe, vodka, lemon juice, and blue curaçao.
Shake vigorously for 15–20 seconds to thoroughly chill and blend the ingredients.
Strain the mixture into a highball glass filled with fresh ice.
Top the drink with ginger ale, pouring slowly to maintain its effervescence.
Stir gently to combine, ensuring a balanced flavor.
Garnish with a fresh mint sprig or a lemon twist for a festive and elegant finish.

name: Snow White's Poison Apple
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the vodka, orange liqueur, lime juice, grenadine, and apple cider.
Add ice to the shaker and shake vigorously until the mixture is well-chilled.
Strain the cocktail into a martini glass or your desired glassware.
Add a dash of edible gold glitter to the drink for a magical, shimmering effect.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Snow White's Poison Apple cocktail.

name: Snowflake Margarita
instructions: Rim the glass with sugar for a frosty effect. Rub a lime wedge around the rim of a rocks or coupe glass, then dip it into sugar on a small plate to coat.
In a shaker filled with ice, combine the blanco tequila, white cranberry juice, lime juice, and agave syrup. Shake vigorously for 15–20 seconds until well-chilled.
Strain the mixture into the prepared glass over fresh ice, or serve it straight up in a chilled coupe glass.
Add a sprig of fresh rosemary for a festive, aromatic touch. Optionally, garnish with a lime wheel for additional flair.

name: Snowman Cocktail
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.
Add the vodka, white chocolate liqueur, cream, and crème de cacao.
Shake vigorously for about 15–20 seconds until well chilled.
Strain the mixture into a martini glass.
Garnish with a skewered marshmallow for a playful, snowy touch. Serve immediately.

name: Solstice Old Fashioned
ingredients: ½ ounce Tea Forté African solstice rooibos tea syrup
instructions: In a mixing glass, combine the bourbon, African solstice rooibos tea syrup, Fernet Branca, and chocolate bitters.
Fill the mixing glass with ice and stir gently until well chilled and diluted (about 30 seconds).
Strain the mixture over a large ice cube in a rocks glass.
Express the oils from an orange peel over the drink by twisting it over the glass, then drop it in as a garnish.
Enjoy your Solstice Old Fashioned!

name: Sorcerer’s Spell
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the gin, pomegranate juice, raspberry liqueur, lemon juice, and simple syrup.
Add ice and shake vigorously until well chilled.
Strain the mixture into a coupe glass.
For a magical touch, sprinkle a small amount of gold edible glitter into the glass before serving.
Serve immediately and enjoy the enchanting taste of Sorcerer’s Spell!

name: Southern Peach Bourbon Tea
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine bourbon and peach syrup. Shake to mix well.
Prepare your highball glass by adding ice.
Strain the shaken mixture into the prepared glass.
Top off with iced tea.
Garnish with a peach slices.
Enjoy your refreshing drink!

name: Sparkling Blood Orange Margarita
ingredients: Blood orange or lime slice for garnish
instructions: Pour margarita salt onto a small plate.
Run a wedge of lime around the rim of your margarita glass. Dip the glass into the salt to coat the entire rim. Fill the glass with ice cubes and set it aside.
Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Add the tequila, blood orange juice, and lime juice.
Pour in the simple syrup and a splash of orange liqueur.
Secure the lid on the cocktail shaker and shake vigorously for 30 seconds.
Strain the mixture into the prepared margarita glass.
Garnish with a slice of blood orange or lime.
Finish with a splash of club soda for a sparkling touch.

name: Sparkling Christmas Cocktail
instructions: Start by placing one rosemary sprig in a champagne flute.
In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, combine the pear vodka, lemon juice, and simple syrup.
Shake well to chill and blend the ingredients.
Strain the mixture into the champagne flute over the rosemary sprig, filling the glass about halfway.
Top with sparkling champagne to fill the glass, and garnish with an additional rosemary sprig for a festive, aromatic touch.

name: Sparkling Fall Sangria
instructions: In a large pitcher or beverage dispenser, slowly pour in the sparkling wine, cooled spiced simple syrup, soda water, apple cider, and lemon juice. Stir gently to combine all the ingredients.
To rim the glasses, first dip the rim of each glass into caramel, then into cinnamon sugar, coating the rim evenly.
Fill the rimmed glasses with ice, if desired, and pour the sparkling fall sangria over the top and garnish with slice apple and cranberry.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Sparkling Fall Sangria!

name: Sparkling Grape Mojito
ingredients: Mint sprig and Grapes for garnish
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, muddle the grapes with the simple syrup until well combined.
Add the fresh squeezed lime juice, mint leaves, and light rum to the shaker.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake it well, then pour everything into your glass.
Add some crushed ice to the glass to top it off.
Top with Prosecco.
Garnish with a mint sprig and a few grapes. You're all set!

name: Sparkling Pear French 75 Cocktail
instructions: Start by running a lemon wedge around the rim of your cocktail glass, then dip the rim into granulated sugar to create a sugared edge. Fill the glass with ice.
In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, combine the gin, lemon juice, and pear liqueur. Shake well until the mixture is well chilled.
Strain the mixture into your prepared cocktail glass.
Top the cocktail with 2 ounces of chilled Prosecco for a fizzy, refreshing finish.
Garnish with a slice of fresh pear for an elegant touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy the sparkling, fruity flavors of this refreshing Pear French 75.

name: Sparkling Prosecco Cosmo
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the vodka, orange liqueur, cranberry juice, and lime juice.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously until well chilled.
Double strain the mixture into a chilled martini glass to ensure a smooth texture.
Top with Prosecco Rosé.
Enjoy your sparkling and refreshing Sparkling Prosecco Cosmo!

name: Sparkling Spiced Pumpkin Punch
ingredients: Sliced oranges (apples, cranberries, cinnamon sticks, star anise for garnish (optional))
instructions: In a punch bowl, whisk together the pumpkin puree, apple cider, orange juice, rum, and cinnamon until the mixture is smooth and well combined.
Once the pumpkin is fully dissolved, gently pour in the champagne and give it a brief stir.
Garnish the punch with cranberries, sliced oranges, apples, cinnamon sticks, and star anise, if desired.
Serve immediately.

name: Sparkling Thanksgiving Cocktail
instructions: Pour the vodka, apple juice, and cranberry juice into a champagne glass.
Stir gently to combine the flavors.
Top off the glass with chilled champagne.
Raise a glass to everything you’re grateful for and toast to a wonderful year ahead.

name: Spiced Apple Cider Margarita
ingredients: Pinch or two of kosher salt (for rimming)
Garnishes: Cinnamon stick (apple slices, orange slice, or star anise)
instructions: On a small plate, mix the sugar, cinnamon, and kosher salt. Run an orange slice around the rim of your glass to moisten it, then dip the rim into the cinnamon-sugar mixture.
Fill the rimmed glass with ice. Pour in 1 oz of reposado or añejo tequila, 0.5 oz of triple sec, and 3 oz of spiced apple cider.
Give the drink a gentle stir to combine all the flavors.
Add an optional garnish of an apple slice, orange slice, cinnamon stick, or star anise to elevate the presentation. Enjoy!

name: Spiced Apple Margarita
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.
Add tequila, apple juice, lime juice, honey simple syrup, and a dash of ground cinnamon.
Secure the lid on the shaker and shake vigorously for about 20 seconds.
Strain the mixture into a prepared margarita glass filled with ice.
Garnish with a star anise if desired. Cheers!

name: Spiced Apple Prosecco
instructions: Ensure all ingredients are well-chilled before preparation for the perfect refreshing drink.
In your chosen glass, combine the spiced rum and apple cider.
Stir gently to mix the flavors together.
Top off the drink with 6 ounces of Prosecco, pouring slowly to preserve the bubbles.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Spiced Apple Prosecco!

name: Spiced Apple Rum Punch
ingredients: 25.4 oz Bundaberg Spiced Ginger Beer ( 2 bottles)
instructions: In a large pitcher, combine the unfiltered apple juice, spiced ginger beer, and light rum.
Stir the mixture well to ensure all ingredients are thoroughly combined.
Serve the punch over ice in individual glasses.
Enjoy!

name: Spiced Apple Tiki Smash
instructions: Dip one half of the rims of two rocks glasses into a little maple syrup, then into the cinnamon sugar to create a spiced-sweet rim. Fill the glasses with ice.
In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, add the spiced rum, reserve rum, allspice dram, falernum, maple syrup, apple cider, pineapple juice, and a few dashes of tiki bitters.
Shake the mixture well until it is thoroughly chilled. Strain the cocktail into the prepared glasses.
Garnish each drink with a few thin apple slices skewered with a bamboo cocktail pick.
Serve immediately and enjoy the rich, spiced flavors of this autumn-inspired tiki cocktail!

name: Spiced Cider Lemonade
ingredients: Orange slices and cinnamon sticks (for garnish)
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the lemonade, apple cider, whiskey, and a pinch of cinnamon.
Add ice to the shaker.
Secure the lid and shake well until the mixture is thoroughly chilled and the flavors are well combined.
Strain the cocktail into your serving glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with orange slices and a cinnamon stick for a festive touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Spiced Cider Lemonade Cocktail!

name: Spiced Cranberry Bourbon Cocktail
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the spiced cranberry juice and bourbon.
Add ice to the shaker, then shake vigorously until well-chilled.
Strain the mixture into a glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with ginger beer and give it a quick stir to blend.
Grate fresh nutmeg on top for a fragrant, festive garnish.

name: Spiced Cranberry Paloma
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the cranberry juice, grapefruit juice, lime juice, spiced simple syrup, and tequila.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously until well-chilled.
Strain the mixture into a glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with sparkling water, filling the remainder of the glass.
Garnish with a sprig of rosemary, a few fresh cranberries, and a grapefruit slice for a festive presentation.
Serve immediately and enjoy this holiday-inspired cocktail.

name: Spiced Honey Bourbon Old Fashioned
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the bourbon, lemon juice, orange juice, spiced honey syrup, and orange bitters.
Add ice to the shaker and shake the mixture vigorously.
Strain the mixture into a glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with an orange slice and a rosemary sprig, if desired.

name: Spiced Maple Bourbon Fizz
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the spiced maple syrup, bourbon, lemon juice, and orange bitters.
Add ice to the shaker and shake until well-chilled.
Strain the mixture into a glass.
Top with champagne and stir gently to blend the flavors.
Garnish with an orange slice and a star anise for a festive, aromatic touch.

name: Spiced Maple Rum Cocktail
ingredients: 0.5 to 1 ounce maple syrup (adjust to taste)
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the ice cubes, dark spiced rum, lemon juice, and 0.5 ounce of maple syrup.
Shake vigorously to blend the ingredients and chill the mixture.
Taste the cocktail, and if desired, add the remaining maple syrup for extra sweetness. Shake again to combine.
Strain the mixture into a glass to remove the ice. Garnish with lemon wheel.
Serve immediately and enjoy the rich, sweet, and tart flavors of this Maple Rum Cocktail.

name: Spiced Orange Gin Punch
instructions: In a shaker, combine the gin, orange juice, and spiced simple syrup.
Add ice to the shaker and shake vigorously for 10–15 seconds to mix and chill the ingredients.
Strain the mixture into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a slice of orange and a cinnamon stick to enhance the drink's aroma and visual appeal.

name: Spiced Pear Cocktail
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, muddle the fresh ginger slices with the pear juice to release the ginger's flavors.
Add the spiced rum, aperol and a few grates of fresh nutmeg, along with ice.
Shake the mixture well until chilled.
Strain the cocktail into a glass filled with ice.
Top with a sprinkle of fresh grated nutmeg and garnish with edible flowers.

name: Spiced Pear Gin Cocktail
ingredients: 0.75 ounce St. George Spiced Pear Liqueur
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice and add the gin, pear juice, spiced pear liqueur, lemon juice, and cardamom bitters.
Shake vigorously until well-chilled.
Strain the mixture into a glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a slice of pear and a sprig of thyme for an aromatic, festive touch.

name: Spiced Pear Margarita
instructions: Begin by preparing your rocks glass. Rim the glass with agave syrup, then dip it into a small plate of cinnamon sugar to coat evenly. Set the glass aside.
In a cocktail shaker, combine the blanco tequila, spiced pear liqueur, orange liqueur, orange juice, lemon juice, lime juice, agave syrup, and a dash of cinnamon.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously until the mixture is well blended and chilled.
Strain the mixture into the prepared rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a lemon wheel for an elegant finish.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Spiced Pear Margarita!

name: Spiced Pear Martini
instructions: Cover the bottom of a plate with cinnamon sugar. Using a piece of lemon rind, wet the rim of a martini glass. Dip the glass into the cinnamon sugar to coat the rim.
In the bottom of a cocktail shaker, combine the honey and lemon juice. Stir with a cocktail spoon until the honey is fully dissolved.
Add the pear vodka, amaretto, and cardamom bitters to the shaker. Stir again to ensure the honey is well incorporated.
Add ice to the shaker, cover, and shake vigorously until well-chilled.
Strain the mixture into the prepared martini glass.
Enjoy your Spiced Pear Martini!

name: Spiced Pear Negroni
ingredients: Lemon peel, rosemary or thyme sprig (for garnish)
instructions: Infuse the vermouth: In a small container, combine the white vermouth with the vanilla extract, cinnamon stick, cloves, and ground ginger. Allow the mixture to infuse for at least 30 minutes (the longer you leave it, the more intense the flavors will be).
Once the vermouth has infused, strain the liquid through a fine mesh strainer to remove the spices.
Fill a Rocks glass with plenty of ice.
Add the gin and the spice-infused vermouth to the glass.
Top with pear cider, stirring gently to combine.
Garnish with a twist of lemon peel and a sprig of rosemary or thyme for an aromatic touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy the warming, spiced flavors of the Spiced Pear Negroni!

name: Spiced Pear Tequila
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine tequila blanca, pear nectar, freshly squeezed lemon juice, honey, citrus bitters, vanilla extract, and a dash of cinnamon.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake well until all ingredients are thoroughly mixed and chilled.
Strain the mixture into a highball or rocks glass filled with ice.
Serve and enjoy.

name: Spiced Pumpkin Punch
instructions: In a blender, combine the gin, apple cider, pumpkin purée, honey syrup, lemon juice, and pumpkin pie spice.
Pulse the mixture for 30-45 seconds until all the ingredients are well blended and the punch has a smooth, consistent texture.
Pour the punch into punch cups filled with cracked ice.
Garnish each cup with a cinnamon stick for an added touch of warmth and spice.
Serve immediately and enjoy the rich, spiced flavors of this festive punch.

name: Spicy Avocado Margarita
instructions: Begin by preparing your glass. Brush half of the rim of a rocks glass with agave syrup, then dip it into a small plate of Tajin seasoning to coat evenly. Set the glass aside.
In a blender, combine the water, avocado, orange liqueur, lemon juice, lime juice, and agave syrup. Blend until the mixture is smooth and creamy.
In your cocktail shaker, muddle three jalapeño slices to release their spicy flavor.
Add the avocado purée from the blender to the shaker, followed by of tequila.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake well to combine the ingredients and chill the mixture.
Strain the mixture into the prepared glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with two jalapeño slices for an extra touch of heat and visual appeal.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Spicy Avocado Margarita!

name: Spicy Bourbon Pumpkin Smash
ingredients: Cinnamon sticks and star anise (for garnish )
instructions: In a punch bowl, combine the spiced pumpkin syrup by mixing together the maple syrup, water, pumpkin puree, pumpkin pie spice, vanilla extract, and a pinch of sea salt.
