Strain the mixture over fresh ice in a highball glass.
Garnish with a cinnamon stick for an extra touch of spice and visual appeal.
Serve immediately and enjoy your White Chocolate Vodka Matcha!

name: White Christmas Bourbon Smash
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the sugar, mint leaves, one sprig of rosemary, and lemon juice.
Gently muddle the ingredients about five times to release the flavors without over-crushing the herbs.
Pour in the bourbon, secure the shaker lid, and shake well to combine.
Fill a cocktail glass with ice, then strain the bourbon mixture into the glass.
Top with lime seltzer for a refreshing finish.
Garnish with a fresh sprig of rosemary and cranberries for a festive touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy your White Christmas Bourbon Smash!

name: White Christmas Margarita
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the white cranberry juice, lime juice, orange liqueur, and blanco tequila.
Add ice to the shaker and shake vigorously until well-chilled.
Strain the mixture into a glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with frozen cranberries for a pop of color and a sprig of rosemary for a festive touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy your holiday-inspired margarita.

name: White Christmas Mojito
instructions: In a shaker or mixing glass, muddle the mint leaves with the sugar and lime juice until the sugar dissolves and the mint is aromatic.
If you prefer a smoother cocktail, strain out the muddled mint leaves before proceeding.
Add the white rum, coconut rum, and coconut milk to the shaker, stirring or shaking gently to combine.
Fill a glass halfway with ice, then pour in the coconut rum mixture until the glass is about three-quarters full.
Top with sparkling water for a light, bubbly finish.
Garnish with extra mint leaves and a sprinkle of pomegranate arils for a festive look.

name: White Christmas Tequila Sour
ingredients: Rosemary sprig (cranberries, and lime wedge (for garnish))
instructions: Combine the tequila, lemon juice, agave nectar, and egg white in a cocktail shaker without ice.
Dry shake (shake without ice) vigorously for about 10 seconds to create a frothy texture.
Add ice to the shaker and shake again briefly, 2–3 times, until well-chilled.
Strain the mixture into a rocks glass filled with ice using a Hawthorne strainer. For an ultra-smooth finish, use a fine-mesh strainer as well.
Garnish with a sprig of fresh rosemary, a few cranberries, and a lime wedge for a festive touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy!

name: White Clausmopolitan
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice and add the vodka, triple sec, elderflower liqueur, white cranberry juice, and fresh lime juice.
Shake vigorously for 15–20 seconds until the mixture is well chilled.
Strain the cocktail into a chilled martini or coupe glass for an elegant presentation.
Garnish with three fresh cranberries, either floating in the drink or skewered on a cocktail pick for a festive touch.

name: White Coconut Christmas Margarita
instructions: Prepare a short glass by filling it with ice and adding a few fresh cranberries for a festive touch.
In a cocktail shaker, combine the silver tequila, Cointreau, coconut rum, lime juice, coconut milk, maple syrup, and orange bitters (if using).
Add ice to the shaker, then shake vigorously until the mixture is well-chilled.
Strain the cocktail into the prepared glass.
Garnish with a sprig of rosemary for an added holiday aroma and serve immediately.

name: White Cosmo
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Add vodka, Lillet Blanc, triple sec, white cranberry juice, and lime juice.
(Optional): Sprinkle a pinch of edible glitter into the shaker for a shimmering, festive effect.
Shake vigorously until the mixture is well-chilled and frothy.
Strain the cocktail into a chilled martini or coupe glass.
Float a fresh cranberry on top of the drink for an elegant finishing touch. Serve immediately.

name: White Pumpkin Cocktail
ingredients: Delicate wispy flower sprig (for garnish, optional)
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the white rum, RumChata, and unsweetened vanilla almond milk.
Add ice to the shaker and shake vigorously until the mixture is well chilled and frothy.
Strain the cocktail into a frosted coupe glass.
Lightly sprinkle the top of the drink with a teeny bit of pumpkin spice to add a warm, seasonal aroma.
Garnish with a delicate, wispy flower sprig for an elegant touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy your White Pumpkin Cocktail.

name: White Russian
instructions: Pour your mixed liquids over a double rocks glass that's been completely filled with ice, in the order listed above
After you've poured in the vodka and liqueur, gently stir it.
Then add the cream, pouring gently so it floats.

name: White Winter Margarita
ingredients: orange wheel and rosemary sprig (for garnish)
instructions: Rim a rocks glass with lime juice, then dip the rim into sugar to create a frosted effect. Fill the glass with ice and set aside.
Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.
Add the tequila, Cointreau, lime juice, rosemary simple syrup, and white cranberry juice.
Shake vigorously to chill and combine the ingredients.
Strain the mixture into a prepared glass.
Garnish with an orange wheel and a sprig of rosemary for a festive touch. Serve and enjoy!

name: Wicked Witch Cocktail
instructions: Add vodka, melon liqueur, blue curaçao, orange juice, and lemon-lime soda into a cocktail shaker filled with ice.
Shake well until all ingredients are fully combined and chilled.
Strain the mixture into a glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a cherry for a pop of color.
Serve and enjoy—Happy Halloween!

name: Widow’s Kiss Cocktail
instructions: In a mixing glass filled with ice, combine the apple brandy, yellow Chartreuse, Bénédictine, and Angostura bitters.
Stir the mixture thoroughly to chill and blend the ingredients.
Strain the cocktail into a chilled glass.
Garnish with a cherry or a twist of lemon peel for an added touch of elegance.
Serve immediately and enjoy the rich, herbal flavors of this classic cocktail.

name: Wild Turkey Thanksgiving Cocktail
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, add the bourbon, lemon juice, and simple syrup.
Add ice to the shaker and shake vigorously for 25 to 30 seconds.
Place larger ice cubes in your serving glass.
Strain the cocktail mixture over the ice in the prepared glass.
Enjoy your Wild Turkey Thanksgiving Cocktail!

name: Winter Aperol Spritz
instructions: Fill a large wine glass or spritz glass with ice.
Pour in the Aperol, cranberry juice, and lemon juice.
Top with Prosecco to fill the glass.
Gently stir to blend the ingredients.
Garnish with a sprig of rosemary and a handful of fresh cranberries for a festive look.
Serve immediately and enjoy!

name: Winter Berry Cocktail
instructions: In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, add the rosemary vodka, pomegranate juice, lemon juice, cranberry juice, and simple syrup if desired.
Shake vigorously for 15–20 seconds until well-chilled.
Strain into a chilled martini or coupe glass for a refined presentation, or pour over ice in a rocks glass for a more relaxed style.
Top with a sprinkle of pomegranate seeds and a sprig of fresh rosemary for a festive and aromatic touch.
Infuse the vodka: Combine 1 cup of vodka with 1–2 sprigs of fresh rosemary in a sealed container. Let it infuse for 24–48 hours, shaking occasionally. Strain out the rosemary before use.

name: Winter Gin & Tonic
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the cranberry juice, pomegranate juice, and gin.
Add ice to the shaker and shake vigorously for about 30 seconds until well-chilled.
Strain the mixture into a chilled glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with tonic water and stir gently if needed.
Garnish with a few cranberries for a festive touch.

name: Winter Honey Old Fashioned
instructions: Fill a rocks glass with ice to chill it.
Pour the bourbon honey sage syrup and two dashes bitters over the ice. Stir gently to combine.
Using a peeler or knife, cut a strip of orange peel. Hold the peel over the glass and twist it to release its aromatic oils. Drop the peel into the glass.
Place a fresh sage leaf on top for an earthy, aromatic touch.
Enjoy as-is for a balanced flavor, or add more honey sage syrup if you prefer a sweeter drink.

name: Winter Margarita
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice and add the tequila, honey, lime juice, blood orange juice, vanilla, and a pinch of cinnamon.
Shake vigorously until the outside of the shaker is frosted and the mixture is well chilled.
Strain the cocktail into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Serve immediately and enjoy the warm, citrusy flavors of this winter-inspired margarita.

name: Winter Paloma
instructions: Start by filling your serving glass with ice to keep the drink chilled.
In a cocktail shaker, add ice, tequila, grapefruit juice, tonic water, and rosemary simple syrup.
Shake the mixture well until it is thoroughly combined and chilled.
Pour the cocktail mixture into your prepared glass.
Add a few pomegranate arils to the drink, gently stirring them in to distribute.
Garnish with a rosemary sprig for an aromatic finish.

name: Winter Pear Cocktail
instructions: Add the gin, lemon juice, pear syrup, and egg white to a cocktail shaker without ice.
Dry shake vigorously for about 15 seconds to create a frothy texture.
Add ice to the shaker and shake again until well-chilled.
Strain the cocktail into a chilled coupe glass.
Gently place a star anise on the foam for a decorative and aromatic garnish.
Serve immediately and savor this wintery delight.

name: Winter Sazerac
instructions: Rinse a chilled rocks glass with absinthe, swirling to coat the interior, then discard any excess. Set the glass aside.
In a mixing glass, combine nutmeg-infused whisky, Cognac, simple syrup, aromatic bitters, and Peychaud’s bitters.
Add ice and stir until well chilled, then strain into the absinthe-rinsed glass.
Express the oil from a lemon peel over the drink, then discard the peel. Serve immediately.

name: Winter Spice Old Fashioned
ingredients: ½ ounce cardamom and clove simple syrup
instructions: Fill a mixing glass with plenty of ice.
Pour in the bourbon, Cynar, and cardamom and clove simple syrup.
Add three dashes of Angostura bitters to the mixture.
Stir the cocktail until it is well-chilled and the ingredients are thoroughly combined.
Strain the cocktail into a coupe glass.
Garnish with a star anise for a warm, aromatic finish.

name: Winter Tequila Sunset
instructions: Add the tequila, Aperol, orange juice, lemon juice, and sugar syrup to a cocktail shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously until well-chilled.
Strain the mixture into a glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a sprinkle of pomegranate arils and a fresh rosemary sprig for a festive touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy this citrusy holiday cocktail.

name: Winter Vodka Sour
instructions: Add the vodka, cherry juice, lemon juice, and egg white to a cocktail shaker without ice.
Dry shake vigorously for about 15 seconds to froth the egg white.
Add ice to the shaker and shake again until well-chilled.
Strain the mixture into a coupe glass.
Garnish with a cherry for a touch of elegance.
Serve immediately and enjoy the smooth, frothy perfection.

name: Winter Wonderland
instructions: Begin by filling a cocktail glass with ice.
Pour in the vodka, elderflower liqueur, and blood orange juice.
Top with ginger beer, giving the drink a gentle stir to mix.
Garnish with a sprinkle of pomegranate arils and a sprig of fresh thyme or mint for a festive finish.
Serve immediately and enjoy the holiday flavors!

name: Winter's Bitter Negroni
instructions: In a mixing glass, combine tequila blanco, sweet vermouth, Campari, and cranberry juice.
Add ice to the mixing glass and stir until the mixture is well-chilled.
Fill a rocks glass with ice, preferably a large cube to minimize dilution.
Strain the chilled cocktail into the prepared rocks glass.
Hold the orange twist over the glass and twist it firmly to express the oils. Drop the twist into the drink for added aroma and visual appeal.

name: Wisconsin Old Fashioned
ingredients: Orange slice and maraschino cherry (for garnish)
Additional cherries and orange slices to garnish
instructions: Put the sugar cube along with the Angostura bitters, cherries soaked in brandy and orange slices into a lowball short glass
Muddle those ingredients together
Top the glass with ice
Add the brandy and top off the drink with lemon and lime soda
Stir to combine
Garnish the glass with cherries and an orange slice

name: Witch Potion Margarita
instructions: Begin by preparing the rim of your cocktail glass. In a small bowl, combine the blue sugar and salt. Stir together, then spread evenly onto a small plate.
Rub a lime wedge around the rim of your cocktail glass, then dip it into the rimming mixture to create a colorful and flavorful rim. Set the glass aside.
In a cocktail shaker, add 3 of the fresh blackberries, blueberries, and raspberries. Muddle the berries until they are crushed and juicy.
Drizzle in the agave syrup and lime juice, then add the silver tequila.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously until the mixture is well combined and chilled.  Strain the berry-tequila mixture into your prepared cocktail glass over fresh ice.
Top off the cocktail with sparkling berry-flavored soda, adding a refreshing fizz and vibrant color.
Garnish with skewered berries for a magical touch and enjoy your Witch Potion Margarita!

name: Witches Blood Cocktail
instructions: In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, combine the bourbon, blood orange liqueur, pomegranate juice, and lemon juice.
Shake the mixture vigorously for about a minute until well chilled.
Strain the cocktail into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Top off the drink with chilled ginger beer for a fizzy finish.
Garnish as desired (suggestions include a twist of lemon peel, pomegranate seeds, or a sprig of rosemary).
Serve immediately and enjoy your Witches Blood Cocktail!

name: Witches Brew Halloween Cocktail
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the pomegranate juice, blood orange juice, silver tequila, agave syrup, and ground cinnamon.
Add a handful of ice to the shaker, then shake vigorously until all the ingredients are well combined and chilled.
Strain the mixture into a glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish the cocktail with a cinnamon stick, a sprig of fresh rosemary, and a slice of blood orange.
For an eerie, smoky effect, carefully light the tip of the rosemary sprig with a match or lighter until it starts to smolder, then blow it out to create a few seconds of aromatic smoke.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Witches Brew Halloween Cocktail.

name: Witching Hour Smash
ingredients: Rosemary sprig (blackberry, and lime for garnish)
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, add the blackberries, fresh lime juice, and agave syrup.
Muddle the mixture thoroughly to release the juices from the blackberries.
Add the pomegranate juice, chile liqueur, and mezcal to the shaker.
Fill the shaker with ice, and shake until the drink is well chilled.
Strain the cocktail into a glass over fresh ice.
Garnish with a rosemary sprig, a fresh blackberry, and a lime wedge for an enchanting presentation.

name: Yuletide Spice
ingredients: Cinnamon sticks (star anise, and an edible flower, for garnish (optional))
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the spiced rum, Amaro Amorino, lime juice, pink grapefruit juice, cinnamon simple syrup, ginger simple syrup, and aromatic bitters.
Fill the shaker three-quarters full with ice, then shake vigorously until well chilled.
Open pour (unstrained) the mixture into a rocks glass, filling it halfway with crushed ice.
Top with additional crushed ice to fill the glass.
Garnish with a cinnamon stick, a star anise, and an edible flower for a festive presentation, if desired.

name: Yuzumelon Drop
instructions: Begin by preparing your glass. Dip half of the rim in simple syrup, then dip it into a small plate of Tajin to coat evenly. Set the glass aside.
In a cocktail shaker, muddle the watermelon chunks until they are well mashed, releasing their juices and flavor.
Add the simple syrup, lemon juice, yuzu marmalade, vodka, watermelon liqueur, and orange liqueur to the shaker.
Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously until the mixture is well combined and chilled.
Strain the mixture into the prepared glass over fresh ice.
Garnish with a slice of watermelon for a colorful and refreshing touch.
Serve immediately and enjoy your Yuzumelon Drop!

name: Zombie Brains Halloween Cocktail
instructions: In a cocktail shaker, muddle the raspberries until they are well broken down and release their juices.
Add the pomegranate juice, orange juice, vodka, Chambord, and a handful of regular ice cubes to the shaker.
Secure the top and shake vigorously until the mixture is well chilled.
If you’re using dry ice, carefully use tongs and gloves to drop a small piece of dry ice into the serving glass. Ensure the dry ice is placed at the bottom before adding regular ice.
Remove the top of the cocktail shaker and replace it with a strainer. Strain the cocktail into the prepared glass filled with regular ice.
Top the cocktail with a splash of chilled ginger ale and gently stir to combine.
If using dry ice, wait until the misting and bubbling stops before serving to ensure the dry ice has fully melted.
Serve immediately and enjoy the eerie, fruity flavors of this Halloween-inspired cocktail.

name: Zombie
instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.
Add all the ingredients.
Shake well.
Strain the mixture into a highball or tiki glass filled with ice.
Garnish with a cherry and a slice of orange.

name: Zombie Dew
instructions: Fill a rocks glass with ice.
Pour in the rum and top with Mountain Dew.
Stir gently to combine.
Serve and enjoy your Zombie Dew—a refreshing and lively cocktail with a kick!

name: Zombie Guts
instructions: Add some choppy chunks of the prepared raspberry and grape jello to a Collins glass. Don’t aim for perfect squares; uneven pieces give a more realistic, gory effect!
Fill the glass with ice.
Pour in 2 oz of vodka and top with lemon-lime soda. Stir gently to combine without breaking up the jello too much.
To create the bloody effect, gently pour the grenadine over the back of a spoon into the glass. The grenadine will cling to the foam from the soda, giving it a chilling, blood-like appearance.
Serve and enjoy the spooky fun of the Zombie Guts cocktail!

name: Zombie Mojito
ingredients: Black Grapes and Mint Sprig  (for garnish)
instructions: In a highball glass, muddle the black grapes, lime wedges, and mint leaves with the simple syrup until the flavors and juices are released.
Pour in the Kraken Black Rum, then fill the glass with ice.
Top with black grape soda, gently stirring to combine the flavors.
Garnish with a skewer of black grapes and a sprig of mint for a spooky finishing touch.
Serve and enjoy your Zombie Mojito as it haunts your taste buds with its rich and fruity flavors!

name: Zombie Tonic Cocktail
instructions: Dip the rim of your glass into the corn syrup, then immediately dip it into the sprinkles to coat the rim.
Fill the glass with ice.
Pour the vodka into the glass.
Fill the rest of the glass with Hawaiian Punch.
Garnish with gummy worms for a spooky touch.
Serve and enjoy!
